title: Hear ye! Hear Ye! Read all about it!
pros: Great teamwork at ESS! Even though one many often be on a site alone -- there is a great network of information to help one always perform to the best of their ability! The computer systems are top-notch and always being updated -- and IT is always available via speed-dial -- which makes helping customers. The in-person support staff (DVP, DM, DTLs, DLM & EEM) are always available and eager to help as well.
cons: My only con is the cost-of-living in the area that surrounds the site I manage.

title: Happiness
pros: I have been with the company a little over 2 years and I have never had worked for a place that cared so much about their employees from our wages and great incentives to where we started out as co workers turned into a team turned into friends and now family we are happy to help one another with goals we like to meet problems we are struggling with and we do it with our whole heart and we are happy to do so and that shows to our customers. Happiness, kind. compassionate, understanding, professional and knowledgeable. We are enthusiastic and value one another and value our customers because our values are who we are and what we stand for. We can depend on each other with the highest integrity we thrive in excellence to give our customers the best experience possible we have passion for the work we do because we get the appreciation from upper management from our team mates just the recognizing that your doing a great job makes you continue to thrive and be the best you can be for you for the team for the company for the customers, You have great opportunities to advance your career at Extra Space, I have never felt so much happiness then I do knowing I have family behind me to encourage, to teach, to help me grow and continue to be the best manager I can for our customers.It's just the right thing to do even if no one is looking.
cons: Some days can be extremely challenging we embrace it. Deadlines to meet can be overwhelming at times we reach out to where even our District Managers will come in to get their hands dirty to finish. Customers can and will get angry about rate increases we take a breath and know we have compassion and understanding to calm the storm and fix the issue after all we are in customer service, Every place of employment we have ups and downs its how we handle the downs that give us our outcome, Sure there are things I think my site could use or would be better and more secure if I had them in place communication is key and patience is what we have to have it all has a process but our voices are heard would I call these cons with Extra Space? Technically yes, however its also teaching me patience its teaching me how to stay calm in frustrating times and helping me grow when im uncomfortable and that will always be more positive then negative

title: It May be an OK Fit For Some
pros: Fellow store managers, assistant store managers & others are great. Everyone helps everyone & pretty much has a positive attitude. It's not a difficult job, it just may be a lot for someone at first.
cons: A lot of work for the pay. There are possible bonuses, but it depends on certain factors. Personally, don't care for property management & borderline harassment of customers/tenants. Also, the company expects you to follow a script to the tee, especially when being reviewed on your performance (being "shopped" - in person or on the phone). As with all companies, the goals are to get more, more, more. More reviews, more money (insurance), etc. Some expectations are a little more difficult to meet than others. One last item - being an ASM, you'll be expected to travel to sister sites when they need coverage (which is why they ask if you have reliable transportation). While there is mileage reimbursement, they calculate the distance for you & if you don't match it, there are going to be issues. Never mind traffic delays, detours, and wanting to arrive at the job on time; just make sure to get Google Maps to track your trips & timing, so there is no discussion of trying to take a longer route to get more money.

title: Integrity, Compassion, Teamwork

Also, the delinquency calls are a bit much to the point where it seems as if we are a glorified collection agency at times...sort of makes it feel like we are baby sitting the customers.

title: From Life Storage->Extra Space - Could not be happier!
pros: I transitioned to Extra Space from the acquisition of Life Storage and could not be more satisfied and impressed with how the corporate culture has improved, and the transition to a new team has been so seamless. Everyone at Extra Space has been so welcoming and willing to help with anything I may need. And the workplace atmosphere is so much fun, whether it is in person or remote. I love working here!
cons: Generally no cons, whatsoever! I would say I pay slightly more for my prescriptions/benefits, but you'll have those variances at any workplace. I am fairly new, but the onboarding process was so seamless and the corporate culture is one of the best I've ever experienced.

pros: Meet new people, sometimes work with someone you like

title: An ok place to work
pros: If you get your work done, you are generally left alone. My co-workers have always been great to work with and I've built meaningful friendships here.
cons: The pay is low. The median employee made about 43k in 2020 and about 46k now in 2022, but with inflation that 46k is worth about 39k in 2020 dollars, so we've all taken pay decreases essentially. Our CEO saw his compensation go from about 6.7 million in 2020 to 11.6 million in 2022. Dealing with customers has become more difficult because their rates are going up faster and much higher in a lot of cases than the market rate for their unit. This pays for executive bonuses and raises, as well as acquiring other storage companies, but not keeping employees at least at the same buying power they had in 2019 when median employee pay was 39k. We're struggling to buy groceries while our CEO has gotten a $6,000,000 raise.

title: Easy job-terrible people

cons: Security and safety is not a concern for the company. Every manager is going to train you a different way. Very shady towards both employees and customers. Most days are spent completely by yourself.

title: Amazing Company to work for and with!
pros: I feel like what I do day in and day out makes a difference. I am appreciated by the company and my supervisor daily. I feel valued and important to each of my customers and feel like what I can do for them makes a difference in their lives. All this while being supported. Working within my team feels more like family. We communicate with each other throughout the day to get support or just to chat. Pay with the ability to earn more with commission is very good. Great benefits, unable to find better out in the private sector. The company is constantly improving systems to better assist our customers and each of our locations. I LOVE my job! There is a lot of growth available for those who earn it!
cons: Sometimes hard to get the schedule you want. Changes every 3 months. Not enough paid time off.

title: Happy to be here!

cons: I don't agree with all sites having to have the same amount of monthly reviews. Smaller sites should have less to do or larger sites should have more to do.

title: Secret Sauce!!!!!
pros: Extra Space Storage has figured out the secret sauce to long-term success. The secret sauce is to ALWAYS put your employees first. We are a people-focused, people-driven company changing the way individuals have looked at happiness within their careers. I can hold-heartedly say that our Extra Space Storage team has everyone's best interest at heart. It almost sounds too good to be true but you'll see that we continue to expand, impress, and succeed in ways others have never thought possible. All due to the commitment to our people. I hope everyone has a chance to experience true work-life balance, positive work culture, and a psychologically safe work environment in their careers because it will change your life. I am happy, fulfilled, and driven to continue bringing success to my company because they return it to me tenfold.
cons: You'll never want to leave this company! (Not a con, but I truly did not expect to want to stay with one company for the rest of my career but I am not mad about it).

title: Good company that continues to grow and evolve.
pros: 1) Reasonable levels of autonomy 2) Fair pay for DM's 3) Strong company culture 4) Peer and supervisor support 5) Company vehicle and expense account 6) Access to virtually unlimited amounts of data
cons: 1) Very questionable and unfair promotion practices 2) DEI initiatives often trump performance and equal recognition 3) KPI's a strong focus, ignoring that this is a actually a property management role 4) Hiring from outside has resulted in an abundance of people managers who don't actually understand the core business 5) Lean staffing targets create challenges during holidays, rental season, or when adding new stores on short (<30 days) notice

title: Great place to work
pros: If you're an individual who can manage their time, likes to do a good job and have positive reinforcement, this is the place for you. We're closed on all major holidays too.
cons: It's a service based industry, so you must deal with the public. My experience has been 95% positive in that regard.

title: Used to be great... gone way downhill in the last few years
pros: Opportunity to work at home and remotely.
cons: So many downsides lately. The new sick time policy is a joke. As a 4 day/10 hour worker, I have to work 4 months to earn one day of sick time. Regular 8 hour workers have to work 3 months. I have never had disciplinary action for attendance in my 10 years with the company until they updated the policy. They claim the change was to help us, but it's quite obvious it was to make it harder to call out. God forbid you catch the flu and need more than a day of recovery. With record profits for the company, our executives are seeing huge pay increases, yet the lower level employees are technically making less than we used to with the rising costs of living. The technology issues are worse than ever. It takes weeks to get anything fixed and we are the ones that deal with the customers' backlash over it.

title: GREAT PLACE TO WORK.
pros: I have only been here for a short time but from the beginning I felt as if I was a part of a team. Something special. Everyone is friendly and helpful. The training program is outstanding. I have been in retail Management for over 35 years, and I can say they spend time with their people and make sure that you understand the process.
cons: Nothing as far as I can tell.

cons: Training is thorough but can be challenging if you do not learn quickly.

cons: Prepare to do the work of 3 people.

title: Awesome Place To Work
pros: There is a good work / life balance. The work hours are reasonable and Sundays off are great. There is great opportunity for growth and advancement. Some of the friendliest coworkers you could ever work with.
cons: No overtime is permitted unless extremely necessary. The 30 minute lunch breaks feel quick. There's way more to the job then just renting out storage units.

title: Easily the top company in the country to work for.
pros: Great leadership, c-suite, work like balance and culture.
cons: Cons are nonexistent. If you join the company you hit the lottery.

title: Best Company I've Worked For!
pros: Extra Space has been the best company I've worked for in my career. I've been here for almost 3 years now and during that time I've seen how much the company cares for it's employees. They are constantly looking for ways to improve the work life balance of employees and do the right things for the employees. I have seen it in all parts of the company (field, corporate, and call center). When I first started I kept waiting for "the other shoe to drop". A lot of companies say they are great during the recruiting process, but after you get in the door the shiny and new wears off and you find out it's not great. 3 years later I still find that this company is true to their words.
cons: The environment is very fast paced so sometimes it can be very busy. It's what keeps Extra Space innovative so overall it's not a bad thing, but it can take a little bit to get used to at first.

title: Hiring Commission Pay is Deceiving
pros: Respectful. Intensive training & support. A lot of opportunities to win small gift cards for your effort. Supply all equipment needed to work from home. Friendly team members. Positive work culture and work/life balance.
cons: Quarterly schedule lottery, random positioning in schedule bid is not very random, best positions for highest earners who have been with company the longest, making it difficult for new hires of less than three years to get shifts which pay commissions well. When getting a less-desired, bad schedule, there is little to almost no chance of earning a commission. Commission structure is misleading and too rigid, high service calls to the sales call side ruin the numbers your percentages are structured around, even if your actual sales numbers are high, making it nearly impossible to commission in amounts that are beneficial. Will terminate you if your sales percentage numbers are bad/too low for 3 rolling months (which if you get a bad shift in the bid is the entire quarter) even if your legit sales call percentage are super high, the service calls coming in on the sales side can destroy your overall percentage rate. Passive/aggressive performance reviews where the management acts like the focus is to help and support teams but really is to threaten your position if in the quarter you can not meet their goals. Actually very low paying position, because you are hired with the promise of high commission opportunities to offset hourly pay. Continuously firing team members as well as a high turnover rate from team members leaving due to actual commissions, leaving call center under staffed, which additionally burdens team members with call volume as they take more service calls which throw off the sales numbers. Company continuously tells you the numbers ‚Äúeven out in the end‚Äù which is a flat out lie.

title: Extra space is great!

cons: Pay is lower than I'm used to so it make it hard

pros: Everyone helps everyone, from our highest chain of command! I have never worked for a company that had the higher ups actually introduce themselves the time of on boarding welcoming the newbies, all the way to HR who responds instantly !! The way they help out is really mind blowing! They recognize you for the smallest things I got a cute gift sent to me for my ONE year anniversary I was so confused to why I was receiving this package they literally celebrate every milestone with you if I had to say this is more like my second family and I wouldn't trade my job for the world. I completed my degree this year for my bachelors and decided I'm not ready to step away form my job so I am going to continue my Masters and keep on with my job here at Extra Space
cons: there is nothing to list about conns.

title: Wish I had come here sooner!!!

Great teamwork in the field organization, excellent work life balance if you are looking for that, and one of the BEST companies I have ever worked for.

title: BEST MOVE I'VE MADE!!
pros: Great pay! Don't let base pay scare you. There are commissions, sales bonuses, prizes, and monthly attendance bonuses that add up to make yearly pay great! There is a culture of support for each team member, opportunities to grow and advance your career (even remotely), clarity of expectations, and excellent training. Management listens to employees! Surveys come out regulary and meetings are held to let employee voices be heard. Our requests are given consideration and often changes in policies, procedures, and even commission structure, are made! I love that employees have a real voice in how things are done!
cons: Getting the perfect shift can be difficult but doable! If you excel at sales, you‚Äôll have no problem here. I‚Äôve gotten my first choice on most shift bids. If you take on extra roles like mentor or coach, you have even more assurance of a great schedule.

title: A Company that Actually Lives by Their Culture
pros: When you join Extra Space, you really do join a company that cares about you. You can bring your whole self to work and will see our core values of Teamwork, Integrity, Passion, Innovation, and Excellence in all that we do. I'm encouraged to share ideas and have a voice in decisions that impact me. I'm comfortable expressing when I'm feeling overwhelmed or want more opportunities for development. My manager checks in regularly to provide support and to ensure I have what I need to be successful in my role. I'm trusted, given challenges that help me grow, and am treated like a person, not just another cog in the gears that make the clock tick.
cons: Would like to see more opportunities for remote work; however, there are more opportunities for hybrid roles, so they're meeting us halfway. The office is wonderful to work in, but remote work would expand our reach for talent.

pros: They take care of us at work and as a company they understand that life happens. The bonuses can be decent each month if you keep up with what youre supposed to do. My coworkers are great and upper management is incredibly helpful when it comes down to it.
cons: Some of the biggest issues I have at my location are the people that urinate in the halls or units, leave bottles of urine around the property or in the units when they move out, and have pooped in the stair wells. The amount of stress that comes with dealing with break ins is kind of crazy sometimes. Peoples livelihoods are in these units and when stuff gets stolen, you have to he the one to let the customer know. You have to work with them even when they are angry and yelling at you blaming you for it because, "Its your job to protect their stuff" and etc etc.. just incredibly stressful despite having good back up with the team.

title: Be Prepared
pros: Job itself is not hard, if everything worked the way it should.
cons: Be prepared to be left by yourself with no life line. DTLs and DMs are always ‚Äúout of pocket‚Äù or unreachable when you need help, and when you do ask for help, you‚Äôre ignored. You‚Äôre expected to put in hard work and sweat into a thankless job. Upper management does nothing to motivate employees, and favoritism runs rampant across the company. Everyone acts like they‚Äôre in high school. Even if you do your job by the book, if you aren‚Äôt meeting the KPIs or you aren‚Äôt one of the ‚Äúfavorites‚Äù be prepared to be treated like so. HR is also not helpful, the company makes it hard to even speak with a rep and there‚Äôs zero consequences for anything. Customers can be as horrible as they want and be rewarded for it. They can cuss you out and assault you, but the minute they escalate to a DTL or DM, they get what they want and you‚Äôre left to pick up the pieces. They want you to value the customer who just threatened you because they want their money. Hard to feel motivated to stay at a company that doesn‚Äôt value their employees well-being or safety. Pay is also unfair across the board, there is definitely a gender-wage gap.

title: New Hire and No Regrets

Top leadership is very open and shares information in All Hands. Answered some tough questions from employees as well. DEI program. They develop their people and promote from within. Live and standby core values. Free fruit, snacks, and drinks. Culture of recognition and teamwork. Great benefits and pay. Overall I am so happy with my decision to join #teamextraspace.
cons: Bit of a drive for me, but it is a hybrid schedule so it isn't so bad. Not a drive for those in SLC or Utah counties.

title: Interesting Projects and Great Culture
pros: The culture of the IT department is collaborative. I've stayed for the excellent culture and we're focused on great solutions with opportunities to implement new technology. Our culture is to architect and deliver long-term solutions and the cross-team collaborative environment has been an excellent source of growth for my career. I have supportive management and mentors. I learn something new everyday. Great work life balance. Great benefits. Remote work with option to go into the office has been fantastic. I have more personal time rather than 2 hours commuting to and from work. Really nice perk.
cons: PTO caps could be higher.

title: Good To Me
pros: I cannot speak for anyone else, but Extra Space has been good to me. I have worked in companies in which unprofessional behavior was tolerated or even encouraged, where manipulation was preferred method of managing and where basic respect was a laughable concept. I have no such issues with Extra Space. Basic common courtesy, a push toward excellence and professionalism and proper training for all aspects of the job are some of the many reasons this is a good place to work. There is room for growth as well as opportunities in different areas, if one chooses to branch out, without leaving the company. In general, Extra Space is a very good company to work for!
cons: There is more encouragement for vertical mobility verses lateral. In other words, sometimes an employee needs to fight or use strategy in order to work in another district or department. I rarely hear district managers or DVP's looking in-house for accountants or when needing to fill positions in nearby districts. These positions ARE listed, but for the most part individuals are guided toward staying in their lanes.

title: People make all the difference!
pros: ESS treats their people very well. From a robust benefits package to an actual interest in employee pain points, ESS understand clearly that if they don't care for the people, the people won't care for the business. Success depends on this idea. Development opportunities are available for people without typical background experience and/or formal education, ESS is always looking for the next potential Store Manager, Trainer or District Manager and is not afraid to fill in the knowledge gaps a top tier internal candidate might have. Our values actually matter, they're not just some sign on the Boss' wall. Teamwork, Integrity, Passion, Innovation and Excellence drive everything from the top down.
cons: Our industry involves a large amount of change and while ESS manages this change well it can be tough at times to keep up with all the policy changes as time goes on. Resources abound though and the answer is always there to be found.

The executives come out to visit us and let us know what is happening within the company and also hear our concerns, which no other company I have worked for has ever done. I have tremendous respect and admiration for the structure of our operations and the care and concern for the employees and customers.

Hours are great to take the kids to school and hit the gym before work. Always learning and growing with a chance to get out of the office and do other tasks that keep you moving around with a chance to go outside and get some vitamin D
cons: No Paid sick days, you have to take them from your vacation time which makes people work sick. Also running short staffed so you feel alone alot and it's imposible to get tasks done. title: Sets the standard
pros: From the moment I joined this company, I have felt valued, appreciated, and cared for by both management and my colleagues. In my professional journey, I have never encountered a company that so effectively fosters a family-like atmosphere. What truly sets Extra Space Storage apart is the unwavering support I have received from everyone at the National Solution Center, regardless of their job title. From leadership to my team members, the commitment to collaboration and assistance is exceptional. Company culture is extremely important, and Extra Space Storage has truly excelled in this aspect. I am deeply thankful for the company's commitment to fostering a positive and inclusive culture. Thank you Extra Space Storage.

A lot of these stores has a perfect schedule that has been working for them for the longest. It was worked around family time and other things. With the schedule now there is time for family and other things. I myself is a very family orientated person and spends as much time with them as I can. with the new schedule it's not possible to even see them as the have work during the weekdays.

title: Poor managment
pros: Can be a live on manager at a facility that has an apartment available (or made available as some District Managers will promise a place to someone, and fire people to open that spot for them)
cons: Depending on what district manager you report to will probably decide how your job goes here. I was a live on manager. I had a seizure for the first time in my life at this apartment(lasted 9 minutes, had some brain damage). We found black mold on the property, in the vents, the ceiling tiles were covered with it, even some of the units that people stored their items in, had mold inside (that ruined their items). Had a quote to clean the mold. Didn't get approved because they wanted other work to be done first. The vendors that Extra Space had for the other work, would never answer or respond. So it was never done. 4 months after my seizure, I was fired. Because I couldn't drive, and my assistant manager had forgotten the deposit in the back, and it was forgotten until I was asked where it was. (My wife had also worked for Extra Space, as a DTL. She had been moved every year , being promised promotions(which she received until this last move). After our district manager started fast tracking other people and telling my wife she wouldn't be getting a promotion for quite a while, she left. Another reason I believe I was targeted to be removed/fired).

title: Great Culture,
pros: -The work culture is excellent, there's a healthy respect for work/life balance, they have robust Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion groups and programs, they promote from within and almost everyone is vested in your success. I started as an entry level Assistant Manager and worked my way up to a District Manager, and I'm not the exception to the rule, half my peers have a similar development path. -Lots of opportunities for growth, especially with the recent LSI merger. -The benefits package offered is pretty good, health, dental, vision, 401k, stock grants, etc
cons: -Pay scale (not including benefits) is lower for comparable positions then its peers -You get an extraordinary amount of support and development, but the learning curve is steep for a District Manager especially if you experience doesn't entirely overlap with scope of responsibilities and work required.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: I have been working at Extra Space for two years and what I enjoy most is working with the people here. Lots of people at Extra Space are passionate about their work making it a great place to grow professionally. The collaborative environment makes the work days enjoyable and productive. Additionally, the people have made me feel like a valuable team member since day one of joining the company. I enjoy that there is always more to learn as the company is always growing. Managers are supportive and invested in the growth of their employees and promote a healthy work life balance.
cons: One area that Extra Space could improve is by providing more comprehensive and structured programs to help employees prepare for advancement at all levels within the organization.

They keep their eye on you from a distance and then step in every so often to make sure everything is going good and you don't need assistance with anything Training - It is easy (for the most part) to get help or training on anything you may have questions about.
cons: Pay - Where as the pay is (somewhat) competitive it is not the best, especially with all the inflation that is obviously not going anywhere it is getting tough having to live so tightly paycheck to paycheck. If I didn't have a roommate I wouldn't be surviving right now.

title: Great Place to Work!!!
pros: I have been with ESS for 12 1/2 years now. I started as an Assitant Manager and with support, development, and patience I am now a district manager. Extra Space not only understands that in order to be successful you must be customer-centric but they also have found the secret to taking care of their employees as well. From the top leaders to the manager onsite everyone is supportive and lives by our compass. The pay is reasonable, I have a work-life balance, and my supervisor is understanding support and fair but most importantly it's a fast-growing company with tons of opportunities. If you want growth, stability, and a work-life balance this is a great place to work.
cons: I can't think of many cons or reasons anyone wouldn't want to work here. Unless you are not motivated to go above and beyond to strive for top performance. ESS is big on being the best and pushing fairly to meet goals and be successful.

JoAnn great DM communication and very understandable. Jacky over at Alhambra is awesome trainer and Ed great support and always there no teach us when obstacles on the way. Ana is a Store Manager always there to help out visit you at any site needed for anyone.
cons: moving from store to store no stability as Assistant manager

title: Great Place to Work
pros: There is so much diversity, the environment is very friendly, easy communitcation with higher level management
cons: Closing at 6pm, extra space storage talks about a good work live balance, but for working parents 6pm is not ideal. Daycares close at 5:45-6:00pm and do not leave wiggle room for that policy. Finding childcare with these hours have been a stuggle my entire career here at Extra Space. I'm positive i'd want to continue my career here indefinitely if not for the hours.

title: Best In the Industry
pros: Work Life Balance Career Growth Inclusivity and Diverse

title: A Company That Actually Cares
pros: Fantastic HR team that looks after its employees. I have had so many positive things to say about the HR and management team that would not fit in this tiny box. However, the compassion and humanity that these people have for their employees is second to none. They have so many programs in place to assist employees in cases of emergency, or life changing events.
cons: Metrics are a necessity at every company, I guess, to make sure people are doing their job. Much is the same here. They have certain numbers that you have to meet, which can cause stress and anxiety.

title: Assistant TO the Manager, Be Warned!
pros: Work life balance. Sundays are guaranteed off, holiday pay and consistent with your chosen weekday off.
cons: Be warned! If you become an Assistant Manager here, I have a few lessons for you I had to learn the hard way. These warnings are specifically for the Morganton/Hickory NC area although the company as a whole has a high turnover! 1. Make sure to ask to meet the staff that you‚Äôll actually be working with, it‚Äôll make all the difference on your first impression of what the workplace culture will actually be like! I only interviewed with the district manager and trainer. Once I met the actual staff I had to work with, the entire mood changed! I experienced a lot of racial micro-aggressions, unprofessionalism, hypocrisy and laziness from my Store Managers and one of my trainers. 2. Although you have the title ‚ÄúAssistant Manager‚Äù, it is just you and a Store Manager in the store. I was led on to believe I was in a leadership position working alongside a Store Manager over staff, but that is not the case! So make sure you‚Äôre working with a great store manager with actual professional management skills, otherwise you might end up being treated like the Store Manager‚Äôs personal assistant doing the dirty work and their scapegoat when something goes wrong like I was. 3. This particular district, if they don‚Äôt like you, for whatever reason, they will attempt to manage you out. Which means making your job more difficult and having you document your progress as a legal justification for terminating you. Luckily I‚Äôm a hard and professional worker because this little trick of theirs did not work. I ended up being with the company for almost a year before I finally found something else and quit! 4. The company looks and sounds professional on paper, but on the actual district and store level, they are not! They are not preparing the Store Managers (who you will be working under) for actual leadership positions. A huge evidence of this is that the managers don‚Äôt even train you, you‚Äôll have a trainer travel to you for that and leave once your training is over. Unless you get lucky and you work in the same store as your trainer. This creates an environment of entitled Store Managers who are protected by favoritism and having longevity with the company. There‚Äôs only ‚Äúslap on the wrists‚Äù if they do wrong in this particular district. 5. Know your worth. If you‚Äôre interviewing and you know the pay is low and they try to entice you with annual or performance based pay raises, don‚Äôt settle! I was ‚Äúmeeting expectations‚Äù at the end of the year and I received a thirty cent raise. Even ‚Äúexceeding expectations‚Äù will be less than a $1 raise. 6. This is a dirty, outside and at times dangerous and sketchy job. They don‚Äôt disclose or elaborate on this too much during the interview process, so allow me to. Don‚Äôt let the temperature controlled office setting fool you. Especially if you‚Äôre the Assistant Manager. You‚Äôll spend majority of days outside cleaning out every storage unit on these gigantic properties the second someone moves in or out, rain or nighttime, which can be full of pests. Homeless people sleeping on the property or inside the units is a huge thing, which can be a dangerous, dirty or awkward situation to run into. Creepy/sketchy things do happen. There are most days where you‚Äôll cover the store alone, so keep that in mind. This particular district, I was consistently working by myself not even a full week out of my training when I was told it would be at least a month before that happened. You are this company‚Äôs pest control, landscaper, handyman and plumber because they‚Äôll do anything to save a quick buck. If you like your personal space, too bad, because you are required to drive customers in the front seat beside you in a golf cart to their storage unit. You also have to do bill collecting calls for customers who haven‚Äôt paid their bills, so be prepared for some seriously angry customers because they can‚Äôt get in their units or their items are being auctioned off! But again if you have a great Store Manager that views you as an equal, then you won‚Äôt have to worry about all the dirty work being put on just you. 7. As an Assistant Manager, know that majority of your days will be spent covering other stores. I was told maybe a day or two I will be covering my neighboring stores, which are each thirty minutes away from my home store. In reality I spent three out of 5 days every week at these other stores and I had no control over my schedule or where I would be. You‚Äôre basically a pawn piece for these managers, you go where they want you to with little concern for how you feel about it.

title: One of the best companies to work for hands down
pros: Great job, great District manager to work for, great location.
cons: I had to move. Couldn't transfer.

title: Discriminatory
pros: None. Hostile work environment replete with habitual abuse and condescension. False allegations rendered with no substantive proof of any statements of "authority."
cons: Terminated me citing a falsified criminal background to avoid the true reasoning that would implicate them. They are currently being investigated by the EEOC for disability, sex, and sexual orientation discrimination. The primary bad actor is under criminal investigation for her actions. Disclaimer: all are known reported facts not open to argumentation or modification.

title: You make it what it is
pros: Daily and weekly processes keep things running smoothly. Planning ahead with team members and collaborating to meet monthly goals is a plus. Hard work and dedication is a must, and keeping in contact with your District team leaders and District Managers are great and a wonderful help to get you through difficult situations.
cons: When there is silence, no one communicates you see it reflected in individual site metrics.

title: Great Company
pros: They are great with the staff and care about their customers. They are willing to improve their sites to keep their staff and customers happy at all times. They are will to help you grow in the industry.
cons: I have no cons at this time frame

title: Nothing good or bad pay is a little low
pros: Work from home train at home
cons: Low pay. Lots of work, micromanagement

title: Great place to work
pros: Great company, keeps me active, coworkers are very nice and my DM has an open door policy!
cons: Winters are rough with outdoor units

title: Work Life Balance Difficult
pros: Great co-workers, awesome management team, work life balance for non in site managers, can be relaxed job based on location

title: Continuous Culture
pros: Work/life balance. Development opportunities. Culture is important.
cons: The Current compensation is average.

title: Relaxed position

title: Dependable, yet diminishing perks and benefits
pros: Very dependable and sustained work
cons: Perks keep disappearing and it keeps becoming apparent that they care more about numbers than providing employees with these types of incentives.

title: No so great
pros: The people you work with at the stores are normally great to work with. Pretty good benefit package and time off.
cons: If you like being micro managed and told what to say and exactly how to say it , so that all your personality is taken away and you are now a robot, then this is the job for you. You feel like a used car salesman without a soul. You are given several goals to reach. In the 5+ years I've been here no manager can make all of them so they use this to give you a 3% raise. Turn over is extremely high. At best this is a place to get some pay and insurance until you find a real job that appreciates what each individual has to offer a workplace. Also if you work after store hours to help a customer they are too cheap to pay you and will expect you to take a longer lunch so that they don't have to pay you overtime. One last thing, when I started it was not like this. Things have made a turn over the past few years and definitely not for the better.

title: Great Place to work
pros: 1)Company really cares about you as an individual. 2)Work schedule is way better then retail could ever be. (NO SUNDAYS!) 3)Upper management really seem to care how you are doing and try to help were you need it. 4) Everyone is very nice company wide and treat you with respect. 5) The pay is great and competitive. 6) Inclusion is a big part of the company 7) Great opportunity to advance.
cons: 1) depending on your store that you can be at, it can be overwhelming because you can be by yourself most days. (answering all calls, handling customers etc.) 2)If you are an assistant you float between stores most times, so you wont be in the same store day to day. Your schedule can change quickly depending on what's going on in your district.

title: Wonderful Company!
pros: Work/Life balance Hours Support Teamwork Benefits YOU ARE TREATED LIKE A PERSON
cons: I can not think of any cons worth noting.

title: Extra Space Storage - Teamwork, Integrity, Respect
pros: Many companies claim to care for their employees; Extra Space proves it year in and year out. I am proud to work for a company that thinks of their people just as much as their profit. The company values of Teamwork, Excellence, Innovation, Integrity and Passion are on display and not just a poster on a wall or words on a mission statement. Transparency is on full display as well which makes everyone feel to be part of something bigger than the role we serve with the company. A great mix of people and diversity that enhances the work experience as well.
cons: From a district level, we want to be at our facilities, interacting with our team and customers. The administration piece and the constant follow up with vendors does take some strategic balancing but this is a minor con and one that we all deal with from a multiunit management perspective.

title: Working for ESS
pros: The best part if working with ESS is that they are so willing to help always. Weather that be with work or you have an emergent family situation. The people here have been more than kind and so helpful making sure I Have all the tools to do my job correctly.
cons: I think the ONLY con I have for working for ESS is the shift bid, but that is probably because it is new to me. I was hoping for more options for the weekends off to spend with my kiddos. But it always has worked out, and I have not had to miss many of their events since starting with ESS.

title: Great People, Room for Growth
pros: It's a great culture because of the great people. You're compensated fairly and have opportunities for growth. It's a very stable company and currently the largest self-storage company in the nation by number of locations. Teams are still lean and the company functions more like a smaller company, despite its size; pros and cons because of that.
cons: Working remotely varies greatly, with some teams not working remotely at all and others working remotely 100%, or a hybrid in-between. Check in your interview what the norm is for the team/position you're applying to.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Great coworkers and leaders. Our work environment is helpful and team focused. Everyone is willing to teach or problem solve together which is invaluable. Our core hour workday and WFH days also provide flexibility to make a work schedule that best suits us individually. I also appreciate that Extra Space asks for feedback from their employees regularly and has accommodated those requests when possible. There are also several perks such as snacks and drinks provided by the company, fun holiday celebrations, and family summer parties. Overall, a really great place to work.
cons: Health Insurance could be better.

title: Ain't What It Used to Be
pros: -No micromanaging which is nice
cons:
-Pay
-Short Staffed
-Business Hours/Work Life Balance

title: Neutral
pros: Having 2 days off guaranteed, having one weekday and Sunday off, work/life balance is a +, having major holidays off, the ability to grow within company is a plus.
cons: Hours 9:30a-6p, I commute to work having these hours with children are tough, working every Saturday and not having any complete weekends off without a request requiring you to use PTO, 30 days in advance. Your two off days are not together, they offer no sick or personal time, only accrued PTO which you must use for sick, vacation, personal, with about 6 hours per pay period accrued takes a long time to accrue the first year, goes to about 4 hours after that, then 5 years with company goes up.

title: Awesome Company that Truly Cares about their Employees
pros: Imagine the stress of knowing your company is merging with another, and you might not have a job. From the moment the people of Extra Space Storage (ESS) stepped into my world, all stress melted away. I quickly experienced how everyone, from the CEO to management to coworkers, welcomed me like family. ESS is a company of teamwork where the employees work as hard as they play. Work/Life balance is essential, and ESS walks the talk. If you are lucky to work for a company where all the employees have smiles on their faces, it‚Äôs the best!
cons: I've only been with the company for 2 months but so far smooth sailing.

title: Great Company
pros: Working at Extra Space everyone is willing to assist with any questions you may have. Company has a great PTO/attendance system. Company does a great job listening to their employees regardless if it's negative or positive to make the company better as a whole. Extra Space is very upfront, and you know what is expected of you. Extra Space has a lot of tools in place to help you succeed. Extra space is very diverse, and have great benefits.
cons: I do not have anything negative to say because Extra Space like their employees to be open so they can provide a great company balance and work on improvements when needed.

title: Call center
pros: Great benefits semi flexible schedule
cons: Non stop calls get told you‚Äôre gonna be a sales associate and deal with customer service calls half the day about how peoples rates have been astronomically increased from one day to the other

title: Great
pros: Great company to work for
cons: A better way to do lease presentation

title: Great Experience
pros: Management actually cares about their employees. Healthy work life balance. Superior culture that is a forethought to employment not an afterthought. Good benefits. Collaborative. Friendly. Fun.
cons: I mean it's storage. I frequently find myself needing to explain why a storage company (actually a real estate company) needs so much tech. Its not always sexy, but the underlying technical mechanisms are quite complex and there are many challenging problems to solve. I probably shouldn't feel so obligated to explain my job to friends anyways!

title: Customer and Employee Focused
pros: They listen to employees, make changes based on feedback we provide, and give us the ability to help our customers without always needing to reach out to tiers of people above us, within reason of course, but far more ability to take the lead at our site as long as we are meeting our goals within company policy. They are less micro managing than some companies as long as you are completing your work, which is really nice, and do provide you with pretty much what you need to make the job doable, within reason.
cons: Honestly, not too much is a con here. My current site is slower, so it's normally just myself which can be a con as it falls to me only to really handle all the tasks daily, but not a big issue. Other sites you do have a peer you work with most days which makes tasks easier. Maybe a con would be that some people can be gross and you sometimes need to clean up rather gross things, but that isn't a very common situation, thankfully.

title: Great Employer
pros: Good hours, teamwork atmosphere, decent pay for work
cons: None that I can think of

title: Great company culture
pros: Leadership lives by our company values of teamwork, passion, excellence, integrity, and innovation. If you are looking for a great place to work, with a good work/life balance Extra Space is for you. Opportunity and job stability is also another great reason to come work at Extra Space.
cons: When I was interviewing with this company, I asked someone that worked here what the con was. They said we have to do audits, and it is hot outside sometimes. I figured if the only bad thing was that I had to do an audit when it was hot this must be a great job.

title: Can‚Äôt work for dishonest employer
pros: Plenty of time to read a good book.
cons: They train you to misrepresent their product. You are selling ‚Äúinsurance‚Äù but you‚Äôre NOT an agent. You are told to tell the customer the insurance is comprehensive but if you read the fine print it‚Äôs not. I was too honest to be comfortable doing this job.

title: Corporate
pros: Liked the work and the opportunity to work outside

title: A little sales, a lot of abuse from customers

title: Culture comes first
pros: I am proud to work for ESS because we really put the company culture front and center - we strive for Innovation, Excellence, Passion, Teamwork, and Integrity. These are pervasive in what we do and how we make decisions. We strive to bring the best on board with us and develop them for internal promotion. We're undergoing constant growth and change and we want to ensure our team is capable of rising to the challenge.
cons: The change that all this brings can sometimes be hectic and stressful. I'd say as far as high stress jobs go this is on the low end of that scale, but that doesn't mean that as a people manager it comes with no stress. Dealing with turnover can be very stressful for yourself and your team as you need new people before others leave you. When sites are covered by one person it becomes hard to schedule people and coverage.

title: Full time property manager
pros: Guaranteed two days off - one week day, and Sunday Rental incentives for site managers are great In my experience, the DM's are amazing and uplifting
cons: Some of the KPI's are just ridiculous - google reviews being one. Working Saturdays unless you have PTO (so it isn't exactly a con)

title: It Was Fine....
pros: I enjoyed working in my district and with my team.
cons: schedule and staffing. Weekend Work. Certain metrics were just silly.

title: Amazing Company!
pros: My favorite thing about Extra Space is the culture. It's hard to find such a large successful company that also cares about each individual and Extra Space does just that. I have always felt that my voice has been heard and leadership cares about my development as much as I do. It is very apparent that people come first here! I also really love the focus on diversity and inclusion, which makes it a safe place for employees to be themselves.
cons: Honestly, company as a whole, there are not any big cons. Obviously, there are people or teams that can improve because nobody is perfect, but Extra Space really is a wonderful company to work for.

title: Review
pros:
Good benefits
Get to be outside
Get to work with amazing people
cons: Nothing good place to work.

title: Great Place to work
pros: Extra Space is a great place to work, Working for Extra Space gives you the opportunity to think and work like an owner. Every day feels like your home. Everyday is different and there is so much change and growth within the company . Very supportive Bosses to go to and they never put you down. Teamwork is amazing and there is so much to learn. Some days are super busy and some days are slow. We also have Great DTL'S to go to when you feel lost and need some help.
cons: The only con I see is the groups that we have to sign up for .I feel it bring division between employees instead of bringing us together . We should be all one group together that has to do with work only.

title: Work with the best Teamwork, Innovation and Excellence
pros: Worked for Extra Space Storage for 8 years, after they bought the storage company I worked for at that time. The difference in companies was unbelievable. Extra Space appreciates their employees far more than any other company I ever worked for. Extra Space respects their employees, their employees ideas and treats everyone with dignity from their employees at every level to their customers. When market rates in the area increase, Extra Space increases rates or gives bonuses. Really too many great reasons to work for Extra Space Storage to list including a hefty uniform and shoe allowance, always improving benefits, working with employee scheduling, tons of opportunities for development and growth, etc. There are Vice Presidents for the company that started as Assistant Store Managers so employee development and growth is very real!
cons: Can not think of any.

title: Bad Managment
pros: one of the nicer storage companies as far as office
cons: horrible management and leadership. they do not care about their employees

title: Fantastic environment and great work.
pros: Extra Space offers a friendly work environment with a lot of clarity from the upper management. I rarely feel like I am not being included with upcoming changes, events, and information relating to the business itself. There is a lot of freedom of communication between stores within your district and even to other districts within the company. I always feel like I have the assistance I need and the upper managers care about the employees. The job itself is engaging and satisfying and you will feel like you are making a difference in helping other people with their storage needs, especially when you know some of them are going through hard times.
cons: There aren't alot of cons about this company, the only gripe I can say I have with the benefits is that the health plan is not the best and is a high deductible. I really wish Extra Space Management would expand our health benefits and get rid of the HDP plan while keeping the prices we pay monthly about the same. Otherwise Dental is fair and vision is fair.

title: Excellent culture and lots of room to grow!
pros: -The people hired here are good, down to earth, smart, generous people -Upper management is committed to the personal growth of people on their team -Flexible hybrid schedule, leaders trust their team to get their job done -Leaders are trustworthy, open to ideas, and will listen to requests of their team -Fun company culture with events, parties, monthly games, fantasy football/march madness competitions, etc.
cons: -Not all departments have the same flexibility -Open office - can be difficult to focus when in office with a lot of people around -Room for improvement with compensation to keep up with inflation -Parental leave lacking for new dads

title: Good but not enough
pros: Good pay, good work hours
cons: Bad organization of the employer

title: Extra Space is not just a job, it's a lifestyle!
pros: Working at Extra Space Storage, is more than just a job. Its a way of Life! The values here, the people, culture, diversity, and just all around work life balance and continued growth is what makes ESS home for me. Im just so grateful to be part of such a successful organization that focuses on people and helping both employees and customers to a better tomorrow.
cons: I do hope to see ESS build a presence outside of the United States. With qualities and culture like ours, I know we have what it takes to make a global impact both nationally and internationally.

title: Relax. Extra Space Storage Got It!
pros: From thorough training and ample amounts of resources to getting you prepared for the next level in your professional career... Extra Space has got it! One on One leadership ally's and multi diverse employee relation groups...Extra Space has Got It! A compatible work/personal life balance...Extra Space has got it!! Fair and competitive starting wages...Extra Space has got it!!!
cons: Eventually you build interpersonal relationships that last the duration of their leasing agreements. Not every opportunity you will close People don't appreciate how great it is to work here. It is different from other work environments where all the tools you need to be successful is right in front of you. There may be a day where you have no rental activity, and you have to improvise your duties to keep busy.

title: Good job bad for stepping stone experience
pros: Friendly coworkers are what make the job better.
cons: No real movement to grow here. Sure you can be the store manager but no real difference in pay and ‚Äúpossible‚Äù to get to district manager level but I don‚Äôt know personally.

title: Better than Most
pros: Sundays off, schedule can be flexible at times. Good work environment, great teamwork. Live on site, not micromanaged everyday (as long as you are doing your job) opportunities to grow in the company.
cons: Pay is not that great, difference in pay between assistant manager, store manager, and district team lead is small, so it is not worth it. They say think like an owner but do not pay you like an owner. No overtime allowed. Be prepared to work alone every week, they cut hours to one day of double coverage and expect everything to be done right away. Considered retail so we work most holidays.

title: Outstanding Workplace Culture
pros: The company: - is financially stable, healthy, and growing. - offers work life balance at all levels within the organization, and opportunity for advancement. - has a culture that is engaging, friendly, dedicated to our team members success, and people are truly authentic.
cons: I haven't found many cons, so this its difficult to find something for this section, but maybe due to size the amount of competition when promotional opportunities arise. There are a lot of talented and hard working folks in the company.

title: Great company to work for.
pros: Competitive Pay and Benefits. Annual raises. Monthly bonuses. PTO. Work/life balance is superb! The only reason my phone would ring for something work related on my day off would be for an absolute emergency. In this regard, ESS is something of a unicorn in my experience. Also, being closed on Sunday is a real blessing. Good culture of teamwork. Support from chain of command is always easily accessible. Good work environment. Clean and well maintained facilities. When something needs to be fixed, it is! I.T. infrastructure is almost always reliable and easy to use. Again, when there is a problem, a solution is usually only a few clicks or a phone call away. Store management is given the tools necessary to make case-by case decisions with customer care and implement them quickly with minimal delays because of needed approvals. Checks and balances are in place, but they aren't a burden.
cons: The slow times can be really slow. But there is always something that can be done to pass the time: cleaning, organizing, etc. Delinquent tenants. . . What can be said? Some are understanding of the situation, others treat you like it's your fault they didn't pay their bill on time. Just have to remember to not take it personally. It can feel a bit discouraging and tedious to keep calling and emailing and texting the same individuals over and over again and never seem to get anywhere with them. But that's just a small part of the day-to-day.

title: Good Environment
pros: Great Benefits, Good Salary. Slow Stores
cons: will sometimes get unhappy customers that are going to auction. I felt kind of like a debt collector

title: Excellent Culture at Extra Space!
pros: Even though I've only been here a few months, I can really feel the wonderful culture Extra Space has created. From an employee perspective you can expect excellent teamwork and a high level of integrity. Team members are passionate about what they do & the company is overall extremely organized. When they mention "no Sunday scaries" in their job descriptions, they mean it - I genuinely look forward to my work day has in store for me.
cons: No cons to report at this time.

title: GREAT!!!
pros: Prior to Extra Space I was a District Manager with Life Storage. The learning curve has been sharp. Along the way I have gotten support of my peers and coworkers. Extra Space wants you to succeed and it is what you make of it. There is a lot of work involved but the reward of being a part of a worldclass team and company goes along with it. My only wish is that I could have started sooner with the company.
cons: email communication is heavy. Very busy.

title: Best Company I Have Ever Worked For!
pros: There is no limit to your growth potential in the company, the only thing that can hold you back is you. It is the best company to grow with as everyone in management and upper management will support your growth plan. They strive to do better every day, always looking at what and how they can improve for their employees as well as the customers. The support I feel from Extra Space as a whole has been pretty amazing. Extra Space Is by Far the Best Company that I have Ever Worked For.
cons: No 2 days off in a row. AM's have no set store they have to travel around to different stores in their district. As a manager you spend most days running a 700+ unit facility with no AM to help.

title: Steady pace and rewarding position
pros: Competitive pay scale. Storage benefits for employees. Health and retirement plans for employees. Pace of work balances out between boring and overwhelming. Always supported by your field and home office teammates.
cons: Short staffed, many days worked alone with no physical assistance.

title: Great, but flaws exist
pros: Benefits are top notch and affordable in comparison to my past employers. I have a no deductible healthcare plan that has saved me so much this year. They offer generous reimbursement for a ton of different fitness related things and a credit you can earn easily to help with your monthly premium. They do their very best to provide all the resources you need to do your job well. If you utilize what is given you'll be in great shape. Support from management is usually top notch as well. Opening up remote roles in the national call center post COVID was a smart move. Working from home is amazing. Overall the culture is positive and the environment is good. I may have a lot in the cons section but they want feedback and I'm willing to provide.
cons: Mandatory PTO usage during FMLA is unfair. If you're sick you have to sacrifice time you've earned and possibly not have a much needed vacation during the year. Everyone should have those weeks of PTO for leisure and relaxation, not managing illness that prevents them from working. Communication is a constant problem. The systems in place don't work well. The disconnect between the call center and the field is staggering. The recent merger was fraught with issues and the call center was completely understaffed during the initial stages. Stress levels have been at an all time high. I feel it could have been handled a lot better. It's very irritating to see upper management saying it was handled well and not owning up to the mess it was. There's not enough emphasis on the service side of the call center. We're constantly taking way more volume overall and have less time between calls because we never have enough agents in comparison to sales. We take the brunt of customer complaints. Feels like we're the afterthought, not the priority. I dislike the ETO system immensely. It's never enough. After the crazy merger nonsense they should load some ETO in for everyone as a thank you since a lot of us had to use it to get some sanity back. While remote roles have expanded, most of the open positions at the main office are still not remote. I don't want to move to Utah, so I feel that my opportunities are limited until then. There also should be more roles within the call center that support agents and don't involve being on the phones. Talent is being wasted and employees are burnt out.

title: Amazing place to work
pros: Company culture, work life balance and room for growth
cons: Only getting a 30 minute lunch, if I had to pick something.

title: Extra Extra Read All About Us
pros: I have had the privilege of working at Extra Space Storage (ESS) for quite some time, and it has been an incredible journey. This organization has truly set the bar high when it comes to creating a conducive and thriving work environment. Here are some reasons why I can't help but sing the praises of my employer: Supportive Leadership: One of the standout features of ESS is its leadership. The top management team is not only approachable but also genuinely cares about the growth and well-being of every employee. They foster a culture of open communication and transparency that empowers everyone to voice their ideas and concerns. Inclusive Culture: ESS is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. They actively promote diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives, creating an atmosphere where individuals from all backgrounds feel valued and empowered to contribute their unique perspectives. Professional Growth: The organization is dedicated to helping its employees grow both personally and professionally. Opportunities for skill development, mentorship, and career advancement are abundant. I have witnessed numerous colleagues rise through the ranks, which is a testament to the company's commitment to its workforce. Work-Life Balance: ESS recognizes the importance of maintaining a healthy work-life balance. They offer flexible work arrangements and provide support to ensure employees can meet their personal and family commitments without compromising their career progression. Innovative Projects: I have had the pleasure of working on some groundbreaking projects during my time here. The company encourages innovation and supports employees in exploring new ideas and technologies, making every day exciting and challenging. Great Benefits: ESS provides a comprehensive benefits package that includes competitive compensation, healthcare, retirement plans, and more. They genuinely invest in their employees' well-being. Community Involvement: ESS actively engages in community service and philanthropic activities. It's inspiring to work for a company that not only cares about its employees but also makes a positive impact on the broader community. Extra Space Storage recognizes a plethora of diverse ethnicities across the globe by honoring and providing support for veterans, students, and our seniors. COVID-19 Response: During the challenging times brought about by the COVID-19 pandemic, ESS demonstrated remarkable adaptability and prioritized the health and safety of its employees. Remote work options and safety protocols were swiftly put in place. Future Prospects: ESS is constantly evolving and expanding its horizons. I am excited to be part of an organization that is continually looking to the future and exploring new opportunities for growth. In summary, working at Extra Space Storage has been an enriching and fulfilling experience. The combination of exceptional leadership, a commitment to diversity and inclusion, professional growth opportunities, and a genuine concern for employee well-being make this company an outstanding place to work. I look forward to continuing my journey here and contributing to the exciting future that lies ahead. If you are looking for a workplace that values its employees and provides a platform for personal and professional growth, I wholeheartedly recommend Extra Space Storage as your #1 pick for employment and for the beginning of a new career.
cons: No cons... If I had to choose one con, it's not being allowed to clock in and work when I'm bored at home with nothing to do. (If that makes sense).

title: Good Culture‚Ä¶ Poor Pay
pros: Great company culture. Everyone has your back. From the CEO to the DM and DTLs, every person will make sure to have your back and ensure that you are supported. Opportunities for advancement are abundant but only if you want to move.
cons: Poor pay structure for the type of work that is performed. You have the title of ‚Äúmanager‚Äù but the pay of someone working at Best Buy or Target. Incentive pay for rents is also low and not worth it. Poor PTO accumulation compared to other retail / property management jobs out there. There is tons of room for growth but you need to move which is a downside.

title: Great Place to Work At!
pros: The hours are great, work and home life balance. The DM, DTL's and other Mangers support in everyway possible. The benefit's are outstanding. There is room to grow.
cons: No Con's to share. But one point of advice to anyone looking to work for Extra Space. This job requires you to multitask and handle both the office and property requirements. I spend 50% of my time on the property and the other in the office. You have to be willing and able to keep both balanced!

title: Promising Future
pros: Getting the benefit to work from home and still feel connected with my coworkers is an amazing experience. The amount of training and care taken on each of us gives every opportunity to grow and improve everyday Stable Company structure that gives their employees comfortability on what we do for our customers
cons: Being young and not having an experience in a national standard was a bit overwhelming but it got better. Any "Con's" on here is really just nitpicking. I have way more positives than I do negatives on this job.

title: Best Company I've Worked For...Ever!
pros: Company leadership is impressive. They have high integrity, are dedicated, resilient, caring, great communicators and are impressive humans. Management is friendly, open and cares about their employees. Lots of opportunity for growth. Supportive of employees' individual goals. Team oriented. They care about work life balance. Often host team building activities. They offer referral bonuses.
cons: When I first started two years ago, salaries were below industry standard, but they have since, raised salaries to competitive rates.

title: Its... a publicly traded company
pros: In my experience, there has been no micromanagement and I LOVE that independence. (This backfires if you get a lazy coworker who operates like a cat on their phone that needs to be instructed to do even the daily tasks) If you get a cool DTL, you'll feel like they help get you the time off you request. (Anyone too corporate will tell you that you work based on the companies needs). I like the half office/half outdoor role, having a reason to get up and stretch your legs feels great. The company will stand beside your decisions when you need to kick an unruly customer off your property. They give a lot of trust to their employees. My cons list is sizeable and there's definitely room for improvement as an employer, but I overall have a positive outlook
cons: Well, you'll help run a site that brings in like $1 million/year and you'll get paid as little as possible. A small stipend for new rentals is shared between you and your coworkers, so there's 0 reason to not give everyone first month free and rent short term. The benefits are honestly kind of trash and the company doesn't fully pay them. They help, but you'll still be footing a couple hundred a month, at least. Embarrassing for a S&P 500 company. You're a call center, a collections agent, a janitor, a front office desk worker, the escalation department, the maintenance guy, and so on. But your compensation will show otherwise. It begins to feel like a joke when you have to explain to a renter why their rates go up $50-$100 at a time with no extra services being provided to them while your wages are stagnant. The company is monopolizing the market, so their extremely high "street rate" is some arbitrary big wig algorithm created to make it look like its the markets fault. $5/sq ft of non climate controlled space? Are they renting a flat in San Francisco? Why are they paying this much?

title: Extra space needs extra pay
pros: Super easy. You work collectively for about 4-5 hours. And the rest of the time your relaxing
cons: The pay is horrible. It‚Äôs the only reason I‚Äôm leaving

title: Manager
pros: PTO Insurance Benefits Sundays Off
cons: The pay is very low for the amount of work that is required on a daily basis especially if you‚Äôre at a busy site, for example, cleaning, restrooms, vacuuming, and dusting units, excessive amount of walking around the property

title: Fantastic Experience at ExtraSpace Storage
pros: I have been working at ExtraSpace Storage for 9 months and I can confidently say that it's been an incredible experience. The company's commitment to excellence is truly commendable. One of the standout aspects of ExtraSpace Storage is the supportive and collaborative work environment. From day one, I felt like I was part of a team that values innovation and encourages professional growth. The management team is approachable and always open to new ideas, which creates a positive and empowering atmosphere. Furthermore, ExtraSpace Storage's dedication to customer satisfaction is unparalleled. It's evident in the way we go above and beyond to assist our clients with their storage needs. The company's commitment to providing top-notch service sets it apart in the industry. The company also places a strong emphasis on employee development. There are ample opportunities for training and skill-building, which has greatly contributed to my personal and professional growth. The benefits package is comprehensive and reflects the company's commitment to taking care of its employees. Moreover, ExtraSpace Storage is at the forefront of technological advancements in the storage industry. It's exciting to be part of a team that leverages cutting-edge technology to enhance the customer experience and streamline operations. In summary, I am proud to be a part of the ExtraSpace Storage team. The company's values, commitment to excellence, and focus on employee development make it an exceptional place to work. I look forward to continued growth and success with this outstanding organization.
cons: - IT tends to compare its employment data with competetors in the REIT space, while they should consider looking at other tech companies of similar size instead. They've come a long way in terms of matching market rates, and they're constantly looking at data.

title: Great Company - Horrible Benefits
pros: Love the culture and the people.
cons: Our benefits seem to get worse with each passing year. I‚Äôve paid an unholy amount of money for healthcare in 2023 and compensation does little to help offset those costs. I feel like I‚Äôve been paying into health insurance for absolutely nothing because my out of pocket has been so high.

title: Why I enjoy working at Extra Space Storage
pros: Extra Space Storage is a growing organization. ESS recently acquired my previous employer. In my past experience, being a part of a merger left many unknown question. Extra Space was different. They engaged employees throughout the process. This engagement continued through onboarding and training. From day 1, I felt part of the team. The people here definitely set this organization apart! I have been set up to thrive in my position with Extra Space.
cons: I was brought on as a remote employee. I had some minor technical glitches otherwise a very smooth transition.

title: Great culture and values
pros: Ability to use your creativity to find solutions for customers needing storage.
cons: Very few individuals want to take all the credit. This is the exception to the norm. I get an occasional comment eluding to "stay in your lane", which hurts creativity and synergies in business.

title: Great place to grow a career
pros: The culture is supportive and encourages teamwork even between departments, the decision makers are open minded about trying new things or changing approaches, the remodeled corporate offices are beautiful, and the pay and benefits are competitive. When there are job openings, the interviewers and hiring team try to judge candidates fairly and pick who they think will be the best fit.
cons: The hybrid in-office and work-from-home policy makes the office feel empty on the days where most others are working from home. Staying connected with remote employees can be difficult if they work at one of our remote office locations.

title: Great workplace atmosphere
pros: Understanding peers and district management
cons: PTO accrued balance is very slow

title: Worked many jobs in my life, this job is the best and so far the Greatest.
pros: Helping people with their storage needs especially in time of need or hardship. Working outside and inside both is nice. Best of both worlds. Meeting people customers and co-workers from all over is exciting and a learning experience.
cons: It isn't an easy or simple job as most might think. Working in the heat or cold is not always easy.

title: Great company to work for!!
pros: Great work/life balance, amazing benefits, great team atmosphere, flexible schedule, generous PTO, outstanding core values. A corporate based company that actually values their employees, and consistently highlights their progress and success. They offer groom to grow and great training programs. to help with career advancement. They truly want their employees to succeed to the best of their ability and works with them to build them up. Their dedication to support diversity and equality speaks volumes as to what they represent. I started from the bottom and worked by way up!
cons: I do not have any cons.

title: A company that continues to learn and grow!
pros: To start off our company is completely transparent even at the highest level of the organization to let its employees know what is going on and its plans for the future. Extra Space has been an amazing environment for growth within the company. The work life balance that our company provides has given me more time to focus on my son being a single dad.
cons: In my 5 plus years of working for the company I haven‚Äôt encountered anything I would consider a Con against the job or company.

title: Smallest BIG Company I've ever worked for
pros: Extra Space Storage treats their employees with appreciation and respect. They take excellent care of us, knowing that if we are taken care of, we will in turn happily take care of our customers and properties. We will soon be the largest Self Storage Company in the nation and we still consider ourselves one family.
cons: The only issues are with the software. Finding answers sometimes takes time. Thankfully we have what are called "Service Desks" that we can go to if we are not able to find the answers elsewhere.

title: Great Company, Great Atmosphere!
pros: They care about their employees and reward hard work with small but meaningful benefits (treats, lunches, events and parties, gifts, etc.). Work/Life Balance - have core hours but allow flexibility in work schedule and for hybrid working. Standard benefits package (Health, Dental, Eye Insurance, 401K contributions, Employer covered insurance: life, short and long term care.)
cons: Company does not prioritize education assistance for employees. They do not have a meaningful employee education reimbursement program/benefit.

title: Extra Cool.
pros: This company really cares about their people overall. They keep us informed of everything that is happening making all of us feel like we are a part of the whole team. They give us all "ownership" at our sites, where you can run your site at the pace that works best for you without the stress
cons: The hours aren't amazing, but not awful. It's not always great to get home at 7:00 every night and working every Saturday. But you are guaranteed every Sunday off. So that's nice. It would be nice if we had 2 more paid holidays, we don't recognize Memorial Day or Labor Day as paid holidays in the field.

title: Great Culture, Great People, Great Company
pros: Extra Space really listens to employee feedback and accomodates discussions and an environment for everyone to work together to come up with solutions as a team. The company is growing and that leads to more opportunities to learn more about successful acquisitions and how to deal with changing working environments.
cons: There are a lot of moving parts and sometimes the communication from top down could be better.

title: Experience

cons: Cleaning out The lockers and units people are gross

title: Great Company
