cons: A lot of single staffed days

title: Good Place to work
pros: Extra Space Storage has a culture that implements core values which shows how we care for our workers and everything we do as a company. Our company values teamwork, excellence, passion, innovation, and integrity. If you are looking for a company to grow with, this will be the right place to work .
cons: At Extra Space Storage, you will have to work alone and have a lot of cleaning to do at times but if you anything like me, I enjoy it.

cons: The medical insurance could be much better. Health insurance is not that great, and takes 6+ months for them to process manually submitted claims with most providers being out of network.

The work hours are directly in the middle of the day leaving no time before or after work to do anything: Appointments, grocery shopping, spending time with the family. I would love to continue here for as long as possible, but eventually I will have to move on due to these hours. I also feel that we could be closed on more holidays, for the parents of small children.

title: Amazing

title: BEST COMPANY EVER!!!
pros: I have worked with this company 2 years so far. I have been promoted twice and have received several raises. This company is very rewarding. When they make more money they put it back into the employees. They have started groups for different people such as lgbtq+, bipoc, military, womens for everyone to discuss anything openly. I have never with any other company got to have such an amazing upper management team that strives for their team to succeed and care!

title: A great place to work, with a few areas of improvement

cons: Given what is expected from employees, pay does not match up to work load, and can cause a high turnover, which can lead to stretched staffing.

title: Best company I've ever worked for
pros: I've been at Extra Space Storage for almost a year now and I have never dreaded waking up and coming to work, this has never happened to me before at any other job. My co workers are team players and my DM is a master at what he does, he makes me want to develop and grow in my career as well as outside of work.
cons: I can honestly say the only con is some of the customers are hard to deal with, but that is the case at any customer service job you work at. At least at Extra Space they give you the tools you need to help you through those tough scenarios.

title: Truly Great Place to Work
pros: Wonderful coworkers. Great work/life balance. I enjoy the widely varied tasks I have in my role. My managers are exceptional. My efforts are valued. Decisions from the C-suite seem legitimately to be made with the well-being of employees in mind.
cons: The structure of some teams in the company--Operations in particular--is very conducive to advancement. My particular team has a relatively flat structure and isn't so much. But this was a known reality when I took the position, so it's not a big deal.

title: Understand life work balance
pros: *Inclusive company that walks the walk *I have not worked for a company that truly made it possible to have a work/life balance. I have always been in very high strung jobs working for high strung employers so, this down to earth attitude is so refreshing. Don't get me wrong, there are quotas to meet and they want the job done their way but, they give you the tools to be successful. Its like an extended family across the region that is always willing to help each other. *Provide a uniform allowance. *Great benefits *401K with a portion matched *Friendly helpful coworkers and leaders across the board *Most locations have great potential for quick advancement
cons: Getting use to the slower pace. Some locations may not be ideal for advancement. Pay is not the greatest. No sick pay only straight PTO earned biweekly. Work most Saturdays

title: Best company I have ever worked for.

Lastly I love that we have SO many stores in the United States because in the case you ever move most likely you would be able to transfer.
cons: Since the pandemic there has been a large over turn and hard to find individuals that hold our companies values and work hard. Unfortunately leaving us extremely short staffed where you generally do not have a double coverage day

pros: Work by yourself most of the time. Offers a 401k matching plan that is decent. Have one day off during the week and sundays off.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: I am Fairly new to Extra Space Storage and I enjoyed my time here. I feel welcome and supported by all my seniors. The work load is just right for keeping my interest and staying busy. Everyone is so friendly and helpful it has been just a pleasure working with them. The DM Ryan understands leadership and strives to be a great leader.
cons: Working with customers who are past due and up for auction cause some stress.

title: depends on dm
pros: live on site opportunity is a pro
cons: wrong dm can make it suck

title: Culture Matters - But for REAL!
pros: The "pro's" list of working for ESS is extensive, but here are my personal favorites. 1) There is constant development at every level, and room for growth. We are a "by the people, for the people" type of company which values our employees. Ever since I joined 6 years ago, I have been poured into, developed, presented opportunities and have been encouraged to be my best my numerous mentors who have helped me get to where I am today. I don't know when I would have made it into the corporate world if it weren't for mentors encouraging me to apply to positions I did not qualify for or putting their stamp of approval on me as a candidate because they saw my potential before I did. 2) Our Culture. It is simply one of a kind and is the reason behind our success. We don't just preach our culture, we live it. Every employee at every level. It's just who we are and what we do here. I have the freedom to be a fun, optimistic, realist and show my slightly competitive self with no shame. 3) Work Life Balance. Although I have a high drive and work more hours than needed, everyone at ESS is entitled to a work life balance. For our site employees, our offices are open within reasonable and regular business hours. For corporate, our expectation is that you follow suit. At the corporate level, our time is precious and best spent in the field, with our people, partnering with our stores to drive results. I work a salary position, and still have a life. Lastly, pro number 4) The experience gained is applicable to life and other business situations. I firmly believe that the attention to detail that we have here is what helps fine tune the brain of any businesswoman (or man) and entrepreneur. You have the opportunity to learn in depth business accumen while also getting paid to put your knowledge into practice in a safe space that allows you the opportunity to fine tune your own skills. We have development programs, e-learning, a GREAT L&D department, articles, seminars and mentorship programs that we use in order to help set anyone up for success. This is a very unique industry that has an interesting learning curve, however, there is not a day that goes by that you do not have the tools or mentors needed to succeed. There are no "stupid" questions. There is feedforward, not feedback. There is the safe space to learn and the grace to make mistakes. I do not get the Sunday scaries. I do not feel intimidated when my boss visits me. I do not fear what people think of me when I say "I am not sure what to do here" because I know that there is someone or something out there to help me. Like I said in the very beginning, there are A LOT of pro's for working here, but these are my top 4.
cons: I honestly think the only "con" I can think of is around the compensation guides, at every level. Although we do have a bonus structure as well as stock options/compensation packages at different levels, this is an extremely lucrative business that continues to flourish. The scope of work at any level is not difficult, however, it is time consuming and often times tedious. If we are looking for people who genuinely live out our company values of Excellence and Innovation, I truly believe that comes at a greater cost that what we offer monetary wise. Now. I choose to stay here because the pro's I listed give me peace and fulfillment which is more than I can say for a LOT of corporate (especially salary) jobs out there. I truly am happy working here, even under stressful or challenging situations. I do also see that there is an area of opportunity that we should be able to remedy through an increased pay range. Money is not everything, but it definitely helps. It's times like these where you have to sit down and really think about what matters most to you. Do you want to work for a company that has a great culture, cares about you, offers work life balance and a peace of mind as well as an opportunity to grow and develop at the cost of getting paid less? Or. Do you want to work at a soul sucking corporate job that you hate because you get paid more, ultimately bumping you into a higher tax bracket and losing a large lump sum of that to taxes annually anyways? I choose option 1, but that is just me.

pros: The company highlights their employees and are always looking for teachable moments to make each other better. We are mystery shopped to make sure that we are always at the top of our game. They make sure that no matter the time if you need someone, you can find someone to help walk you through any process you may be stuck on. cons: The company can work out kinks in the training process especially in districts that are short-staffed but this is a minor thing and once fully staffed probably won't be a concern at all.

title: Making A Career Here
pros: With Extra Space Storage, you get out what you put in - if you work hard and do well - management notices and promotes you. If you're a slacker, you won't make it for very long or very far in the organization. We take our culture and our business seriously, but we care about our employees. With every new hire, we reinforce our beliefs of integrity and doing the right thing and encourage them to adapt the same way of doing things.
cons: If you are unable to move or change locations, promotions will be more difficult. If you are able to move or relocate - you can be promoted much quicker than someone who is unable to move their family from the area.

title: Storage positions
pros: Tbe Company seems like they care and want you to do great.
cons: When something unplanned in your life happens. ( the passing of my husband of 25 years. It seemed be a problem. Along with getting cov19. And my own medical issues. Seemed to be in tbe way. In there own eyes.

title: extra space
pros: good pay and hours. monthly bonuses
cons: very pushy with sales speech. alot of downtime

title: Property management
pros: They typically have apartments that managers can live in rent free.
cons: The compensation was not worth the risk.

title: Amazing!!!
pros: I enjoy working with Extra Space for several reasons. First and foremost, they genuinely care about their employees! Extra Space encompasses integrity, passion and provide a great place to work. With hard work and the help of others, I have been able to advance in my career. Our leadership and development teams are amazing! They truly want to see every employee happy and provide support to those who want to advance. They are our biggest cheerleaders! I'm looking forward to at least another 10+ years with Extra Space!
cons: I have no cons at the moment.

title: No second chances
pros: Benefits, Sunday's off, that's about it.
cons: Extra space took over Life Storage, and that's when everything changed. I was a former LS manager, I loved my job, I took pride in my property, I worked hard to keep up with the constant changes, and I took it well. Or so I thought. I was terminated, thanks to the divisional managers, "no second chances" policy for LS store managers, and LS managers only. I made a mistake, and I wasn't given a chance to explain myself. They decided the best course of action was to fire me. It's funny how rumors can be spread and talked about, trickling down from your closest members and then going straight down to new hires. I'm not gonna let others get fired, so y'all can try to contact me and try to "investigate," and try to fire everyone just to feel good about yourselves, but at the end of the day, I guess that's all you need. They don't care about you. You're a number. That's all they care about now. They made that ABUNDANTLY CLEAR when they took over LS, they treated us like we didn't know how to work storage, as if many of us hadn't worked storage for several years +. We had low turnover rates, which is the opposite of what I found out was the opposite for ES. They had shown us employees that had worked there for several years, but little did I know, there were several employees, under 2 years employed by ES. DM's will throw you straight under the bus and will run you over a couple of times for good measure. It was extra funny that they treated us LS employee's like we were ignorant or something. As if we weren't doing the same job, with possibly more trust and freedom. To employee's and those looking to be employed, ask your DM at least five times before doing something, because then they'll fire you if you do it. Don't fall for these 5* reviews, they send out a link here and there for employee's to fill out a glassdoor review. Don't think you're secure in your job, they'll replace you within 2 weeks or less ü§£ Don't stress yourself out for a job where you're a number unless you're a district manager and up.

title: Super fun and great place to work!
pros: Work hard, play hard mentality. Often, we are rewarded with fun outings or food trucks for the work we do. The culture means that everyone who's hired is easy to get along with and don't slack off. I would say that there's a lot of opportunity for growth, and everyone here is eager to help you develop. Would recommend.
cons: Insurance benefits could be a bit better/less expensive

title: GREAT PLACE TO WORK!!!!
pros: Great work life balance, having every Sunday off is GREAT!! Teamwork within district, division and company Great Customers!! We have the best customers around
cons: I don't really have any cons, I always want more PTO!!

title: trash
pros: nothing good at all seriously
cons: the management is the worse, do not count on HR to help

title: Very People Focused
pros: The company is very good about focusing on people and promoting that mentality throughout the organization. I have sat in meetings where executives specifically asked about employees and encouraged other management to make additional efforts to support their respective teams. They push managers to promote from within whenever possible.
cons: It is a very large organization and sometimes it is difficult to identify the proper channels for project approvals and ensuring that the appropriate people are included.

title: Only Climb so High
pros: Off by 6. Closed on Sundays. If you live on site you get a super affordable apartment and do not have to pay utilities. No driving to work for those that live on site. You can learn a lot here and grow as an individual. Can be very quiet at times. Do not have to cover tattoos. Company does ask for valuable feedback.
cons: istently trying to improve training methods. Company is huge on diversity and inclusion and offers resource groups. Uniforms are provided. Can be a lot of fun being able to rotate between the office and outside. Much better work/life balance than most standard retail positions.

title: Great Value for your Money, Reputation and Excellent Service.
pros: too many to list but great company to work for , excellent benefits, flexible work schedule, family oriented, diverse work culture, excellent management support team, good reputation and strive to give great customer to every customer that walks through the door.
cons: ring phone missed calls counting against you when it only rings once and customer hangs up

title: Great
pros: Great place to be employed!
cons: No negative vibes thus far.

title: Great company to work for!
pros: - Sunday's off - Not really any rushing to get things done. Plenty of time to complete daily tasks. - DM's actually put your wants/needs in consideration. - Fair pay - Build relationships with your tenants. - Very friendly and helpful co-workers.
cons: - Can get very hot in some units during the summer. - Lots of bugs and creepy crawlies.

title: Great company to work with
pros: Great with internal promotions, good support with tasks, a forgiving disciplinary structure, and work/life balance.
cons: The pay is decent but not as great as those involved in Sales for the workload.

title: Hidden gem in the Salt Lake Valley
pros: Extra Space is a phenomenal place to work. As the largest public company in Utah, and with more locations nationally than Chick Fil A, it's constantly changing and evolving. They're cutting-edge with their tech. They have a strong management group. They treat their employees right! They've also increased salaries in the past 12 months
cons: A few top executives have old-school approaches to hybrid work and generally oppose it. However, hybrid is still an option.

title: Love It
pros: I have the privilege of working at this company, and it offers an outstanding workplace culture with a positive attitude toward the work. The flexible hybrid work model accommodates different team needs, and the company prioritizes a healthy work-life balance. I genuinely look forward to each workday, thanks to the stimulating environment and supportive colleagues. I highly recommend this company for its culture, positivity, flexibility, and commitment to work-life balance.
cons: Increase base pay to keep up with inflation.

title: Depends on your dm
pros: There is absolutely no pros to working here. It's a trick and huge inconvenience to live on site.
cons: Boss gets switched on you. Working in cold, snow, heat or rain. Which not every employee does but the ones that do don't receive any additional compensation. Work alone, isolation. Not every store but the people who decide that don't actually run the store to know. They won't send you help but they will write you up till you're fired for falling behind. Micromanagement. Heavily male run industry. Conflicts of interest in upper management.

title: Great company with growth opportunities
pros: Work/life balance Great work environment Growth opportunities
cons: Need to relocate for growth

title: Great Company Culture!
pros: I really enjoy working at Extra Space Storage. They have a great work/life balance and everyone is great to work with and completely supportive. Their onboarding procedures transition you into your role well and explain how everything works and what is expected of you. Best of all, the people from the top down are great to work with!
cons: There are a lot of employees, so might take a while longer to know everyone.

title: Best call center
pros: Extraspace Storage is the best call center job I have ever worked in. There is a good work/life balance and the atmosphere of the call center is not a typical call center you would not be just a number.
cons: We do have our busy times when storage is being used the most but it's not much of a con because even management will jump in a help with the calls in queue

title: Great place to work with great people
pros: I feel like there are great people here that thrive due to the open and great culture. It's a culture of helping one another and it makes work easy.
cons: Benefits are pretty middle of the road, nothing too special.

title: Voted Best Place to Work
pros: Hours Work/Life Balance Pay/Bonuses (depends on location) Personal & Professional Growth
cons: Pay/Bonuses (depends on location) Labor Intense Onboarding/Training can be Inconsistent

title: Best Place to Work
pros: The companies values and culture makes this the best place to work. I have worked at the National Solutions Center for over 11 years now and I am not going anywhere. I drank the Green Kool-Aid as we would say. Leadership really values their employees and strives to maintain a comfortable work environment.
cons: We would love more free food!

pros: Wish I did have a Pro but none come to mind,

title: Time fly's by

title: "Why work anywhere else?"

cons: When the NSC calls and YOU are the only one who ever answers the calls after hours. More people nee to take responsibility for their stores in that sense.

pros: Can essentially be your own boss.

title: Extra Extra ... Read all about it!
pros: Great Benefits, Bonus Structure and Co Workers. Friendly, Helpful, Knowledgeable and Quick . Customer Service Oriented company.
cons: In general, working with the public is tough. With the economy so unstable , people tend to get frustrated with increases in rent , some areas are worse than others.

title: Best Place to Work Hands Down
pros: Great team culture, i feel like i'm very much include in team decisions and have been able to well network in the Extra Space workspace. Work life balance is good and I'm able to fulfill my things at work and home without feeling overwhelmed. Great 401k match
cons: They do not have an ESPP program.

title: Home
pros: They actually care for the well being of their employees as well as customers.
cons: Wish there were more properties in our area for the growth.

pros: No weekends, long hours, limited pto, maintain metrics and collection.
cons: Great pay, great co workers, busy environment, room for growth

title: Great Company Culture & Management
pros: Great Company Culture & Management. For real, everyone is a pleasure to work with. Not at all a cut-throat corporate atmosphere. Work Life Balance is good if you preform & get desired shift. Low pressure compared to most sales jobs.
cons: None if you show up on time, do your job and take advantage of the continuous education and mentoring.

title: Great Job
pros: Extra Space Storage is one big family, we each do our best to support each other. You can always feel secure when you know you can contact anyone of your coworkers, even if it's in a completely different city, or store. Great opportunities for growth.
cons: No Cons, you just really have to be a team player and be willing to help where needed.

title: Stressful at times but amazing culture
pros: - management has been VERY understanding and accommodating towards me and my goal of finishing college - Sundays off is great for churchgoers and even just those that enjoy time off over the weekend. - VERY helpful and friendly team - Great opportunities to promote from within - Competitive wages - monthly bonuses
cons: - while some days can be very calm, some days tend to get VERY overwhelming and can be quite stressful - each facility will only have a max of 2 personnel at a given time with a majority of workdays spent independently depending on location.

title: Okay company, but difficult to move up
cons: istent pay, work/life balance, company culture (sometimes), thorough training, collaboration

title: The best place to work!
pros: Great work team, always supportive and ready to help a fellow employee. Great with family needs and its just a fun atmosphere to work in. There are plenty of opportunities for advancement and there is always something new to learn. An added bonus is you get to meet some very interesting people!
cons: There isn't always enough help at certain locations like mine for the amount of work that there is do on a daily basis.

title: Great Environment
pros: * Sunday always off , also there is Integrity and it is taken seriously * Not being Micro Managed by our DM or further up the chain, not much drama as other companies , they take that serious and reduce this. You feel your presence is an important role and opinion's you have can be discussed, your not made to feel like just a seat warmer * Most times SM have a set day off * Great resources , benefits with bonus * Team Work and sense of belonging * Sense that your heard or can be heard * Good training * You can actually get abandoned goods hauled off or help from other Co workers , instead of you breaking them down maybe causing injury to self. * You get to be outside and inside , so you get tired of being inside , you get to go out find tasks to do All in all I would say this has been one of the best companies I have worked for and love all my Co workers , I did not give a full 5 stars as with any place there is always room for improvement
cons: My main Con's are ,which is why I could not be honest to give a full 5 * is that I feel like the bonus system is a bit unfair for slower property's and number's expectations . **I also feel like with the inflation is at an all time high and keeps rising , it makes a single parent or single individual a bit more difficult difficult as an AS or SM to make it on the pay they offer at this time . **( I will state that they did last year try to help off set this with a 8% raise across the board and we all was very grateful for this Thank You ) You can advance , but it is hard to if you do not or can not move from your district

title: Been here six wonderful years and running...
pros: - work/life balance - leadership support to do one's job - talented people - collaboration focused - stable during times of recession - largest publicly traded company in Utah - #1 in the self-storage industry - executive team is very sharp - ski-pass perks for employees - food trucks every day - great office location and fun campus - a hidden gem employer
cons: -shareholder focused vs customer focused

title: Great Place to Work

cons: Compensation could be better but my overall happiness in my career has increased while working with ESS.

title: Work Culture and the Company is Amazing

title: A company that prioritized employee learning, development, and growth
pros: As an employee at Extra Space, I have been consistently impressed by the company's focus on people. I have felt a focus on my growth and development both personally and professionally. From day one, it was clear that this company values their employees and is committed to investing in their success. Extra Space's strong people-first culture has created camaraderie and teamwork among colleagues I haven't' experienced before. They genuinely care and strive to create a positive work environment.
cons: I haven't experienced any downsides working here

title: If being appreciated is a must for your next employer then search no more!

cons: Due to operating during the normal work hours during the week I don't get to see my family as much as I'd like on a day to day basis.

title: Positive Work Environment
pros: Extraspace offer so much for the employees from different groups you can join to build connection, Team engagement, education benefits, and such much more. Internal Opportunity for advancement, and growth.
cons: Some dislikes when working as Assistant Manager travelling to different locations, and not a set work schedule within some district.

title: Excellent Company
pros: The company offers fair compensation with an incredibly good work life balance. Of course, some of that is dependent on an individual's willingness to stay true their own schedules, but the culture very much encourages and respects work time vs non-work time.
cons: Company leadership (VP, C-suite) can sometimes be less than transparent concerning smaller, but relatively important items. This often gives off an air of dismissal, which I don't think is the intent, but there are certainly better ways that things could be handled.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: There is a strong company culture at Extra Space. Everyone works hard at their job, but also at being a positive influence on those around them. Its great to go to work everyday knowing you are making a difference and doing it with people you genuinely love to be around!

Their CRM is easy to use.

pros: Extra Space Storage has a phenomenal culture that separates us from all other employers - especially in our industry. We hold the values of integrity, innovation, passion, excellence, and teamwork very sacred and is something we pride ourselves on. I am very grateful to work for a company who values diversity, equity, and inclusion as well. In addition to being a great place to work, the company continues to grow at a rapid rate and career opportunities are abundant for those who work hard and want to do more within the organization.
cons: I do not have any negative feedback on Extra Space.

title: Great Place to Work!

Extra Space cares about their employees and always strives to do their best! I am proud to say that I work for such an awesome company!
cons: There are no downsides working for Extra Space.

title: Awesome Place to Work

title: Pretty good
pros: It's truly a good work atmosphere, your team cares about you and wants you to succeed.

We work hard and the yearly raises are pennies compared to the companies income. If you are a two income household it can work but being single, it's hard to live off of.

pros: I like the hours and the fact that sites are closed on Sundays.

pros: Extra Space truly lives the values of Excellence, Integrity, Innovation, Passion and Teamwork from the top down. I am treated as more than a headcount number, but an individual person. I highly recommend employment with this company.

pros: District Team is All for One and One for All! The best Work/ Life balance Company puts Customer service First Our culture and ethics are top notch, great standards of excellence

title: My time working with Extra Space
pros: As an employee that has been in a couple different positions, I'd say this is the best place I have worked at. The culture here is unmatched and leadership ensures that everyone is valued. Everyone I have worked with has always been helpful and supportive.

title: Another day making Magic at Extra Space Storage

cons: Work till 6pm every day Work by yourself a lot even though they say you should have extra coverage Customers yell and curse at you all the time Hourly and not salary- don't get paid enough for what they make you do

title: Not bad

Advancement opportunities through growth of the company. There is real longevity potential with Extra Space Storage. Leadership that keeps their word and work along side the team.

title: Working at Extra Space
pros: Extra Space is accommodating to employees and different work schedules. Many corporate employees are remote 2-3 days/week.
cons: There arent very many downsides to working at Extra Space.

title: Fantastic Company That Lives Up To It's Values
pros: While self-storage may seem like a "boring" industry, all of the intricacies of how self-storage works with technology and data make this a highly interesting product to work with. The company has great employees, you will find that working with your co-workers is one of the best parts of the job. There is a drive for innovation and teamwork, and each person has a passion for what they do that shows up in their everyday interactions with each other.
cons: The corporate office is a little further away from great restaurants for lunch, it may take 10-15 minutes to get to areas with more restaurants available. That said, the location of the office has excellent views of the valley.

title: Great company to work for
pros: This company allows for a healthy balance of personal life and work life. Which is important for me.
cons: Pay rate is extremely low for the position I am in.

title: Best Storage Company To Work For!!!
pros: Great people to work with! Everyone helps each other building great teamwork. Flexible schedule for Part Time employees like me! Professional and friendly district manager. I would highly recommend others to work for this company without hesitation!
cons: None that I know of!

title: Company that goes above and beyond
pros: Management takes positive steps to make sure work life balance is attainable. The company has a lot of resources available regarding the health and wellness of employees and their families. Management is supportive and collaborative in their employee's work. The company champions diversity.
cons: No major concerns but the company could be more flexible with paid time off.

title: Spectacular
pros: Always there in a minutes notice,
cons: To date the only con I don't care for is the different hours worked on Saturday's. We have clients waiting on us when we get here, coming in at 8:30 am, gave us that couple of extra minutes to prepare before people were making their way in.

title: Great ESS Culture
pros: Great place to work at due to the organizational culture. Our District Managers and Divisional Vice Presidents make you feel part of a team. There are many opportunities within the company and it is truly a great place to work for.
cons: Districts are sometimes realigned and getting attached to the District Managers is not a good idea since they can be changed periodically.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Great separation from home life to work life. Lots of room to grow. Fantastic hours. Feel like something bigger than yourself. Great co-workers and feeling of team cohesion. Uniform allowance. Great vacation policy. Pay to travel.
cons: I'm nitpicking just to fill out this space because it requires me to. The following things aren't that big of an issue to me because I understand how business work. So if I had to say something it would that there is a lot of red tape to get bigger projects completed on time and we only get the big holidays off, Christmas, Thanksgiving, Independence Day, and New Years.

title: Great company & work life balance
pros: Extra Space Storage is a great company that provides a great work life balance. They care about you and your family and want you to be happy. The culture is amazing and so are all the people you get to work with.
cons: The compensation is not so great, but there are some good benefits.

title: Great company
pros: laid back, work/ life balance, flexible schedule, PTO, benefits, great team, and fair pay with room for growth
cons: As site specific problems and needs arise that require construction/renovation or camera/security installs DM's/owners and corporate will prioritize their profit margin over getting the site what it needs to be successful in providing the tenants with a storage facility that is worth the price we charge. Also depending on your district you could end up being responsible for multiple stores due to shortage of staff and there is no added compensation for this.

title: Great Company and Team
pros: - Awesome team of people to work with/around - Communication is quick and accurate inside your department - Management is understanding of any issues you have
cons: - Communication between departments can be spotty and cause issues - Training for certain roles could be better but overall are not the worst I have seen

title: Company with integrity
pros: If you are looking for a company that is 100% behind you in whatever career path you want...well this is the company for you. The support you get at every level is bar none. You will get trained on anything you want to learn and the customer service is the best I have ever seen. This company cares about you as a person and operates with the highest integrity.

title: 9 Year Review
pros: Pros: Live On Site, Job Security Biggest perk was living on site, and job security. Extra Space was very good to their employees during Covid which I am forever grateful for and they are a very forgiving and understanding company.
cons: After working for ESS for 9+ years(2014-2023), I have a lot to say. A lot of ups and a lot of downs, definitely a wild ride. I think if I can summarize my experience with ESS with one word, I would say STRESSFUL. I remember getting hired and my DM telling me ‚Äúhere at Extra Space we wear many hats‚Äù, and now I know if you hear that, get ready to be overworked and underpaid. You will indeed wear many hats. Some days I felt like a psychologist, therapist, exterminator, janitor, HVAC technician, handyman, manager, slave, father, prison warden, the list goes on and on. Stressful is an understatement. Aside from literally having to play many roles, there are really two factors that determine your experience here. One, location, and two, staff. I had the worse of both. One, I worked at an urban location where delinquency was high(meaning a lot of late customers, people peeing/pooping in the building, rude/nasty/entitled customers who would threaten you, yell at you to your face) And two, I worked with many, and I mean many employees who were lazy and did the bare minimum. One thing with ESS is team work truly makes the dream work. Each property is mainly staffed 2-3 people, so the real issue is the employees. Customers will be customers, there‚Äôs always a way to deal with people if you do so with respect and dignity. The problem is when you work with people who are not self starters, lazy, take advantage, and want to get paid without doing work, THATS when the job can take you through some of the worse seasons. Extra Space is interesting because it combines both physical and mental. On one hand there‚Äôs the physical side of the job where you have to clean storage units, maintain landscaping by picking up trash, cleaning stairwells, changing light bulbs, cleaning elevator tracks, mopping, you literally do it all. Then, there‚Äôs the mental side where you have to assist customers, manage auctions, sell units, make rental/delinquent phone calls. Now again, it‚Äôs all apart of the territory. And for the most part as overwhelming as that may sound, it actually isn‚Äôt too bad IF you have a team. This is where your experience drastically changes because if you work with someone who for example has anger issues, is overweight and lazy, someone who perhaps cannot take criticism well, someone who sees a customer park and runs to the bathroom to ‚Äúdodge‚Äù a customer, it becomes hell. This is when you can feel the weight pill on because if you are someone who cares about your job, passionate, self starter, but work with others who aren‚Äôt, you will be abused to high heaven , and this job turned me into a horrible human being. I loved people and took pride in my job in the early years, but as time progressed and I worked with people who were in fact lazy, took advantage and did the bare minimum, it made me a bitter person, a person who no longer cared about others, a more reserved and quiet person. This job truly took a toll on me for the worse. What kept me going honestly was the live on site because of course I wasn‚Äôt paying rent so it was a huge blessing, especially since I am a single father, however, it cost me my peace, my sanity, my mental, I‚Äôm no longer the person I used to be. I know this may sound dramatic, but I am a person who does care and I always do any job with passion and care. It sucks when you wish you can ‚Äúturn off the care‚Äù but can‚Äôt. And when you work with others who don‚Äôt care, this job can feel like torture. Anyone considering working for ESS, I would still recommend to the company, but again, location and staff will HIGHLY impact your experience here.

title: Great company with awesome management!
pros: When I was first presented with the opportunity to interview at Extra Space Storage, I thought storage sounded so boring (I was currently working at a huge online retailer).. but I researched the company and heard nothing but good things, and am so glad I took the job here almost two years ago! Even though storage isn't the most thrilling product, what I love about ESS is that they are always trying to keep their employees excited and involved, and are constantly growing and changing to keep up with technology and trends. They completely renovated the office space so it's very modern and open, there is free coffee, soda, and fruit, monthly office socials, food truck parties just to show the employees their appreciation, holiday parties, summer parties, and more! The benefits are fantastic - great medical, dental, vision, PTO, incentives to stay healthy and fit, 401K, and more.. The executive team is by far the best I've ever worked with- there are no egos (rare nowadays!), they value their employees' opinions, they remain transparent with everything going on with the company, and take the time to get to know each employee. Joe (the CEO) is by far the nicest CEO I've ever worked with as well. There's a reason why we've become one of the best places to work!
cons: I would say the training has lacked a little bit, but we just barely rolled out a new training program so that took care of it!

title: Extra Space Storage

title: Great place to work
pros: I really love working with customers but at a place that really wants me to grow and excel, as opposed to a large retailer/department store. I manage my own property and have a lot of control of what my day to day looks like. Like with all customer service jobs there are always going to be a few difficult customer situations, but for the most part I have great relationships with my regulars and I enjoy going to work everyday. I also really like being able to split my day between outside and indoor tasks. My property has an excellent view and it's nice to be able to walk or take the golf cart out and do some cleaning if you want to stretch your legs and get some fresh air. Also, when you do eventually work your way to being a store manager, most properties come with an apartment where you live on site, and the apartments are actually really nice with new appliances (dishwasher, washer/dryer, full kitchen and stove, full bathroom, etc). Most are two bedrooms one bath, and some even have a balcony or patio. I also really love getting off by 6pm every night (and 5:30pm on Saturdays) and always having Sundays off. That has been game changing and now that I have it I'm not sure I would take a job with sporadic hours. Everyone is really nice here, and like I said earlier the higher ups DO want you to get the most out of your experience and this is a company that definitely promotes from within to see their staff grow. I personally love working here and don't see myself changing companies anytime soon. If I want to grow beyond my store manager position there are many opportunities for me to do so, but I really like running my store and making it the best it can be.
cons: Unfortunately, there are a few downsides that come with all customer service jobs and a few specific to storage. People will come in upset with either their rate going up, or something with their unit they need fixed, or even worse there could have been a break-in or rodents in their unit. These are not every day conversations but they are tough when you get them. It is also hard sending people to auction when they haven't paid in a long time, but ExtraSpace is VERY flexible and I'm glad I am able to offer people the chance to come get their items at a higher reduced price if they can no longer afford the payments.

title: Great entry level job. has promise for more, But room for improvement.
pros: -Autonomy: Largely responsible for how your own day goes. as you work by yourself most of the time -Mostly Laid back. As long as you are on top of your daily tasks the job can be very easy. with some days being hectic. -Opportunities: Size of company and number of locations allow for many additional opportunities as your life and career advances - Great Entry Level: If your looking to make a major career change. this can be a great Entry level job to get your foot in the door. as long as you have great customer service and presentation. - Other Store managers and Assistant managers are largely very helpful and kind. So far have not met anyone at this level who has not been a kind and genuine person. Benefits are decent: Heath insurance, dental, vision Retirement Plans, as well as some discounts and coupons available for a variety of things. your plan is largely Customizable to an extent to fit your needs.
cons: Tennant rate increases: Rate increases are sent out by cooperate, customer will call often angry asking for answers for large increases you were unaware of. while increases are an understandable part of the job, this interaction is one of the worst parts of the day. High expectations and but rarely scheduled with additional help. As stated before you are often working alone. while this can be great. company has high expectations many of which Can be close to imposible to maintain on a regularly when things get busy with out at lease one more person. no room for free thinking: Many complaints seem to be brushed over and waived or explained away as being excuses . If you tow the company line and keep your opinion to yourself you will have a much easier time....with that said i find myself in a district with a wonderful DM. if you are lucky enough to be in the same boat this may not be as much of an issue Pay while better than some could definitely be better than it is: pays better than my last job but with the high amount of success the company has had and the pride they have for Year over Year Net income growth. you would think the pay would reflect that. in addition Monthly Incentive bonus's while nice have only gone Down every month since I've been with the company and i would say hardly incentivize anything. Extra Space like most/All companies is a product of Capitalism. which means Revenue above all else. but there is great Potential for the company to evolve. i hope the company reads these reviews and uses them to improve where it is needed. in summary overall decent place to work but always pay attention to your situation.

title: Great Job!

cons: No longer control my schedule

title: The Perfect Blend of a Physical job and an Office Job
pros: 1.) I get to work outside doing physical work, but I can schedule my day as needed, so that if its too hot or too cold at some point in the day I can choose to do my office work during that time. 2.) If I feel like I've spent too much time making calls and answering emails I can go outside to clean a unit, Help customers on site or do any of the many other things that constantly need to get done. 3.) Lots of Career opportunities. If you want a company to grow with Extra Space is the place to be. I started working with Extra Space as an Assistant Manager and with in 5 months I worked my way to Site Manager and have had very open conversations about how to progress from here in order to keep growing with the company. 4.) Awesome company culture. Extra Space really cares about the people they hire and they work hard to make sure that they continue to hire people who care. The company values are listed as Integrity, Excellence, Innovation, Teamwork, and Passion. And the company truly works to live those values everyday. 5.)The hours. There is a definite respect for work life balance. No schedule is perfect, but I love that we always get Sunday off, and that if I am responsible about staying in communication about my needs my supervisor is willing to be reasonably flexible. 6.) The people are the best of the best. Extra Space holds it self accountable to its high standard based off of its company values and it works hard at finding and hiring people who feel passionate about living a life based on values, and I am grateful for that because everyone I have had the pleasure of working with so far has not only been a great team mate, but also a great person.
cons: Like any job there are cons, but I definitely feel that for me the pros outweigh the cons. That may not be the case for everyone, so I think its important to answer some of the questions that may have come up from seeing the other reviews from other employees. 1.) Have I had to pick up Human Feces? Yes. Was I happy about it? Absolutely Not! Do I blame the company? No. In both situations where customers choose to be this disrespectful and disgusting I had a civilized discussions with said customers and they received repercussions for their actions. 2.) Am I mostly working alone? Yes. As a Site Manager I am normally the only one at my site, which depending on the day can be a pro or a con. On busy days it can feel like a lot, but for the most part I have created a work flow that allows me to get things done in a timely manner. But it can get a little lonely on slow days. 3.) Am I required to help other stores? Yes. As mentioned before, managers are normally at their site by themselves, if a site is more busy than another the busy site will reach out for help with their calls, so they can get some of their physical work done in a timely manager. To be this isn't a burden its a way to build trust and relationships with other managers in my district. But if teamwork isn't your thing keep that in mind. 4.) Are we asked to request reviews from customers? Yes. Currently we are asked to get at least 10 reviews a month. They are easy to send and easy for the customer to fill out. It literally can be as quick as 4 taps on their phone. From opening the link to choosing how many stars to give their experience. I normally get at least 15 to 20 reviews a month.

title: Diamond in the Rough
pros: .Upper Management is a well oiled machine that knows how to handle any major projects with ease .Network of help desk agents or team leads to help solve any problem you run into no matter how small so you always have help .Live on Site options all over the country .Easy to find a rhythym with the daily workload once aquainted .Work can feel very rewarding as you get to help people in all types of situations and build a connection with your community
cons: .Long learning curve before you are tuly able to handle your position with some ease, the resources are there for help but until you know the ins and outs it can be very stressful .Stressful situations can be quite common as our customers are usually people moving or struggling to find space for items and tensions can run high when valuables and money are involved. .No recognition for manual workload, all they celebrate is numbers and sales. Get 10 more rentals than normal cool you get a bigger bonus, but spend days and weeks hard at work on the property and theyll never know. .Pay is OK if you have an easy property to handle but if you have one with increased workload or issues you wont be getting payed more. Still think they should pay better overall and let there emloyees have Livable wages instead of survivable wages..

title: Do not work here!!
pros: Very hard to get fired and gives you lots of chances to fail before they pull the plug. Gives you an allowance for shirts and shoes every year. Yearly percentage bonus based off performance but very skewed so a 50/50.
cons: This would be a no star if i could make it that but I can‚Äôt. Toxic work environment. Corporate doesn‚Äôt care about field level employees at all. You will work way more than you have too especially if you live on site. They don‚Äôt pay very well, corporate keeps all the money even though they don‚Äôt do anything except send emails out. For the pay, which is not good at all, you‚Äôre required to run a million dollar business every year and know everything about it. If you start to hit your bonus goal they cap you off and lower the payout, when it should be the other way around. You have a ton of metrics to hit for sales and for your store and they‚Äôre almost impossible to hit altogether. Corporate really has no idea how to run the sales process but yet require the field employees to know it better than your children. Corporate has zero respect for field level employees. They expect you to deal with rate increases and upset customers when you had nothing to do with it in the first place and then it‚Äôs the field level employees fault for not keeping them as a customer or if they leave a bad review when again we had nothing to do with the issue. Company doesn‚Äôt value its employees and doesn‚Äôt care about screwing people over, the most unethical company you will come across, they don‚Äôt care about customers and employees. If Extra Space can screw over a customer and find a loop hole then bet your butt they will find a way. You also only get 3 paid days off throughout the year. Banks are off employees should be off Also don‚Äôt expect to move up unless you want to work here for no pay for 15-20 years and maybeeee and I mean maybeeee have a shot to get an interview but the average response is that you don‚Äôt have enough experience and then they hire a 21 year old fresh out of college with no experience and no clue how to do anything. 15-17 bucks an hour isn‚Äôt worth the stress and headache that this job will put you through. Better be ready to have those knee pads ready if you want to get anywhere in this company, if you catch my drift. Also benefits package is outrageous for a field employee. If you opt into it as a field level employee, it will be roughly 1/3 your pay or more and that‚Äôs if your single, have a family then cut your paycheck in half and some.

title: Easy job / Needs work
pros: The pay is not bad for the area I live, the mileage and travel time make its better though. Coworkers are more often than not a great time to be with and work with. The team in my area is very family friendly when it comes to last minute emergencies and such. The room for growth is there if you wish.
cons: Oh the cons... I feel like some employees are not recognized properly for the work they put in. I also believe some store managers should not be store managers and dare I say not be apart of the extra space team. Hard to have motivation when bad work ethic and rule breaking goes unpunished while hard work and dedication goes unrewarded. It's strange to stay but becoming a store manager is a con there's not a great enough pay bump to make up for the travel you had as an assistant manager. And that's just off what I've been told. A personal con to the job as an assistant manager is going weeks without working with someone. Having to cover down on the busiest sites in our district alone on a Monday morning to start a week is not fun. Having to clean up messes left behind from a store manager who doesn't care isn't a good time either.

title: Happy Employee
pros: The best part about working for Extra Space Storage as a Store Manager is management has a lot of respect for their front-line employees and you work by yourself a good amount of time. The pay is respectable, and the benefits are excellent. Extra Space Storage hires a better quality of employees versus other storage companies so most of the employees are a joy to work with at the site. The company has a monthly incentive pay out and the Store Manager gets a larger portion of the money. Real incentive to become a Store Manager. The hours are not too early and not too late. (9:30 am - 6:00 pm M-F & 9:00 am - 5:30 pm on Sat.) My District Manager tries to work with personal schedules for days off within reason, but the business needs must come before personal preferences. I personally like having a day off during the week. Management supports your decisions when you are doing the right thing by the company and the customer. This is the best company I have ever worked for in my life and I have been employed with several large corporations, such as Bellsouth, Verizon Wireless, Bank of America, Wachovia Bank, LGE Community Credit Union, Chase Bank.
cons: Health insurance deductibles are ridiculously high.

title: Change
pros: ESS spends 2 weeks training you in person at a central location, and then continues to train and teach through e-learnings once you are at your home site. DM is very involved and will answer any questions you may have. Overall super easy job. A little overwhelming at first, but with all the support you figure it out within a month or so. Got to stay on top of a lot. Calling customers, cleaning, and online paperwork stuff. Lost of cleaning. I would like to continue to stay here as long as the opportunity to grow is there. Lots of freedom throughout the day to do what needs to be done.
cons: End up working alone a lot. The algorithm that decides hours based on units is broken. A busy small site doesn't get as much hours as a slow large site. In a perfect scenario there should be 2 people at every property and the only considerations should be if a 3rd is needed. Shouldn't have to go days at a time without help and have to plan when things can get done based on coverage. Taking time off is a problem because of this. Dont feel safe alone when working at night, especially with day light savings time crap. Here for an hour in the dark until close. Can't really rent to customers or clean after 5pm. I think we need to change hours to 8am-5pm during the winter months.

title: Company Review
pros: great benefits, and great co workers
cons: not enough double coverage. sometimes communication is not the best.

title: Great however
pros: The company as a whole puts a lot of effort into making sure employees feel cared for. Being a publicly traded company they do routine evaluations of cost of living and adjust pay according to their perspective per region. Current District manager is new and has been super busy but she's been amazing to work with. I feel like things are finally getting done. I feel like she's listening and that she and I align on a lot of goals. She's the reason I'm still here. Now I feel like I have the resources and support I need to continue making progress with this store.
cons: There are people at the district level that clearly don't care. I had a sit-in DM try to tell me that all the problems I asked her for help with; the problems that my store has had for years before I got here, are all my fault because of "time management." I had another district level manager imply that I get paid too much and she reiterated about "time management." I am glad to work on time management but that wasn't what any of this was about. I was being blamed for things that existed before I got here and then not get recognized for the leaps and bounds of improvements this store has experienced since I got here. That is a horribly unhealthy way for leadership to behave. People don't quit bad jobs, they quit bad managers. Unrelated but it is worth noting that I do not get paid enough for the cost of living for this area, let alone for the work I do. My rent is $1800/mnth. My paychecks come out to $2600/mnth after taxes and insurance. It's not sustainable. I intend to be a father one day and I don't even get paid enough to save for a house. I have now gotten sick from mold/mildew in a unit, I've had to come in on my days off because people keep breaking the doors, and I've had to clean up fecal matter. None of that is the company's fault but just know what you're getting into if you want to work here.

title: Awesome Company To Work For!
pros: I`ve been with Extra Space over five years now and have yet to have a day I didn't want to be here. Management on the divisional level and district level are amazing and always responsive when needed. They have always been willing to work with me through numerous cross country moves even when the initial solution/move was not ideal we managed to compromise and work toward the end result that was ideal. They continually offer numerous outlets to actively grow and explore your position. Being a team player also plays a large roll in making Extra Space a great place to work. We try our best to help each other out when available and it creates almost a sense of community rather just being a co-workers. Being able to call the store in your area and have them help you out with a question or issue really helps build that sense of community and strengthen our team. The company has made amazing strides over the past several years to stay ahead of the curve and remain current with the changes in times and technology. With that being said the work flow has also changed and expanded beyond the original basic facility maintenance and minor administrative work by offering us a more hands on approach to running our stores. Having these administrative tasks to look into and take care of has greatly increased my confidence as a manager and helped me grow my knowledge base in amazing ways. In all Extra Space Storage has made an amazing environment for its employees to learn, grow, and expand in our fields and continues to put forth a great deal of effort to carry this on.
cons: Couldn't pick any if I tried!

title: Yes! I like it here!

title: The Walmart of Storage
pros: Sometimes managers let me handle emergencies without taking my PTO.
cons: * Senior management retaliated when I reported a data breach. Management ordered me to not rock the boat and gave me an official reprimand. They then subsequently swept the whole data breach under the rug by saying it didn't exist, despite all the provided evidence. * I worked here with my wife. She suddenly ended up in urgent care and then the emergency room. She kept in constant contact with her manager to let her know. She was a hard, dedicated worker up to this point. She was fired the next day for "job abandonment". I know her emergency contact was never even contacted, which is protocol, because I am her emergency contact. * I asked about how to promote to a new role doing UX work. My manager asked me to gather info and we could talk about it. I gathered info and gave it to the manager. After 5 months and several dozen reminders, my manager told me that because "times are tough" I just needed to "keep my head down and we could discuss in a year". ......yeah. * Management constantly swooped in on teammates, Seagull style, to make immediate changes and decisions without discussing literally anything with anyone that would be impacted. * I have been in meeting where Senior management casually refers to their retail workers as "rabid, wild animals".

title: 4 Years and counting......

title: Great place to work!

title: It's a job.
pros: Easier than traditional retail. Sundays off usually. Those with below-average intellect can still do the job well as it's very repetitive. Won't starve to death with a job. Easier than planning and carrying out a bank heist. Being employed looks good on a resume. 50% discount on moving supplies.
cons: All sites are chronically understaffed; instead of doing anything about it the leadership team will just claim they are working on it (this is occurring in at least half a dozen major markets in the US, not simply the region I work.) Know that if you are hired as an Assistant Manager you WILL have to work at three or four different locations with your schedule changing weekly. Medical insurance is expensive. Most upper management are outsiders and only know how to run a facility in theory. Raises are minuscule. You might have your schedule changed without being notified and expected to work on your day off. No training on repairs or maintenance but they expect employees to do it regardless. Low employee morale typically caused by understaffing and being overworked. Praise goes to those who suck up to supervisors, not those who work hard (could also be listed as a pro I guess.) Tenants can occasionally be horrible, either in additude or behavior, though depends on location.

title: Great Company!
pros: At the corporate level, employees are able to have a good work-life balance and career growth. Extra Space does a great job of having an inclusive workplace.
cons: Pay and benefits are okay. There is potential career growth but pay increases are minimal. Upper management is really against remote work; depending on your team, you might be required to be in the office 4-5 days a week.

title: Great company
pros: Extra Space Storage is a great place to work. Been with them for 27 years now. The reason I love this company, is the work ethics. The team at corporate office always listens to the employees. Its the employees that help the company grow. We are all a large family.
cons: Staffing shortages. Need more to join the Extra Space Storage team.

title: Do Not Come In Expecting Opportunity Growth From The Ground Up
pros: A fast paced environment with little down time. A workplace with many goals to achieve and to track with a workplace balance that is exceptional.
cons: Field employees are rarely given their chance to move forward in this company causing them to lose internal talent. A talent drain with field employees has been extensive across the board with few high performers, causing the company to charge far more than the market value of units and goods to make up for the talent drain of their field employees. The only reason it's top 90 of 100 companies in the US on Glassdoor, is that it asks its employees to review the company positively in exchange for gift card chances. I would not recommend this job to friends or family members as they over manage their expectations of employees and pay below the industry average. For an example if your slightly overweight, you will be looked down upon and be told that you need to meet the company image. You can take your complaint to HR but they will do nothing if you have nothing in writing. If you get too old, in a corporate position, they try to push you out even if you perform to a high standard, which is around 50. They'll hire district managers that cause multi million dollar class action lawsuits and fire an entire district worth of employees without just cause but keep them in line to be senior district managers. Any other workplace would remove these people but Extra Space Storage embraces them.

cons: Significantly under paid for all the duties expected, raises are minimal at best, growth opportunities are sparse (I had them, others did not do to lack of positions to ‚Äúgrow‚Äù in to), significantly understaffed- while somehow telling you you are over staffed, upper management refuses to face customer complaints unless a negative review had impacted the sites/districts KPIs, no such thing as positive feedback- only negative-across the board‚Ä¶. My favorite‚Ä¶forget finding a career here to retire with unless your upper management. ESS finds reasons to get rid of people, or chase them out, if you start to push back, or make too much money. Oh and the policy book changes regularly without notice or a date stamp so good luck! Soooooo run!!!!

title: I sometimes wish I had passed away in my sleep than have to go to work lol.
pros: Covered parking area, working by yourself sometimes. Getting a day off during the week to apply to and interview for better career opportunities. Monthly incentive bonus, its not much but it's something.
cons: Error prone software, everything you do is scrutinized, we have meetings and they tell you it's ok to do something, but a month later you have to explain why you did the thing they told you it was ok to do. Inept lazy site managers. Pay is pretty crummy considering , I am cutting locks, being a janitor, selling merchandise, renting storage units, making delinquency calls, making unnecessary follow up rental calls, calling/harassing reservations and leads 5 times in 3 days. The incentive bonus.... The sites where the manager lives on site don't pay for rent, electricity, heat or water, but get 35% off the top of the monthly incentives. Only 4 paid holidays, they whine if god forbid some reservation shows up 5 minutes to close on a holiday, and the person than proceeds to make 2 more additional reservations and you have to show them all the units until they finally decide on the unit they want, and by 6:45 pm on memorial day you finally get to leave, but have to explain why you were there 45 minutes past closing time.

title: Favorite place to work

title: Good Work Environment
pros: I came to ESS after a career of more than 30 years in retail grocery. This is a nice change from the daily hustle of a grocery store. Fellow associates are great, District and Store Managers were helpful in my transition to a different work environment. Upper management seems to genuinely care about this business and employees who work for them.
cons: I have no real cons about working here.

title: Progressive and Innovative Company
pros: Extra Space empowers and trusts us to make decisions for our Stores on behalf of Extra Space Storage. There's no micromanaging or fear of making mistakes. The Company offers opportunities to grow as the Company grows each year. The training is great and Extra Space is committed to making it a great and enjoyable place to work.
cons: The pay is not terrible, but certainly not great. It can take years to reach the Corporate level. Corporate receives better benefits then the field employees do. The stores are only closed four days a year with Holiday pay. Work/life balance is decent, but could be better with improved pay and benefits. Outside of this, Extra Space is a great place to work.

title: Used new staff to cover for Managers

title: Teamwork Everyday

title: Extra Greed Storage
pros: Store managers and assistant managers along with our district team leader are good quality people and are all helpfull. Starting pay is fair for the market. Paid time off is good and benefits are good . Work hours are pretty good.
cons: Where as the starting pay is decent the raises you get at the store level are pathetic considering the huge profits Extra Space Storage has made in recent years and the fact the store employees are the ones busting their butts making the corporate big shots rich. Now I'm a bussiness major so I understand the need for a company to increase it's revenues and profits but Extra Space goes to far as they try to nickle and dime their customers at every turn. Extra Space pushes its employees to use bait and switch tactics when renting storage units to customers. They force customers to buy storage insurance . As one customer told me sounds like ObamaCare ( where the federal government mandates that everyone buys health insurance). Extra Space also loves to jack up tenants rates . Now I understand rate increases are necessary but their increases are ridiculously high and of course it's the store employees who catch the crap from angry tenants. The computer system that Extra Space uses is outdated slow and prone to many errors which can make life hell for store employees. Technical support from The "Help" Desk is slow and useless. In a nutshell Extra Space is extremely greedy and at times unethical. Which is why I can't wait to find new employment.

title: Employment opinion
pros: Stability, customer interaction and hours of operation.
cons: Finding reliable employees that are willing to do all job duties and carry their own weight. The staff that we hire for handyman work is always the lowest bid and 9 times out of 10 the work is mediocre at best. Not enough employees in our area but we just recently hired two new employees so hopefully it will get better. The Store Managers should get paid higher wages considering all of the physical work that is weighed on our shoulders. I cant even get someone to pick up large items by my dumpster so I end up doing it myself taking it to the dump, saving the company money and keeping my property looking nice. I'm not getting paid bulk item removal fee to do so. It's a lot of work and we just aren't recognized for being the brain and body of each store. Maybe if the DM's or higher up employees actually were Store managers they would understand better as to what all we go through on a daily basis.

title: Very satisfied!
pros: I've worked at the Extra Space corporate location for less than a year. I have been really impressed at the quality of talent found here. There are a lot of really smart people which always creates a wonderful environment for learning from others and producing quality work. Pay is very competitive and from what I have seen, they definitely promote from within when they can. Company cares about your feedback. We recently had a town-hall meeting in which we voices all types of concerns to the CEO and the rest of the executive team. They also send surveys to rate people you work with, including your boss. They have a great fit reimbursement program where they reimburse you 50% of gym fees/fitness equipment etc up to $500 (they will reimburse $250 each year). The company is booming and probably will for a very long time. It's a very technologically savvy company and that makes things run so much better than if you were to work somewhere where they were behind on technology. Chief executive team is wonderful. They are definitely approachable. Overall, I cannot complain. It's a great corporate job with amazing pay. I love my job and I work with really smart coworkers.
cons: Long hours at some departments, need for more flexible schedules for all departments. Benefits are better than average, but not amazing.

title: Great Company, Awesome Boss
pros: Excellent work environment, Advancement , Great Incentive, Great management and co-workers. I have worked in the Bucks County/Bensalem/Philadelphia/Pittsburgh District for over seven years. I have had the pleasure of working with a great senior management team. Presently, I report to an excellent district manager. He is results-driven, supportive and always available to discuss my present and future career goals. What is really impressive is that I have been a management/professional for over twenty years and I still learn new things from him. Our district manager takes the time to visit us one on one and discuss our property and ways to make our business better. He is always teaching us new aspects of business so the job never gets stale. You only have to drive by the properties or look at the site reviews to see he oversees a staff that cares about our customers and their overall satisfaction. He also promotes within and fosters a great relationship among his managers. I also was managed by his assistant for two years. She too is class act and always there if we need her. All and all I give my employer and management team five stars. But seeing is believing. Apply in this district and you will see that if you are dedicated and willing to work hard, our DM and the company will reward you. I am very pleased to be an Extra Space Storage property manager working in the Bucks County/Philadelphia/Pittsburgh Market. I highly recommend.
cons: College Tuition reimbursement for advancement to senior management opportunities.

title: Hard work, dedication, and integrity pay off here!
pros: Management at Extra Space is the best I've ever seen. They genuinely care about the staff and want us to feel fulfilled and challenged. My manager always gives me sound, educated advice but allows me to work through issues or come up with ideas for improvement on my own when appropriate. I always feel supported and empowered by my manager. One of the best things about working for Extra Space Storage is that I know the things I do matter. If I accept challenge and change with a positive attitude, work with integrity, and consistently do my best every day, it is noticed and it matters. If I were to resist challenge or change, have a poor attitude, avoid getting my job done, or act with anything less than impeccable integrity, that would also be noticed and would also matter. Depending on a person's own work ethic, they may or may not like working here for those reasons. You also need to be able to understand and carry out your work and be willing to continue to learn and improve.
cons: There really aren't any. Extra Space is a fantastic company.

title: A thank you to Extra Space Storage
pros: Where to even start. The family bond we all have, the career options, the culture, the upper management and more. These are all areas that leave me waking up extremely happy to come to work. I have gained so much self confidence since working with this company. I was always used to being in the shadows working at other retail jobs where it only mattered if you had a specific title in your name. It is far from that in Extra Space Storage. No matter who you are, what you do, you matter. Your co-workers and upper management know your name and treat you as an equal.
cons: Finding cons is truly difficult. I would suggest more traveling for field employees to have the chance to visit the home office and a tour of the National Call Center.

title: Extra Space has us do reviews to keep the rating High!
pros: 9:30-6pm work day Guaranteed 2 days off Easy work when you have 2 people Each day is basically the same No long lines or super busy days Lots of time to talk with fellow team members and guests
cons: The rating above is BS we are asked by the company to do reveiws annually to improve our rating here! Promotions or Growth opportunities given based on how long you‚Äôve worked here, not because of your ability. Company not hiring staff effectively. Important Emails and Texts ignored. Sometimes you need help NOW but left to just figure it out for yourself. Training program Sucks Most managers in Richmond shouldn't have jobs, yet we won‚Äôt hire new people. (As if we have some sort of high standards) Scheduling: Many are with little or no help while some stores have people getting paid to sit and talk to each other. We could simply split the staff across the district and fix staffing issues No staff

title: Extra Space
pros: Good benefits and good bonus / commission structure. This company is the highest pay in the industry. Extra Space advancement opportunities are available as well as transfers to any facility in this Nat'l Corp.
cons: Don't be fooled. This is not an office job. If you walked into a facility and thought the Mgr you spoke with had it made, and left thinking this is just an easy office job, think again. Doesn't matter your gender or age, be prepared to be responsible for most any maintenance issue. Extra Space is considered the cleanest in the industry. To accomplish that you will be scrubbing walls, doors and floors then wiping it all down with rags to achieve a dust and dirt free unit, which may be inspected by you DM. I tell you this because no one told me this when I hired on, and no one mentioned there is no maintenance personnel hired for the properties. This can be a problem for some in the freezing cold or the stifling heat. You will be gritty dirty on a regular basis, and still be responsible for greeting customers and running your office. And thats just the units....the entire property needs cleaning daily, as well as CC halls need mopped regularly, and roll up garage doors are hand washed as well to be free of dust. It's good honest work, but you will WORK. Other than that, it's a good company, built around a strong team atmosphere.
