title: Steady paycheck
pros: Steady paycheck Vacation time Incentive bonus each month if you can hit goals If you are a manager of a site that has an apartment you can live on site rent free Store managers are allowed to have 2 days off in a row but not Saturday's Free storage unit for managers
cons: Health care too expensive and continue to raise rates Hourly pay could be better considering how much work on the property your expected to do Hours not family friendly When your site is highly occupied you lose out on my nice give bonus As an employee you are expected to have a cell phone in case you are needed at the site after hours but you are not compensated for it Assistant managers do not get 2 days off in a row. It is Sunday and one other day the AM chooses Managers are required to work every Saturday Corp office spends money on things that are not necessary instead of putting it in places that will be better spent

title: Backsliding Company
pros: It truly is hard to find something to rave about. However it was not always this way.
cons: We have so much paperwork it is ridiculous. We have so many reports to roll up on a weekly and monthly basis. The content of these reports are things we normally should be doing or business numbers of which we should already be aware. Instead of the District Managers addressing lack in the areas ofthose reports with individual personnel, the middle managers have chose to inflict discipline on their entire group rather than those who are the offenders. This tendency has evolved into the overall style of management. Another thing I despise is the company Facility Operations Manual specifically says the customer has two options for insurance on their stored goods. Either Extra Space insurance (CPP) or their own (home owners/renters). The Ops Manual also says never lose a rental over insurance. However many employees have been disciplined and even terminated for not getting CPP insurance on over 94% of their rentals. This company pays great lip service to valuing their employees, however their actions show they do not. We are expected to do sales, collections, cleaning and maintenance of property and offices along with two pages of other tasks on a daily basis. We are highly underpaid and overworked

title: Great benefits, OK pay

title: Good place to work

cons: Can be a problem if you are not a self-starter

title: Great Company
pros: Great management, hours, team comaraderie. And a great chance to grow and expand your job horizon.
cons: I do not have one

title: love Extra Space
pros: the company is so awesome i love coming to work
cons: i do not have any cons

title: Awesome Company
pros: Great company with an amazing team. The benefits is one of the reason I returned to Extra Space.
cons: The only down size to work with Extra Space is Saturday workday. Which really is not a down size.

title: Awesome place to work
pros: I started with Extra Space Storage 09/11/2017 and it's been awesome. A company that cares about the employees. This is a awesome place to work, stress free and happy work place.
cons: None that I can think of.

title: Site Manager
pros: Management gives you the freedom to run your site with out micro managing you, the expectations are clear and you are provided the tools you need to get the job done. The DM is also very motivational, he pushes you to reach your goals and will provide you the information you need to understand those goals and how to reach them.
cons: Scheduling can be tough at times, employees are moved from a site that they have worked at for months with no notice to them or the manager at the site. This creates inconsistency for the customers who like seeing the same faces when they come to the facility. It is also hard on the managers and assistants that work well together and have a routine figured out to then have to re-train and re-learn a new employee or site, I understand they don't want complacency and they want everyone to learn and grow but at lease give us warning that staffing is changing.

title: Assistant Site Manager
pros: I have been here almost a year and after having such bad luck with jobs I am happy to say I LOVE MY JOB! The hours are great and love having Sundays off. I really enjoy everyone I work with they are always happy to help. We are a big family here and all stay connected. I really enjoy the customer service side. There is never a slow time, we always have customers or projects going on. We do at least one event a year as a district, I have even met the CEO! I would recommend this job to anyone who is hard working and really enjoys people. You will have a ton of stories to share during your time with Extra Space storage. I also really like that we are expanding so quickly, there is always opportunity popping up to move up.
cons: Only thing I could complain on is cleaning... but it varies from store to store. It really is not too bad in most stores, but this is something you are made aware of before taking the job so you already know what you are signing up for. A lot of times I enjoy it, makes the day go by faster. Plus they do everything they can to make your job easier for you. They really do care.

title: ESS = The Career
pros: Culture, Work/Life Balance, and Opportunity.
cons: Rapid growth can create different challenges and time constraints in all areas of operation, but not necessarily a bad thing.

title: Love Extra Space
pros: Absolute blessing to be able to live onsite. Wonderful leadership, and great team atmosphere. Competitive pay
cons: Could use a new golf cart

title: Company that cares
pros: This company cares about its employees
cons: Work and home life balance. Working Saturdays isn't ideal, especially when you store is empty

title: My experience may be different from yours
pros: Very calm work environment. Just hope for good coworkers because you'll be spending lots of time with them
cons: Same routine every day. Might be a pro for some

title: Extra Space Storage
pros: friendly inspiring room to grow
cons: non consistent schedule lots of travel

title: Pros/Cons
pros: Great work life balance they offer
cons: The salary is quite low

title: Terrible company to work for.
pros: If you like working alone and making money for this greedy company that won't return some of those vast profits down to the people making them, then this is the place for you.
cons: Worked 2 years as an assistant manager and was told upon first being hired that I would move between 2 sites to assist the managers of those 2 sites. That was not the case of course. Within a few weeks I was working 4 different sites a week traveling all across our district and not being reimbursed for my mileage since the DM/DLS never informed me how the reimbursement worked. Upon discovering this month's later I was told I was SOL on those past months... For some reason I stayed any way and continued to be thrown around the district, working 4 different sites a week. Never getting weekends off and never having the same day off. They then expect you to basically harass your customers to no end with phone calls of some 'new' procedure that they will scrap in a few weeks. The corporate HQ is an embarrassment as they treat their employees like numbers because that is what ESS cares about most. I have never seen a company care so little about keeping their employees happy, but they sure do like to come down on you if one of your hundred different metrics is in the red. The straw that broke the camels back was that I was requesting bereavement and was told that if I could not find someone to cover I would be denied bereavement, I didn't even know they could do that but I guess they can.

title: I Love working at Extra Space
pros: Promotes from within Bonuses Friendly team mates
cons: I Don't have any cons

title: My Experience so far!
pros: I really enjoy working for this company! I feel comfortable, informed and honestly prepared for my career here at Extra Space Storage! The team is amazing and couldn't ask for a better job!
cons: Nothing bad to say honestly!

title: Bad hors and bad times to be off

title: Great Place to Work!
pros: I love working at Extra Space. Despite it being such a large company, you still feel valued as an individual employee. The culture here is unmatched!
cons: Nothing I can think of!

title: Options

title: Interview was very enjoyable
pros: I believe there are some great opportunities with this company.
cons: Don't know as of yet.

title: Zero Stress, Fun, and Plenty of Growth!
pros: Career building accomplishments, a great team work environment and a very satisfying company to work for. Being relocatable will help you "move up the ladder" fairly fast. One of the things that I appreciate the most with Extra Space Storage is how much they care about their employees and the product that we provide to our customers. The day to day operations as a Store Employee gives you the flexibility to be your own boss, which leaves you completely stress free at the end of the day. You can plan your day accordingly, and each day accomplish set tasks. This company pays great attention to detail to the whole process of what we do as employees at ESS. There is always someone willing to help or someone to answer any of your questions.
cons: There are constant changes to improve our day to day operations. So, if you have trouble adapting to new systems, policies and procedures; then this company might be difficult for you. The benefits can be a little expensive, but they offer a premium healthcare product.

title: Great company with amazing culture!
pros: Extra Space Storage is a great company that values its employees and customers! Great company to work for with amazing culture. I love working here!
cons: No cons for me as I love everything here.

pros: Good company culture culture culture
cons: Not great pay py oag

title: Good company to work at needs a little improvement
pros: Good hours Great work environment Great upper management A company that cares
cons: Needs better hourly pay Each store should have its own assistant

title: Low pay no help
pros: Stable, outside work 50% inside 50%
cons: Unrealistic sales goals tricky insurance sales low pay no help work alone a lot

title: Easy job
pros: The job itself is easy. Management is good in this district and the people are nice enough.
cons: The pay is not good or competitive. They have way to many metrics you have to meet that are ridiculous

title: Good company to work for
pros: Self starter, great team, good resources.
cons: Training time too short, each site needs a dedicated assistant manager.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Full Time status Almost set schedule Team work / Helpful team mates Set Schedule Work Indep
cons: Going outside in cold weather on some locations

title: Best Company to work for
pros: They listen to the employee!
cons: We end up doing more work and get more tired for the company to save money.

title: Great Company
pros: They had a great work culture The upper leadership was very friendly and encouraging
cons: Strict about working from home

title: In the race to be on time some people are being left behind
pros: Great schedule, no working past 6:00 PM, we are closed on Sunday. If needed we get free or discounted storage depending on job level.
cons: In an attempt to increase profits and keep expenses down most sites are manned by one person at a time. We are required to walk strangers through a warehouse to show units. They know we are alone and that is unsettling. Some warehouses are located off the beaten path and in questionable neighborhoods. Anything can happen with no witnesses and no help. We are expected to be there for the customers, answer calls within a certain time, follow up reservations within 15 minutes and leave the facility to go to the bank. With one person on site this is just not possible. The phone goes unanswered and customers wait for you to return. It's common for us to be yelled at by angry customers complaining about late fees and auctions or having to wait outside a locked office for you to return. Having another person for support will reduce these incidents.

title: A Good Place To Learn How to Run a Small Business
pros: There are pros to working here at store level. You get a level of autonomy that you wouldn't get at other places. Store level decisions are for the most part left up to me (with guidelines) and I am encouraged to run my store as a franchisee thinking of what my choices will lead to further down the line. There is a "we" culture and encouraged to help other employees out to reach our company goals. Competitive time off package that increases with tenure and medical benefits with 401k options. 99 percent of facilities are closed on Sundays and we get to set the tone for our daily work duties. If you take advantage of all training opportunities, an employee will gain a wealth of experience on how to be a future entrepreneur.
cons: Split days off, relaxed culture where the company gives troubled employees too many chances to succeed. Staffing is run extremely efficient so manager vacancies are felt by all and some hard to employ areas are never fully staffed. A manager will never get rich working at Extra Space and they pay about the industry average.

title: Great options the company offers
pros: clean,locations , operations, team work
cons: rate changes, maybe locations of sites

title: Lots of hard work
pros: Sundays off‚Ä¶..except for alarm calls
cons: Homeless tenants. Break ins. Drug use.

title: It‚Äôs ok
pros: Lots of down time. Cool co workers. Running my own store
cons: Mandatory saturdays. Pay is low , rude customers. Auctions can be stressful dealing with jerk customers, depending on your location you will deal with crackheads and thefts.

title: Great place to work
pros: Good salary, benefits and great people to work with.
cons: May have to work at other locations.

title: Wonderful Team
pros: comprehensive training, resources available at all times, useful benefits, great work/life balance, understanding/helpful team
cons: Some of the work can be stressful at facilities in less affluent areas.

title: Assistant Manager
pros: ExtraSpace has been my favorite job since I have been working. They pay well above minimum wage, have health and other insurance benefits for full AND part time, which is very rare in the modern day business world. Hours are always on a set schedule, on the few occasions you have to stay late but that is not bad at all. 401K, Paid for mileage when traveling to other stores to help out, ESS definitely cares about their employees.
cons: The only con that is really an issue is overtime. ESS does not allow overtime, so you will have to cut it sometime during the week, so either leave early, come in late, or take an extra xx amount of minutes for your lunch. The problem arises mainly on Saturdays when our office closes early, and is the end of our work week, so the only option is to eat the OT, but our company does not really like to pay for OT.

title: Great Place to work for!
pros: Independence, use of Critical Thinking, Great Team members and Management.
cons: While I am in a different position than most, I do see where money concerns do affect many team members. While I appreciate the idea of a monthly bonus based on rentals, one could ALWAYS make more of a monthly bonus by keeping costs under control EVEN IF the (previous) rental threshold was not met. I have sent ideas in the past suggesting a higher per hour with the current bonus set up would be beneficial, bust those properties with low inventory and/or high prices can only rent a fraction of what other stores can generate ( even in the same district) Especially with the fast approaching consensus on $15.00 per hour, employees would have options outside of Extra Space that are not currently viable.

title: Great place to work!
pros: This is a great place to work! Hours are excellent, you definitely get a sense of ownership and learn what it's like to manage a large business. Competitive pay, 401k match is decent, PTO is better than most. You earn 80 hours a year your first year, then 120 hours per year after the first year. It goes up based on your length of employment. You should be self motivated with a big focus on cleanliness. It's a team environment and you can always reach out to others for assistance.
cons: The biggest problem I have seen since I started working here is the constant turn over of employees. No matter how many people they hire, it always seems to be short handed. The down side to that is that a lot of the time you will be working by yourself, even if you work at a large store.

title: Great place to work
pros: The company really cares about you as a person. Great benefits and great hours. They will also work with you if you need time off. Awesome work/ life balance!
cons: I have not found any yet!

title: Amazing Company, Full of Opportunities
pros: Plenty of opportunities to grow Great pay Hands on training and post training guidance Company with ethics that you can stand behind
cons: Working different properties in different areas Frequent travel

title: Great Company, Great Culture
pros: The culture here at ESS is great. I have an amazing district manager who truly values his employees. His constant feedback is so valuable. He genuinely cares and wants you to grow and succeed. The schedule is pretty sweet as well: 9:30am-6pm and closed on Sundays. This is a heavily customer oriented job. You'll deal with a huge variety of people every day. Some are great, but you'll also experience some not so great ones. Just something to keep in mind. Overall I have enjoyed my time here. The culture is inclusive and supportive.
cons: The pay is pretty bad considering what we do. As a SM, you are responsible for EVERYTHING on the property. Maintenance and upkeep, billing from vendors, foreclosures, etc. Often there is only one person on site, so it gets overwhelming at times. Also be prepared to have people very angry with you and scream a lot. I've had many screw this moments as customers take everything that is wrong in their lives out on you. Have a thick skin! Another thing I really REALLY despise is the fact that we are expected to get at least 10 Google reviews a month. If you don't, be prepared to get called out on it on a Teams meeting. The Google metric is the worst. Lastly, there's not much room for advancement beyond the store level.

title: Great company, great people!
pros: Work-Personal life balance company culture and values opportunities to grow people!
cons: Cannot think of anything that could be put under the cons category

title: Annoying sales techniques, over indulging the company, too many secret shoppers.
pros: Decent pay, benefits, steady job
cons: ESU is ridiculous, hard to do when there's work to be done. The SIZZLE customer service is ridiculous. Good customer service is important, but they take it to the point where it's not genuine, but a script. If you need that much to make a sale, then your product isn't that great. You HAVE to talk about how great the company is, how awesome you are, how awesome the site is, etc etc etc. Then to top it off, when a customer doesnt want to make the committment, you have to call them back 5-7 different times as "follow ups" What makes this worse, is some of these people are secret shoppers and have no intention of buying. Calls are also recorded then reviewed and shared among your peers in the district. They also grade you on your performance. The SIZZLE stuff is really unnecessary, the product speaks for itself and if your customer service is top notch (without excessive script reading) you can make the sale! The ESS product is by far top notch, but you don't need to over indulge in it to make the sale. One more thing, I sure don't like to be called 5+ times by someone trying to get my business or a sale if I'm not that interested at all, so I sure don't like having to call them so many times to get their business.

title: Great place to work!
pros: This company lets you manage your storage site without micromanaging you. Great team support and excellent benefits.
cons: Over all a great company

title: Very under paid
pros: Staff members are great Live on site option (rare and might be very under paid bc of it) Districts can be like communities where everyone is there for help and more
cons: Very under paid!! I found out today that multiple store managers who possibly will be, is or won‚Äôt be a DTL and is getting paid under $18. With 4 or 5 years of experience with the same company. That is sad. They say they promote within. Haven‚Äôt seen that yet. Certain districts can be dry and stale (filled with old people who will take the next step and stay where they‚Äôre for years. So people below especially young people don‚Äôt want to stay bc of that reason.) Amount of responsibilities you have isn‚Äôt that hard but doesn‚Äôt come close to what you should be getting paid. Amount of maintenance you do yourself incredible high. You do everything but heavy duty stuff like cleaning units throughly, changing light bulbs, sweeping hallways, sending invoices, reaching sales, KPI numbers and much more. Basically a janitor who does sales and gets under paid. No sick days PTO u start off not even earning half a day. Work 5 days a week if not open on Sunday and hours suck.

title: Totally recommend working here
pros: Great work life balance, and paid holidays. Coming from retail working here was such a relief lol. You don‚Äôt have to get up super early or stay late, you come in at 9:30 and then leave at 6 during the week and then come in at 9 and leave at 5:30 on Saturdays with Sunday's as an automatic day off. The work load isn‚Äôt a lot as all you have to do is rent units to customers and make sure they get insurance. The DTL‚Äôs (district team leads) are there to help whenever you need it and are super supportive!! More than I‚Äôve experienced in my past work experiences.
cons: I don‚Äôt have cons as i had a great experience. The only thing that can be annoying is the secret shoppers whether it‚Äôs over the phone or in person you have to be by the books, they grade you on it and everything. Other than that it‚Äôs a great way to see how you are with real customers. My only bad experience was after leaving, i didn‚Äôt get the support from remote recruitment that i expected when relocating. I wanted to continue working for the company but remotely. My application got denied before i could even at least receive an interview but they‚Äôre still hiring for that position, it‚Äôs a little hurtful to say the least.

title: District Team Lead
pros: Great Company to work for. Good pay, No Sundays, Corp team who values their employees.
cons: No real downsides. Hours are good. Saturdays get busy but still out at a reasonable time, 5:30pm

title: Great
pros: Everyone is so helpfully and has great customer service.
cons: I don't have any cons.

title: Great Company
pros: Easy and great company to work for.
cons: Regarding being understaff meanwhile nothing worth mentioning.

title: Great Company
pros: Amazing upper management Great office culture Good bonuses
cons: Not great for working from home. We got 2 days max and they had very strict rules about it.

title: Great Work/Life Balance
pros: The company lives their core values daily. Work/Life balance is achievable and encouraging regardless of position.
cons: There isnt currently any cons.

pros: Care about employees Room for growth if there is opportunity Work life/ balance Stores everywhere throughout the state in case of needing to transfer Great people
cons: All DM styles are different and could impact overall experience working at ESS Benefits are pricey

title: It is a job..
pros: Great co-workers and a lot of down time to catch up on the news. Also when it is slow I have time to apply for a new job and conduct phone interviews.
cons: Most of the time working alone and managers get all the credit for everything. Pay could be a lot better as well. I have been working here for 3 years and new hires in the same position as I get paid more than me and I have a Bachelors Degree in Business. I applied for a District Manager in Training position and I met all the qualifications in the job description but was told I have to become a manager, and training manger first. The person who ended up getting the position never worked in the storage industry before getting hired. How do they expect us to stay motivated and try to get promoted when it would take another 5 years to move up with crappy pay. You are required to do Sales, Collections, Maintenance, and clean units while trying to reach some of the ridiculous goals the company wants to you hit. They also expect employees to get Google reviews from every customer that comes into the office. If you do not reach your Google Review goal you receive and nasty-gram email from your DM. Also having split days off lowers the moral of your employees.

title: Great Job, give or take a few things
pros: Honestly the best job I've ever held. Work/Life balance is outstanding. All you do is rent storage units to people, clean and keep up with maintenance around the property and other general tasks expected at most retail-esque jobs. You also could live on-site where the rent and utilities are free.
cons: You are a salesperson first and foremost. You will have to sell insurance to folks on every rental you do and try to get them to leave Google Reviews in the office. If this is not your thing, I'd look elsewhere. Depending on where you work, you could have to move to another store and possibly move apartments if you live on-site. You really don't have a say in the matter either. Like most corporate places, you could do really well at this job and never really get anything out of it. People have been passed over for promotions many times regardless of how good their sales numbers are or their customer service skills. It's really all about who upper management likes best is how you move up in this company.

title: starts out good then goes bad
pros: 20 years ago it was a good place to work. Good work/ life balance though.
cons: Benefits that have been promised are taken away with no consideration of length of service. Every change they make to benefits is designed to look good but carefully prescribed to actually reduce payout so you are always making less not more.

title: Over all a good job
pros: Promote with in Great hours Descent pay As long as you are doing the right thing you will do great.
cons: Get use to deescalating customers People can be nasty sometimes

title: great place to work
pros: 40 hr work week excellent communication promote within
cons: nothing really, company is fair and honest

title: Store Manager
pros: Leadership is transparent and do a great job of supporting customer facing employees.
cons: Additional site coverage,at times, was difficult to find.

title: It's Storage
pros: great if new site. great if you like your DM. great if you like your coworkers.
cons: awful if everyone doesn't pull their weight.

title: Great Company
pros: Great leadership, Good hours, tools for what you need to do your job, live on site locations, and promotion opportunities
cons: You have to work on Saturdays

title: Decent place
pros: You will develop good comunication skills.
cons: Too many responsabilities and very little pay

title: District Team Lead
pros: When I interviewed with Extra Space Storage in January 2014 I was told much about the positive work culture, opportunities for advancement and competitive compensation. In two years I have found all of those to be true and much more. Extra Space Storage has always delivered on their promises. This is a soulful, caring and merit based company. Training is thorough and extends far beyond your first day. There is no disconnect between our Corporate Office "Store Support Center" and staff in the field. Few companies acknowledge, support and develop those in the field who are responsible for the success of the company as a whole in the way that ESS does. Many who work here claim to never have thought they would work in self storage. Now they cannot see working anywhere else. I count myself among them.
cons: Having worked for a number of corporate retailers in the past, I have no reasonable complaint against Extra Space Storage. This is simply an exceptional place to work. I advise all talented, passionate professionals to seek a career here. You will not regret it.

title: Super Supportive Management
pros: First of all, the benefits are honestly very comparable to most large companies and the monthly incentives are competitive, keeping things friendly and fun. Also, most sites close at 6pm (Mon-Fri) but you actually leave at 6pm, not 6:15 or 6:30. If you manage your day well, you literally clock out at 6pm. Most of the sites are also closed on Sundays so that is a benefit in itself. The Orlando District Manager is organized and well-versed in the storage industry so his communication is straightforward, helpful, and transparent. The Divisional Vice President is very involved, passionate, and also very "hands on". So far, this management team has contributed to me feeling valued and appreciated every step of the way. If you are a self-starter and self sufficient, you will appreciate working for Extra Space Storage. The training program was very thorough and set at a reasonable pace. My trainer not only welcomed my questions, he answered them with expertise. With most companies, the new hire gets "lost" in the shuffle after a few weeks, but with Extra Space, the training program sets you up for success, with the trainer and DM reaching out often to gauge your progress and be helpful in any way. There will always be challenging days or moments with any job... The key is to find the solution that benefits you, the customer, the team, and the brand.
cons: There are no cons worth mentioning. Everything has a solution. :-)

title: Great place to work!
pros: Competitive Pay Development Support Work - Life Balance Growth Opportunities
cons: Must be open to relocation Self motivated as you work alone often

title: Growing Company
pros: Opportunity for growth Hire from within
cons: Alot of downtime Cleaning can be tedious

title: new employee
pros: great opportunities , success, achievements ,learn new skills
cons: there are no cons at the moment

title: Need More From ESS as a Employee
pros: **Sometimes Sundays Off **Paid Mileage **Get to outside and Do Inside work. **Get to work with best Coworkers!
cons: **The Raises should be on Dollar scale vs Cents. **Insurance should be affordable and should have more coverage to it. **My pay is ridiculously low to the amount of work I actually do. My DM'S have been very interactive but don't like the sneakiness that comes with them. And when you go to them about raises and money they laugh it off, but say keep up the great work though! ** They say you can go up but higher up's like to kick you back down. Its very sad when you have better numbers then your Manager but you still are not recognized. **Policies are constantly changing, as well as job description. **Wish they actually listened to our opinions vs only worry about red and green spread sheets. **Not allowed to have Overtime. **Incentive for Assistants SUCK!!

title: Best company I've ever worked for!
pros: One of my favorite things about this company is that they only promote from within. There is so much opportunity for growth here. Another thing is this company has your back 100%. I've worked jobs where the customer is always right. Here, we want to leave the customer happy, but not at a risk to you. My leadership team here is so understanding and empathetic to both employee's and customers and makes the best decisions based on that. I truly, truly, feel valued as an employee working with Extra Space Storage. From my direct leadership team, up to the DVP and higher. Last year, the company did GREAT, and you know what they did? They gave every single employee a 5% raise. That is HUGE! I've never worked for a company that gave that out to the employees! Plus a few weeks ago, because gas prices have gone up so high, they gave everyone an extra $250 in their paycheck. That was in ADDITION to our normal bonus's we get each month. This is an amazing company to work for.
cons: I can't think of many con's at the moment. Extra Space has very high expectations with their KPI's.. but they are very easily attainable.

title: An excellent place to work
pros: Excellent work life balance with fair compensation.
cons: None that I can think of!

title: Love the culture and schedule
pros: Extra Space really cares about it's employees. It's demonstrated everyday in it's culture
cons: The starting pay could be a little more competitive

title: Every day is a Great Day
pros: Clean, Caring, Teamwork and Great People.
cons: I don't have anys that this time.

title: Disappointing Leadership
pros: My district team and peers in the division are great to work with.
cons: One of the Senior VPs is absolutely horrible to work with. He has no filter, talks poorly about other DIvisional VPs, senior executives and DIstrict Mgrs in the presence of anyone who will listen. As a DM, you have to travel with him and he does his best to criticize, put you and the DVP down and make himself sound important b/c of his title and tenure. My DVP hates to see him coming and so do DMs. We all have to receive sort of a pep talk before and after he leaves b/c my DVP knows how ignorant, rude and arrogant he is and tries to make the DMs feel better. He takes pleasure in bullying and making you feel uncomfortable during visits. Not to mention, he uses very foul language regardless of who he is around. I am embarrassed that he even works at Extra Space. For those applying for a DM position anywhere on the east coast, you should think twice about it. Every person on his support staff has left the company. Having to deal with him has been the worst part about this job and has caused me to seek employment elsewhere even though I'm considered high potential. Constant exposure to this SVP is just not worth it.

title: A Company with Values
pros: My experience at Extra Space Storage for the last two years have been wonderful. Marketing is lead by some of the best marketers I've ever known. We continue to hire amazing people that make it an enjoyable place to work. There are interesting and complicated problems to be solved which keeps me engaged. Also, there is a lot of investment into my own growth and learning which I really appreciate!
cons: More fun things to do at the corporate office would be cool. We see what other companies are doing all the time to attract new and young talent and there's nothing like that. What I mean are things like ping-pong tables, game systems, etc. It might seem like a waste of time but I think it's good to be able to do something to take a break and take your mind off of work for a few minutes a day. The landscape for hiring is progressively getting more competitive and with that comes employee retention. More rewards to employees staying long term as well as opportunities for pay increases instead of the only way being a promotion/title change to receive a pay increase would be nice.

title: If you like the independence of small business ownership combined with corporate support, this is the job for you!
pros: Corporate Management is very hands-off in the day to day. We have the 80/20 philosophy for development. Corporate/ Management provides the resources for you to succeed. (The 20%) Its up to you to provide the drive and passion (The 80%). Its very much up to you to succeed. There is a strong family atmosphere around here. If you seek the support, you WILL receive it. If your looking for a job that will challenge you to be your best self then this is the job for you.
cons: The hours are designed to accommodate the 9 - 5 worker. Most stores operate from 9:30 AM to 6:00 PM with a half hour lunch. Management typically tries to keep you close to home but if you end up with a commute then you have little to no evening at home depending on when you go to bed. This is a personal thing, but I'd prefer hours that were earlier. Unfortunately, given the nature of the business, it's important for us to be available for customers who want to swing in on their way home from work.

title: ESS Review
pros: -good work/life balance -not micro managed -good teamwork amongst the district -better pay than competitors
cons: -not enough holidays off -having to handle angry customers due to high rate increases

title: Great place to work
pros: work/life balance team oriented great upper management
cons: Job can be dirty (lots of cleaning, maintenance)

title: Culture & Growth
pros: Work/life balance, growth potential, people & culture
cons: There are normal storage/rental challenges.

title: Great place to work!
pros: Team work is the main driving force.
cons: Sometimes customers get upset over rates

title: review
pros: Enjoy working for a company that treats you like family. offers growth and great training. Great benefits and Really cares about your opinion.
cons: Needs to offer more uniform styles and shoe styles.

title: Extra Space cares about their employees development
pros: Caring Leaders Development programs Competitive pay Great co-workers
cons: Can get too busy to take advantage of development programs and opportunities.

title: Great place to work
pros: They make you feel like a family.
cons: wish we could wear jeans :)

title: Depends where you work
pros: Well-meaning management and coworkers. Fast-growing company.
cons: My district manager was a recently promoted DTL who was still clearly trying to find their footing and generally seemed to lack confidence in their authority and seemed uncertain when it came to motivating employees, delegating responsibility, or staying on top of a slew of properties. Often difficult to reach. My district also had a new DTL recently promoted from an SM, who seemed to be struggling to find her footing in her new role on top of that. In the year I worked there, I don‚Äôt think she ever once answered my phone calls or made an effort to return the calls. Stretched too thin. Other DTL was constantly swamped with pleas for assistance from SMs, many of whom were recently promoted and new to their roles as well. Revolving door of ASMs who were quickly affected by the general feeling of low morale and disorganization. Frequent bickering between SMs/ASMs and sister properties that could have been avoided with clear communication, expectations, and definitive boundaries.

title: Best job ever
pros: Great hours with great pay. Stable and predictable schedule. Supportive team.
cons: None that I can think of

title: work
pros: show that we value they business
cons: dont have anything to share at the moment

title: Great Company
pros: Treats you as a person not just another employee number.
cons: If not self motivated easy to fall behind in work.

title: Could Be Better
pros: Great Co-workers Meeting New People Reasonable Shifts Bonuses
cons: Lack of Open Door Policy Slight Retaliation Pay Scale Growth Ability Minimum or Late Communication

title: Fine pay for a while but growth limited
pros: Better than normal retail pay, in depth training, impressive software, decent health plan, closed on Sunday.
cons: Limited growth opportunities, poor bonus structure, and uncomfortable pressure to hunt down Google reviews and sell company protection plan.

title: Great place
pros: Easy work, Predictable, Working alone
cons: Irate customers Cant do what we need to do

title: No work life balance
pros: If you luck out and get a facility that is 70% or more full, you‚Äôre essentially just a janitor and part time sales person. It‚Äôs nice to leave the facility for errands as most of your day is spent there so that‚Äôs a plus as long as you have a car. The higher up corporate folks do drop in often so that‚Äôs nice to see them more or less on the ground floor.
cons: Far too much stress for what you‚Äôre paid, there‚Äôs little work life balance even though their company totes that‚Äôs a major benefit. You‚Äôre 100% required to be there 5-6 days a week 9am-6pm not including extra time to come in early for web meetings and not to mention when you‚Äôre short staffed and customers non stop call and knock on the door. It‚Äôs a downright dirty business that asks you to prioritize money over all else. If you‚Äôre okay with that kind of thing, this is your spot. My coworkers cleaned up human feces weekly for a little over $18 an hour and called it a great job with work life balance. To each their own. I happened to be there at a time when they were doing a trial run of Sunday hours, essentially prioritizing money over staffs sanity. You‚Äôre also only allowed to request one Saturday off a month. No one gets two days off in a row.

title: My experience
pros: on-site living 401k match up to 5% Better Paid Time Off than most companies I've ever worked for. They promote from within.
cons: being on the front-line dealing with irate customers due to almost a 100% rate increase. Upper Management does not have strong communication skills nor do they show true appreciation for your hard work. I have not been offered nor have I received a raise due to this recent inflation in the economy.

title: great job
pros: Easy going, great sales process, learning opportunities, regular hours
cons: Slow work, upset customers, cleaning,

title: Good Culture
pros: Employee focused culture Customers are important and taken care of Excellent executive leadership
cons: Below industry average for multi unit pay

title: Not for me. But some people love it.
pros: Set work times, Sundays off. Simple job, with growth opportunities. Not micro-managed. Definitely has some scheduling, work-life balance pros, especially if you are used to working retail. Training is specific and thorough on most pieces, but what they miss, they miss big. Health benefits are not fantastic, but adequate. DM has high, clear standards. Very little ambiguity or not knowing where you stand most of the time.
cons: Heavier sales piece, far less actual management responsibilities than led to believe. Very few women in leadership positions, so very much a man's world. Not employee focused. PTO/sick time is combined, even in states with required sick leave standards. Equates to VERY little PTO, unless you never get sick or work sick. Corporate checks (such as secret shoppers) are not made known during training. The standard that the secret shopper is seeking is not made known. So, the employee could be great, but miss the bullet points and look incompetent on a report that goes to corporate. General disrespect from DM to store level, especially the AM position. He acts as if he is a better person than they are because he is their boss.

title: People Expect a Lot
pros: I'm shocked at some of the reviews I'm reading. Complaining we "only" get six holidays off? I've worked at places where I didn't get any off. If you don't like the pay, don't take the job. This is higher pay that I've gotten anywhere else for supervisor jobs. Management is fantastic. It isn't true that you can't take Saturday/Fridays off without PTO. That depends entirely on your DM and is not a blanket statement for the entire company. And getting one weekend day off every week is standard for many companies. A workplace isn't going to do every little thing you want it to, like giving you Presidents Day off or Saturdays and Sundays. You need to accept that or start your own business.
cons: I didn't like our bonus structure this year because it didn't reward us for growth or work done, but they LISTENED TO THEIR EMPLOYEES and are rolling out a new bonus so this will be an old con. No sick days isn't good but we make a lot of PTO and I think it's fair that we can use that as a sick day. The days seem really long because they are all middle shifts. I wished we worked 8:30 - 5:00.

title: My Time at Extra Space Storage
pros: Some sites are closed Sunday, Workday ends at 6pm, Some flexibility in terms of swapping your day off, end of month bonus determined by total rentals for the month
cons: Bonus money is not split evenly, Site managers and District Team Leads receive the bulk of the bonus with Assistant Managers walking away with less than 25% of the bonus pooled money. My site was myself and the District Team Lead who was also the Site Manager. We made $400 in bonus, of which I received $40. No accountability for sites that aren't making their goals and development process can take well over 6 months regardless of how well you are doing.

title: Best Culture and Work Enviorment
pros: A culture that listens to it's employees vs. a top down driven management culture. Empowers coworkers to "Think like an Owner" Higher than average pay for the industry, little things like a bonus, PTO, kind words, on the spot awards, Sundays off make a work atmosphere that is tops in the industry. While some companies have had to pay for a slogan to say "We Care" at Extra Space the investment made in each customer, site and coworkers demonstrates that this company really does Care. Extra Space provides not only the training to be successful but the support and tools to reach career success. Having worked at another Storage Company (10+years) I can say that Extra Space is hands down the leader in customer and coworker care in the industry. Wish I started here 20 years ago...
cons: Work is challenging and demanding. Interview process is long as the culture is protected by every coworker. It is not just can you do the job but can you operate in a culture that is not fear driven management and can you drive and achieve results while demonstrating your soft management skills. These are not cons for the right people.

title: Better than standard retail
pros: Good hours, Sunday off for most stores
cons: Metric driven from the management

title: Extra Space
pros: A great work culture that promotes having a healthy work-life balance.
cons: Lower pay and slow advancement opportunities.

title: The best job
pros: Highest pay for storage Mileage reimbursement Amazing teamwork
cons: Traveling far from home store

pros: The bonus from renting storage spaces.
cons: 5 managers in one year.

title: Pretty good place to work
pros: Nice working environment, competitive pay, pretty fast accruing PTO, uniform allowances, great company discounts as well as a groupon style program, nice and stable working hours. Closed for all (christian) religious holidays as well as new years, thanksgiving... Decent amount of freedom and autonomy provided you do a good job. Good health benefits if you want to pay for them. Lots of internal contests and other ways of winning Amex gift cards. Not so much "corporate overlords" as executive management. Very OSHA compliant.
cons: Uniform budget only goes so far before it's out of your pocket. NO NO NO NO overtime, they loathe overtime. Somewhat frequent reminders that our job is to pay shareholder dividends. Facilitating hoarding. The sales tactics of specific merchandise are sometimes borderline mendacious, given one knows the industry and related products inside and out; but I guess that's sales for you. To be fair though, we don't rip people off, ever. Just like the post office, you are expected to go outside whether there is rain, sleet, snow or shine. ESS pinches its pennies hard. We're often given tasks and provided with the cheapest, bare minimum tools and equipment and are expected to produce professional results. Your regular day off is subject to change with just a few days notice. Small staff [relative] means there is fierce competition for small number of promotions.

title: Motivation is key!
pros: Company understands its employees. Our DM and DL are both very easy to talk to. Our DM strives and lives to motivate. He is enthusiastic, out-going, great with customers, helpful, and one of those managers that will not let you accept failure. He pushes you towards goals that he see should easily be in your reach, he looks for potential in people and that means a lot to me. I love the hours, the fact that I get two days off a week and not to mention a lunch break. So far, this company surpasses any other that I have worked for! I love the environment that I work in, the people that I work for and with, and the fact the the company is family oriented. I go to work each day with a purpose and I thrive on the daily challenges. This job is by far one of the easiest that I have ever done, I keep telling myself that there has to be a catch but....I haven't found it yet.
cons: The only down side that I could even come close to considering is..... those few customers that won't give you a chance to help them.

title: Storage is Sexy!
pros: Diverse fast past results driven capital planning. A strong focus on understanding their employees and for their employees to understand themselves. This helps to create a more proactive and empathetic environment. They are focusing on building a diverse group of leaders and I‚Äôve noticed an increase in woman being promoted. If there is an emergency in storage, it‚Äôs a true emergency. When I was there 90% of the workload was planned capital projects. Break/fix, add-hoc daily issues were lead my the operations team. The capital project clock/budget resets annually. Meaning your deadline for completion is November, including billing. Other departments are friendly and helpful. Company truck is provided.
cons: Primarily office forward and has not embraced a remote culture. Depending on your DVP it could be a hybrid environment. Driving to a division office when no one is there is not time efficient and can impact work/life balance. Changes in bonus structure. Starts with 2wks vs. 3wks vacation. No employer is perfect. It‚Äôs about finding a place that you can bring value to the table and a role that you‚Äôre passionate about. With all that said, I‚Äôd work for them again and recommend that you apply.

title: Review
pros: Company takes care of their employees
cons: for the things we do, wages should be a little higher.

title: GREAT COMPANY
pros: Extremely helpful and thorough training, made sure you knew what you were doing
cons: Inconsistent location schedule, was placed in multiple locations weekly by yourself

title: Great Place
pros: This is a great company to work for. They try very hard to foster a positive work environment. I have had a great relationship with every member of management I have interacted with. The company has a good set of guiding values and when they make decisions, big or small, you can see those values reflected in the decision. They also do something called where every couple years the senior leadership comes and shares a meal with all the employees, district by district, and then you have round table discussions with all of them. It is very cool, and you will often see things you or others discussed at the round table implemented which shows that they listen. You can also submit ideas for change or improvements and many of them end up being used.
cons: You will be asked to convince customers to pay for Customer Protection Plan, (Storage Insurance) and it can be uncomfortable, but it is something the company pushes because it actually protects the customer. I have a unit and actually had to file a claim with my CPP and was glad I had it. Although there are opportunities to move from assistant manager to store manager, moving up from there can be a difficult step and will likely require you to relocate.

title: Awesome company!
pros: Great team and support for Newton area!
cons: Lots of turnover throughout company.

title: Store Manager Position
pros: After reading all of the reviews I want to set things straight: Saturdays are required, but I get three day weekends every other weekend. There is a lot of cleaning and maintenance, but they told you that up front in your interview. There is amazing room from growth, and they like to promote from within. If they aren't promoting you, you're doing something wrong. As long as you go in every day and do you job, it's not hard. I have a 40+ run down property in a horrible part of town and I love it. The work is easy as long as you know how to follow rules.
cons: It can get a little gross sometimes - roaches, moldy mattresses, human fluids. Auctions can be hard but only if you're a bit emotional (this is business after all) - even though it's hard, you can give people options. Some customers ask for the moon and you obviously can't deliver. There is a lot of change all at once and sometimes it is hard to keep up. Benefits are a bit expensive.

pros: Able to promote to manager
cons: Too much cleaning and boring

title: Legacy storage company with promising potential that doesn't values employees and diversity by it's actions.
pros: Laid back work environments are usually easy places to work for however...
cons: 1.)Lacks senior diversity (non women), yet core customer identifies as non-white; 2.)Ever-changing policies (no concreteness, can be a mental drainage-its just storage ppl); 3.)Staff sending racially insensitive email, maybe if senior management had representation that looked like its demographic it could understand why its black staff may have an issue with "picnics" as it relations to the history of this country and its black citizens. 4.)Sales metrics and sales bonuses are a sham. SM and ASM run sites, it should be split among those who made sale at site. 5.)Nepotism, career-ships run this corporation.

title: Good place to work
pros: Decent job, easy hours, great coworkers
cons: Rude customers, a lot of work done around the facility

title: Great Company
pros: Benefits, the people and the ESS values!
cons: None I can think of!

title: My Opinion
pros: I like that we are given a great deal "ownership" at our stores in the regard to the fact that we are not micro-managed.The training given provides us with tools to do our job. I love that our company will listen to what is said by all employees & they have implemented suggestions given by us so that our jobs are easier & that we can take care of our customers more proficiently. I also like that we are closed on Sunday.
cons: We used to be able to take 2 days off in a row ( Sunday, Monday) ( Saturday,Sunday) without having to use vacation time but now the days are split up. I think we should be allowed to do this at least once a month without using PTO. Also I believe that every site should have 2 employees and not have to share an assistant between stores. This is stressful if you are a busy site and need to share your assistant.

title: Good workplace BUT room for improvement
pros: I appreciate that corporate has vitality and actively asks for input on how to be better. I have not seen too much action based on feedback but, that may come with time. The pay - I feel that the pay is fair, especially for entry level work. Hiring from within - there is ongoing communication that Extra Space wants current employees to aspire to progress and move up the ladder to fill leadership roles. They do not push it on you but they do communicate that they want to see you grow and develop in the company.
cons: PTO accrual is very slow in my opinion and days where you are sick and cannot come to work are required to be PTO. Vacation days shouldn't be required when you feel sick and can't recharge away from work. I believe people need more time to refresh and be with their loved ones or doing enjoyable activities to them. Schedule/hours - Mandatory Saturdays are understandable even if they are not great. However, the hours are difficult and pretty late which makes work/life balance difficult.

title: Potential great job but it's squandered
pros: They have insurance. There are lots of resources and tools available. Some cool people to work it.
cons: Pay Training is a joke. I was made to do the grunt work while training and didn't get much actual training. Split days off Pricey insurance plans boredom Advanced metrics they grade you on that's more important than customer service. A general CYOA attitude and malaise. People just seem to look out for themselves and are forced to focus on numbers instead of people You're literally just a number here. The email addresses are numbers @extrspace.com

title: Stable and secure, but long term vision is shortsighted
pros: Extra Space is a stable company that was in the right place at the right time during the recession and has an economic rent in the short to medium term within the industry. That is, the company bought assets in limited supply at a favorable price and doesn't have to work that hard to do reasonably well. This makes for a fairly stable place to work where long hours are not generally the norm, but compensation generally matches this. There are certainly exceptions where compensation and payrates are more competitive.
cons: The company talks a big game on innovation, but is afraid to really commit and take financial risk on innovative ideas that will be revenue drivers 10 or 20 years out. Even shorter term operational projects end up being a bit hamstrung by resource constraints resulting in sub-optimal results. Career advancement is limited, as a general rule, unless you make the right impression with senior leadership early in your career with the company.

title: Losing what made them great
pros: Extra Space used to be a wonderful place to work. Very balanced. The company expected good work, but they also supported their people and did things the right way. That has mostly ended.
cons: As I mentioned, Extra Space has changed a lot as a workplace. They seem to be pushing sheer quantity of work in many departments. Metrics are all that matter, and they're usually metrics that track rate of work--not impact. I don't know if they're trying to imitate Amazon, but that is the kind of change they are making across the board--industrializing every facet of work so they can squeeze all the value they can out of their people. What they're losing in that is the passion and ownership that made their workforce great. Extra Space was a top performing company for years, but they seem to be slipping, and I think employees are beginning to look elsewhere. I see Extra Space having significant retention, engagement, and performance issues down the road. Communication between management and employees is really poor. They're changing a number of departments without explaining anything to people. "Anything" may sound like hyperbole. It's not. Extra Space used to have a wonderful feeling. People were part of a team and did good things together. It was great. Now it feels like an assembly line, where the quota is all that matters. It's a shame.

title: Job environment
pros: The environment was very comfortable
cons: Not any negetive things I can think about

title: Culture decline
pros: Stable company that typically doesn't have large layoffs
cons: The company culture has really moved from people focused to all about the numbers. If you like corporate politics, smooth talkers, and people that hide behind the latest business book trends to move their agenda this is the place for you.

title: Great IT culture and projects
pros: The IT department at Extra Space is exceptional; almost everyone I work with is highly engaged and excited about their work. I've heard several of my fellow engineers who are newer to the company say that this is the best IT shop they've been at. The company makes a solid investment in IT strategy, giving us the time and resources to build innovative software and solutions. The IT culture has been improving greatly over the last couple years. Management is honest, open and fair.
cons: There have been some negative reviews of IT over the last few weeks, which I suspect have come from the same former employee posing as different personas. You'll notice a similar tone, style and timing. I only point this out in fairness to the company. All you have to do is come and see for yourself. Once you meet the people here and learn about our projects, goals and values, you'll understand why so many of our IT employees have been here for many years, myself included.

title: Need to simplify
pros: Decent money, nice people, advancement opportunities, health benefits.
cons: This company is very hard to work for especially for new hires. I worked @ E.S. over a year and NEVER had a permanent schedule or home site. Some weeks I would be at 3 different sites in 3 different cities, or 2 days in one site, one day off three days 35 miles away. Each site has a key box with its own code each gate has its own code, and each alarm has its own code. This ia all before you clock in... The constantly transitioning is ridiculous. The only thing that was consistent is how they complicate EVERYTHING. Most SS use software that is efficient, they take bits and pieces from the top 3 that formulate into more confusion. STUPID rules, everyone has to answer the phone with a phoney scripted message that is of course wayyyy to long. They are so diluted they try and convince their employees this all makes sense by making you graduate from the EXTRA SPACE university... Oh they hope the spies they send in will insure good customer service, but still demand you lie to the customers. You are told you must tell the customers that insurance is MANDATORY...... This company is not a place to work if your honest or not paranoid too....

title: Flexibility!
pros: I actually have recommended this company to several friends. The work-life balance is amazing and people at every level take advantage of it. It's not something that the company "offers" but people are too afraid to take advantage of. As long as you get high quality work done on time, you can have a lot of flexibility in your work schedule, make day-time appointments, etc. The benefits and pay are sufficient, and there are promotion opportunities for hard workers.
cons: There is a paradox between the company always telling people to get "fit" as part of the HR/health insurance message, and then all of the free soda in the fridge, and donuts, bagels, and barbecue handed out all the time. If you don't have much willpower, you will have to watch your waistline. The treats are pretty constant. Also, especially among the older employees, there is a pretty strong resistance to change which is annoying when trying to make even small changes.

title: This Company Cares
pros: From the moment I started working at Extra Space I knew I was in for a totally different experience. This company truly believes that by caring and supporting its team members, it in turn will thrive. What got me to apply was the stress on work/life balance in the ad, and they definitely live up to it. They seem to know that happy employees will give more to the companies that support them. While I've only been here for a little over a year, there are many employees who have been with the company for over a decade and you can definitely see why. They want to support you in whatever your goals may be. I've never worked in the storage industry before and the training provided is the best I've ever seen bar none. They didn't let me out on my own until I truly felt empowered to be the storage expert and know that I was in the best position to assist my customers with all their needs. I made my desire for advancement known and have had great support put behind me preparing me for the next step in my career.
cons: Compared to some of the companies I've worked for in the past, I truly can't think of any. Do the work, and the rewards shall follow!

title: Property Manager
pros: Closed on Sunday's. A few paid holidays (more than most storage facilities). Nobody over your shoulder 24/7.
cons: Only 30 min. lunch. To have a Saturday off during peak season must use PTO day. Must be a salesman and with that said be prepared to lie to push higher insurance or more expensive lock. Deal with daily complaints of price increases. Clean outdoor units in the heat and or cold and if your DM can wipe any form of dirt from the wall, you fail. YOU will perform all maintenance with a few exceptions. You will have a cell phone (stays at store) so you can clean and perform maintenance all of your 8 hour shift until somebody calls but you better stop immediately and rush to the office to stop the clock because you only have 10 minutes to call them back! I felt so horrible taking advantage of trusting people looking for a place to store their property.

title: Lost focus on employees ========
pros: Full time work but works you to exhaustion
cons: split days off, very rare they will provide double coverage. PTO denied a lot. cliques. They pay $3 to $4 dollars less than most storage companies. They offer $25 gift cards and some money but do not support emotional/physical and will work you to exhaustion. They will not give straight answers. They talk in circles of avoidance and do not put truth in the forefront. They publish a schedule in the district but the schedule is not accurate information trying to make it appear as if stores get support but they do not.

title: Assistant Manager
pros: Depending where you work most of the times its the people that work with you that make working here worth it. Schedule is decent.
cons: You are considered to be a store manager even if you are an assistant. They only created the Assistant position available as an excuse to underpay someone. As an assistant you are responsible for the same duties as a store manager and chances are you high that you would be running the store alone as an assistant without help but when it comes to your monthly bonuses you will never get anything back since you dont have the title of a store manager and its extremely hard to get credit for your hard work

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Being with Extra Space for approximately 18 years has been a great ride. I've been in the Self-Storage industry for almost 30 years and I have to say that my years with Extra Space have been positive and rewarding, throughout the years the company has helped me continue to develop and grow my knowledge which in return has given me the opportunity to pass that along to others. The companies culture, open line of communication and commitment to grow their people has been a great experience. These attributes coupled with great team collaboration have been rewarding during my years of service!
cons: With anything in life there are going to be growing pains, I wouldn‚Äôt necessarily consider the following a Con but instead part of change and growth. As a company we continue to focus on growth and growing our people, this at times can bring a little sadness when those you've developed and worked alongside for years have moved on to bigger and better things within the company. We just need to keep in mind that these are not Cons but achievements in some one‚Äôs life and a beginning to better opportunities within their career!

title: Great place to work, but not much opportunity to advance.
pros: In general, there is a clean, organized environment with good people to work with. Good software programs are used to make the work responsibilities easier. There are many opportunities to learn new things to become a better employee, and good support from upper management to acquire the knowledge and skills for higher-level jobs. There are good company and department parties and activities. There's a pretty good work-life balance.
cons: There's a constant push to shorten deadlines, which can make work too stressful at times. There's not enough recognition for a job being well done. Upper management can be a little too critical about one-time mess-ups. Upper management is not very open to new ideas for improvement. There's not much concern from upper management about work load for the lower-level employees. There have been various instances that a change in a certain process has caused more headache than improvement.

title: What In the Cult
pros: -It‚Äôs a fairly easy job. -You get to know your customers -If you like being outdoors instead of being cooped up in a stuffy office, this the job for you
cons: -Benefits are expensive -Metrics not obtainable with the call center setting the stores up for failure -Pay is below average in surrounding businesses -if you disagree with a policy and voice your concern they get rid of you -HR complaints aren‚Äôt anonymous. They literally share your complaint to the person you have the problem with -there is a ridiculous amount of favoritism at every level. Even if a employee deserves to be held accountable and fired, if they ‚Äúlike‚Äù you that‚Äôs okay -lack of uniformity when it comes to protocol and procedures -lack of accountability -you feel like you can trust no one

title: Proceed With Extreme Caution
pros: Decent work/life balance (Sundays off, no early mornings or late evenings. Overtime is forbidden unless pre-approved). Nice co-workers. Benefits.
cons: Very few paid holidays (4). You will work on Christmas Eve, New Year‚Äôs Eve, Memorial Day, Labor Day. You will work every Saturday. Unrealistic workload expectations (single coverage at site most of the time). KPI goals beyond your control (Google reviews, insurance sales, phone answer %). Difficult to get PTO approved (Good luck trying to get a full week off for that vacation you want to take, you must find someone to cover for you). Very low pay (not a livable wage). Poor advancement opportunities beyond Site Manager. Frequent irate customers (lately due to unreasonable rate increases). Cleaning toilets and human excrement on site.

title: Overworked
pros: Fixed schedule for the most part
cons: Expectations where never carried the same to all stores and employees. Exceptions were always made and the team moral continued to fall.

title: Great environment/people, subpar compensation
pros: Work/Life balance is good. If I occasionally (once or twice a month) need to work from home even that is supported. I really like a lot of the people.
cons: The entire compensation package is mediocre at best. This may simply be the perspective of a software engineer in a company that refuses to accept the reality that they are a tech company more than a real estate company, but the fact remains. Jobs I held before this offered more pay, literally twice as much PTO, and better health benefits that costed less. This creates an interesting paradigm. On the one hand, the fact that any engineers stay here is a credit to what the company is doing right, because they CERTAINLY aren't staying for the compensation. The other side of the coin is, I wouldn't be surprised if the engineering department is one misstep away from losing about half their people. What would be most tragic, if it came to this, is some of the most skilled and experienced would be the first to leave because other opportunities would be much more lucrative.

title: A good company to be a part of during its continued growth.
pros: From a high level Extra Space values its employees. The company is continuing to grow, with executive management focused on providing a quality product in storage through high quality properties. There is a feeling of camaraderie and family within the company which makes it a nice place to come to.
cons: Pay could be better, but it is pretty competitive relative to the level of work expected for the positions within the company. There is some disconnect in certain areas where the compensation seems higher that appropriate while other positions should be at a higher pay level. Recognition in all departments is not at the same level, so it can be sometimes difficult to feel you are making a difference. Benefits are not great relative to their high cost.

title: Buy shares, don't work here! That will pay you better!
pros: The corporate office looks nice. The company is definitely growing. The cream rises to the top so if you make it to upper management, you will earn 10 times the average employee!
cons: Management doesn't trust the employees. Office culture is ultra conservative. The pay and benefits are below average and the only people that tend to matter to the executive team are themselves and their fellow shareholders. FYI - HR sent an email out about a month ago requesting employees to go leave positive reviews of the company on glassdoor so be wary of the recent reviews. When you first start working for Extra Space, you may get a 10 minute "get to know you" interview with the CEO. That is all the time he will ever have for you or any other employee who isn't an executive or in his inner circle. The politics at this company are ASTONISHING! I have never seen anything like it! AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!

title: Storage Why would you right?
pros: This list can go on for days on how well they take Innovation to the next level with the satisfaction of the employees. The voice of the employee is heard and changes are made accordingly. ESS strives to keep not only the employee Informed but, they Care and Appreciate them as well. By providing and EAP program for its employees and family members 24/7. We have an Ideas tab where everyone can voice what they think can improve the company. I truly believe that ESS is where it is today because of the innovation of the employees they hire.
cons: Not much to say here just wish we would have have opened our doors on Sundays during this COVAD19.

title: Best Company I've worked for so far
pros: -values inclusivity and diversity -positive and super supportive teams -The company actually cares about you as an employee, not just a number. -Stable income, direct deposit paychecks come in bi-weekly, and strong job security. -Won't have to take work home with you. -Great medical benefits after the initial 90 days, special auto prices, and gift cards for above standard performance. -Excellent PTO accruement (even for new employees) and plenty of relief pay
cons: The company has bought out smaller storage companies / sold stores which can create miscommunications in management when there are variations in sales / certain employees running their properties differently based on higher or lower company knowledge. Also just as a heads up --> Often, you will be working with a large variety of people. If you do not like interacting with customers, I would highly recommend for you consider a different job. Frequently, we will be working with tenants who struggle with homelessness, mental illnesses, drug use, probational commitments, behavioral issues, financial concerns, the elderly, and a host of other "raw" situations.

title: Overall Great Employer
pros: I love the PTO and the flexibility we have on requesting days off. The bonus program is decent. I love the Extra Space University that teaches you how to become more business oriented and includes lessons on being more successful in the company. You can also apply the lessons to life outside of ESS. They are always coming up with new ideas to keep you interested and excited to be apart of storage. This company is always keeping the door open to create your work experience better. They want you to stay and want you to grow always looking to assist you in the areas where you may need improvement. I could go on about the many positives it's so many.
cons: I wouldn't say it's a con but I would like to see a little bit more affordable health insurance. The pay is pretty good but if the health insurance is going to continue at the rate it is. Maybe we could increase our pay so the insurance could be affordable.

title: Best Job Yet!
pros: - Excellent training and great support from supervisors, district managers, and other stores - Small company feel with big company perks - Lots of opportunities to grow and continue challenging yourself, personally and professionally - Great program for promotion, easy to get on track to work your way up, if you desire to do so - Every possible metric is tracked, so you will get credit for the good work you do, and it keeps those in leadership honest...a company with a lot of integrity! - Competitions and opportunities for giftcards and bonuses every month! - Great hours and decent benefits - Store managers often have on-site apartment included as part of benefits and compensation (if that site has one). - Lots of variety in your workday...it is never boring!
cons: - PTO accrual is pretty slow, so taking days off may be unpaid, depending on when you need them. - They have a lot of locations...but they're not everywhere in the US yet! I relocated and wished I could transfer within the company.

title: Integrity, Passion, Excellence, Teamwork & Innovation
pros: I have never worked for a company that lived and breathed it's values from top to bottom like Extra Space Storage does. From the consistency in the work life balance for employees to the exciting new technology they invest in for the customer experience, this company embodies excellence. I've been here 8 years and I will be a "lifer" for sure. There is a vast opportunity for growth, advancement and relocation as well. Extra Space is committed to diversity and inclusion which has made personal growth an opportunity as well. If you want to be part of something inspiring, you have found a great partner in Extra Space.
cons: As the company grows, this is getting better, however advancement beyond the field level management can be tough if you are not willing to relocate.

title: Above Average
pros: You work in an office environment so you're pretty much relaxed and can socialize with co-workers to pass time, but there will be A LOT of time spent on the phone. You get to meet some interesting people working here - customers and employees. Feels good to know that you helped a customer in an emergency situation (you will get a lot of these). Higher management really value their employees here, and listen to any suggestions you may have.
cons: The pay could be better. I wish we got paid commission on certain products or higher bonuses were given. You have to complete these annoying online training classes, a total of like 400. Even though you're title is an Assistant Manager, you don't have any delegating abilities because EVERYONE (except the Store Manager) is an Assistant Manager. You will get hundreds of complaints from customers regarding rent increases and auctioned off units; so you have to have a thick skin about this.

title: On site assistant manager
pros: The free apartment. There is little else I can put in this section.
cons: There are so many cons. The biggest is that management does not care about you. I told my district manager that the store I was working at 3 of the 5 days a week made me depressed and really made me dislike my job. I was very unhappy. I was told it was my job and was moved to that store as full time. Thanks for that. The upper management has zero idea on how to actually run a store. They only care about their numbers and getting their bonus. The bonus setup is a joke and only the store manager profits even if they do less sales work than the assistant. I was written up for applying for a transfer because I didn't ask my district manager if I could apply even though I had previously told him I want to transfer and apply for other positions in the company. There are many more cons and far too many to list here. The company is a home and all they care about is paying you nothing to make them millions.

title: 80% of the positive reviews are fake
pros: There are no pros to this company. Run, just run!
cons: This company has a contest for reviews and will send you a gift card if your name is drawn.
