Most of the positive reviews are either upper management posting fake reviews or they are from a contest from.employees trying to win a gift card. The CEO/ Comapany had a contest to win a gift card for any of the awards this company has won. Sure you'll get positive reviews if you are offering free money. You can take it for what you want. Most of the reviews here are fake. The company is full of drama and favoritism. You will not promote unless you are in the DM's group of favorites. The company has very high turn over. This includes upper management all the way down to the bottom. We receive emails almost weekly of all the people who have left the company. The list is usually 8 people in the upper management level. Upper management is excessive. All over paid. Especially the CEO. Way over paid

title: A Trainers Review
pros: ESS invests in its employees far more than other retail companies. If you're interested in advancing in a career with the company, you need only make it known and you'll be given lots of support to head in the direction you are most interested in pursuing. ESS is also extremely supportive and works to provide a holistic approach to staff development that involves cross training and multiple levels of support.
cons: ESS works to grow as a business in several ways, over the past few years there has been a growing emphasis on key performance metrics as a way to do this. These metrics have often been made the focus of meetings, site visits, and training sessions--too much emphasis on this can lead to perceptions that the company is entirely numbers focused. While, this isn't the case when the metrics are the only message coming at field employees it can seem like there are no other messages of what's important to the company being presented.

title: review
pros: Since i started working here for NSC call center remote from home, the staff and team leaders have been great! i love how we have help from all of them during the calls and i've met some great friends here. UTO(unpaid time off) sign ups have been a really cool addition when offered. i like being able to leave early if i want or schedule uto if i have appointments without using PTO or getting points for missing.
cons: absolutely hate the point system for absences even with doctors note customers can leave bad reviews about site, rate increases, things that don't pertain to us as service agents and hurt our scores. reservations service has to finish even though it has to do more with sales changes in schedules when you have shift bids can be a tough adjustment especially when you wanna work what you previously had adjusted to

title: No incentive for high performers
pros: The company has good hours and you do not have to work any nights or Sundays at most locations. The job is also not very stressful
cons: You can have the absolute best sales skills in the world and you will get almost nothing for it. All the incentives are based on rentals and a tiny portion of it is revenue but the numbers are set by corporate and set high so that you never get too much of an already small amount. There is no incentive to the individual to exceed goals or to sell high levels of insurance. Health care is also very expensive, wages are okay at best, and there is zero overtime allowed.

title: Great culture, great people
pros: I don't give anything 5 stars, not even myself. I believe in anything there is room for improvement and growth. I would have given ESS 4.5 starts but glass door doesn't have half stars. I have worked for ESS for nearly 5 years, I still enjoy going to work (currently, remotely) and the people I work with. There are so many pros about this company that it is hard to list them all. They live a culture that promotes a good work life balance, they encourage promotions from within, they work with schedules (for those attending school this is very nice) and they are innovative. It is one of the few companies that I have worked at that I would happily recommend to a family (and yes I like my family members)!
cons: There are no real "cons" that I would say are a drawback for the company. The company, and it's employees, aren't perfect but there are no red flags. I would mention that the health insurance is UMR, UMR doesn't cover University of Utah and are really difficult to work with, this is no reflection on ESS.

title: Storage: A hidden jem career that boasts growth and opportunity; based on merit!
pros: Quality of life, Pay, Benefits, Growth opportunity, Easy access and prompt response from corporate personnel and operations teams/departments, Visual and interactive training and development, Company Values, and the list can really go on and on. I feel valued as an employee of 11 years, so I feel there are many pro's with Extra Space Storage.
cons: The only con I've heard from other employees is not having 2 days off in a row every week. The business needs dictate that we are busy on Friday and Saturdays, so we currently get one weekend off a month. The trade off with this is that you have every Sunday off and a day during the week, which is great for me because you can get personal stuff done during the week and have family time all day on Sunday.

title: Work Culture is Great but underpay
pros: Work Culture is great and it is a nice place to work for....
cons: Poor pay. Store Manager starts around $15 to $16 per hour. Imagine yourself working for a facility with another employee were there is more than 600-1000 units. You clean units, facility,bathrooms, do auctions process, call customers for rentals, late payments. Do cash handling, call vendors and much more... If you work with an assistant that you consider is not good, you could only tell your DM. *Remember the DM's are not with the co workers everyday.* Most of the time they will say give them a break... Commissions are base on rentals in which depends on the location. If you get 100 rentals, managers gets round $400 of commissions for that month. This is a rare thing to get 100 rentals. The funny thing is that in the storage industry, this company pays more than the rest....

title: 360 Difference
pros: In the past I worked for another storage company that is one of the top five in the industry for almost seventeen years and as I was there they do not promote within, not once met or talked to the CEO, they micro manage all employees, and no longer give merit raises not even for cost of living. I came to Extra Space Storage almost two years ago and my experience has been a 360 change. Within the first year and a half Joe Mangolis the CEO of Extra Space came out to my store and other stores to meet the people who work for him. The company held meetings through out the company traveling all over the states so they could connect and ask the employees that work the sites, what their opinions and ideas are to help improve our company. Not only does the company value your opinion they also value each and every employee.
cons: I have no Cons at this time

title: Wants to be "Great" but ends up being "Good"
pros: -Work life balance is the best I've had in my career -Nice office space with standing desks and sufficient equipment to get your work done
cons: -The company response to COVID-19 was frustrating and, in my opinion, dangerous to its employees. There is a complete lack of trust of employees working from home, even during a worldwide pandemic. A company "coronavirus task force" was formed that ultimately considers itself more knowledgeable pandemic experts than the CDC and state experts and officials. -At the corporate office, there was little to no opportunity for training and further development available to me despite my multiple requests for further development. -This is the only company I've ever worked where a senior level (but non-manager) professional is not granted bonus or equity opportunities. As a very financially successful, publicly traded, S&P 500 company, this is beyond bizarre. -Company values that aren't reflected in its actual day-to-day culture.

title: Great Place To Work!
pros: I've been with ESS for almost a year now, and I absolutely enjoy my job! I've worked at many of the ESS facilities in the SF Bay Area over the past year. The office and company expectation's are all standardized, this creates an easier work experience for everyone, including the customer. ESS stands by their core values, which is very refreshing. A lot of companies say one thing, but demonstrate another. Not Extra Space Storage! If you are lucky enough to work here you, too, can enjoy the following examples in the workplace: Positive Work Environment Excellence In Customer Service Teamwork Open Communication Across The Company Medical Benefits, 401K, PTO Competitive Pay Structure Bonus Incentives
cons: The only real "con" I have found is the list of benefits didn't include my choice of medical facilities. I found a great doctor, but I really wanted a certain facility since it's close to my house.

title: Cooperate office vs field employees
pros: The training is good. The company supplies its field workers with shoes and shirts.
cons: The pay is low. Limited holiday paid days off and the holidays that you do work aren‚Äôt time and a half. The company goals are aggressive. It seems the corporate office offers a lot more fun team building activities as opposed to the field employees where there are no fun days for all sites to get together. Even when reviewing the photos that the company put up for Glassdoor. The cooperate office has Halloween parties, group volunteer outings, ‚Äúoffice Olympics‚Äù. Field employees don‚Äôt benefit from such enjoyable events.

title: Love my Extra Space Storage
pros: Since being hired by ESS I can say that compensation is very fair, monthly bonuses, annual raises and for the last 2 years an additional pay raise along with 2 cash bonuses. Recognized with gift cards for outstanding performance and always being prepared for upward mobility. Every quarter a Store Mgr. and Asst. Store Mgr. are recognized in the District with a cash bonus and eligible for a Company wide award. The culture of ESS is one of inclusion, fairness and respect. What makes me proudest of being an employee at ESS is my co workers. Every single person I work with is always willing to assist others. Our trainers are always available to assist with the tough issues and our District Manager always listens to our concerns. We are also blessed to have a Corporate level management that listens and makes changes based on employee feedback... What company does that?? I am an ESS lifer and look forward to a long rewarding career.
cons: Me personally,,,, I got nothing negative to add.

title: It's ok, needs improvement
pros: I have worked for Extra Space for about a year, I came here cause I needed a job right after college. The job isn't to hard, some days you work hard but a lot you don't work to hard. It's a pretty laid back job I would have to say, and as long as you are a good people person you'll do fine. The pay is alright, and the bonus is at least money. They do try to train you well, and you have a lot of freedom.
cons: Sometimes advancement can be difficult, and sometimes when they do promote from within they will promote someone who is not great at the job. But I guess that could be with any company. The pay could be better, especially if you have experience and a college degree in a field that relates to the business.

title: A Great Company to work for, compared to other companies I've worked for in the same field.
pros: Great people to work for, most major holidays off work, Sundays off, great work and life balance. This is my "second life" with Extra Space Storage and in the span of ten years that I was away most of the great quality employees are still with the company.
cons: I don't know if this is company wide, but since I left and came back, a policy of no Saturdays off (without using your PTO) was instituted and in my opinion this seems to infringe in the work/life balance a bit. Some employees with custody of children on weekends are impeded by this, as well as some others who may want to take an occasional three day weekend without having to draw away from their accumulated PTO. Also, in my previous time with ESS, PTO was given on the anniversary date, not accrued as time goes by during the year.

title: Property Accountant
pros: Great culture, opportunities for growth, leadership supports training and growth, fairly flexible (schedule start time can be anywhere from 7-9, just have to be in the office between 9 am - 3:30 pm), fun activities, FIT reimbursement program to encourage healthy lifestyles, open environment.
cons: Lower end of pay compared to other, similar jobs. No work at home options or alternative scheduling (i.e. 4X10 shifts). High employee turnover.

title: Great Company
pros: Great Experience opportunity- This job can give your a real sense of ownership of your responsibility's and duty's, furthering the opportunity to make you more work self sufficient. Very Flexible Scheduling- You wont always get a weekend but the DM's are very conscience of your home needs and are very willing to work with you. Very friendly and able Management team- One of the few jobs that i worked where there was always someone who could answer your questions and the team you work with can feel like family. Great tools to help you learn-There are so many ways outside of your seniors to get the answers for questions you have and the tools to help you learn. Great Bonus system.
cons: Staffing issues- Short staffed can have you running around your division to make sure stores are open. Compensation- Pay is ok but not great for all the jobs your expected to perform. Pacing- you need to make sure you set a good pace when it comes to side work, Overzealousness can cause you to leave yourself with little to do and vice versa.

title: Property Manager
pros: Positive work culture, learning resources, incentives, and experience with a wide variety of tasks and responsibilities. Great for multi tasking people.
cons: Low end of pay scale, high level of responsibility, unprofessional District Managers, use of personal vehicle is required but mileage pay is minimal. No training on maintenance tasks which are expected to be performed safely to promote the "clean and green" experience. Safety was a constant concern. Failure to promote reliable, experienced, consistent employees to District Management if the candidate isn't a straight, white , Christian male.

title: Best Company
pros: Work/Life Balance, Growth, Support, Training, Family style work environment, Pay, Benefits, Pays for uniforms and shoes Honestly for someone who has personally worked in several different fields and has been laid off by companies that you put your blood, sweat, and tears into I wouldn't trade this job for any other job. This company is excellent with benefits, work/life balance, and pay for what your actually doing on a day to day basis. Above all else this company is employee centered and actually listens to and cares about us. This is an amazing industry with nothing but room for growth and development! You can move up very quickly with this job and they will train and support you every step of the way!! I love Extra Space Storage and if you are a Hard working, motivated, and tired of bouncing around jobs this is the place for you!!!
cons: Only con that really comes to the forefront is the same con you get with any customer based service. You will get customers that just try and ruin our day but with the support team you have around they are never really successful

title: Great place to work, especially when the company shares its profits with you
pros: When our company makes profit, they hand out bonuses to ALL employees. Get the important, major holidays off. Sundays are always an off day. Everyone that works here is a team player, helpful and nice. The pay is pretty good for what we do. Also, if your an live on site manager like me, you get a free apartment BUT you get a small pay cut. Every year you get a increase in pay. When the head of the division or your DM comes to visit your store, they send you and whoever is there your working with, a gift card.
cons: Dealing with entitled, adult babies. You HAVE to deal with the worst of the worst when it comes to customers. Doing out door cleaning is kind of rough outside in 120 degree weather. Having to clean up nasty stuff is not so fun. Other than that, there is no cons to Extra Space.

title: Culture, Culture, and Culture.
pros: There are not that many companies in this day and age that keep you exhilarated and energized each and every day. With constant change to keep us on top of our game in our industry, Extra Space Storage has clear and consistent direction from the CEO down to the newest hire. It is wonderful to be a part of a constantly expanding enterprise that offers a lot of opportunity for those that apply themselves and take the initiative for greatness. Thank you for the opportunity I have been given to be a part of something great and long lasting!
cons: In any great company, it is always comprised of a lot of great associates. This makes it a lot more challenging to move ahead since there is so much talent to compete with. On the flipside, this makes me that much more focused and energized to deliver excellence!

title: Misleading Reviews.
pros: Decent work hours. Some okay people.
cons: HR routinely checks Glassdoor and has reviews removed that are negative. In October there were 3 reviews from former employees that vanished without a trace. Management will offer rewards to employees who leave good reviews. (Expect this to be removed in a few days, grab a screenshot and wait for the change) Expect to be asked to do things that are borderline illegal or outright illegal. The pay is far below average. No real advancement in certain departments. HR ignores claims of harassment and has fired people for complaining about bullying. Don't expect training for new products and systems. Also expect unpaid overtime regularly. 12 hour days are pretty normal if you are salary and if you push to work your normal shift you will be punished. When requesting time off expect to be told that you shouldn't take more than a day or two. Remember if you are not a manager at the Store Support Center (corporate office) you are going to be treated like garbage.

title: Great Comapany
pros: Great company. They are very invested in their employees. Benefits are great and you get Sundays off. There are a lot of tools available to help you learn and do your job. Great teamwork oriented atmosphere. Upper management is great and (at least my DM) always show their appreciation for employees.
cons: Not many. This is not really a fault of the company... but, the company is very invested in their employees, which in turn means expectations are very high. You are required to complete various tasks (like follow ups/sales calls) within a tight window. The rental/follow up process is very sales driven. In person and phone mystery shops are done regulalrly. There are scripts and guidelines you are required to use, even down to specific work usage. Google reviews are also extremely important and WILL be a major factor in your performance. While there are plenty of tools and coaching opportunities for these things, if you are uncomfortable in a sales/solicitation driven position, this will be challenging.

title: Amazing culture
pros: Extra Space continues to impress me year over year as I've grown with the organization. Our people are definitely what makes the difference. Extra Space truly cares about our external and internal customers. We don't just talk the talk, we walk the walk, everyone from Spencer Kirk to our store team. We're constantly being innovative to keep up with rapidly changing technology and the industry. If you're looking for a dynamic, fun, challenging and welcoming place to work, where you are empowered to make decisions, Extra Space is the place to be.
cons: We have many avenues for career advancement especially for entry level store positions. If you are in a position outside of the store level and you are not relocatable, it may be more challenging to advance to higher level positions. Fortunately, with the empowerment given, you can still be challenged in your current role if you don't have the ability to relocate to another area.

title: District Manager
pros: You will love working at Extra Space! Here you will find a business that is forward thinking and technologically savvy, along with a culture that empowers it's employees to manage like owners and the autonomy to make the best decisions for the benefit of both the company and the customer. While every job has it's pros and cons, this company strives to make an environment where the employees believe this is a great place to work and I am very happy to be on the team! If you have a passion for customer service and a desire to love the work you do, then I encourage you to apply.
cons: There is a lot of collaboration in decision making, which is great most of the time, but can at times, slow down the processes causing us to miss some opportunities.

title: Property Manager
pros: I came to Extra Space Storage from a 29 year background in retail management as a District Manager , Regional Manager. I had no ideal what this industry was going to be like. When I found out that I was off on Sundays and closed at 6 pm I thought this is like no other retail that I have worked! And I was right, been with Extra Space 2 years now and enjoy working for my District Manager and the management team that I have been blessed with on visits to my locations. They all are real Team players that help guide you through the different aspects of the industry. I don't like idle time and there is always something that I can do to improve my property and find ways to better serve my customers needs. Its been a great ride so far!
cons: I can't think of any...

title: Great Culture!
pros: Hours are consistent, pay is decent, co-workers are helpful and friendly. Extra Space shows that it values it's employees and a great place to work if you want to grow as a sales person. The district managers empower you to own the location you're working at, and although there is a store manager, they work WITH you not above you. There is always learning opportunities and even if you don't get a "A" or a "100%" on something, the district managers and District Team Leads, along with you store managers are always there to help you to improve. I haven't come across a single person so far that hasn't been a positive influence in the workplace.
cons: Not that it's a HUGE issue, but you do work alone for a good bit of the time and sometimes that can be detrimental to some of your daily tasks. Overall, I don't have a lot of cons for working here, though.

title: I love working here!
pros: This is the first company that I've worked for where you're more than just a headcount. The managers truly care about you as a person, and work hard to keep you happy and engaged. They maintain an upbeat and positive environment, and I appreciate that there are always opportunities to learn and be challenged. Everyone's encouraged to pursue growth in their career, whether it's applying for a promotion within the department, or in another department within the company. This is a great company with a great future!
cons: For a company that boasts about it's "flexibility", most of the accounting department is denied that by being stuck using desktops. Changing this should be a priority for management in order to remain competitive and to stay in line with their goal of improving efficiencies and scalability. The benefits need work, particularly the healthcare benefits. The plans and the cost for what's being offered are terrible. This is an extremely important piece of remaining competitive in the job market, and I can honestly say that I almost didn't take this job because of how awful the healthcare is.

title: A company that values your opinion
pros: I've worked for this company for over 5 years. Originally it was just a stepping stone until I found another job that I really liked. However, as a whole ESS takes the time to listen to their employees in the field. They are reasonable with their expectations. The work is challenging and keeps you busy. They respect you and recognize your personal accomplishments. Pay is decent for what we are expected to do. They want to develop and promote as many employees as possible, so its a great launching pad for your career. Great hours, decent benefits, good management. Great place to work!
cons: Most Saturdays are required. As a large company they can be fairly strict on certain things. There are slow periods in the winter, sometimes. With generally only two employees working per site or if there is someone that leaves ESS, your schedule is sometimes difficult to have exactly want you want off; this is uncommon though.

title: Proud to be part of Extra Space Storage
pros: At Extra Space Storage you clearly see a company that works well together. You are provided with knowledge, assistance, and a great feeling knowing you are appreciated. Great benefits for new employees and a good structure for being able to grow within the company. Your superior always listens to your concerns, and is very accommodating. I am proud to continue to work with Extra Space Storage and recommend this company for anyone looking for a great professional experience.
cons: Customer service can sometimes feel overwhelming, however there are very easy ways to handle negative feedback or criticism. You must listen and stay clam. Hear what the problem is and instead of getting wound up, take a second to breath and try and help them out. Ultimately you are there to help in any way you can. If you feel tense, take a 5 minute break and calm down before continuing.

title: A little better than the rest,
pros: Pays a $1 or 2 more than their competitors Closed Sunday You are allowed to think and use your own discretion You run the store with little bother from the DM Helpful co-workers
cons: Understaffed. You work alone most of the time. They will lie to you about hiring more people. Deceptive technique of selling of insurance. Advertising first month free when no such discount exists, leading to angry customers. Always on your back to meet the many metrics. Some are hard to meet due to no fault of your efforts to try to meet them. Record and test call you all the time. Sometimes you are helping a customer and cant answer, They don't care. Assistant Managers perform the same duties as a Manager but paid less. They role play with you all the time. You will never be good enough. Expensive and bad insurance coverage.

pros: Decent Benefits Pretty Good Environment WFH
cons: You have learn to deal with their dishonest business practices and poor treatment of customers. They have a ridiculously high gross margin. Ex Walmarts is consistently 25% Extra Space is consistently over %70. Wages for customer service will BARELY get by on if you are single and living alone but you won‚Äôt be able to save for anything. Of course just going in you wouldn‚Äôt notice this, but once you look into their business practices it‚Äôs pretty discouraging and upsetting. If you are good at phone sales you will make pretty good money but they treat customer service like second class employees when they are taking the large majority of difficult calls due to upset customers because of their relentless rate increases. All in all it‚Äôs better than most call center jobs but they have a RIDICULOUS excess income that should be going to their employees.

title: Manager rhymes with janitor
pros: Over all. ok company but you're not a real leader in store manamgnet who can make actual decisions. Your ideas won't matter nor will they count. Your painted a picture during interviews but in reality, the picture painted is not entirely what youre getting. If you love to clean, breath in dust and dirt and have leadership reject purchases of cleaning products just so they can see a bigger bonus check then this job is for you. in the office you'll deal with horrible situations where you have to have empathy for people who are homeless and don't have a dollar to their name but youre forced to sell them overly priced merchandise and insurance that they don't need just to maintain KPIs that you won't get acknowleged for.
cons: No voice if youre store level employees. COmplicated process to reach out to HR. If you do reach out to HR, whomever you snitch out will find out and you'll be punished. No loyalty towards tenured stafff

title: Losing the Culture
pros: There are a lot of great people that work at Extra Space but unfortunately they are not the ones being promoted as the company grows. They have a great work culture as long as you are in the "VPs group". I loved working here but
cons: As the company continues to grow they are losing the culture that had made them a great place to work. There are cliques, limited communication and those that are getting promoted to the next level tend to not continue to exhibit the company values (specifically integrity). They are out for themselves and too make money; not the team as a whole.

title: Very Disappointing
pros: On the surface it seems like a great place, but the reality is disappointing and much different. The store employees want to do well and are really nice people, but they are beat down.
cons: I'm not disgruntled, but expect to work with better people. The field sr. leadership is nothing but incompetent bullies who really have little business sense, but have risen to the top because of who they know. Leaders at corporate hear this feedback, but condone it by doing nothing about it as good people continue to leave. Those of us that work in the field are treated like we have no idea and are worked well beyond acceptable hours and then back stabbed and even lied about by our own leaders. Disappointing, but hopeful I will leave soon.

title: Extra Space is an awesome place to work!!
pros: There are so many pros! Awesome training programs, unlimited promotion opportunities, good pay, full time, set schedule, Sundays off, paid holidays, full benefits, annual raises, monthly bonuses, retail without the retail hours, and you're not stuck inside all day but you're not stuck outside all day either! All employees that work here treat each other like family and we all are very positive, happy, customer service oriented people! We're fun to be around :-)
cons: Not many cons at all! Some small ones are being required to work all Fridays, Saturdays, and Mondays. It also gets very hot working outside in the summer and very cold in the winter!! You may have many days working alone. The little cons are nothing compared to all the pros!

title: Company offers advancement only to those that are young with less than 2 years of experience in the comany
pros: Relaxed Dress Code; snacks and drinks supplied; coworkers are friendly; decent benefits and retirement packages offered
cons: The company is not good at communicating changes. There is a definite culture of weeding out employees over the age of 45. There is very little chance of advancement, and you "Cap" out at your position salary within 4 years, raises are 1% per year after that. Schedule flexibility used to be a strong reason to stay, this is no longer true. Salaried employees are treated no differently than hourly employees. There is a culture of harassment and contempt. Management treats employees in a distrustful manner.

title: Extra Space culture
pros: Extra Space starts you off with 2 weeks of training before heading off to a site. The trainer you are with is the best in the District as a store manager. They give you advice and show you how to run the site effective. Pay occurs bi-weekly with PTO and option for 401k. You have autonomy to run the site but there are still standardizes processes. Work hard even when no one is looking because hard work can be easily seen. Pay is much better than Public Storage. PS pays their manager $9.00
cons: If you need micro-managing this is not the place for you. Customers do make messes so it may feel that you are constantly cleaning but a product and property is the competitive advantage. Our competition does NOT clean their properties.

title: District Manager
pros: Professional, business focused company that has found the unique balance between work and home life. Many company's say that people are their greatest asset, but ESS really believes it. I have not been happier here than any job I have had in the last 15 years.
cons: It's hard to find a definitive con. All jobs have things that aren't perhaps ideal or maybe aren't personally beneficial to one person, but ESS does much better than others in mitigating these factors and trying to be as fair as possible. If anything ESS works very hard to try and improve itself and with innovation comes some things that work and some that don't. That process can create some processes that take time to grow to stability. It's hard to really complain about that because as ESS innovates they are smart enough to try new things and smart enough to change things when they don't work.

title: #TeamExtraSpace is the real deal
pros: People stay for decades at Extra Space, which sounds crazy at first, but you start to understand why after being here. The culture is amazing because Extra Space hires great people that you actually want to work with and get to know. Career growth seems good with different programs for advancement/learning, frequent internal hiring, and company growth. Depending on the needs of your team, there is some opportunity for remote work. The national headquarters is typically hybrid, the call center is remote, and the store employees are on-site.
cons: Compensation is average. Company is often slow to try new things, but eventually gets there.

title: Higher Ups Puppeteered By Predecessors
pros: Benefits Pay Company Movement Training Bonuses
cons: Honesty Upper Management Flexibility Commitments School Scheduling

title: Store Manager
pros: A lot of outdoor work so not stuck in an office all day and it helps blow off steam.
cons: No flexibility with schedules and customers get to treat you like dirt

title: Store Manager
pros: Strong Company, Great Product, Great People
cons: Too many reports within our district, we have way too many repetative reports: comp reports, invoice trackers, deposit trackers, etc.. We have stores to run, units to clean, and way too much on our plates as it is. Please limit the nonsense and let us run our stores effectively. Especially with summer on the way. We have alot of property maintenance in the summer and we're responsible for weed removal, etc.. So when they keep adding things to do, it sometimes becomes a major headache. Otherwise, I love my job-

title: Pros outweigh cons
pros: outweigh cons
cons: Very corporate. The higher ups make idiotic decisions that don't necessarily work or make sense. High expectations of customer service. They do secret shops which require you to cover everything on a checklist which you can only miss 2 things on before you fail. Customer interactions are a little bit scripted but not too much. I will never enjoy answering the phone and asking how can I meet your storage needs. These things are to be expected in corporate jobs, so you have to know what you're getting into working for them.

title: Love it here
pros: Lots of support from higher-ups including hands on support, training and coaching. Team environment where stores within the district help and support each other. Uniform and shoe allowance; don't have to worry about what to wear. So many advancement opportunities. They hire quality people, at least in my district.
cons: Sometimes dealing with things tenants leave behind is gross. Collections calls and auctions can be unpleasant just because of the nature of what they are. Metrics and KPIs can be difficult to keep up with because customers are able to reserve and rent online so some things are out of our control but we are scored on it. Their rental tech and system undergoes a lot of advancements, which is awesome but sometimes there are glitches and bugs that need fixing and it affects business.

title: Store Manager
pros: Well run company who strives to provide exceptional customer experience by maintaining & investing in it's stores. Training programs are thorough, focused but also designed to be accessible to employees on their own. There are opportunites to make your thoughts/ideas known and employees are given support to advance if they choose to.
cons: You have to learn to be extremely organized due to all it entails to run a store. It can get extremely busy and if we are short handed which can be frustrating you may not get to accomplish all you set ou to do on a regular basis. However, if you are on top of everything and prioritize it's not a huge issue.

title: Best place to work!
pros: Extra Space isn't just a job, its a lifestyle and an adventure! I've been with the company going on 11 years now, and most of everything I have learned in my professional life has been here with ESS. I love the culture, the team work, and the growth opportunities that come with company's growth. My peers have been supportive throughout the years and I can honestly say that I am who I am today because of what I have learned and how I have evolved while at ESS. I'm forever grateful!
cons: We wear many hats at Extra Space Storage and it can be overwhelming at times. However this broad range of responsibilities help build character and humility while learning things we never thought we would learn.

title: Store Manager
pros: Promotions and advancement from within occur quickly because the company is rapidly growing. All sites work as a Team and encourage one another on a regular basis. All around just a wonderful company to work for. A very positive atmosphere . We are closed on Sundays which makes a perfect family day. Pay is decent and nice benefits.
cons: I honestly can't think of a negetive thing to say about Extra Space. It really is a great place to work!

title: I love working here!
pros: The people, schedule, pay and advancement opportunities.
cons: Under staffing & maybe more holidays off. (Staffing is really the only thing but, this made me put at least 5 words in.)

title: Corporate does not care about employees
pros: The Store hours are nice.
cons: Does not pay enough for the amount of responsibilities you have. They had the audacity to brag about the fact that they made more money during the pandemic than ever and employees at most got a 75 cent to $1 raise. Mind you we had to psychically report for work during the pandemic the sites only closed for 2 days. Not to mention you always have to travel to other locations no matter what unless your not a team player. EVEN if your the store manager which we were always told the store manager needs to be at the their home site. I did that for 3 months during the pandemic. I ended up leaving due to my laughable hourly wage of 17 dollars and hour as a MANAGER and was told they don't do competitive pay. They rather lose you than pay you more.

title: Strong Company with Impeccable Leadership!
pros: Extra Space is in a strong growth mode and continues to outperform its' competitors in the market place in both Revenue Growth and NOI. The company values its' team members and gives those employees a tremendous amount of latitude to operate their span of control to the way that will allow them to have the greatest impact. Support is ever present and and there for the taking when needed at all levels of the organization.
cons: You definitely take the good with the bad at Extra Space. The strong growth mode and high goals make the positions challenging but the enthusiasm infused throughout the company keeps the energy high and the environment friendly and healthy. Change is a staple as the company expands and support elements stretch and realign both at the support level and through the software the company utilizes.

title: DO NOT WORK HERE.
pros: Work Life Balance. Is the only Pro I have for this. Upper management is horrible and never motivating toward employees and do not set you up for success.
cons: This Company does not pay enough for the number of responsibilities that you are required to handle on a daily basis. You are a Sales Person, Maintenance worker, Real estate agent, Auctioneer, Security Guard, and Insurance broker all rolled into one. Each of these responsibilities or titles can and arguably be considered separate Jobs in itself. Each of these jobs will compensate you way more than you are paid at Extra Space Storage. The growth Potential is insufficient because having any real career outside of a Site Manager is nonexistent. This Job is not the place you want to be if you are truly looking for a financially rewarding career that will pay you adequately for the number of responsibilities that they want you to handle.

title: Company that treats you with respect and easily the best storage company to work for.
pros: They treat you right and do little things that set them apart from the other 2 storage companies I have worked for. They also treat the customer right at least here in the Chicago are which makes it a lot more comfortable enironment to work in. They seem to actually for live the values in their mission of course they are human and it is a big company so they are not perfect.
cons: Like all storage companies they don't pay all that well they pay better than most of the other companies but it is still short of what they should pay. Your day can switch from being very boring to very busy in a second. At times like almost all retail businesses they can be understaffed.

title: It has been a good place to work for the past few years.
pros: Extra Space is growing rapidly and is a very strong company to work for. It is the second largest storage company in the nation and has the big guy beat with sheer superior customer service and beautiful, clean facilities. The tenants tend to really prefer Extra Space over other storage companies. That makes your job a little easier, but don‚Äôt think that the job is mindless and easy. There are lots of goals and expectations, but it‚Äôs nothing that hard work won‚Äôt conquer. The entry positions require varied work tasks and there is always something to get done.
cons: As a company, I believe that Extra Space is making all of the correct moves, but no company is perfect and I sometimes wish that my current superior was a little more understanding. Also, there‚Äôs lots to do and remember to do and the staffing is not always available.

title: Extra Space Storage actually cares about its employees
pros: I come from Mall retail where I was working an average of 65 hrs a week so when I was given the opportunity to work for Extra Space Storage I jumped on it, I have been with ESS for about 3 years and I love my job. I now work 40 hrs a week, I get every Sunday off and 1 Saturday a month off, so, what can I say about ESS? I actually have a life now, I am really happy about how I get treated and valued by my superiors which I never had before;I was always treated like a number and not recognized for my accomplishments, I work in a very tight team and if I ever need something my team helps out, I have a great District Manager who has a heart of gold and who compliments me when needed, ESS is the best Company to work for!
cons: I have no cons to list!!

title: Don't run after the carrot!!!
pros: Great learning opportunities, good way to get experience for your next job.
cons: Bugs, rodents, homeless, break-ins, weather, low pay with a cap on how much you can earn, limited opportunities, google review quotas. They will dangle the carrot for you but you will never actually get the carrot. The live-on-site properties are only given to people they favor- your actual performance doesn't matter. They will dangle it in front of you over and over again until you give up. And, they do not compensate you as a manager who does not get the live on-site. So basically, there's managers and then there's live on-site managers.

title: Some ups, a lot of downs
pros: Health insurance, possible to live on-site, ability to transfer around the country.
cons: seems to only way to get promoted is to move around the country, low pay, lack of transparency.

title: Store Manager
pros: Great culture. A company that truly values its employees as well as their opinions in all aspects. Myriad opportunities for growth and advancement, especially for educated individuals and those who show that they want to succeed and prove they are capable of such. Reasonable hours, benefits and compensation. Changes and challenges are constant but this is what contributes to our growth as employees and as a company. I have learned SO much since joining Extra Space and there are a number of resources available for training, etc. Not to mention our learning and development team is awesome!
cons: The only complaint I can think of is that it seems as though district managers are typically hired externally now. It wasn't always this way. If you are able to get a district manager position from within, you must first be a DTL, but sometimes DTL positions can be hard to come by...

title: Ups/Downs
pros: Work/Life Balance, Benefits, Property management experience
cons: Pay is low for property management (this is a storage thing). They promote you to share ideas and suggestions, but they're usually just acknowledged and quite often are shot down. Opportunities and growth are a constant topic, putting the carrot on the stick for promotion opportunity. The fact of the matter is these opportunities are not equal. It's a game of favorites and politics. Even if you do get a promotion it's often only about $1 an hour with much more than $1 an hours' work slapped on. Very large difference in work depending on where the property is. A property in a nice area, you can get everything done in an hour or two. A ghetto property, you will find yourself always behind.

title: This is the best place I have ever worked. The growth opportunities have been unmatched.
pros: The greatest asset this company offers is its work culture. I have never felt more connected to others in the workplace. The time that is given on each individual's growth and development has been excellent. I love the dedication this company has given me, and in return I am ever dedicated to Extra Space.
cons: As the company continues to grow, there runs a risk of losing some of that great culture that makes Extra Space a great place to work. What is natural to growth is the difficulty it is to stay and feel connected with everyone.

title: Company doesn't trust its' employee's
pros: Decent pay for the amount of work required. Management flexible when we need an extra day off here and there.
cons: Hardly a chance for growth opportunity. Only two people work in one store. AM and SM. Promotions are easy if looking to go from AM to SM, but anything beyond that is rare. Mostly external hires for management or corporate position. I have a bachelors degree and positions that I think I would be considered for if I applied to them before working here I am not being that I need to work my way up the chain. All of the company and its technology is blocked. Internet websites, even the company cell phone doesn't allow for certain features. The work days take forever, and you don't get proper recognition.

title: Great customer service without sacrificing employees
pros: This company has some great benefit options, they reward for going above and beyond. They work with you to achieve your professional goals.(If you want to promote they will help you find that path. If you want to stay at the level your at, they will help you be the best you can be in that position.) This is the first job I've had sense serving in the US Army that I have been excited to go to work and the end of the day is here before I know it. I have already recommended one of my friends here and he loves it as well.
cons: You work a lot of Saturdays and don't get off until 6 most days. There are not many overtime opportunities. You are not eligible for the 401k until after your 1st year.

title: Some Great Some Terrible
pros: The tech focus of the company is amazing at corporate and the executive leadership feels very approachable and respectful. The current CEO is a genuinely great person. Headquarters (pre-covid) is a phenomenal location by the mountains and they mostly hire very bright people.
cons: In the wrong departments you face a great deal of ladder climbing management and nepotism, which becomes extremely toxic. When performance is poor the stress very strongly trickles down the ranks. It's great when its great, when it's not, its absolutely not. The company prides themselves on offering 'competitive' benefits and salary, which means very average for SLC. Keep in mind as you interview at corporate that every company will try to sell you on their culture and values just as you're trying to sell them on why you're great. This company does a good job of selling these things but if it doesn't feel like a good fit when you work there, leave quickly. Again, when it get's bad it's very toxic.

title: Extra Space Experience
pros: The only thing good about this place was the fellow coworkers who are in the trenches with you.
cons: Being lied to about my exact duties was red flag number one. The job title should be ‚ÄúLooking for a person who wants to work multiple positions, yet only get paid the minimum, inquirer within‚Äù If I had known that I was to be a security guard , custodian, insurance broker, salesman, & peacemaker, then I would‚Äôve asked for $500 an hour. On my second week making delinquency calls yeah that‚Äôs a fun task‚Ä¶ Anyways my life was threatened by a customer because Extra Space was increasing his rent again. I did what I could but little did I know that the man would come into the store only minutes after I ended the call, thank goodnesses I was outside taking a break because I was some what disturbed by how aggressive he was. After that I knew I had to leave, I mean other than cleaning horrible filthy rodent infested units with years of dust and grime.

title: Could be so much better
pros: Work-life balance, overall easy work.
cons: Micromanagement, low pay, can be very slow.

title: Progressive company still needs lots of work
pros: -The intranet and job resources are off the charts. -If you need help the team has your back. -Days go by fast -Nice people for the most part -Pay is ok
cons: -Favortism -No work life balance -Punished for personal days -Hard work, experience, and accomplishments go unrewarded/unrecognized unless part of the click -Toxic management behaviors practiced

title: A large, high-performing company that feels small.
pros: The company HQ has a great culture. In a lot of ways it feels a little more like a small company because you can get to know everyone in your department pretty easily. I've had regular opportunities to interact with executives. We hear from our executive team formally every quarter and have opportunities to interact with them fairly regularly. It's great to be able to hear the vision for the company and to be able to buy in to the direction we're going. The company invests a lot in their people, culture, and creating a great environment to work in. We have a newly remodeled workspace in a great location away from a lot of the congestion of the valley.
cons: Culture varies a bit depending on department. That seems pretty normal though.

title: Totally apply! It's AMAZING HERE.
pros: Great work ethics, amazing team and talented coaches. Much passion for helping others, storage is actually a big deal. Great, competitive pay, you could support a family.
cons: I would say the commission scale could use some work. The commission you lose for numbers that aren't always in your control seems unfair. Not much of a chance to move up in the call center, but throughout the company there are plenty. The late shift is not exactly convenient, but it works really well if you don't have a family. It feels like the company is being too driven by investors and that we may be slipping toward a greedy mode.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Great work/life balance, awesome employee recognition programs, definitely a company on the rise. I have been working for this company for 1 year and I can honestly say that of all the jobs I have had in the past this one is the best. They provide you the freedom to actually feel like you are a manager and someone who can make a difference.
cons: The only downside that I can see is that we are required to work Saturdays. This is retail so I understand the needs of the business.

title: Employee Focused Culture
pros: This company balnces our workforce when making business decisions. When the company performs well, the organization has looked for opportunities to give monetary rewards to the team. (Ad hoc bonuses, multiple salary raises to salried and hourly employees) Investment in internal development. Use of Individual Development plans, Succession planning and an entire department dedicated to building employee bench strength at the District and regional level. Diversity and inclusion initiatives, make me feel like I contribute and my diversity of background and experience are essential to our cultural and operational success. Engagement surveys, prompt leadership to create action plans that help improve employee satisfaction.
cons: Opportunity for a better college reinbursement program. Current scholarship style opportunities, leave a lot of people out of the opportunity to take advantage of tuition for their education.

title: It's okay work
pros: Independent work environment. Monthly bonuses based on rentals
cons: District manager outsources their work to the store managers and District Team Leaders. It is a lot of work for the amount you get paid. Limited opportunity for growth. If you want to transfer to a different district, start the process months in advance because you have to compete and interview for the position even if its the same position you already have and apparently people in lower positions in the district you want to transfer to get priority

title: Decent Pay and Benefits for Sales
pros: The starting pay is above that of a typical sales role. The hours are also better than many sales positions with typical hours being 9:30 AM to 6 PM Monday through Friday, and 9 AM to 5:30 PM on Saturdays, with Sundays off if you work at sites that are closed on Sundays. Good health insurance plans are offered after a few months and also PTO is accrued at a decent rate. Very understanding that employees are humans and that things may come up. They do not make you feel badly if you need to change your schedule. They will work with you.
cons: The typical training provided, while detailed, is not long enough for the scope of the role. You may feel caught between getting the office aspects of the role complete and also the cleaning and janitorial aspects daily while working alone. Due to staffing shortages, working alone and also working multiple different locations per week is the current norm.

title: Stable company with great employees
pros: The one thing I like best about Extra Space is my co-workers. People are respectful of each other and generally very positive. I think this is hard to find in the workplace. It is much easier going to work each day to a pleasant environment. Extra Space is constantly growing, which creates a lot of opportunity and a lot of work. It is financially very stable, even during downturns in the economy. All of my experience has shown this is an ethical company that tries to do the "right" thing. Improvements in processes and technology is always on the agenda. It is a very conservative company.
cons: The down side of a growing company is that there is a lot of work to do and it can be overwhelming. The down side of a conservative company is that there isn't much reception for the newer ideas in the workforce for things like flexibility in schedules, telecommuting, and PTO policies.

title: Horrible management
pros: Hours are good. Job is one of the better ones.
cons: All employees are not treated fair and held to the same standard. What works for one person is not the case for everyone. You are hired for one position at one site and then rudely without warning you are told you have to work at a different location. (This other store could be 1 hr drive away) You are not given an option to say no and if you do you get a target on your back. Our management team thinks they are helping, but they are useless. Says they support us, but dont. There is absolutely no team in this area. It's a dictatorship. Hours are cut more and more, but job duties increase.

title: Best Retail Environment
pros: It's not your typical retail position. You work with people who actually NEED and WANT your service. The goal here is to create a bond or trust with your potential customer. That in itself can be rewarding. Sometimes these people com ein at the bottom of their world, and when a little compassion is shown and that you show how much you care about them, can really be a good feeling for both the customer and Myself.
cons: My struggle is watching people lose their items to auctions. Times are tough for some which is why they were using our services, then to see years of memories be sold to the highest bidder can be heartbreaking.

title: Assistant Manager
pros: Perfect Hours. Every Sunday off. Always someone available to ask questions. Good cheap health plans, bonus gift cards are nice, life to work ratio is perfect.
cons: Metrics that must be met every month as well as individual metrics that must be maintained or you will go over the sales process multiple times with your mananger. Metrics are based on 4 things and all of them are completely determined on whom rents with you and what they chose or don‚Äôt chose.

title: I am going to hell or getting killed by one of these customers who we are putting the screws too hard
pros: Social distancing keeps me from having a angry mob disembowel me or getting beaten like its Selma AL
cons: watching. good hard. working people loose everything becaus eof covid. PPD auction and are now back to auctioning off peoples belongings because. I love saying let me speak to D manager and ill get back to you with a terrible offer and No you cant speak to management in fact i must email them . Lord im not middle manning a deal with some person so importsant they dont even have a phone ( i explain they have no phone , no even tough you have given us 20k and had death in your family , your wife lost her job and im just crushing peoples life in the jingle jangle morning . I ffel dirty

title: Mixed bag
pros: At the national level I was pleased. Good communication, lots of ways to give feed back.
cons: The local district I wasn‚Äôt in was poorly managed. Lots of talented and knowledgeable tenured workers constantly over looked for new employees who often didn‚Äôt meet requirements for advancement. Overall the company keeps adding work at cutting staffing. The pay isn‚Äôt equal to the work being done in some cases. You can ask for help but you aren‚Äôt going to get it unless you are a favorite or work at a big store. Hours based on total units not actual amount of work you need to do.

title: A day at ESS
pros: Company does treat you fairly well, the pay is decent if not great. Contests to win $25 spot cards.
cons: Customers treat you poorly, deal with it. The Company wont back you. They are very much against evictions, especially vehicles unless the bill doesnt get paid and they go to auction. A huge push for Google, insurance akd merchandose with no real perks for getting good numbers. 100% focused on the above and getting people on easy pay, they say the rental,os what matters but that simply isnt true. Dm's push these hard because they do get bonuses on the four metrics I listed. Be a car sales rep without the pay. Customers are all but forced to get insurance. We say its required but ots not. Its a great plan but it takes sales tactics to close the deal.

title: Fun learning experience.
pros: Great enviornment. Understanding, competant management. I worked for a small department within Extra Space and our team became very close, as a result of a great boss and management. The higher ups know how to get the best out of their employees. Plenty of opportunity for growth and advancement. Great pay and benefits. They are changing the storage industry for the better.
cons: The new policy of not allowing family to work. I am related to a VP within the company and my department was within the building he oversaw, however he had nothing to do with it. The only reason this came up was because I was promoted to a corporate position. Otherwise I wouldn't have been on the radar.

title: Great company, pay rate not enough for amount of work required
pros: Great benefits, great people, great culture
cons: Pay rate is not enough to keep up with market conditions. Monthly bonus percentage could be higher for on-site managers. No program of giving back to the community. The work atmosphere can be volatile and very challenging at times due to the customers. There isn't always a lot to do, which means certain days feel extremely long. No compensation for driving from home to multiple site locations. Praise not given equally to everyone in the team.

title: renting storage or an insurance company
pros: they are closed so you get Sundays off
cons: No integrity with this company, part of their sales pitch is to lie to the potential customers about price street rate/web rate and your job depends on you converting more than 3/4 of sales at a higher rate than published on the internet. Then tell them that your lease requires them to buy insurance and your job depends on you selling insurance to 9 out of 10 potential customers. its not even insurance and doesn't cover water or rodent damage the 2 most common claims. They used to have pretty good benefits but depending on when you were hired you will see they slowly over the years took most of what made them a good work/life balance away.

title: Worst Company Ever!
pros: Work life balance, laid back work environment and not a lot of customers to deal with on a daily basis.
cons: There are so many cons at this company, the company prides itself as being a great place to work; however I ran into a lot of issues. The other managers lie on you. Also their training is a joke and you feel like you cannot speak up on anything and you are walking on eggshells. I moved from another state to accept a management position with them and wished I never did! Also the pay is below average for their upper management positions. You can get treated more fairly and get better pay with another company. Please think twice before taking any type of job with this company.

title: Fantastic place to work
pros: If you are looking for a company that has built a culture of: Great teamwork Mutual respect Fun environment Promote from within Competitive pay/ benefits Work- life balance: family is important You will love it here! I was with another company for a long time thinking it could not really be any better anywhere else, boy was I wrong. If you are thinking of a career change, do it now, don‚Äôt wait! Come to work for Extra Space, you will be amazed too! I love it here.
cons: I have not found many things I dislike yet- I have been working here six months and I am amazed each day that I am still so excited about working here.

title: Love the job
pros: -Great work/life balance -Paid holidays off -Off every Sunday -Fixed schedule. No early mornings or late nights -Work doesn't follow you home -Learning building maintenance and different life skills -Building customer connections -A very supportive and helpful team
cons: -Don't get paid enough for the work that you do. -PTO accrues very slowly -Even with fixed scheduling, your schedule will change frequently in terms of what location you'll be at unless you're a store manager

title: After 10 plus years...
pros: I have seen a lot of changes after 10 years and now our CEO is retiring. In most cases that would be unsettling as he has been toe core of our culture however in this case we are surrounded by excellent people at all levels. The COO and the SVP carry the message forward show the same views as the CEO. My DVP does a great job and is always fun to work with. Plenty of opportunity for those that are hungry to move up. All the DVP's were internal promotes.
cons: Honestly don't have any major cons but if I had to pick something it would be that the bonus program. It could be a little more balanced and fair,

title: Be thorough when accepting employment
pros: Hours are awesome, job duties are easy, work environment is fun
cons: Communication is not seamless and transparent, upper management does not want to handle issues that employees are unsuccessful at resolving, training is different at each site, but is supposed to be the same, there is favoritism, and what is promised to employees (upon hire and throughout career) is not upheld if not put in writing.

title: Love my job!
pros: Corporate focuses on being the best in the industry by emphasizing the cleanliness of the property, your sales presentation and being customer centric. You must have the ability to adapt to change to work for Extra Space. Compensation, benefits and the option at some properties to live on site make this a great position. Work load is steady but you have the ability to work in the office as well as on the property, which is nice when you need that break from the revolving door or the telephone. And for those willing to relocate, Extra Space will promote from within. Overall, Extra Space is a great place to work.
cons: Inclement weather (people always need storage) So you have to be able to work in extreme temps. Most schedules require working on a Saturday so it's sometimes a challenge to have 2 days off in a roll.

title: Site Manager 8712
pros: ESS is a company that wants and truly allows you to take ownership of your site! I love this fact and how everyday is a little different. I have the freedom to choose what tasks/projects I get to work on everyday as long I as meet deadlines. The people are fantastic!! I work single coverage mostly but have never felt alone, meaning there's always someone to call or email if I need help or just to say Hi. ESS started as a job but I see it as my carrer path for life!!
cons: Bonus structure could be redone, since it's not terribly fair when you compare larger high traffic sites with slower ones.

title: Keep it Moving
pros: The customers are great!!!! They really make my day. Also, having the ability to give the customer the best storage experience.
cons: No room for advancement in some of the districts. Being asked to perform manual labor. Mop, wax, strip floors, landscaping, and other tasks that are not in the job description. Mandatory Saturdays. I could write a five page book about the mismanagement in this company. Very expensive benefits. Expecially on the salary that is offered.

title: Dont bother putting reviews of your honest opinion or the company just has them deleted!
pros: Hmmmmmm some coworkers and free coffee and soda
cons: Too many to get into again just to have the review deleted so why bother. Oh well besides stay away from the horrible Accounting snakes!! The company only keeps the ones that sound so awesome. This really only happens because they have new employees in the first week write a review!! Of course a new employee is going to love it there will all the empty promises they hear. Trust me within a year if not sooner they will have a different review. But then again if you are a whistle blower they just get rid of you so be careful!!

title: Great place to work! I love it!
pros: The trainer is great! She was actually a site manager so she knows a lot from the inside point of view. They train well and do not set you up for failure. The attitude and atmoshpere in the call center is great. When I went in for my interview I heard music playing and saw people smiling and really felt the positive energy. I loved it. Now that I am in training I still continue to see and feel that! The team leads are always coaching and wanting to help all people in their teams. Everyone there wants everyone to succeed! I love working here and hope to stay for a very long time!!
cons: I cannot think of anything negative to say. The only thing I can think of is that the restroom could be a little closer!

title: Join the Green Side! Will not be disappointed at any position!
pros: Unwavering support, consistent cultural focus and a drive to succeed. I cannot tell you how amazing it is to work for a company who continually cares. I've been with Extra Space for 5 years and have loved every minute of it. The vision of our company is promising, and each day is exciting and challenging. Looking forward to spending my career here with the best company in the business.
cons: None that I have experienced!

title: Terrible
pros: Work life balance Sundays off (sometimes)
cons: Favoritism - some are preferred over others and promoted over others Multiple bosses - you have one dm who is supposed to be your direct supervisor but 3 other in the leadership role that are constantly changing your schedule, your job location so who should we answer too? Constant change in job location - Constant change in scheduling..... which means they could determine to change my job location without so much as a blink of an eye. Gossip - a few coworkers that live to gossip about everyone and anyone. Spread rumors and lies and management looks the other way. No loyalty to long term employees. Various people let go for various reasons ranging from attendance to metrics (exactly what those favorites are also guilty of but that get swept under the rug)

title: Company Review
pros: Strong support system from management and above. Very easy and retainable training information and instruction. Great sense of comradery amongst peers and teams. Very positive attitudes and personalities amongst almost all employees. Uniform clothing is comfortable and flexible.
cons: Sometimes work schedule can be hectic if you do not have a specific store assignment. Some customers can be very rude and not understanding of policy or common courtesy as per any retail job to be fair. Some issues such as break ins, messes, etc. are out of your control but can be a daily issue.

title: Store Manager
pros: Great community, as long as you are hitting operational goals management does not micro manage. Freedom to work both inside an office and out on a property.
cons: Training is billed as extensive and ongoing, however the revolving door of employees makes it difficult for the development team to actually develop their talent pool. They could also stand to pay more, they continue to add more and more operational goals and responsibilities without incentives or increase in pay. They are a true corporation and only care about their bottom line.

title: I love It but
pros: Never come in to the same day twice and the customers are amazing. Most of the upper management really cares about the employees, and want to make a great work culture. I‚Äôve been with ESS for more than 10 years and the growth has been amazing. We really are the best at getting better.
cons: For me the work/home life is not balanced the way that I would like in order to hav me an influence with my child the way I would like. The pay is also ridiculous, and a multi billion dollar company like ESS should really pay more and for the long term employees we are only now making what people just being hired are making which is again ridiculous. For ESS to continue to grow and have the talent it needs the pay will have to be addressed immediately.

title: Do they care?
pros: The people I've met and worked with have been really nice. I like the idea of working at multiple sites with different team members. It breaks up the monotony and keeps you on your toes.
cons: If your looking to live on site these days, forget it. I work at a location that has an apartment. The site manager recommended I pursue living on site. Even though it's been unoccupied for over a year my DM told me they plan to turn it into more units, they just don't know when. I do enjoy the job but I have to do what's best for me and my family. I now have to pursue other jobs in my off time to move somewhere respectable. It's unfortunate as I do like my job and coworkers.

title: Love my job
pros: We are well supported and able to find help or answers to questions or problems with ease. Managers are set up for success. Benefits are fantastic, off at a decent time in the afternoon, no Sundays, no major holidays. Not just a desk job and not just a physical job, it's a perfect mix of the two. Not just customer service and sales, but also not a day of no human interaction.
cons: Depends on your personality, you will have to be outside in all weather conditions for no less than 2 hours per day to complete your job. Extreme heat, extreme cold, rain, snow, there are things to be done daily outside. Medical insurance is a bit pricey, but upon comparison same or less cost than using the health marketplace through the government with similar or better coverage.

title: A positive work environment
pros: - friendly staff hand picked by the district manager - no standing behind a register for hours - one on one interactions with new and current customers - full health benefits - PTO and holiday pay - closed on major holidays such as Thanksgiving, Christmas and New Years Day - There is downtime so for an introvert like myself it is great - the software we use is very easy to use and has a very useful support/help guild built-in - Staff from other stores always can assist and answer any questions/concerns you may have. - room to grow in the company - monthly bonuses
cons: - some days there is too much downtime and you spend most of the day cleaning/maintaining the property -

title: 90 days in at Extra Space Storage
pros: The work-life balance of this position is very favorable. I'm glad to have evenings free and every Sunday off. Also, the ability to reach out to any site in the company if you need help helps relieve the stress of learning the storage industry.
cons: It's fairly common that I get called to cover other sites at relatively short notice. Also, if working alone does not appeal to you than this job is not for you. We deal with a fair amount of homeless people and shady people. Cleaning units can be a pretty dirty job and is unpleasant in hot weather.

title: Not what you would expect from a storage company...
pros: I only discovered Extra Space because of a digital marketing conference I was attending where their SEO manager was speaking. I saw that Extra Space isn't just a storage company but a tech company. They are doing some pretty amazing things here and it feels awesome to be apart of. It's nice to be surrounded by talented people because I know that it's going to rub off on me. Someone that I've never talked to walked past my desk and knew my name. That's not something you get to experience often.
cons: Honestly, the only thing I can think of is that its taken awhile for the Help Desk team to respond to a couple of requests I've had which isn't even that bad.

title: Best place to work
pros: Their training program sets you up for success from day one. It is clear as day that they put into us the same they expect from us.
cons: 1. My district (not saying that this is company wide) does not allow consecutive days off. 2. We don't open until 9:30am which is a little late in the day considering here in Texas it's already 85+ degrees outside by 10am in the summer time. 3. We only get 30 min lunch breaks.

title: Great semi-retired Job
pros: Can not say enough great things about working at ESS! The job is not difficult to do. It is not very stressful and my coworkers are great fun and very helpful when I need assistance. Matching 401K, health insurance, Paid time off, holiday and BONUSES!
cons: You do need to keep you 'numbers' up. And rates will increase, so you will get unhappy customers calling about that, but the company will let you adjust this over the phone. As an assistant manager I cover 3 different facilities. Covering the store when the manager takes the day off. There will be days where you are working alone, but again when you have a problem, call a coworker.

title: A company where teamwork and excellence are emphasized
pros: A growing company that continues to value it's employees and customers. There are no limitations to where you can go no matter you starting point. If you love the idea of working independently, wearing multiple hats (variety of work), and striving to be your very best, Extra Space is a great fit.
cons: The industry as a whole has unique challenges in that stores typically require 1 or 2 employees at any given time. This means employees must be self motivated and driven in order to maximize their time. Extra Space does a great job promoting collaboration and teamwork through multiple touch points (phone, email, visits, team meetings, town halls, etc.).

title: I FOUND MY DREAM COMPANY!!!!
pros: I have been with ESS for 3 months. I was hired on as a assistant manager and just got promoted to Store Manager. The staff is AMAZING and there is so much room for growth, You're encouraged to drive your career along your chosen path, and they offer several ways to help you get there, including training, mentorship, internal promotional opportunities and education support programs. ESS is about building the workplace that‚Äôs why they invest just as much in the employees as the do the facilities. If you are looking for a Work-life balance company this is it!!!
cons: Honestly and truthfully since I've been here there's been no cons. I actually feel as part of a family here.

title: Best Storage Company I've Worked For
pros: Easiest merger/transition I have ever gone through in the Industry, and I've been in the industry roughly 9 years. The trainers I was assigned were very motivating! I love the sense of ownership we have over our stores, and the company's drive to repair/improve our properties so we are the best we can be. I love the employee networking that allows for a sense of team/family throughout the District and Company. Oh, and the pay and perks are good.
cons: Having to use PTO to take a Saturday off. I don't mind working Saturdays, but I don't want to have to use a PTO day to go to Synogague. On the flip side, thank you for giving everyone Sundays off so we can spend time with our family/friends that have weekends off!

title: Property Manager
pros: Great team and more attention and genuine care for the top down then any company I've worked for. Growth is there if you work for it. Most of the time. Stable job security and decent benefits.
cons: Again. Growth is there is you put in the work but as with many companies, some people show up one day and get fast tracked because of who they know.. Development is a little lacking only because of how much the DMs have on their plate so sometimes you feel like your chasing and begging for some time. And just when you think you've proven yourself. You get realigned and have a new dm. Back to square one..

title: What Happened?
