pros: The pros at Extra Space are plenty. Decent benefits, Excellent training, Decent work/life balance, and decent vacation time. You'll be trained in a vast range of areas with skills that you can definitely take elsewhere such as sales, property management, or any retail management job. The training I received at ESMI was very thorough and when you were done with 'on paper' training you got to shadow a store for a couple weeks to put it all in to practice. Ideally you should be able to run a store with little supervision. Autonomy is good as well. If you do well and you have a decent district manager there should be no micro-management. Suggestions are taken seriously and even if it may take years to implement it rarely falls on deaf ears.
cons: This is a personal con, and it may not translate over to everyone though the company, but middle management does have to step it up. District managers (in my experience) will often pick favorites and no matter how hard you work or how good your numbers are if you are not friends with your DM you're going to have a hard time. After working at ESMI for several years and being one of the top performers in my district I was looked over for promotion time and time again. Another thing that is universal company wide is the fact that you should plan on getting dirty. Often. Maintenance personnel are hard to come by so chances are you are going to have to do a LOT of cleaning, painting, and fixing yourself. For some that is not a bad thing, and at times it wasn't to me but it can get a little old. By the time I left I felt that Extra Space had gone from a small storage company to a huge corporation, making me feel like they had lost touch with what had made them great to begin with. The difficulty of the work is not that hard overall, however there is a lot that needs to be done and the pay certainly does not reflect that. Extra Space has some of the highest paid people in the storage industry but when compared to leasing agents at apartment complexes they make very little.

title: Very employee centric.
pros: I love that I have a set schedule every week. I came from a retail background and enjoy the fact that our slow season is around Christmas. No more 12 hour days during the holidays. They truly care about the employees in the field. I have seen many things change for the better after asking for employee input. You have a lot of opportunities for quick advancement in the company.
cons: You're not going to make as much as a retail manager does but the trade off is most certainly worth it. I will say that what they do pay is fair for the job expected.

title: I hope I never have to leave!
pros: I really have enjoyed working here at Extra Space. I love the culture and how supportive the management is. They truly want you to succeed and they will help you along the way. There is opportunity for growth. They have a lot of fun events and department activities. You can tell they care about each employee.
cons: With an accounting department of nearly 90 people they need to start offering other options for working besides just on a desktop. To be competitive they need to offer more flexibility. They should allow their employees to work flex schedules and give them laptops to work from home on some days. This will also solve their issue of running out of office space. Also the benefits are expensive compared to other places that I have worked. They should offer cheaper health insurance.

title: Do not work for extraspace
pros: Benefits, Work by yourself, manage a companies site
cons: There's alot of cons but the most apparent was doing EVERYTHING on the site. If your applying to this job under the impression your going to manage anything the title is a joke. Your a glorified janitor who runs the books occasionally as well as do literally everything for the company. For the time I was there I was underpaid and mistreated. Noticed that management did not take kindly to advice and a fresh pair of eyes to view the sites management and downplay literally anything and everything you have to say. I advise you to look for another job if you considered taking this one because all you'll find is a company filled with people about to retire and ruthless DM's that put on a show to get your foot in the door.

title: Great company, not so great benefits.
pros: ESS is committed to promoting from within. If you are willing to learn you will have opportunities for advancement. You are basically your own boss. Lots of freedom when it comes to scheduling.
cons: The pay is only so-so and the medical benefits are not good. if you actually need to use them you better have several thousand dollars on hand for your out of pocket expenses.

pros: Great atmosphere. Great Staff and leadership teams. Plenty of opportunities to evolve in this company if you take the initiative. I have personally seen employees move briskly through the ranks solely by the will to learn, adapt, and advance(Given there is an opening for those positions).
cons: I think the time reward structure could use a little update so when employees work more than 40 hours they can get that overtime rather than have to take longer lunches or leave early. Don't get me wrong, I like leaving early on occasion but when I work a longer shift due to customer service issues that arise, I believe I should qualify to make the choice of getting the OT or shaving it off.

title: This is Where I want to be!!!!
pros: The people make the company and I will tell anyone; we have the Best People on my Team!!! There is a very open anarchy here; any one who can help will help; no matter what they do. Communication the Best!!! Reminders; just love'em!!! Some one always answers the phone!! If there is a will ; they will find a way!!!Thank you!!
cons: I have only a small issue; Breeze; sometimes it works; sometimes it doesn't. But they gave me a way around so thank you again! Again great communication!

title: District Manager New Jersey
pros: I have been working with Extra Space for almost 16 years, time flies by when you enjoy what you do and who you work for. My years of tenure with Extra Space started when we only had 106 stores, and I have to say that they have been exciting and fulfilling. The company's culture and their commitment to their employees and their customers is to be commended, their consistent focus on being the best is something to be proud of!
cons: With over 12,000 customers within the district, there are many walks in life and customer situations that can sometimes feel overwhelming, however these can become easily handled if you are transparent and you listen and treat each situation with care and patience.

title: Assistant Store Manager
pros: Great hours, we see our store numbers and metrics each day, we maintain the property like it is our own. I get lots of great exercise working here! I also work daily with one other person. My trainer and my Store Manager are excellent and help me every day with any questions I may have. The benefits are wonderful and you may receive monthly bonuses. I do a lot of work on the property, but also do a lot of selling to customers. As we are a very customer centric company, Extra Space gives you plenty of tools to help you meet monthly goals, and satisfy customer needs. We work as a team, and let it be known that working here creates a wonderful opportunity for personal growth.
cons: Not much to say here.

title: Horrible Place to Work
pros: No Late Night Hours- They do have 401K w/ Stock Options
cons: Health Insurance Is bad- Upper Management is bad- They do not hire from with in as much as they should, most often they hire some one from outside the company who has little or no experience. Men seem to be paid more for the same position that a female has. I've been there for 5 years and they bring people in making more than me with no experience making more than me- raises are not what they should be, you may get $.30- $.45 a year. And if you happen to get promoted from with in- that is your raise for the year, no matter when your promotion took place- So if you got promoted in January of this year, you would not get a raise January of next year because you have already received a raise

title: Good Bones for Greed
pros: The company will promote from within. The company will work with some tenants.
cons: The company does not actually seek to promote from within. Pay seems good but could clearly and easily be much more. They discourage and even fire for discussing pay. How much the company is willing to work with people seems random and as if it depends on how much the store makes corporate, and not the customer's financial or medical situation. Not all stores are accessible. No transgender health care, not allowed to advocate for it but you will find emails to get ignored through. Must have your own transportation. Was asked to sign a document that training I had not received had been completed This industry is actually a scam.

title: Not just a place to work! It's a place to grow!
pros: Extra Space is one of the most dynamic companies I have had the fortune to work! The company prides itself on treating people well, customers and employees alike. There is a genuine concern for the welfare of people. The company regular discusses the company values and works hard every day to make sure that the values are executed. From Teamwork to Integrity, Extra Space provides not only space for customers to store their valued goods, but also space for employees to develop and grow to become their best! Fair, Fun, Fantastic work environment.
cons: As fast as the company is growing, there is still room to continue the growth. Improving, but still an opportunity for improving benefits for employees.

title: Provides Employees with Tools for Success!
pros: The best part about working for Extra Space Storage that I haven't experienced anywhere else is the amount of support I've received from upper management. They value their employees and want them to succeed. If you don't have the tools you need to succeed right from the start, make a case for it. They are happy to listen and work with you to get you where you need to be so you can perform your duties effectively and efficiently. I'd recommend working here to anyone who feels like they aren't getting that support at his/her current place of work. This is a collaborative, team environment where everyone is working together for the betterment of the company.
cons: Benefits are good but could be better.

title: Love it here
pros: A company that actually cares about its employees as much as it does about it customers. I would recommend this company to anyone who loves working with customers and is looking for a caring company.
cons: Being alone all the time it makes it difficult to get tasks done when your the only one here having to go back and forth between daily tasks and helping customers both over the phone and in person wish we cold always have 2 people working in store.

title: Extra Space is Extra Great!
pros: Extra Space has not been just a job but a career. The company and upper management truly care about us as a whole and encourage us to balance our work and home life's. During the height of COVID in 2020-2021 Extra Space stayed open allowing us, as employees, to continue to work all the while ensuring that we would have a safe work environment. Extra Space is fantastic about promoting from within and provides the means and encouragement to grow with the company. Extra Space Storage is a fantastic company and one I intend on staying at for a very long time.
cons: The only true con I have is that we do not get regular Saturdays off. It would be nice to be able to rotate Saturdays off without having to use your time off to get them.

title: They take care of their people
pros: The managers here work as a team. I have multiple people I can turn to for assistance even when my own supervisor is off or away. People here want assistants to become managers in their own right, and help develop skills quickly. The bonus plan is very good, and I can definitely see how hard work benefits myself and the company.
cons: Cars are required to work here, in order to be able to cover other sites. District Training Leads are often required to travel locally for one to five days at a time. There are a few managers near me who are less than completely forthright and helpful.

title: District Manager
pros: Extra Space lives and breathes their values. The company is results driven but this never comes at the expense of treating people the wrong way. Extra Space is quick to recognize and award performance. This is evident with the multitude of performance awards that are handed out every quarter to all level of employees. The company puts the store employees first as we understand this is who is taking care of our customers day in and day out. I highly recommend getting on board with this great organization.
cons: None to speak of. Other than being a little selfish and saying I would like to see faster growth so more opportunities come about for advancement.

title: District Manager
pros: I have been with Extra Space for almost 2 years now. Since Day 1 and even up to today I have always felt welcomed to the Company. No matter what your title is from Assistant Manager to District Manager to Vice President to CEO everyone wants you to succeed. I can call anyone, even outside my Division for advice or just to ask a simple question and get an answer. With over 1400 properties this Company still focuses on its Core Values and Mission Statement. I truly love this Company and it truly is a great place to work!
cons: None to speak of at this time.

title: My experience was ok, The expectations; as far as work load is unreal.
pros: Closed on Sundays, Set schedule, meeting new customers, and hearing some interesting stories. Having the flexibility of working at your on pace!
cons: Worked most Saturdays, unless requested PTO 30 days in advance. Having to drive to the bank 3 times a week for deposits and drive to different stores within the district to work. (They pay mileage but the cost isn't worth it)and deal with that Site's issues and problems.

title: Huge disconnect between field staff and upper management
pros: Good work home life balance, great co workers.
cons: Pay not enough for the amount of work required. Managers that live on site take a Pay cut despite having more responsibility. 72 hours to move if terminated or quit. Upper management very uncaring about employees.

title: Excellent company to work for
pros: The management team at Extra Space is always open to feedback and strives to address any problems that arise. They are responsive, proactive and concerned about employees on every level. It is a very positive work environment that keeps me challenged with differing tasks every day.
cons: I wasn't given any particular training for my job. I was expected to accept the assignments given to me and find a solution. It took me a while to figure out that I was on my own to discover how the company works and who to go to for advice. Now my job is running smoothly and the balance between work and my personal life is excellent.

title: Company Review
pros: Company cares about its employees and makes them feel like family. They give us an uniform/shoe allowance. They want to hear our feedback and how things are going. They want us to love our job which makes it easy to love it. They make sure our sites have everything they need and if we don't have it they get us it. They are improving our systems everyday.
cons: Working Holidays are tough, since most people have families they want to be with. Compensation could be a bit better, but I have a job and wont complain too much :)

title: No upward mobility at Corporate HQ
pros: Many great employees and sound management. Remodeled offices, average pay, benefits, stable employment.
cons: Serious lack of corporate training and onboarding of employees, no career management, poor succession planning, inconsistent and inadequate talent management, lackluster benefits, flagrant violation of FLSA overtime pay for employees earning incentives, and not a healthy environment for employees seeking better pay and upward mobility. High turnover rate among mid level management.

title: For the most part, it‚Äôs a lot of solo work that will eventually lead to mental and physical exhaustion in a short time.
pros: Like any entry level job, most people can do it but know how to use a computer and Microsoft software. Be prepared to work a lot of solo shifts and be kind of on your own but know that you‚Äôre being remotely micromanaged. Descent gig but the pay is kind of low for the level of perfection they expect placed on usually just one person normally working a Site. They do have pretty good benefits and the PTO and paid holidays off make it a semi-tempting offer to stay. You also could get a basic small apartment at some of the really old sites but expect your hourly pay to go down and to have certain strings attached to that.
cons: Since the new CEO took over in 2016, things have changed progressively. It use to be a better managed company before that so company culture is in decline. Every district is a little different I suppose but I lost respect for my upper management and the support leaders when they started playing favorites and disrespecting their hardest workers. Extra Space is a little broken right now as a company and that‚Äôs too bad because they use to be better. Be prepared to be treated like a work tool eventually and a lot of empty promises from your District Manager so he/she can make ends meet and keep you strung along. Turn over is moderate to high here. The longer you stay the more you feel the company strain of just trying to get paid to do your job.

title: Best company I've ever worked for
pros: Great Hours, Company awards hard workers. Recognition for hard work and tenure by upper management, Good benefits, the company encourages and rewards healthy living, Team Environment, Positive culture,
cons: Not many holidays off and Saturdays you are required to work. Pay could be better, only raise opportunities are when you're promoted and during annual review (normally only 3%) . Pay is locked in when you sign your original job offer so new hires are starting at the same pay that a 3 year employee is now making after several promotions.

title: Used to be a great place to work, but poor software and IT causes a poor work life.
pros: Good commissions, decent benefits, opportunity to work from home.
cons: Poor hourly pay for long time employees (I barely make more than new hires after 8 years), VERY poor website and internal systems (IT takes months to get to helpdesk tickets for customers that can't pay online due to errors).

title: Good place to work
pros: The Incentive program is fair for the most part. The people that work there are great to be around. The company shows a caring nature for all employees.
cons: While the District Managers for the most part are good there are some that feel they can make the rules up as they go along. One DM would fire people just to get rid of them and no matter what the people say about her obvious dislike for some people she will find whatever reason to fire them even if it was false.

title: Extra Space Storage - Amazing Place To Grow Your Career!!!!!
pros: I have been with Extra Space for seven years now. I started as an Assistant Manager and worked my way up to District Manager throughout that time. This is only the 2nd company that I have worked for that I truly love and enjoy. The culture, growth opportunities, and experiences are top notch. I have grown so much as a leader throughout my seven years here. If you want work/life balance, growth opportunities, great culture, and above average compensation, look no further. There are not many companies out there that fit this description and I am blessed to be working for such a great company.
cons: There are no cons to list

title: Poor Management. Does not care about the store employees
pros: Hours. Good home life, if you aren't expected to go to constant after hours calls
cons: Favoritism and nepotism is how things are run. The corporate level does not care about the employees at the store level and keep cutting and cutting. How about cut at the corporate level, instead of making up positions. DM's don't manage and let DTL's run the show. This is not how it should be. Very sad to what this company has turned into. No way to advice, unless your male.

title: Good if you are on the managers good side
pros: Good company with lots of great benefits such as free movie tickets, drinks, and other giveaways.
cons: They hire through a temp agency and the help desk manager makes hiring decisions based on favoritism rather than performance. Saw some of the worst workers get hired permanently while other hard workers were passed over because they didn't go on smoke breaks with the manager. Due to the fact they hire through a temp agency you might leave work after a normal day and get a call from the temp agency saying you are no longer employed.

title: I expect more
pros: - Friendly people - Open environment with a lot of natural light - Rooms for when you need privacy - Clean
cons: - Lack of follow-up from managers to subordinates - Lack of trust in individual work

title: Extra Space Storage - The Pursuit of Happiness
pros: ESS gives us all the appropriate tools for success. Everything from online learning to person-to-person relationships. When ever in need, I do not hesitate to look towards our SharePoint site. If I can't find it there, I know I can reach out to anyone on the team for a solution or advice. ESS feels like a team and I'm grateful for being part it. Overall, best place I've ever worked at.
cons: There are times when our Breeze system goes down and it's not such a breeze to maneuver through the features. Most of the times, it's up and running and we can continue from there.

title: Great Room for Advancement
pros: You get what you put in. For those who are self-driven & self motivated working with ESS is perfect for you. You manage your own day with very little coverage which is great if you like working alone. Full time is only a 40 hour work week so perfect to help with work life balance, good benefits, PTO & 401K, schooling scholarships after a year of employment etc. Your performance determines your grown within the company. Great leaders to help provide many management skills & tools to manage day to day task..
cons: The down side is upper management leaves a heavy load to on field employees day to day task with limited coverage & low pay. High volume in turn over rate. Assuming the work load is not worth the pay.

title: Good, but
pros: I've been working here for about a year now and my co-workers are great, the pay is competitive for my area. Since I am also disabled, there are days that I can take it slower if I need to and focus on other aspects of the tasks of the day. I am huge of working alone and independently.
cons: the manager for the area I work at had resigned recently, but before that we had about three different managers sub in, so the uncertainty of who's going to be in charge does stink, but my co-workers and I all support each other in the mean time

title: Stable company with constant growth and great culture!
pros: Extra Space continues to grow as one of the leaders in the storage industry. The corporate culture is relaxed, you can wear jeans to work if you're in the Salt Lake City office. I enjoy coming to work each day! Most coworkers are very friendly and willing to help on projects or give you guidance when needed. Extra Space seems to hire a lot of leaders that take a hands off, trusting approach.
cons: Some departments don't have much opportunity for career growth. Benefits are pricey and pay seems to be a bit below market rate for some positions.

title: Welcoming Environment
pros: Team environment while still able to fly solo. Easy to reach out to other stores. Work life balance. Set office hours. Monthly incentives based on a combination of metrics. The incentives aren't much on average but the extra cash certainly helps with groceries and such. Plenty of mentors. Opportunity to grow if you work hard enough at it, and maintain good relations with the district peers.
cons: Being 5 places at once. Cutting work time to make up for the travel time while doing store visits. This limits the one on one with employees, and can be stressful. Staffing can be difficult because some stores aren't budgeted enough man hours. This creates a shortage of options for a while if someone calls out or leaves the company.

title: Amazing company!
pros: Team moral, hours, pay scale, room for growth, retail like work w/o retail hours, no nights, company appreciation, care for employees family, PTO. The company is genuinely great to work for. I have no complaints other than the one listed below, and thats more of an opinion than a complaint. This is by far the best company I have ever worked for. They appreciate their employees and understand we have families. The fact that we have Sundays off is amazing. We have great team moral, and enjoy working with each other. Atleast in my district. There is room for advancement as well. They dont immediately hire an outsider for a position someone in the company is qualified for.
cons: hours could be adjusted to come in earlier and leave earlier.

title: Assistant Manager
pros: This is a place where you literally get the best of both worlds, you can work outside and get dirty or you can work in the office. Therefore the chances of getting burned out are slim to none, I like the change up. It is also extremely easy to contact your upper management with ANY questions you may have. I love the open door policy my DM has, he is always there when I need him. Extremely employee centric, I am a super competative person and we always have some sort of competition going on within our district.
cons: Benefits are on the expensive side. Getting off at 6pm not much life time left.

title: Fabulous Place to Grow
pros: Teamwork Clear Communication Recognition Appreciation Attainable Goals The Core Values actually mean something! Ethical and Fair Empowers women in the workforce Diversity All the awesome Excellent work life balance Fun
cons: More affordable health care options that don‚Äôt have such high deductibles.

title: Decent job but not can easily be a dead end
pros: Work/Life balance can be good, Easy work if not at a busy site, and Co-Workers can be a delight sometimes
cons: Low Pay for the amount of work required, Work can be less than fulfilling especially if you work with co-workers that slack off in their own way; you are expected to pick up that slack and co-workers / DMs will start to dislike you and before eventually recommending you leave the company as they usually take the sides of any DTLs or SMs.

title: Caring, reliable, and never a dull moment.
pros: Positive response from upper management of ideas and concerns. Continuous training to help you improve your skills.
cons: Limited opportunities for promotions from Asst. Managers to Site Managers. Promotions not based on time with company, so some Asst Managers get passed up and not offered Site Manager positions. Some Site Managers make less than new hires because of longer time with company.

title: Awesome place to work
pros: -Collaborative culture with focus on employees. -Executive team provides great vision for the company. -There is a high level of trust put into employees here to do their jobs. -Many support avenues are in place in the event that help is needed. -Fun and challenging environment with great peers. -Opportunity for career advancement if you want it. -The company values our team members and will always treat you with respect. -Hands down the best job that I have ever had.
cons: -Very little that is on the con side from my experience. If anything, at points, there is a lot being asked of team members. However, this is where you have to prioritize and stay organized. Expectations are reasonable.

title: A company that cares
pros: Extra Space is a great place to work! The company is forward thinking, always growing and changing to meet the needs of the people. The pay is good. You are given incentives, monthly bonus checks, year end bonuses, that's not all. They also have killer stock options, 401k, health, dental, vision and countless discounts with area businesses. Besides the financial aspect, the company has core values that create a great place to work. With supportive leaders all over the country, there is always room for growth and development.
cons: tantly, you can find new opportunities with in the company that allows you to move onward and upward. I wouldn't even consider a different company to spend my working career with.

title: Above and beyond a great place to work!
pros: I have been with ESS for 10 years in multiple roles. I have had the pleasure of working for one of the greatest people I've ever met. There are always some bumps along the way with some people but you learn to deal with them and usually they go away. I have had a great team of people working for me and working above me. The hours of the job are fantastic and the company has always been flexible. The workload is always achievable and never too over intense. It's basically a job you need to set priorities and close them out.
cons: I will be completely honest when I say I can't think of any.

title: Great Company
pros: The upper management really does take what we say seriously. There have been numerous improvements, changes, updates, etc to the whole company based solely on what employee's have suggested. The support system is wonderful. If the district manager can't help for some reason, there are so many other's that will held a hand. Lots of perks, nice uniforms and shoes. There are always room for advancement also. Many programs to help get employee's to the next level of their career. Good benefits such as medical, dental, vision, life, short/long term, 401K.
cons: Very short list. Not a lot of holidays off since it is retail hours. Medical insurance is a bit pricey but there are a few options to choose from that are reasonable priced.

title: corporate upper echelon get rich off of the under appreciated field associates. nickle and dime the consumer.
pros: They preach and talk at you to do one thing, then expect another. This Company does not pay enough for the number of responsibilities that you are required to handle on a daily basis. I did not sign up for this mistreatment. This is not a company that values their employees.Anyone can do this job, but now everyone will. Not everyone will take the poor working conditions.
cons: corporate upper echelon get rich off of the under appreciated field associates. nickle and dime the consumer with forced added costs. loose promises of promotion.

title: Great company; pretty good culture; a few kinks
pros: One of the largest publicly traded companies in utah The company cares about the culture (at least within the corporate office)
cons: Many of the leaders in the organization have been with the company for decades. This makes it difficult to climb your way to the top of the organization. Some of the leaders are often closed to executing on new ideas. this is a large organization and because of this, there are a lot of politics and there is a lot of red tape. This makes it very difficult to work your way up to higher positions within the company.

pros: 40 hr work week, no nights or Sundays. No supervisor barking orders at you all day. Allowed to take ownership of the business.
cons: No Saturdays off, only 4 holidays a year versus 8 if you work in the corporate offices, no profit sharing or stock options offered to field employees, insurance is not affordable. Not all sites have on-site residences. Constant customer complaints about rate increases and hidden fees upon move in. High pressure sales tactics, feel like a used car salesman.

title: Needs improvement
pros: I have been with the company since 2009. Compared to the other two storage companies that I have worked for, I will say that Extra Space has offered better pay and benefits (health insurance/401K) and I have a decent amount of paid time off that I can use throughout the year. We do not work on Sundays and have 4 major paid holidays off. I like the combination of office and "outside" responsibilities, you are not just sitting in a cubicle all day staring at a computer screen. For the most part you are on your own and have to be a self starter and good with managing your time. It's nice that "the boss" isn't standing over your shoulder and breathing down your neck every day. Most sites offer a "free" apartment for the store manager to reside in (that has it's own pros & cons in itself). Honestly, if it wasn't for the apartment I wouldn't even work here just because the pay by itself is too low for me to afford to pay rent elsewhere.
cons: Because of Extra Space's high standards, they expect A LOT and that means A LOT of work. I have no problem with getting my hands dirty and doing minor maintenance and painting BUT when you mostly work alone...that is a huge problem. If you have what is considered a small property, you will be by yourself most of the time. This is very challenging when you are expected to take care of customers, do paperwork, answer the phone at all times, make bank runs, and maintain the property. I feel that only having one person allows things to be neglected and does not let my site reach its full potential. Also, some of the things that we are expected to do on the properties because the company wants to save money is ridiculous. For example, stripping and waxing floors and painting parking lot lines should be left to professionals. There is not to big of employee turn around at the site level but due to the constant redistricting of sites among other reasons, I have had quite a few different District Managers. Constantly having to get to know a new supervisor is exhausting. Our incentive program is a joke. If you have a great year and your property performance is great you will have little to no chance the following year making a bonus because of the unrealistic goals that they set for you. We keeping being told year after year that they are going to be restructuring the incentive program but I am certainly not holding my breath.

title: Fantastic people and company
pros: - Love working with my co-workers and team members in IT and BI Team - People are given more pay and responsibilites when they deliver - Company trust employees with large projects and provides a lot of support and resources - Technology is a big driver in helping the company grow and stay competitive
cons: The only downside I have encountered is some of the employees have their own agendas that have been bad for the company and they brought a lot of negativity, but some of them have decided to finally move on so things are improving.

title: Good values, benefits lagging behind, great work environment.
pros: CEO is personable and caring, IT dept has liberty to train on new products, IT Management is great. I work with many different departments, and every person respects each other. Best job I have had in the past 10 years, and would be longer albeit for the
cons: listed here.

title: This Is Where You Need To Be
pros: Extraspace Storage is absolutely one of the companies to grow with. You set the limits on how much your willing to grow. Extraspace Storage is very family oriented and emphasize on family time.
cons: If any would probably be having to deal with ECRI's while tenant(s) are dealing with crisis in the world( gas prices, cost of living). However, having the opportunity to find solutions and being able to be flexible when adjustments are needed is a opportunity to showcase our customer service skills in a different aspect.

title: Culture is declining
pros: Extra Space historically has been a good place to work. Fair-minded, trusting of employees, and interested in their well being.
cons: The company is becoming much more bureaucratic than it used to be. It is now middle management-heavy, and this is having a real impact on the quality of life of regular employees. If you're passionate about your work, you're going to have to battle management just to get things done. The company also seems to be walking away from its values. Instead of pursuing excellence and innovation, the company seems much more interested in acting fast, even if the work is shoddy. Unfortunately, they don't seem interested in hiring additional talent so we can meet faster deadlines without cutting quality. Extra Space is much less employee friendly than it used to be. There is potential for a return to their values, but I don't know if that will ever happen.

title: Fun, often challenging work but typical corporate politics
pros: The work is engaging and challenging. The company is growing so there are plenty of changes and everyone is adapting along with you. Open lines of communication with executives and "higher-ups" makes the corporate structure a little less intimidating. Great pay and excellent perks.
cons: I was hired into a new department with a supervisor who had never had a direct report before. It was difficult getting to know my way around the work while not having much help from others. Departmental power struggles are pretty prevalent and the expectations are not clear.

title: Not a bad place to be
pros: Generally speaking the Corporate office employees are pleasant to work with. It is probably a better environment than most companies. This is definitely the best thing about Extra Space. It is also very financially stable. Growth has created more opportunities for career growth. Company tries to be decent to its employees. Work load is usually pretty reasonable, although it can be very overwhelming at times, too.
cons: Pay is below market. The company is definitely very conservative, which is good in some ways and bad in others. The bad part about it is Executives don't like to change things up and are behind on current market trends in regards to employees. Benefits are expensive.

title: Excellent Company and Eager to come on board!
pros: Great Company and atmosphere. Everyone is knowledgeable of the background and takes great pride in working at Extra Space Self Storage. My interview process was amazing and each person took their time to speak with me one on one to ensure i knew the job description and that i can perform the job duties in which i applied. I am eager to start my new journey with Extra Space and gain all of what I need plus more to move up within the company.
cons: Extra Space is a thriving company with great staff and there isn't one word I can say that would be a con at this time.

title: Assistant Manager, Live On Site
pros: I was lucky to live and work on a beautifully maintained property for most of my time with ESS. The job is nice for people who like to step away from the desk and want a little physical activity during the workday. My apartment was large, in a great location, and nicely kept by the previous occupant who had lived in the place for around 10 years. This location and the nice apartment were really the selling points for the job. The customers at this location were really great and fun to assist. The ESS training program is a really integrative and very well organized.
cons: The job is really little more than a glorified janitor and/or maintenance position, even though they slyly call it a "Management" position. Yes, you do have opportunities to practice sales skills with the customers, but this is a very small portion of your overall workload. Even at a well-maintained property like where I typically worked, the janitorial duties are at least 75% of your daily tasks. Forget about it, if you get a property that is not well-maintained. The company does not always promote from within, as they would have you believe at hire. The tipping point for me came with the opening of 2 new properties in my area. I saw veteran employees in our district get passed over for promotions by new hires who had zero experience in this field. It seems the District Training Leader's relationship with the District Manager can have a great impact on employees' ability to gain promotion. If a DM doesn't like the DTL who trained you, then there's little hope for upward mobility. If you want a low-stress manual labor job, and you have low expectations for "moving up" in the company, this is good place to stay. For me, this was just a place to work with a decent apartment until I moved onto a better job.

title: Responsible company that promotes professional and personal growth
pros: Integrity - Company directives are centered around "do the right thing" for the customer and employee. When in doubt default to satisfying the customer and employee. You matter - Everyone has a voice, very personal town hall meetings with officers of the company soliciting your thoughts and concerns. Literally coffee with the CEO at your table of (4) asking what are your ideas and concerns. Wow! Impressive.
cons: Winter, summer, spring or fall. We are outside and in the elements, only a con if you don't appreciate the great outdoors.

title: Great organization to grow with
pros: Extra Space is a growing company with a focus on growing their people as well as store count. We are focused on a set of core values which we believe will help guide us to business and personal growth. As great a company Extra Space is, people work for people and we have some of the best.
cons: With such growth comes a need for flexibility. We need people who want to develop themselves but are also relocatable and able to move where the growth takes us.

title: Great potential
pros: The people here are all pretty friendly. The company has a lot of diversity at the top. Full time hours plus benefits. A lot of opportunity for growth. (You'll be turning down promotions faster than you know it.) This place is a meritocracy and that's great.
cons: There are opportunities for growth but so few open positions. The bonuses are the smallest I've ever seen for the sales industry. How can you split a single monthly bonus of $50 with 3-4 people? For the amount of work required, respectfully, I don't think it's worth the compensation. You are the maintenance person and the sales person, and the manager. If you bust your hump and go the extra mile you may get lucky and take home a $20 bonus for the month? If you live on site you will actually make LESS $ per hour because they build it into your compensation but living on site comes with responsibilities too and isn't exactly "free." What is $200 a month to a company that continues to do so well when you're a contribution to that continued success? The compensation between assistant, store, and lead are not much different. What incentive is there to move up when it's more work and responsibility for $1-$2/hr more? If you aren't going for a rare DM position, why move up and take on the added stress and responsibility? You will use your personal vehicle for business purposes 3-4 times a week. You will/may have to clean up feces and or urine or vomit. You will/may deal with troublesome members of the homeless population and they'll be living on site and you'll be limited in your scope to do anything about it. Honestly, if you have a higher degree, I wouldn't consider working in the field at any of the stores because the compensation will not match your value and or experience.

title: Long time employee
pros: Solid company, job security.
cons: The company mentality has changed alot over the last 10 years. It is now alot more sales driven. There isnt much room for growth if your not willing to move states away. To become a DM you have to be willing to move anywhere in the country where a position opens up. Also there is disconnect from corporate level to store level, this could be anything from standards of operation, to vendors corporate picks to have work done at the site.

title: Great company!!! Mediocre pay
pros: Amazing company. They truly care about their employees. The work to home life balance is by far the best of any company I‚Äôve worked for. Management is willing to work with employees and help them with whatever they need.
cons: They pay is low. They don‚Äôt do performance based raises. Just cost of living. There is no real benefit for working hard or going above and beyond. There also is no increase when the base pay increases for new employees. This means that a new employee could potentially be making more money than an excellent employee who had been there for a few years.

title: Looks good on paper but read between the lines
pros: Very low key job. Easy to get stuff done and multi-task. Exceptional hours and benefits. The company has great values and rewards results.
cons: The number one value of the company is integrity and the company completely ignores those with upstanding morals who are honest in their employment. Employees who lie and fake their numbers tend to be promoted over those who actually live the companies core values. The job can be extremely boring depending on the time of year and how busy your store is. We are encouraged to be dishonest with our tenants about rate increases and insurance coverage and are rewarded for it with higher bonuses.

title: Miss this job.
pros: Freedom to work without someone always looking over your shoulder. My property was doing well financially and that gave me freedom to do things my way. So long as numbers were riding I felt respected and cared about. The customers are from all walks of life and you meet new people every day. Once I got a chance to speak with my DVP, he turned out to be one of the best and most motivational bosses I've had. My DM didn't like me talking to his boss though.
cons: Sometimes they would actually search just to find anything out of place to complain about. A little oil and dirt in the tracks of the elevator done should be okay when the property is otherwise perfect. Never made a big deal about all I did right, but wouldn't let anything go that wasn't. Sometimes hard to communicate effectively with people above the DM. Any communication with upper management from a store manager seemed frowned upon. Too many politics and backstabbing managers who will do unethical things to make you look inferior to them or to get your property. Slow discipline by corporate lets the damage her too bad before removing a bad employee.

title: I love my Job!!!
pros: Stability, Pays well, day is full of adventure working with the public, keeps you busy so the day flys by, benefits are good, bonus potential, company cares about their employees, uniforms are flattering and nice. Chance to advance within the company. If you are on a mission to reach the top, you have real potential with this company.
cons: Sometimes we deal with the public at one of the worst times of their lives. Could be because they lost their home, a loved one passed, divorce, seperation, job loss. It can challange your emotions at time. At times, it does seem that the work takes over. You don't have to take your work home with you, but at times, your work sneeks a ride home in your head.

title: Best company I've ever worked for!!!
pros: Pay is great! Benefits are great! Fellow employees are supportive! Everyone in the company wants you to be the best you can be, and I honestly feel I've grown as an individual in the short time I've been working with them. It's a job for people that have high energy and it's always a great day to go to work for me. I recommend it to anyone looking for a challenge to push themselves and looking for a job that they want to love.
cons: I can't think of anything I don't like! They always strive to better things for everyone, customers and employees! Always about changing things for convenience and rising above our competitors.

title: Store Manager
pros: - Benefits - Environment - Work/life balance - Advancement Opportunities - Uniform Allowance - Travel reimbursement programs - Sundays off
cons: - Low Pay compared to the amount of work, you're the Salesman, Janitor, Collector, Customer Service Rep, Scheduler, Case Manager, Auctioneer, waste Manager, Plumer, Electrician, pest controller and much more. This is a Con because of the pay, but the knowledge gained for future careers may be seen as a neutral or pro. It is just a Con if you stay with the company at the low pay. - No Unpaid time off nor "sick days"., if you miss a day of work for any reason, your "PTO" Paid time off must be used or burned to cover for your missing hours, you cannot go in the negative and if you have no PTO accumulated means you run the risk of getting fired. - Minimal paid days off, apart from New years, Chrismas, Thanksgiving and Independence Day, there aren't many more days off, you will be working almost every major Federal holidays, I think there is only a total of 6 days in the entire year including the ones mentioned already. - Having Every Sunday off is great apart from that they are traded with Saturdays. Your days off will be Sunday + one day of the week not including Mondays/ Fridays since they are the busiest days. You will work Every Saturday unless you use PTO. -Lack of recognition, you might be the hardest worker but don't expect the acknowledgment from the District Team Leads.

title: my 1st ninety days
pros: Teamwork - never have I been told nope from any coworker when i asked for assistance - multiple times I was given more than one option resolve the issue. Listening - The DM in my region is amazing - they listen and hear what I say aknowledging my concerns and are able to follow up on those concerns. Flexing - Every team member is valued for their contribution a DTL is the "fix it guy" another "the computer guy" and another "the sounding board" having good reach out is amazing.
cons: five day work week - having come from warehousing its a down side missing those three days in a row off No movement without experience from working - its harder to gain experience without being at a busy location.

title: Good for people who want to work in retail or sales
pros: This company pays well considering you only need a GED or high school diploma. If you work hard, you can get promoted.
cons: They do not tell you that you will be picking up human and animal waste from the property, lots of cleaning, and will be forced to push insurance on customers at the risk of being disciplined.

title: Corporate Office
pros: Extra Space is a fast paced company where you are in control of how much you learn and how much you are challenged. Management is always willing to provide learning opportunities if you have the desire. The office space is newly renovated. This is a company that likes to be on the cutting edge of the storage industry and keeps up with new technology. No drama with co-workers. This is the best company I have worked for.
cons: Sometimes upper management in some departments can be resistant to change or change can take a long time because of how many hoops have to be gone through. Pay increases are low and slow. Upper management seems unapproachable.

title: The best job I've ever had
pros: Excellent team, quick upward mobility, and a executive team that cares about their employees. Back as an assistant manager, they did a Teams meeting where we broke into groups and had a chance to question various executives (including the CEO) regarding our concerns. Company gave a 5% bonus to store-level employees, in addition to our annual raises, due to how well the company was performing. Company kept us safe during COVID. Company pays well, and gives extra incentives as well.
cons: They HAD been understaffed, but only due to the company growing and acquiring new sites (which led to more promotions for employees). Thanks to recent job fairs and a wave of new hires, this issue has been resolved.

title: Awesome Place To Work!!!
pros: Monthly Bonuses, Great Support Team, No Paperwork, Fast Responses, Awards, Contests, If Snow Is Bad They Close (first company ever), Sunday's Off, Later Hours, Care About Their Customers As Well As Their Employees & Properties, Weekly Meetings, Have The Ability To Actually MANAGE Your Property, IT Dept Fast & Helpful, Paid Holidays, PTO, Awesome Training Program, No Micro-Managing, Lunch Break, Nice Uniforms. The List Goes On & On
cons: The Only Con That I Have Has Nothing To Do With The Comapny Itself, The Computer Program Has its Glitches Which At Times Can Be Aggravating But So Does Every Computer Program Ive Ever Delt With.

title: Property Accountant
pros: PEOPLE!!! Extra Space Storage has an immense variety of people with different backgrounds and upbringings.Everyone is always willing to give a hand and share their knowledge. This in turn helps with the learning curve and provides a comfortable environment among co-workers. There are many department/group activities which help unite us even more while going through the hectic challenge of a growing company. With it's expansion there are many learning opportunities and trials to face.
cons: There are too many accountants and few leader positions which can limit the availability to grow in the department.

title: Great job, awesome company!
pros: Too many to count! I am a manager in the Bensalem area and I can't imagine working anywhere else. Management really cares about their employees. They have grown a lot in the last few years but still manage to feel like a small company that treats us like family. There are many opportunities for growing your career and my DM is always willing to help us be the best we can be. I highly recommend Extra Space, especially in the greater Philadelphia area, to anyone who wants to grow with a company who appreciates them.
cons: I truly can't think of anything.

title: Started as a Post College Position, Stuck Around
pros: Extra Space has decent benefits, and is a decent job to get management and property experience. I stuck around because I have a brilliant District Manager that understands his employees and focuses so heavily on personal development.
cons: Conversely, I‚Äôve had previous managers who weren‚Äôt really up to the position. It can be a bit of a crapshoot with who your supervisor is and how effective they are at their position. Had my current DM not taken over, I would have left ages ago due to the treatment. Also, due to the limited nature of stores/districts, to advance up the ladder it is a requirement that you‚Äôre able to relocate.

title: Innovative company with limited growth.
pros: Innovative and challenging work. There are always opportunities to learn new things and build your personal skill set. Work life balance and flexibility are key reasons I'm still with the company. They offer flexibility that cannot be beat.
cons: Very limited career growth, raises are capped at 10% of your salary. HR red tape is detrimental to individual departments trying to keep their talent satisfied. The benefits are far too expensive for what you get. Look into buying a personal plan before you enroll in ESS benefits program, you will find a better price.

title: Excellent employment experience
pros: Amazing work/life balance, positive company culture, low stress work environment, upper management recognizes in house talent and makes efforts to promote from within
cons: Industry tends to pay lower than others, job seekers don't seem to have self storage on their radar making attracting new talent difficult

title: An Extra Great Working Space
pros: No scheduled Sundays, no work before 9:30 am or after 6 pm. You get to choose your other day off in most instances. The district staff is helpful and very informative, and when you need help it is never more than a phone call away. If you are someone who counts your daily steps, this place definitely helps you reach your goal!
cons: The job can be a little dirty with cleaning units and picking up trash. Some customers will get angry with your phone calls and some things you don't have much control over.

title: Love Your Job and You Will Never Work A Day in Your Life
pros: I am ride or die for Extra Space Storage. The focus on team and work/life balance are unmatched. Competitive pay and opportunities to promote from within. You drive your development with a supportive team that is bought in to help you find your success. If you enjoy new challenges, a quick pace and two days that are never the same ...this is the adventure for you.
cons: Cons??? I don't have one.

title: Great Work Environment
pros: Extra Space has cultivated a positive work environment where hard work is rewarded. I love that I get recognition for what I do, and that management recognizes when the job gets difficult. The company is always looking to improve and we are on the forefront of the industry for technology, security, and employee development.
cons: At this point in my career I will have to relocate to advance in position. That is unfortunate, and I may have to leave if nothing closer comes available.

title: Best place to work BY FAR
pros: This company is amazing! They go above and beyond for their employees. Giving everyone the same opportunity for success. They work hard for us and as an employee, I am confident in the business and what we do. I would stand behind this company 100% as I feel they would do the same for me. This is a family environment. We stick together. I know that whenever we hire, I will be telling all of my family and friends to apply! They pay top dollar even though I work at a call center- Not very many people get paid what I do.
cons: The benefits! No so much the benefits but the cost of the benefits. They are outrageous!

title: It's a Job
pros: Guaranteed full time is very nice and the starting pay is at least above minimum wage. I wish I had negotiated more at the time of my hiring though.
cons: Customers can be very hard to deal with in this business, they often times see you as an enemy and won't hesitate to drop some mean spirited words over rate-increases. Impossible to ever get a Saturday off without using up your PTO

title: Manager
pros: Extra Space Storage is a value driven company that is committed to providing an excellent product and great customer service. There several reasons that I can give to convey why I enjoy working here. Great participatory environment that provides a a daily challenge to achieve winning results. This company truly values their customers, employees and vendors. Several vehicles for recognizing the achievement of outstanding results and performance that would be considered above and beyond what is expected.
cons: Some might look at performing outside tasks during the winter months as a downside. But I say if you dress appropriately for the weather its not bad at all.

title: Other jobs pay more and LOVE more!!!
pros: No boss hovering over you, minimal amount of stress when it comes to daily duties
cons: Dirty job, lie to customers, trained to take advantage of the less fortunate

title: Great place to work
pros: Extra Space is a great place to work. They have great opportunities for growth within the Company . Their training team is dedicated to ensure employees are well versed in ESS policies and customer service. Their management team are always open to suggestions and are there to guide you if needed. Its a rare company that upper management visits and asks" what can they do for you" !!
cons: I have been working for Extra Space for 12 years and they are an innovative company that changes with the times in a good direction. All Pros no Cons as far as I'm concerned !!

title: Assistant Store Manager
pros: Hardworking co-workers and an appreciative and supportive management team
cons: There are, at times, that you have to dig your heals in and get down and dirty to clean up, shall I say, more than the usual mess that a client might leave. Just put your gloves on and get it done!!!

title: Excellent Organization, Excellent Training, Excellent Leaders and Staff
pros: The training is phenomenal. You will learn the top selling skills through the incredible processes put in place, leaders who care about your personal growth and a corporation that shares financials so that you feel like you are the owner of your facility. Total buy in. I am a professional with a business degree and although it was an hourly job, the knowledge I learned from the CEO/COO/District VP, District Manager, Team Leaders was phenomenal.
cons: Sometimes you feel like you have to take care of maintenance things you really don't. They are quick to fix any vagueness once an issue arises though.

title: Small family company atmosphere - Big corporation structure and culture
pros: Company with great benefits for all employees and a solid coaching culture. The leadership team strives to bring a suite of development programs to help each team member enhance their competency skillset and reach the next level in their career path. Great work life balance culture at all levels of the organization.
cons: Rapid growth challenges all staff to be flexible and consistently adapt to change. Requires all team members to be proactive and adaptable to change in order to succeed.

title: Great place to work
pros: I really like the work hours at Extra Space and we are closed on Sundays and off by 6 pm during the week and 5:30pm on Saturday, I travel to other stores to work for them and like that so it's not the same thing everyday
cons: wish we closed by 4 pm on Saturdays i have been here over 1 year and its pretty slow after 4 pm would not mind coming in earlier so we did not have to stay til 5:30 pm, also we work almost every Saturday wish they would rotate those with everyone, but you can ask off if needed

title: Never a Boring Moment
pros: Plenty of customers that need help storing property, and there is variety of work required from cleaning, to sales, and maintaining the facility. This company is very customer service oriented. Also they're very open to suggestions from employees Future growth is planned by adding more facilities across country over the next few years .
cons: Though open to new technology, months or years have been spent correcting problems because of changing the software again, Little opportunity to move up in company, but may see opportunity in relocation. Feeling micro managed these days. Would also be nice if the hourly pay was higher, Pay usually starts at bottom of pay range.

title: There is good and bad.
pros: This job is not all that hard to do. You need to learn to deal with customers and know how to deal with conflict sometimes. But other then that, the job is not all that bad. You have decent hours and the workplace is pretty casual. You spend 75%-90% of your time in the office, these people who posted reviews about them spending all their time outside must be doing something wrong lol. I spend 80%-95% of my time in the office and I work for one of the best stores in the division. You should know that you will have a lot of downtime sometimes which makes the day go by slow, so if you like to stay busy alot then you will not like it. You have pretty good training and learn alot about the storage business which is cool.
cons: Fix Omni, people who work for ESS know what I am talking about. There is no reason for a multi-billion dollar company to have such a crappy computer software system. I know ESS makes a few million dollars a month on CPP so use some of that money to fix it. ESS will honeslty update it,and it will make it worse, (5 and 3 anyone?) I do not like how ESS sells its storage insurance either(CPP), they basically imply that we should tell potential customers that it is mandatory. They never say that out right, but its what they really mean, and its pretty obvious. The salary could be better, either make the incentive bonus better or raise the hourly rate. Also about 75% of the last 20 or so reviews on Glassdoor are fake for ESS. They might respond to me saying that real employees are posting these, and that very well be true. But most likely a District Manger or someone is pressuring lower employees to wright a "good" review.

title: Demanding job but rewarding
pros: Fast paced, challenging and rewarding. Lots of variety of tasks both inside and outside. Working with the public. Sales incentives and contests to supplement hourly pay.
cons: Learning the job on the fly. Black uniforms in the Texas heat. Would like a cooler uniform with a more feminine style for the women. NO overtime allowed and often necessary in the spring and summer.

title: Unsafe work environment
pros: Sunday's off, Choose your own day off
cons: Poor management, very low pay

title: Great place to work
pros: Extra Space presents a people first culture and does everything within it's power to embody that. The company goes above and beyond to support and keep it's field employees. From full time hours with benefits and pto to tuition discounts, there is a lot to be grateful with here. Anyone who is committed to working hard and being ethical, can find a happy home here.
cons: There are some opportunities to increase advancement and development tracks. The company runs a very flat organizational structure, which makes sense but could be frustrating to a long term talented employees.

title: Great Job
pros: Amazing district manager and coworkers! Raymond will bend over backwards to help you out regardless of how difficult the situation. He‚Äôs never ‚Äútoo busy‚Äù for his employees!! The pay is outstanding compared to any other storage facility job assistant manager or manager. Within my 1st year on the job I got two raises and countless bonuses and they gave us extra money every now and then just because gas and food was getting more expensive.
cons: None! I worked at the Norman store for a year and anytime I had an issue (employee or customer), the manager and dm had my back and they were both quick to react.

title: High Pressure Sales
pros: Provide extensive training to fill positions. Promote from within the company for many positions. Are hands on to improve worker performance. Customers make life interesting.
cons: Believe in and use social shaming to induce worker conformity. Consistently change sales operations and tactics without much interaction with the field (had sales pitches change in as little as a month). Pay is pretty low for responsibilities and expectations, raises are a joke .20-.30 per year, not even cost of living.

title: There‚Äôs some good things and bad things
pros: The people are great to work with especially in my division the DM always gives incentives to hard working employees such as my self pretty laid back job
cons: The customers can be interesting at times most not listening to reason but that‚Äôs every retail job lots of cleaning be prepared to take a shower when you get home auction paper work can be a headache if you‚Äôre not prepared

title: It keeps getting better
pros: You know you are working for a great company when you enjoy coming to work each day. I love the people I work with and I really enjoy the challenges I face each week. I originally had reservations about working in self storage, but I didn‚Äôt realize what a hot sector of real estate it was and how innovative the company is. It‚Äôa not all roses but I feel lucky to be here. The executive team is top notch and has a great vision for the future and I‚Äôm excited to continue to grow in the organization.
cons: Needs to continue to be more competitive in the talent market by focusing on pay, benefits and talent development.

title: Property Accountant Review
pros: - 40 hours most weeks - Lots of growth, so lots of new things and positions - Lots of processes are pretty automated, which is good in some ways - Female Controller - Lots of people come back after leaving, so must have something people like
cons: - Expensive insurance, even with the reduction for having a health assessment - Do not pay extra for having an advanced degree or professional certification - Lots of customer service involved in accounting role - Lots of processes are automated, which is bad in some ways - Acceptance of high turnover rate and no real emphasis on changing things so people will stay

title: Used to be a "Great Place to Work" but not anymore
pros: I work for the Corporate Office so my experience may be very different from those employees who work at our facilities. Beautiful office Job stability, even during bad economic times Company performs well against competitors Decent benefits and benefit costs Challenging work
cons: Little room for compensation growth after hire, other than cost of living increases Executives seem out of touch with their employees Not enough transparency in decision making Company is very focused on financials and supporting operations, corporate seems like an afterthought Need much more training for corporate employees

title: Site Manager
pros: We have a great family feel to this company. From our CEO to our DM every level really seems to care. They keep us iinformed about our future growth, benefits, goals and what we can do to make a difference. We (field level) have the ability to resolve customer issue and help our customers have a great expierence with the support of our leadership team.
cons: Longer lunch break with a set time posted on the door. 1:15 pm to 2:15 pm. Open 9 am to 6 pm Mon through Sat.

title: Anonymous Employee
pros: Willingness of coworkers to help each other across the board.- Chatter Bonuses Benefits are good, a little costly.
cons: Training on different policies could be better, not changing the ways of doing things so many different times. The high amount of shoppers sent to the store each month(phone & in store) increases anxiety and lowers morale. Blackout days for days off: Saturdays and Mondays(PTO required to take these days off) Make sick time and PTO two separate accruals Not being able to make our own schedule between the SM & AM

title: Great as long as you don't work in Treasury Dept.
pros: The Executive leadership is top notch. Most departments were well-run and worked well with others. The office space is nice and modern. The best quality while I was there was that everyone was approachable.
cons: Treasury dept is poorly run. Stay away from that group. The good competent employees are disparaged while the incompetent workers are rewarded. This has been a problem for about 13 years. Solely attributed to bad management.

title: Accounting
pros: Flexible schedule sometimes. Not a lot of micro-managing. Allows for your own time management and reasonable deadlines to meet.
cons: Not promoting employees that have been with the company over 5 years. Seem to promote those that have been here less than 2 years and are not able to answer questions for those they supervise. Those employees still leave within a short period so lots of turnover. Invest in those employees that are invested in the company.

title: Fantastic Culture, Growing Company
pros: The people who you get to work with are awesome. I work in Customer Acquisition and it is a fantastic group. The work is engaging, there is a great appetite for testing and trying new things, and it is mixed with the right amount of fun. Our CMO James is a great leader to work with.
cons: No negatives that are not controllable. If a problem / opportunity is there, you can usually work with others to fix it.

title: Simple job, occasionally complex situations
pros: Steady hours for the most part, bonuses every month, opportunities for growth, ability to advance to a store manager position with adequate effort, generally good team
cons: Working with customers in storage can be a very challenging thing. Many customers who are down on their luck or are in sympathetic situations we are unable to help. Small mistakes can spiral into large ones quickly. Break ins do happen and they are very difficult.

title: Great Place, Great People
pros: Company core values are truly embodied by all employees at every level. I started as a SM in the field and worked my way up to the Senior Division Learning Manager position. This company believes in hiring and promoting the best talent. We are focused on PEOPLE to drive performance. The company spends the right time on developing people with numerous tools Advanced programs, Launch training, LDP/EDP, team trek, WorkDay Learn e-learning courses, etc. Company has a great feel, honestly I can't say enough about working for ESS. Best Company I've ever worked for!!!!
cons: I can't think of anything to be honest.

title: Really Wanted to Love It Here
pros: This is a great job and company to start out at if you just graduated and want to get into the accounting field. You gain a lot of accounting from this job.
cons: I feel like the job is moving away from accounting and more of helping resolve issues at the sites. There is no growth in the company if you want to stay in accounting. No opportunity to work remotely they just keep adding more accountants and shoving us closer together. The company also strives on work and life balance, but I don't see it. If you want to learn more things you end up staying late and forget taking more than a few days off. You will just get criticized for taking more than a day at a time off. Most people hit their accrual cap and have to take a random day off. However, it is not like the company gives any great time off benefits anyways.

title: ESS proves to have unique talent!
pros: Not everyone is meant to work for ESS. Those I have had the pleasure working with the past year are truly amazing and rate them 5 stars, hands down.
cons: The only complaint or downfall of the position of being an AM is the rate of pay vs the work duties.

title: Get ready to REALLY work!!
pros: Possible free housing. Free or discounted storage space. Paid company meetings with food provided. Independent work scenario's, where your left alone ...most of the time. That's about it.
cons: Required to openly lie to potential customers about renters insurance by stating it's required/mandatory. But if the customer is walking out we have them sign a insurance rejection form. So it's not really required. Makes the employee look like an idiot! Constant rate changes that make customers mad. Corp is not interested in a long term, renter, relationship. Get them in, raise their rate, if they stay okay, if not get them out and get another sucker in. They're going to run out of local customers sooner or later if they keep thinking along these lines. Corp. requires lease to be presented under 3 minutes, and it IS timed, making the employee look stupid as we're not able to really tell all that is involved in that time period. Dealing with irate customers due to Corporate changes on the local level that Corp. does not let it's employees, on the local level, know about beforehand. Performing weekly and monthly reports that nobody ever really shows you how to do. I didn't sign up to be an Analyst or a CPA. Most local level employees are out for themselves and could care less about you so there's lots of backstabbing. District Managers that would rather sit and work from home than visit your store. They also love to micro-manage. Promotions above the local level are few and far. Corp. hired a new DM into our district who had never even worked in the industry ...yet we're supposed to let this person tell us what to do when we've been doing the job longer?? Most all maintenance (painting, door repairs, roof repairs, etc...) is done by the employee. They're so tight they can't even hire a district-wide maintenance worker. The company is publicly traded, so they care more about profits for the shareholders than they do about customers.

title: Excellent Company - Best I have ever worked for!
pros: Ethical and genuine, people focused, excellent work/life balance, innovative, growing and financially sound, easy to interact with management and executive leadership, compay culture is second to none.....company is always looking for ways to improve internally and externally and not satisfied with it's own success.
cons: Company innovation can create many changes/adjusments, leaves some to feel changes are made at times without more testing.....

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Very Stable company that has and will continue to grow and become better, even in a down economy. Great incentives outside of the standard pay and health benefits. New office space provides a welcome environment to work. Top Management are the right people in the right places and they don't take them selves too seriously. They're quick to joke and have a good time. Extra Space really is a hidden gem, one of the best companies, you haven't heard of. Fortune 500 company based in Utah.
cons: Depending on your manager, feedback can be hit and miss; for the most part pretty good though. Need more training opportunities as managers although getting better.

title: Site Manager
pros: They have good medical, dental, vision, and 401 k program.
cons: There is a high turnover rate, and management is horrible. There is really no way to move up in the company, because they are always hiring outside. The amount they pay is not worth the amount of work they expect from you. And there is a lot of favoritism shown throughout the district level. This is the worst company that I have ever worked for.

title: Was one of the best decisions I've chosen along my career path!
pros: I work with very understanding down to earth people. Mostly non judgmental associates. The pay is good, benefits, PTO, training, company loves to promote within the company. There is always room to advance depending on where you would want to take your career.
cons: As with any job when dealing with upset customers. Not that is on a daily basis but you will experience it through out your journey when dealing with public. But as far as cons with the company its self, I have no cons at this time..

title: Best Company I Have Ever Worked For!
pros: The company truly works to make Extra Space a great place to work. They care about you and your family and the balance of work and home is better than other sales and service jobs. You certainly have business goals to achieve, but they are also work hard to give the skills necessary to succeed.
cons: I don't have any strong cons to review. After years in retail and service the cons at ESS are pretty small in comparison. That's not to say they get everything right, but they do work hard to improve processes and procedures and course correct when something isn't working.

title: Overall Fulfilling
pros: Excellent benefits, good insurance, helpful coworkers, team efforts
cons: A lot of time working alone, a lot of time working outside even in extreme heat if necessary but water is provided

title: A good place to work with some drawbacks.
pros: The company is a good place to work in regards to their career advancement, hourly pay and great management support.
cons: The work schedule is from 9:30 - 6:00, and there are no saturdays off which is kind of ruff on me because I have kids, the medical benefits are very expensive, and the customers can be very mean at times.

title: Excellent, progressive company
pros: Extra Space is a great employer and an incredible place to work. They are extremely focused on the betterment of the company and of the culture. The executive team is truly passionate about the development of their employees and growing the company.
