New hires are already being asked to work by themselves not even 3 weeks after starting, because of staffing shortages. No maternity or paternity benefits, and no sick leave. Facilities are sometimes not at their best, and everything takes ages to get repaired due to approval processes and budget.

title: Performative, Not Supportive
pros: They encourage you to grow and move up in the company. You get to be fairly independent in your work. The supervisors know their jobs well and are always willing to help.
cons: The company claims to be all about "Diversity & Inclusion," but do not put much effort into it beyond releasing newsletters about different holidays and how to be "kind to one another." Their healthcare plan is self-funded, which allows them to skirt around issues such as family planning and LGBT rights and needs.

title: Sketchy ethics got sketchier after pandemic
pros: Pay, hours, advancement potential, uniform allowance, employee discount on storage
cons: 99% of store positions are assistant manager or manager. You'll be told these aren't sales jobs, but they are, with the added benefit of janitorial and collections calls. In the actual stores, expect to have to deal with homeless people attempting to live out of their units, having to clean up human waste when customers just poo or pee on the floor. Yes, human waste in addition to folks not cleaning up after their dogs if they bring them in when visiting the units. Depending on where you are working, this can happen rarely or often. Store need major repairs? Expect to field customer complaints for months while the bean counters try to justify or minimize the expense. When leasing to a customer, you're expected to NOT mention the periodic rent increases when signing a customer up unless they ask. If you don't mention it, you're more likely to get a sale. But then the customer calls back 4 months later angry when the first increase hits. Sure, point out to them then that it's in the contract and they should have read it closer, but at least you got the sale! Corporate does give you a few options to compromise on the rate at this point, but you're only allowed to do it so many times a month, and it's tracked and brought up in your yearly reviews, so you're discouraged from doing it. In general, before the pandemic it was a great job. Hours were regular, pay was good, great benefits, great coworkers on a local level and a supposedly good corporate culture. Then the pandemic hit and the deeper corporate culture began to show through. Yes, corporate took employee safety seriously, but got really, really callous on customer relations. Company initially suspended customer rate increases at start of pandemic, for about 6 months. Corporate bragged to the employees about what a great shape the company was in despite the pandemic. Then rate increases were reinstated, and rents often doubled at this point. The rationale was "to get the customers caught up to where the would have been" if increases hadn't been suspended. Keep in mind that nationally storage needs were at a premium at this point all across the industry. Basically, they jacked up prices just because they could. Why is this bad for you, the store-level employee or customer service rep? The company executives left it to the store crews and customer service reps to deal with the infuriated customers, basically told us to tell them we sympathized, but they were welcome to move out. This left a lot of customer feeling trapped since it's often a huge pain in the rear and/or expensive and the customers took it out on the staff. Corporate response: We understand and appreciate you dealing with it, but too bad, so sad. Customers trapped out of the country due to lockdown did not necessarily receive notice when autopay failed, or the subsequent legal notices of pending auction. Again, pissed off people who lost a lot of personal and valuable items with no recourse took it out on store staff and customer service reps. Yes, it's a business and people need to keep track of their own finances, it's not the company's job to do that for them, but this was an extremely unusual and international crisis. The company handled it very poorly, while bragging about taking care of customers by stopping rate increases for 6 months.

title: Pros and Cons
pros: you're own boss within company guidelines. chance to work on your own self advancement in business based on your customers. to a younger mind they tend to rally up the incentives and seem to be soo caring. I guess they are too for anyone that wants to be a manager without having to even go to college.
cons: question you on anything you need and hold off on supplies materials and work to keep cost low however leaving employee or customers at risk of injury. not once during the really hot days did an email or message from upper management about proper hydrating, especially since you most likely work alone and could drop dead and no one would know. constantly just trying to build an image and get reviews from people even if it means getting them from people who are not even customers yet they want you to have integrity>>once they suck the people in, they slam them with super rate increases. i got really confused with how we can be super clean when we are super rusty!! old falling apart doors on most units with infestation of mice. never even offered special cleaning equipment or at the least lysol....instead a blower which if you google or ask a doctor can cause serious respiratory disease Hantavirus. There is no evidence that the disease spreads from one person to another which is probably why they do not really care. i am sure they would play the plausible deniability card.

title: It's good, but it could be great
pros: In the field, a decent work/life balance. Every Sunday off and one Saturday a month. 9:30-6 weekdays, 9-5:30 Saturdays. Benefits are fantastic. They promote from within often. Monthly bonuses based on rentals, not any of the metrics attached to them. Mileage and travel time if you have to travel further than your home store. Some stores have the opportunity to allow you to live on site at a reduced wage but no monthly rent (unless you opt into their renter's insurance, then there's a small monthly fee). They do have opportunities for recognition, bonuses, and prizes. The company's culture is very progressive -- I attended a town hall in person with the CEO and other executives and they heard us out. Very cool stuff.
cons: Training and onboarding needs a lot of help. I think during interviewing it's also not explained well what's expected of you, so there's a lot of turnover. That affects you by having to work alone a lot, being pulled to a lot of different stores (if you're an assistant), and everyone there to help you being stretched thin. PTO is the only time off you have and you accrue it per pay period. There's no separate sick or personal time. Because laws in each state vary, learning the auction process will go through your team leads and other managers. This can be confusing and difficult, and there's no official training from the company beyond basic functions in our systems we use because every state is different. There's a lot of disconnect between the corporate office, field, and call center. The work can be very taxing -- emotionally, physically, and mentally. You handle rentals, cleaning, basic maintenance, coordinating with vendors, customer service, collections, and facilitating auctions of foreclosed units. Juggling the phone, in person customers, and all of your other responsibilities is a lot, and although pay has gotten better, it's still not quite worth all the hassle. Working at the corporate level usually means being open to relocation and having a bachelor's degree at minimum.

title: Extra Space is the Place to Be!
pros: Extra Space genuinely cares about its employees. They provide extensive training and don't even let you work alone for the first month so you can gain practice and ask questions. They provide monthly, yearly, and Christmas bonuses. It is a growing company with lots of opportunities for advancement.
cons: You do have to work in all types of weather conditions to perform cleaning/maintenance and do rentals, but you are generally inside for the most part when it is raining or snowing.

title: Good starting point to learn financial corporate accounting
pros: Great hands on accounting experience after college. Financial statement preparation, journal entries, bank reconciliations, fixed assets classification, approval of vendor invoices, etc. Very nice people and atmosphere. Free drinks and regular department activities.
cons: Work can be grueling after a while. Management gives you more and more work/projects. Having to baby sit the store managers with everything. Having to refund tenant cards. Having to fight tenant charge backs. Those last three things take away too much time from accounting duties.

title: Great Place to Work!
pros: I've worked at Extra Space for many years now, and it has been a great place to work. Growth has been a constant, which has brought new opportunities and improvements. The culture is positive and supportive. Work-life balance is good. Management takes what they hear from employees seriously.
cons: No job is ever perfect, but I can't think of anything to complain of at the moment.

title: 2022 review
pros: Multitude of experience from varying different responsibilities in the field. The people are genuine and create a great place to work! Opportunity to gain exposure in all aspects of operations.
cons: Compensation could be more competitive based on how much work load you have if you are in a market with high turnover. Advancement and career development are slow internally. Field is very diverse but that diversity is lost once you look at leadership and executives.

title: Employment
pros: Great staff, comprehensive training and Sundays Off.
cons: Short staffed, scheduling requests not accommodated, insufficient pay, and employee health insurance program too expensive for employee to pay out each paycheck on such insufficient hourly wages. Your bonus structure needs re-working. Schedules given at last minute. Also, I have never, in my many years of employment, had to buy my own uniform shirts. I was given an insufficient allowance that essentially covered the cost of 2 shirts. I work full time, which means I need 5. I had to BUY 3 more uniform shirts out of my own pocket. I consider this unacceptable. Many offices have no break rooms, and 30 minute lunches are simply too short. If you have to go buy your food, by the time you get it, you are shoveling it in your mouth so fast you barely have time to clock in again. Each location should have regular janitorial help.

title: I made a great choice to work for Extra Space Storage!
pros: I have had an awesome experience here so far. The training is great with hands on as you go along. Benefits are beyond comparison and it helps to work co-workers that are just excited as you are to become successful in everything that you do.
cons: Nothing that I can think of.

title: assistant manager
pros: loved the company's culture freindly available upward mobility
cons: i dont like that the title assistant manager basically means you are an associate not manager because there is no one working below you, yes you are "managing" the facility but so do associates in other work settings. i expected to be at least a somewhat higher up person with this job title but unfortunetly its misleading and you are nothing but an associate and pay is good if you are still in h.s or college but for a place that requires a degree it is less then minimul

title: Decent Job
cons: istent hours with most major holidays off. Easy to pick up. Hourly with sales incentives. Okay benefits. Very nice management staff.

title: DIstrict Manager
pros: Senior Management finally fired a tyrant, the DVP in MD. This tells me they listen to feedback. Many company's only look for results. This company listens to its people to make sure it's done correctly.
cons: Not many cons other than flawed internal operating systems and branding identity, mostly due to growing pains. Benefits could be better but not horrible.

title: Assistant Site Manager
pros: Good work/life balance. Decent schedule. No nights I feel valued as an employee I come from retail where I definitely felt like a number not a person. It‚Äôs different here, I feel I‚Äôm part of a team that cares about each other including my DM.
cons: As site managers we do it all.. painting, cleaning, pretty much everything that regards to maintaining the property. I feel pay could be a bit more to be fair for what we do.

title: Extra Space Storage is EXTRA AWESOME!!
pros: Extra Space is a great company to work for. The atmosphere and people are great also. Everyone seems to always have a smile on their faces and are enjoyable to work with. The job itself is not difficult and can be quite fun.
cons: I am unable to provide any cons about this company. I am happy here.

title: If you get a job offer from Extra Space Storage, an S&P 500 Company, take it!
pros: People, training, learning, growth, atmosphere.
cons: Athletes prefer physical jobs yeah!

title: Starter manager job
pros: Very good job for introduction to property Management / self storage. And you'll learn to take care of a facility and other facilities and very good you will acquire and develop many skills here.
cons: As the demand increases and stockholders are always on the pedestal you will feel like you will have to work a lot and sometimes a lot by yourself and there's always turnover rates. Just because, there are no values and there's no mission statement even though the company says that it's non-existent, since the biggest thing is the stockholders and customers.

title: Average company salary barely over minimum wage
pros: Some health benefits (not great but benefits nonetheless). 401 k
cons: Within the company salary never goes over .65$ per hour doesn‚Äôt matter how much good you made to the company or how much money you make them. Promotions within always go by seniority no much opportunity for new employees 1-3 years if there is someone in the company with more years than you.

title: A Great Place To Work
pros: Extra Space Storage truly is a great place to work. Executives and Senior Management CARE - about our customers, about our employees, about our investors, about our vendors, etc. The organization has a strong culture focused on our values - passion, integrity, excellence, innovation and teamwork! If you are willing to work hard and make a difference, you will be rewarded.
cons: We are constantly changing, which can be viewed negatively, but change at Extra Space means growth, advancement, and excitement.

title: Great Company to Work For!! 9 Years with Company Next Month
pros: Great working hours that gives us the ability to spend time with family. We get the best time off I have ever seen in any business or industry. Extra Space really cares about their employees.
cons: Sometimes there is not enough double coverage at all site.

title: Assistant Manager
pros: This is one of the best company I have work for, the flexible schedule allows me to plan my days since I know my days off for months in advance. this is a fun place to work great team work lots of incentives to motivate you. The training is excellent they make sure you are confident before you start working on your own, there is always people to help you when ever is needed. I highly recommend working for Extra Space Storage.
cons: having to travel far from your home at times.

title: Decent corporate job
pros: Great people -Great building - Great CEO (Margolis) - Good Benefits- Good pay
cons: They tend to assume if you are great at one job, you will do great in a new position that is not connected to the current job you have. This leads to a pool of directors and middle management who lack the skills and training accomplish their goals. It can cause undue stress and unclear objectives. The 5 values that claim to stand by are not the actual values of the company.

title: 23 years and still going strong
pros: The culture and values at Extra Space have been a match for me for 23 years now. This company is innovative and has shown continuous growth over the decades which has provided opportunities for people like me to progress in a career. I made the switch to self storage from a large big box retailer to get a better life balance and I've never regretted my decision.
cons: Self storage isn't a sexy business but it is challenging, pays the bills, and provides a good work/life balance.

title: Unsafe
pros: It's usually a great environment. There's a lot of freedom on how to run your office. You need to be self motivated but I see that as a positive thing.
cons: They went from a company that cared about the safety's and wellbeing of their employees, to the exact opposite. I don't feel safe in my current environment and I'm not allowed to say anything about it. My concerns fall of deaf ears. This isn't the time to be ignoring your employees. I want my safe working environment back.

title: Great company!
pros: I've enjoyed all the people I get to work with at Extra Space Storage. Joe Margolis is a great CEO and wants to get to know the people in the company. When he walks by, I am able to say hi and he knows my name. The company cares about it's employees.
cons: I would like to work-from-home more often. I love being in the office, but I like the work/home balance.

title: What you would expect from a corporate job.
pros: 99% of the time the people you work with area really great people. There is quite a bit of down time if you can get things done quickly. Learn data entry and sales and other useful skills.
cons: Pay, short lunch. Grey area of "requiring" people to purchase insurance plans and meeting quotas. If you are not living on-site or plan on working for 6-12 months to achieve on-site management I wouldn't recommend.

title: An ever growing company maintaining its core family values. The greatest company to work for!
pros: Incredibly unique industry that is perfect for the individual who enjoys working with customers and has healthy, boundless energy.
cons: Do to the nature of the business, our managers must be very self motivated and organized. They are given the responsibility to maintain and manage a multi-million dollar asset, and thus must practice the utmost integrity. Many are often under the impression that our managers sit in an office all day.

title: Tremendous Career Opportunities!
pros: Extra Space is a progressive forward thinking company that encourages development and growth! Extra Space provides the most collaborative and innovative work environment I have ever experienced!
cons: Every job has routine tasks that need to be completed that takes away from the fun dynamics of the position. Extra Space continuously looks for opportunities to streamline those tasks to allow their employees to focus on driving results and developing their team.

title: Awesome company to work for!!!
pros: - Retail without the late/long hours - Upper Management is wonderful - Many opportunities to move up - Good pay with monthly bonus incentives - Off every Sunday! - Possibility to live on site (free apartment)
cons: - Working in extreme weather (cold/hot) - Working every Fri & Saturday

title: Best Self Storage Company to work for
pros: Extra Space has a great culture and truly cares about and listens to the field employees. If you have a great work ethic and are a strong performer- the sky is the limit. The company likes to promote from within. The growth of the company is impressive and will continue
cons: Overall there are very few cons. The health coverage is expensive but that is the case with most companies

title: As been overall a great place to work. Best job I have had so far.
pros: Great for self starters, not micro managed, room to grow in the company with people to help along the way
cons: The health care is mediocre and the gossip in a district is terrible. We are basically glorified janitors. Bonuses can be almost non existent.

pros: Benefits are great 401k matching Hsa matching Hours
cons: Pay isnt worth the work load "Bonus" system is a joke Lack of support from higher up

title: Not a place to promote
pros: Good Benefits, Well known brand, meet lots of good people "customers"
cons: Lots of back stabbing, gossiping, lying, favoritism, jealousy, not a good work environment due to fellow employees.

title: A place where you can Earn a great pay. All you have to do is put in the work.
pros: Great commission, Its easy to make a sale. Calls are not back to back so you get to relax between calls. Not stressful at all. I enjoy working at extra space. management has been kind and i enjoy working with my coworkers
cons: I really cant think of anything that has a negative affect on me while working at Extraspace

title: It is a very nice place to work, you meet lots of people, and have a good time.
pros: You get to help people that are in adverse situations sometimes. And see the look of relief that comes from helping them in an emergency is very satisfying.
cons: We sometimes find in neccessary to auction peoples stuff, I personally would rather people pay their rent and keep what they own.

title: Work Hard, Play Hard
pros: Extra Space is a growth oriented company that continues to stay focused on their people being the number one asset. They offer continued training and advancement opportunities for individuals who have the skill, passion and drive to do so. The company looks for high energy people which make the work environment fun and rewarding.
cons: Compensation and benefits are decent, but the benefits cost more than average.

title: Great Company
pros: I love this company, I have never worked for a company that has such a great team builder, helpful team, they provide you with all the tools you need to succeed in a company. I want to move up. Hopefully to SM soon. Manager & DM are working with me to grow with the company.
cons: So far there is no Downside to my job. I enjoy working for this company so far. I have Learned so much.

title: Division Learning Manager
pros: Wonderful family-like culture, clear focuses from CEO and we promote internal growth. Lots of professional growth opportunities if you're in Salt Lake City. CEO is an incredible individual that exudes our company's culture and values. He knows you by name and is thoroughly invested in the growth of our company and the treatment of our customers.
cons: A lot of travel within the corporate field positions and 60-70 hr work weeks 75% of the time. The pay for a learning manager is not as competitive as it is in other industries.

title: People are Leaving, Don't Come
pros: The CMO is funny? Some people just play video games and take the low pay.
cons: Management and pay are the biggest issues. My job required a lot of IT's help but they never had time for my projects. They were talented but were super stressed. I wish they could have like x4 the data team and other teams. But I guess they will never care enough to do so. Marketing and IT guys and girls should look elsewhere for a job.

title: District Manager
pros: Great company values. Great leaders & peers. Many interesting aspects of the job. Good opportunity to earn bonus at DM and store level. There is a definite want to focus on developing talent internally. The company and leaders truly care about the internal and external customer.
cons: Communication and tasks come in too many ways. Benefits could be better - they are pricey and many providers are not in network.

title: 2 years with extra space
pros: I've been working with extra space for almost 2 years I started as an assistant manager and within that time I have became a store manager I have worked at different properties learning different things all over the place we are a growing company upper management opportunity is very possible we are all over the place growth is based on you
cons: This job isn't for everybody we do some cleaning, we do some maintenance, we're all over the place on property, we even help outs irate customers

title: Excellent Company
pros: The company is very well managed, and is never satisfied with the status quo. Its drive to always take success to the next level is what has made it one of the leaders in the storage industry.
cons: Things can at times be very stressful, but if you can handle the stress the rewards as far as commission and recognition are well worth it.

title: Asst Manager
pros: There is basically no stress its storage. The people you meet are interesting Most managers are great and the hours are ok.
cons: The role playing is ridiculous and over scripted you either get or ya don't. They pay is not worth it unless you are a site manager for many years. And you are expected to work every saturday and if you have no pto it is frowned upon taking time off. It is very cliquish

title: An Employee Driven Company, that actually cares
pros: - An employer that cares about the employees success (both in and out of the office) - Great healthcare options - Yearly merit increase
cons: - Hours aren't the best with family at home, but they are consistent which helps with planning - At times you work alone and it can get busy, but you always have a great district to help share the load (at least phone call wise)

title: Diamond in the Rough
pros: Great culture and work environment. Known for collaboration and partnerships on all levels across all departments. Forward-thinking company with everyone driving to create a customer-centric experience while delivering results for our company and shareholders. I could go on and on about how great ESS is but if you are really interested look us up and find out for yourself. You will not be disappointed!
cons: Is being too awesome a con? Hard to find any downside to this company!

title: Talk the Talk, Walk the Walk
pros: So many positives: Sundays off, focus on developing internal talent, clearly defined goals, and the tools need to achieve them. If you love people, want to enjoy what you do, and have a great work life balance, then you need to work here!!
cons: If I find any, I will update this review.

title: Extra Space Storage Rocks!
pros: Extra Space is a company very friendly and welcoming. It is nice to work in a company that is so happy. Benefits are great, especially since they start on Day 1, as are the 401K and HSA programs. The PTO and holidays are very generous. We are paid to help with projects for the community. There is a very nice free on-site gym. There are break rooms with free snacks and a large kitchen with free soda. Underground parking. Management is awesome!
cons: None come to mind.

title: liked the work but the culture was terrible
pros: Helping bring on new storage was great. Loved working with our district managers and third-party owners. Also, our third-party management team was awesome and understanding.
cons: poor management low pay poor work-life balance old school poor boundaries failed to protect identity when needed seemed to be to under the wrong department- worked for ops when most of our work came from third-party mgmt unequal titles and workload

title: Great place to start a career
pros: Overall an excellent company to work for that really believes in their people. Company goes out of their way to ensure that their employees are taken care off. Leadership trusts their employees to do what is right. If you are willing to relocate you can go far.
cons: Advancement can be slow if you are in a remote market and will almost always require a move to further your career past the store level. However, if you are willing to relocate this is really not a con

title: I LOVE WORKING HERE!
pros: Pay scale is higher than most companies, there is a pay increase each year based on performance. I received a $2/hr increase over a year and a half. The work life balance is great. Only 40 hrs a week required with one weekday and Sundays Off. Paid time off and 401K match with Medical/Dental and Vision benefits. Very relaxed work environment with being able to get time outside the office instead of being inside you get the best of both worlds.
cons: Have not found any cons yet.

title: Extra Space is a great company to work for.
pros: The hours are family oriented the team is focused on positive progression. The Corporate leaders communicate with Store team members on a regular basis.
cons: There are very little cons that come with working for Extra Space Storage. I think that some SM's don't follow the rules and let somethings pass them by. I believe that things are done a certain way for a reason and if the Corporate is putting it out its for a reason every facility should be running the same tight ship.

title: An exciting culture driven by great people to work with.
pros: An overwhelming majority of coworkers are self-motivated an strive to excel at their position and make the company successful. No micro-managing of your time and work. This is a very collaborative environment.
cons: Health benefits have been cheaper with other employers, but the cost has been getting cheaper each year for the last 5 years.

title: District Team Lead
pros: Amazing and dedicated staff!
cons: tant and continued opportunities for growth and advancement. Constant camaraderie and people supporting your efforts. Company is truly focused on customer centricity and making Extra Space Storage a great place to work for employees.

title: Exceptional Company Culture
pros: Extra Space Storage truly cares about my employee experience, and encourages me to "do the right thing", "be the best", and "be balanced". These resonate with me!
cons: As Extra Space Storage continues to grow larger and more profitable in the industry, it faces increasing competition, and may lose some flexibility to change and adapt quickly. Innovation is a core value that requires ongoing commitment.

title: A great place to grow!
pros: It is exciting to be a part of a growing organization at a time so many companies are cutting back or on shaky financial grounds. The work is challenging yet rewarding, and everyone has the opportunity to make a difference. Internal promotions occur regularly - I have never worked anywhere with so many leaders who were promoted from within.
cons: Some of the best ski slopes in the world are only minutes away from the office and they are very tempting during the season!

title: A great place to work
pros: Great work/life balance. No nights. No Sundays. Promote from within. Great benefits. Leaders who listen and act on your best interest. Hiring practices that allow for inclusion and diversity. Your voice matters. Part of a team. I've been with this company for 10 years and still enjoy coming to work everyday!
cons: I've got nothing negative to say.

title: Best job I‚Äôve ever had
pros: Great pay rate, lots of down time, no micro management, many great people in the company. I‚Äôm not one to stay in one spot for too long as I always find myself either unhappy or wanting more, but this company is definitely somewhere I want to stay for the years to come.
cons: Having to clean at times, dealing with garbage or pest still not bad though

title: Great place to work!
pros: The culture within the organization is absolutely fantastic. The leaders of the company put a high value on their team members and know that people are their biggest asset. Good upward advancement opportunities. Solid income with opportunity for growth. Lots of people here that you want to work for, not have to work for.
cons: More hours than what was originally communicated, but still very manageable.

title: A company that cares...
pros: The hours The support from upper management The team spirit Career opportunities are easy to access The training program is very thorough
cons: If you work at a smaller location, it can sometimes get lonely being by yourself at the store level all day. You get support and communication from other stores and upper management, but physically, it's just you. That can be viewed as either a pro or con depending on what type of personality you have.

title: Way to go Extra Space
pros: I've been with the company for 3 months now. I really enjoy getting up in the morning and going to work. The communications between manager and upper management is very impressive. There training is awesome , they give you the tools to do your job. There is always something new everyday to do. Great place to work and further your experience in a new position.
cons: If you like sitting down all the time this is not for you.

title: Not a bad place
pros: Good work environment for the most part. Management seems to care and tries to be fair.
cons: Having to run entire store virtually alone. Company does not properly staff and they expect you to do things beyond your pay grade. Have to pick up after nasty customers and pay is kind of low for what they ask.

title: Would Be a Great Place to Work if it Weren't for Local Management.
pros: Typically Peaceful Work Environment for a Storage Job.
cons: Management from Top Level to the In-Store Management are TERRIBLE. Think of your In-Store Managers like the worst retail Assistant Managers. And the Regional Managers clearly do not care about the in-store employees or the customers at that. Poor Reopening Stratagems even though Extra Space never actually closed like other storage companies. Its just a mess.

title: Good company,
pros: 9:30-6 job with Sundays off. Very relaxed most of the time. Some locations are busy but all the work is str8 forward, no rocket science required. Training pretty easy. Uniform allowance through their website. Easy going. Light sales. Unit discounts for employees 50% for ASM and free unit for managers select unit
cons: Seems like the performance reward system is rigged. Some metric don't make sense and uncontrollable, shouldn't be held accountable. Pay should be better. Health care is expensive, couldn't afford it. At times you feel like company is disconnected with customers, especially those in need.

title: Decent work but work environment is too dependent on DMs mood
pros: Pay is decent for work done, steady work schedule, fun customers
cons: No real room for advancement, leadership only cares about results, expect to be thrown under the bus for nearly all and any issues that arise, Human resource managers have no

title: Excellent Company
pros: I am very lucky to work for Extra Space. The culture you hear about the company is true. The focus on work life balance is extremely apparent. The culture comes from the very top and is felt through the entire company. This was shown even more so during covid by the decisions that were made from the executives and sent down to everyone.
cons: I have yet to find any negatives.

title: Great environment
pros: You are your own boss. You manage your facility and are a key team player in the district.
cons: There can be lack of communication from upper management to your site level at times. DMs are way over whelmed. So are DTLs. This leaves you to make best guess judgments at times.

title: The company is always innovating
pros: They are open to ideas and create a team feel for a district. They invest heavily in technology and look for opportunities to increase customer satisfaction.
cons: I came to this company thinking I was going to make Extra Space a career, but I no longer feel that there are any positions attainable above the store level. I have seen others promoted, so I understand this may just be my perspective.

title: Company that has potential
pros: Not a lot of micro-management. Overall job duties are easy. Helping customers can be nice.
cons: Working on Saturdays, constant changes to the company forcing you to "keep up" and learn new policies and procedures almost on a weekly basis, corporate/upper management expects way more out of you than what is actually listed on the application, working in extreme cold and heat.

title: Extra Space Career!
pros: Extra Space Storage is a fast growing company so there are a lot of opportunities that open up and they encourage employees growth in the company. Employees are recognized on a regular basis for accomplishments.
cons: If you are not comfortable with change, this is not the company for you. We are constantly changes processes to keep up with a changing market and the increased growth.

title: Agendas
pros: I do not like speaking up or posting on sites like this. I keep to myself and do a good job. Then I see the only positive reviews on here are clearly from management. I see others finally speak up and they get discredited. I will not disclose my position or department. Clearly they do not like positive feedback or the truth.
cons: There is a recent review that talks about peoples agendas the only agenda I see at this company is of management. I feel very insulted and unsafe here now.

title: Good company, but profits far outweigh the people
pros: Many great people work for this company Those in director level and above positions love their jobs!
cons: Salaries are not competitive relative to the job requirements Little opportunity for advancement unless you are willing to relocate to join the retail side of the company Those below director level do not enjoy the same "amazing place to work" mantra as those above

title: This is where it's at!
pros: Stable hours, good pay and a high functioning team that is easy to work with.
cons: Crazy hot outside if you work anywhere south of the Mason Dixon.

title: Strong Company Culture, Great Mission!
pros: A field management focus that sets the tone from the top down. Phenomenal benefits, great hours, salary, and major room for advancement.
cons: There are no cons working with Extra Space.

title: Great place to start a career for experience only
pros: Independent work environment. Left alone to make many daily site decisions. No supervisor hanging over your shoulder. Bonus opportunity.
cons: Clickish work environment, low pay to start and slow wage advancement.

title: Great Place To Work!
pros: Excellent culture and environment to grow your career. If you are looking for a company that cares about people and will work to develop talent Extra Space is the place to be. I have watched the company grow from a small public company to a S&P 500 company. This doesn't happen by accident.
cons: Fast growing companies have some hiccups. Extra Space is no different. Overall no real cons to worry about.

title: Working At Extra Space
pros: This is a great place to work. We have every Sunday off, we get our schedule a month in advance, other employees are very helpful and friendly. I relocated to Indy and thought that it would take me forever to get a job but ESS was quick and prompt with everything. The company tries to work with all the renters to the best that they can.
cons: There is really no downside to working for the company.

title: Best company I've ever worked for hands down
pros: This company strives to foster a small business/family feeling with all it's employees. It cares very much about listening to employee input and being transparent about how they run things.
cons: A byproduct of our accelerated growth is change. While we do a great job updating people on each policy change and the reasoning behind it, sometimes it's difficult to keep up with all the changes.

title: Extra Space is the place to Be!!!!!! Even after 6 years and counting
pros: Family atmosphere, change to advance all over the united states, Some site have store managers apartment, very fast commute then, We get to work with the public and meet so many different people.
cons: It can be a dirty job some days and you are in the heat if you have a big outside site, and sometimes if you are in the south like me you may have alligators or snakes to tend with.

title: Amazing Culture but Unattractive Pay
pros: Amazing culture, friendly people. Managers are really friendly and seems to care about your well being.
cons: Salary is too low for the amount of work you are required to do. This job is not for someone who have a family and wants to live comfortably. There seems to be little to no room, for salary or career advancement.

title: Fun, Laid Back, Flexible Place to Work
pros: Working here at Extra Space Storage is a great place to work. They allow for a flexible schedule, and a good work/life balance. The environment is very friendly and laid back (no micro managing). It has a feeling of family.
cons: They like to promote the younger employees, and I feel they don't appreciate the more "seasoned" people and their years of service when it comes to promotions.

title: Amazing place to work
pros: I was looking for a place where I could be challenged and keep growing in my carrier and I found both here at Extra Space Storage, The culture was also an important part of my decision and I can tell that the principles used to build the culture here are being used to provide a healthy environment for each employee, I look forward to see how the company will continue evolving and improving.
cons: Time off is very limited

title: Try It! You‚Äôll Like It!
pros: It‚Äôs a mesh of property management and customer service. Some days you‚Äôll be too busy to sit down, and others you‚Äôll be looking for something to do. You‚Äôll have a lot of guidance and a lot of support and the people you‚Äôll work with are just nice.
cons: Uniforms and closed toe, black, slip resistant shoes are required, and denim is FORBIDDEN, so not a lot of room for self expression.

title: Meh.
pros: You don‚Äôt have a boss breathing down your neck Freedoms to do things at your own pace and time
cons: Non- livable wage Low pay for all the things we do Horrible monthly incentive Work saturdays Minimal holidays paid. Clean crappy bathroom Painting, cutting locks, process auctions Deal with upset customers daily

title: A company founded on honesty and progressive thinking from all sources.
pros: Throughout my career I have never had employers that encouraged AND acted on the ideas shared by me and others in the organization, at all levels. I have been promoted and given opportunities to act in as many roles as I would prepare myself for and look for more opportunities. This is a strong, dynamic and viable company.
cons: not many opportunities to grow outside of SLC headquarters

title: No Future
pros: I enjoyed most of the coworkers at the corporate office.
cons: HR's motto is to hire the youngest and healthiest, if you fit into that category you might survive for a while at Extra Space. For the past 2 years they have been firing employees over the age of 40. They harass employees who use the insurance, or they fire them without a cause. I witnessed discrimination against women and age, they won‚Äôt hire smokers and humiliate employees who are over weight. There is a low moral because employees are worried about loosing their jobs. They will only let a few employees‚Äô advance or change departments

title: Manager
pros: Good management Great 401k plan Very neat and organized in everything they do Everything in this job is hands on and they have great training to help you along your journey
cons: Basic pay Basic health plan There is a lot of work that you have to split between 2-3 people and sometimes may be a little overwhelming.

title: Not a career job
pros: Everyone one you work with is very helpful and willing to teach. This job is for those who are constantly competitive with reaching sales and goals.
cons: The type of customers you work with are the worst kind. When it comes to money, people will flip in a heart beat. There is never enough employees, and a lot of the time, you are by yourself to do a workload created for 2-4 people. Unnecessary stressful.

title: How did I get so lucky?
pros: Unlike anywhere else I have worked, Extra Space respects their employees. The efforts they make to respect your work life balance and make you feel appreciated and valued is amazing.
cons: I haven't come across any yet.

title: Extra Space Storage
pros: Extra Space is a great place to work. The people are excellent and a joy to work with. Everyone is always willing to help out on anything they can.
cons: Sometimes departments can become siloed. Since everyone is working on something, they can forget to learn about how other parts and groups can interact and help.

title: Standard has changed
pros: CEO, Sunday's off, Town Hall, Bonuses
cons: Being left to work alone a lot, mandatory Saturday work, Insurance,

title: Assistant Manager
pros: I am a 50+ female who had been looking for a full time job for almost 2 years. No company would even give me an interview until Extra Space. I have been working here for 5 months and love it! Teamwork is big on my list and we definitely work together as a team.
cons: I guess the only con I have is working on Saturdays but it‚Äôs the business!

title: Culture, Work Life Balance, and Values!
pros: The company values are second to none. Amazing work life balance so I get to be there for my children. The quality of our products are the best in the business so it makes it easy to do our jobs. All around an amazing company to be a part of!
cons: Absolutely no cons with this company!

title: GREAT COMPANY
pros: Pros Customer service is #1 here - Growing company with competitive pay and benefits! - Excellent communication at every level, constant request for feedback - Support systems are always available - Promote teamwork every day and great training program - Sundays off -
cons: Working at a different site sometime challenging if it's a last-minute schedule change but it's really not a big thing just couldn't think of a con

title: Constant growth and innovation
pros: I can constantly count on being challenged to be the best I can be. A great national company with a strong culture for being the best you can be. Also, the work/life balance is incredible. You work hard, but are given a good deal of flexibility to manage your own schedule.
cons: tant growth and innovation

title: Great Company
pros: Great atmosphere to work in, wonderful coworkers. Very helpful and aways there for you if need be. You are able to work in and outside and it's great pay, great everything in my opinion.
cons: Personally I don't feel there is anything bad I could possibly say about this company. They take care of their own as family!

title: Awesome workplace!
pros: Extra Space Storage has a great dedication to work/life balance, offers great bonuses, great incentives from District Manager for goals (i.e., gift cards, rewards). A large company, but has the feel of working for a 'mom and pop' company because of the camaraderie between everyone. Senior management is here to guide you and help you.
cons: The need to travel away from home after a certain point in climbing the ladder from site to district-level, but mileage recompensation and hotel accommodation is generously provided.

title: I am proud to work at ESS
pros: I enjoy working at ESS because we can help customers that need a space to store what is essential to them. We have a diversity of situations that we face every day, and we continue learning and growing with the support of our team.
cons: You have to be able to adapt to changes constantly; we face difficult situations with some of our customers.

title: Working at Extra Space Storage
pros: -Great work/life balance and great co-workers! -Great leadership team -Family like work atmosphere
cons: -No "sick pay". All sick days must be covered by vacation hours which in turn, eliminates time for vacation. -Starting pay is low based on the current cost of living and job requirements -Yearly raises are relatively low

title: Really Appreciate Our Hard Work
pros: All levels of upper management listen to your ideas and really encourage you to do your best. They're always there when you need them. There are great rewards and benefits to working for this company. The hours are fantastic and can be flexible if an unavoidable situation happens.
cons: Assistant managers get bounced around to different stores a lot. They don't have a set store and their commute can be long. Mileage pay out doesn't seem like a lot for our errand runs.

title: Store Manager
pros: Extra Space Storage allows and supports their employees to grow within the company. I have been with this great company for over 8 years and have seen team members start at the Assistant Manager level and move up to the Corporate Office. I have not seen that in any big companies.
cons: For me, there is no Cons. I have had all positive experiences.

title: Company is moving away from its great culture.
pros: Flexibility in schedule, ability to learn invaluable skills
cons: Pay is very low for the amount of work and responsibility. Staffing is at a all time low. Turn over is high due Disctiminatory upper managmemt.

title: Doesn‚Äôt Balance Out
pros: 401k match, Sunday‚Äôs off, ample training available, CEO is approachable and makes himself available to hear from his different locations
cons: Little pay, no room for growth, lack of communication, work/life balance not as described, spread very thin, DM is not available as led to believe, no OT, goals to be met with no recognition if done, company does not care about its employees or the customers

title: Excellent and welcoming environment
pros: The company has a work/life balance priority unmatched by any company I have worked for. They are, genuinely, driven to ensure your work does not interfere with your home life.
cons: The advancement opportunities are based, solely on attrition. The attrition is seemingly high at the moment, so there are advancement opportunities at the moment. Outside the current time, the advancement into and above middle management seems seldom.

title: Stable, but at what cost?
pros: Stable industry and the company continues to grow its revenue.
cons: Growth comes at any cost. Customers are only seen as an ATM. The CEO and executive leadership say one thing, yet act differently. They say they care about the employees, but they only make decisions that put money in their pockets. They will say "look at us we gave everyone a raise", but in reality they are paying way below market unless you are an executive.

title: Culture Defines This Company
pros: * Positive, supportive, and collaborative culture that is TRULY lived by all in the company. * C-Suite that interacts and creates relationships with its associates. * Excellent Schedule. * Amazing growth opportunity. * Competitive Pay.
cons: None to speak of at this time. Every job has its difficulties, but to this point the difficulties are not created by the company, simply a part of the business.

title: Great Company to work with cares about employees
pros: -Always something different going on - ability to learn new things (paint, concrete patching, tree/ trim, etc) - consistent hours, guaranteed off on Sundays -four paid holidays Full benefits for full time, Bonuses sometimes extra ones from corporate as well
cons: some downtime especially if rentals/ moveouts are slow some mundane tasks (collection calls, walk through, etc) upset customers (rate increases, damaged goods etc...)

title: Politics
pros: IT doesn't seem to be a place where you will want to stay. A lot of people are either already gone or in the process of finding a new job.
cons: Ever since the new CTO took over, it's been more about managing how people perceive you instead of actually getting stuff done. Innovation has been replaced with politics. If you want to move up in the company, you have to pander to management.

title: Great Company, Great People
pros: one of the company goal is to " Make ExtraSpace a Great Place to Work" and they are very successful at doing so. its a positive, team oriented atmosphere throughout this district and the entire company, lots of support from the leadership teams and from corporate. salary is more than competitive in this field and there are opportunities for monthly incentives (bonuses) .
cons: benefits are good but a bit pricey, that's about it

title: Great Work Atmosphere
pros: Great benefits, great co-workers, awesome upper management, and excellent promotability within the company.
cons: Average pay for hard working professionals, open Saturdays for a full work day, and company goals should be adjusted to match each individual site versus just one set goal company wide.

title: A great place to work with the best in the industry
pros: Extra Space has a fantastic and special culture. All employees are driven to give 100% everyday they come to work. This means great teamwork, innovation, and service for our customers. Extra Space encourages forward thinking and growth from within. How can you beat that?
cons: Extra Space asks a lot from team members at all levels. This is only a con if you don't like hard-work and dedication!

title: Amazing Company
pros: Extra Space Storage has the most incredible work/life balance. They value their employees and genuinely want them to have a healthy and happy home life as well as confidence and satisfaction with work.
cons: I do not feel that the health insurance is the best. I wish that it were a little more competitive with others out there. It's not the worst, but certainly not the best either.

title: Best company to work for!!!!!!
pros: In this work field you get to help out people when they need it the most.
cons: There is really nothing negative to say about working here.

title: Work Life Balance
pros: You never have to work a Sunday. Monday-Friday 9:30-6pm and Saturday 9:00-5:30pm. They typically prefer you to work close to home, so they‚Äôll find a close location for you.
cons: It‚Äôs only you and one other person that works there. You have to be able to multitask really well, answering all the calls, close the sales, maintain the property, and clean.

title: Extra Space Storage is Great!
pros: Truly an amazing company that cares not only about it's customers, but also about the employees. Great home/work balance. Great interactions and ease of communication with upper management. Fun work environment. Stability with lots of plans for the future of the company.
cons: The benefits plan can use some review: cost are high. Company should also do more to promote internal promotions and career growth.

title: Assistant Property Manager
pros: Great training program specially for those without any background in storage. Good communication from Headquarters to the stores.
cons: Low bonus system, doesn't pay for all the move ins and they're very demanding on the numbers, asking for insurance sales and other items but no commission for those tasks either.

title: Lifetime job
pros: Great retirement options (401k match, HSA match). Extra Space is the best I've seen in regards to upward mobility. Management support is top tier, if you are struggling in certain areas, you have a lot of people around you that will guide your success.
cons: Health insurance is not free. I am taking bigger risks with the cheapest packages because of my age. If you have kids and are maybe a little older, then your insurance costs could get objectively high.

title: Extra Space Storage!
pros: Family 1st!, Will work with you on ANYTHING as long as you let them know of the situation. very employee orientated, They understand that a happy acknowledged employee means great customer service ! They help you grow in anything you want to learn, Extra Space Storage always asks for new ideas on anything that could make the company even better
cons: Haven't found any yet and have been here 2yrs !!

title: Wages don't match responsibilities!!!!
pros: Only 1, Not open on Sundays
cons: Where do I start, Management isn't very proactive! They can't keep decent employees due to treating them like janitors and then asking employees to lie about requirements to get increased sales and google reviews to make corporate numbers...

title: Not too good but good enough
pros: Money to pay your bills Room for growth if you can fit in (so clicky and so dramatic)
cons: Constant and repetitive ‚Äúreform‚Äù if you don‚Äôt hit certain numbers no matter the circumstances even if they say the numbers don‚Äôt matter (they do).

title: Extra Space Rewards Good Work
pros: Extra Space does a fantastic job at rewarding those who put in the effort, while even maintaining a good work/life balance. I've been encouraged to stretch beyond my normal job responsibilities even into other departments so that I can be happy in what I do. This is a company with leadership that cares.
cons: I would love to see the company giving back more to the community. There's opportunities here and there, but not enough that I see.

title: Phenomenal Company
pros: Great benefits can be found anywhere. Great benefits are found here at Extra Space Storage, but what sets Extra Space apart from the competition is the people and culture. You cannot find a better company that cares for its people.
cons: Location. The views out of the corporate office windows are amazing. However, I care more about commute time and ease of access. A more central location along the I-15 corridor equidistant between Utah and Salt Lake counties would be better.

title: Phenomenal Company
pros: This is by far the best company that I have ever worked for. The management truly cares about the employees and their growth and development. The company is always motivating us to be the best and to do our best
cons: There is not a lot of upward mobility in my position. It is a great company to start a career in my field but not a lot of long term advancement.

title: Great Place to Work?
pros: The Manager has the ability to live on site, and the salary is not too bad.
cons: This Company doesn't seem to value the long term employees. Advancement Opportunities are very limited. Quality of District Managers could be much better.

title: Excellent place to work.
pros: Great hours, I still get out early enough to do anything else I want. They promote from within, work hard and they'll reward you for it. Salary is according to workmanship. Friendly co-workers and super helpful management. I honestly wished I applied earlier in life!
cons: Honestly there's isn't anything bad about the job. It's a pretty simple job, it's a mixture of customer service representative and a handyman.

title: Highly demanding job
pros: Big corporation that you can transfer to different sites or states. Bonus can be good but all depends on sites.
cons: Highly demanding job for customer service. The higher ups don't know what it's like to actual work at a store or it's been years since they have. Only interaction the site has is the district manager. most are controlling, and degrading to employees. We are the workers that have to do everything and are reminded we are replaceable.

title: Assistant Manager
pros: Get to work outside, opportunity to help people in need when not constrained by the company's policies.
cons: The company's business model is arguably predatory regarding rate increases and starting rates/promos. They expect way too much work for what they pay. They want you to be maintenance, sales, retail, debt collector, auction runner, truck renter all at the same time for barely above minimum wage.

title: Great Place To Work - Good Benefits - Awesome People
pros: The corporate office was just remodeled and is a fantastic space to work in. All of the people are great to work with. Benefits are good.
cons: Things seem to be tightening up a bit now that the CEO left and we have a new one... but that might be good overall to keep current employees and avoid future layoffs etc.

title: Great Place To Work
pros: Flexible scheduling, no one breathing down your neck all day, self motivating, challenging (in a good way), and changing environments
cons: No overtime, short lunch breaks, low pay for assistant managers, LOTS of manual labor, at the mercy of your district manager (meaning, if you don't have a good one like I do, your working life could be miserable)

title: Salary
pros: I had one district manager in my almost 8 year career that had a sense of professionalism and looked for opportunities to inspire growth within his district. He inspired his staff to aspire to grow with the company.
cons: This company needs to take better care of providing opportunities for employees to earn bonuses and opportunities for growth.

title: Best culture! Next 5 years are going to be innovative and fun.
pros: Leadership supports new technology and software to better interact with our great customers. Great push for better Customer Experiences. Rebranding of stores helps with building a consistent and familiar experience at every store.
cons: Decisions often made by committee, and those can be too large. A relatively conservative company in taking risks.

title: Great company to work for
pros: Extra Space is an organization that seeks talented individuals. They care about their employees and their customers. It‚Äôs a great work culture and a great work/life balance.
cons: Pay structure/Bonus/Compensation should be re-evaluated based on different factors which include but not be limited to longevity, experience, property GPI.

title: Great Company
pros: This culture at Extra Space is the best I've ever worked in. Not only from your co-workers, but from the leadership as well. Its the only big company I've worked for where the WHOLE company benefits from us doing well. (bonuses, appreciations, gift cards, etc.)
cons: Just because I'm so use to working really early, the hours were harder to adjust to, but they're not bad. 9:30-6:00 is pretty standard. I just came from previous jobs that started way earlier.

title: Change is Good
pros: Meeting and greeting new people everyday. Getting to know the customers by name has been great. Finding likenesses in my co workers has been amazing.
cons: The only con I have is wearing the same thing everyday! lol, I had finally become accustomed to wearing my own clothing and being able to change it up but....Nope, back in uniform again

title: Company really cares
pros: Set 8.5 Hours of Office Open Hours makes scheduling personal life easier. Corporate is very pro-active in getting out in front of employee concerns. Good work ethic is typically noticed quickly, opening promotion opportunities. Not much micro-management by management, unless you give them a reason, which is refreshing.
cons: personal monthly goals set by company are sometimes uncontrollable. pay starts low, but bonuses on monthly sales helps. honestly, there isn't much to complain about.

title: At Extra Space you will gain good work experience while working with exceptional people.
pros: There are plenty of opportunities to push you out of your comfort zone and help you learn and grow. If you show initiative, management is more than willing to coach you and help you grow.
cons: Low work/life balance. You rarely have excess capacity but are expected do whatever it takes to get the work done, which generally means extra hours.

title: District Team Lead
pros: Progressive company, always striving to get better. I love the fact that they are always asking for our input, and even better actually utilize our input.
cons: tant growth and opportunity. Great work, life balance.

title: Falling apart
pros: Not working on Sunday, seasonal work environment, better base pay compared to competitors.
cons: No sense of direction (very indecisive), highest turnover rate I have ever witnessed, there's absolutely no structure (schedules were a constant disaster), district managers are always trying to take the easy way out because they're too busy running around like chickens with their head cut off. They never seem to be prepared for anything, everything always feels last minute, like they're winging it...chickens I tell you. They're constantly making changes without proper notification both internally and externally, it's pretty common to receive an apology email as an employee and/or customer because they failed to give notice of any updates and changes. They are growing fast, which sounds positive, but unfortunately they just don't seem have the qualified leadership to properly manage their daily operations. Company morale has been trending down for over a year from my experience and nobody seems to be willing to do anything about it. You hear a lot of great things, but soon understand that words mean little to nothing when it chines to the integrity of this company. Extra Space Storage used to be a great company and I used to enjoy working there, but I left because they are falling apart. With this acquisition we were experiencing a lot of employees leaving or being encouraged to leave, and yet somehow they seem to be more focused on the next person they want to fire rather than the next person they need to hire. Over my tenure I worked with a full staff for a brief stint of maybe one or two months. You will be constantly told to transfer to or cover other facilities because your district is always understaffed so be prepared to drive, but more importantly, be prepared to be told that you're going to work at another facility as late as the night before you're expected to work there.

title: Awesome place to work!
pros: Extra Space truly cares about their employees. There is always an open line of communication, and many people available to offer support. The leadership of the company operates with integrity, and also has a true passion for customers. We are also passionate about employee development. I am proud to work for such an amazing company!
cons: With tremendous growth comes many changes. While change is good, it can be challenging to navigate.

title: Accounting department is struggling
pros: Average benefits, lots of growth, and job security. It's good experience for new college graduates that have never worked in accounting before.
cons: The accounting department is really struggling. They have a huge staff and it's not organized very well. Current set up is really inefficient and the pay is pretty low. They have people with accounting degrees performing customer service and secretarial tasks. The company is growing so much that they're constantly increasing our workload but not our pay. Property accountants are forced to fill too many roles. There's a lot of pressure to meet deadlines and take on more work in less time. The company is growing but they won't increase our head count. Work isn't distributed evenly (check other reviews, some say it's a great Work/life balance and others say it's terrible). The good people have way more responsibility but aren't compensated for it. There is really high turnover in this department. Some people quit within a couple days or weeks and few make it more than a year. The turnover puts even more stress on those that stay. Everyone is burning out and it's creating a terrible work environment.

title: #teamextraspace
pros: advancement opportunities ,Family culture ,great benefits, great hours
cons: We don't have any cons a great please to work

title: Excellent Company
pros: Our company really does have a focus on customers and employees. A lot of companies say that, but Extra Space really believes in it using no pressure sales goals that gives the tenants the best service possible.
cons: The only con would be that business is slow during the winter.

title: It started great
pros: Alone time Not micro managed Done by 6pm Closed on Sundays
cons: Upper management is horrible. They remind you you're replaceable constantly. I trained for 3 seperate districts the last few months I was there. While running my office. I worked 6 days a week, running my office & driving everywhere from NOLA to pensacola and even up to Hoover Al. I was finally given some time off, only to find my job posted on indeed when I left.

title: Great Employer
pros: *Set Schedule *Amazing crew *Wonderful benefits *Growing company *Great training ** more wonderful things to come once you start...
cons: *assistants are back and forth between sites *slow to receive benefits *could pay higher (this next one stands only for my situation) *DM is in another state. (but is active within our district)

title: Being assistant
pros: Schelude days off off on Thanksgiving Christmass New Year's Day and the 4rh. Uniforms at least 1/2 hour for lunch paid for milage
cons: All you do is clean Managers just sit in their chairs. Rotated between 4 placess in St Louis all the same Silly manatory email rah rah crap really no reason to keep open until 6 PM every night NO ONE EVER COMES IN. NO ONE REALLY EVER COMES IN ON SATURDAY EITHER

title: Awesome Place For Employment
pros: The atmosphere within the company is fantastic. I enjoy walking around the floor to see how everyone truly enjoys their employment. I always see a happy smile on their face and a willing to help new people feel welcome.
cons: All I can say if you are not willing to put forth the effort, this may not be the best fit. We strive to have a great and diverse atmosphere with the most talented people found.

title: No Future
pros: I loved my team. I learned a lot from my team.
cons: Management doesn't care about the future of BI. I came to work with this great team and they all got screwed. I found another job right away for so much more money and another great team. Management are nice guys but they just lie about how they care. Actions are the important thing. So many people are interviewing and looking to leave.

title: A great career move
pros: REAL culture with coworkers who like their job too. REAL people who are willing to help around every corner. REAL training with continued, ongoing development . Rapid Growth, Realistic Goals, Generous Benefits, Attractive Pay, Great Leadership.
cons: Can be travel heavy, depending on location. You must be ambitious, tech savvy & adaptable to change. Not necessarily cons for the right people!

title: You don't want to work here
pros: Extremely talented employees. A great place to build a network. Most of the employees leave within a year so you'll have networks into various companies.
cons: The bad reviews you read about this place are 100% accurate. I'm convinced the good reviews are from the owner and his family. The company was good at one point but nepotism has become the new norm. Turnover is extremely high. Professionalism is nonexistent. They are extremely paranoid that everyone is trying to take advantage of the company. People are frequently fired and decisions are made on emotions. We have to account for every single minute of our days and are extremely micromanaged. Our bathroom usage is monitored. One minute late is documented regardless of job level. Berating is common from the Executive Team. Lunches are 30 minutes and closely watched regardless of level unless you're family. Bonuses are talked about when you start but no one (other than the family) has gotten one over the past years. All of our jobs are posted even when we're still in them because the turnover is so high and this provides the flexibility if they want to fire someone. Truly, you do not want to work here. You'll be told you can be an entrepreneur here and build a career, but it's not true. Unless you are family you will have zero say in anything. You will hate it and most people leave before a year. You may be mad at your employer but you're better off where you are.

title: Time for some truth
pros: You will see plenty of "pros" to working with this company as they require their new employees to come onto this website and review them. And who would be stupid enough to say anything bad. So now that I am not employed with them let's just skip to the cons....
cons: They work you like a dog and I literally mean a dog. We were taken over by them in August and were told we had 2 weeks to clean all units to their standards. So in the dead heat of summer they expected me to clean 140 vacant units within 2 weeks. I mean clean as in sweep out unit, clean back of the door, bush down the dust on the walls, microfiber rag the walls with a cleaner, spray pesticide and vacuum out the corners of the unit. That was just the beginning they had ridiculous goals that I didn't think could get any worse until 2017 hit and they require you to now get 90% of your new rentals with insurance. So 1 out of every 10 people could opt out of insurance for you to meet your goal. Not to mention you are required to get 4 Google reviews a month; people honestly panic over not having enough and then try to get each other or friends to post fake reviews for them. The company grooms you to speak a specific way to deceive your customers. Then they force you to force the brand new customer to give you a Google review before you can leave the office. The DM told me to send them the link to their phone then ask if they did it yet. If not then I was to say well go ahead and do it then once your done I'll take you outside to your unit. The DM has favorites and you can definitely tell. He treats people completely different depending on whether or not he likes you. The DM's will promise you growth in the company but then guess what, they also promised that same position to 3 other people! When I address the issue I am then told that anyone can go through training but not everyone's going to make it (a perfect example of the deceiving talk they try to teach you). Speaking of training they dont tell you until your on but you'll have to go through Extra Space University which will consist of weeks of going through online schooling, tests, check ups from your team leads and a paper or two before its all said and done. I think worst of all was that my assistant was making almost as much money as I was and with his mileage he was getting more! Yet some how I was at the cap of a managers pay and I would need to move up to get more money; but that job was hard to move up to when 3 other seniored ES employees had already been told they were next in line. I have worked for quite a few storage companies over the years and this is by far the worst one I have ever been a apart of. I am just thankful to be out of there and onto a better company.

title: Great place to work
pros: There is a great work life balance! The District Manager is always there to help if you need anything or have issues. Out of the few other storage companies I have worked with, Extra Space is by far the best when it comes to concern for the customer and goes the extra mile for the customer.
cons: None that I can think of.

title: A genuinely good job
pros: Competitive pay (Received a $1.5 dollar raise switching to this company in the same business and market) Robust training through a dedicated trainer, videos, and written procedures. Straightforward and simple job Professional workplace Solid work-life balance
cons: Experience varies drastically between which DM or DTL you work under Miscommunications are not uncommon - be willing to adapt/take initiative

title: My experience so far
pros: I am learning things that i never got the chance to before. I have a very strong crew of people I can always reach out too and get my questions answered where they see potential they use it and where they see a weakness they try to make sure you no longer have that weak spot.
cons: Im so scared to fail a company this awesome because the amount of time they've already put towards me

title: Great opportunity
pros: Retail without the hours, good benefits, opportunity to grow if your willing to work hard, closed on Sundays at most locations, bonus opportunities, upper management cares what you think
cons: Some customer can be tough to deal with. Cleaning of unit no matter the weather.

title: District Manager
pros: Most companies talk about employees and how valuable they are. Extra Space believes it and lives by it. Development is a constant focus and I really appreciate all the time and funds that the company has invested in me! Work life balance is like no other company I have ever worked for. I can have a career and can be a mother! Love my job!
cons: Health insurance is a bit pricey.

title: Store Manager
pros: My District Manager has been very supportive since I started almost a year ago. Day to day operations are fairly simple but there a lot opportunities to grow in the company and take on more responsibilities.
cons: Days can get boring and repetitive Lots of cleaning and maintenance

title: Have been with company more than 2 years.
pros: Company seems to really care about it's employees. Upper management often spends time in the field. Great work/ life balance. Although you work very hard sometimes, it's fair. Customer centric.
cons: Sometimes you work alone too much. Wish actual sites were more secure.

title: Great Company & Senior Management
pros: I work with some of the best people, and senior management is responsive & timely.
cons: Aside from the usual frustrations of dealing with customer that don't always follow the rules, or heed advice most of the time...there is very little downside to this company. Pay however could be more inline with living costs in the area.

title: Good Career if in the right situation
pros: Working alone, No work on Sunday, Team atmosphere, Flexibility
cons: Cleaning toilets, Units, Hallways, Parking lots. No OT, Not much double coverage. Working on the weekends.

title: Fantastic Company to Work For
pros: The training is so detailed. The company has great work life balance and truly wants everyone to succeed and has great growth opportunity as they life to hire internally.
cons: Needs a better pay and benefits package. ie stock options, tuition reimbursement for site level

title: No work to life balance
pros: Certain properties have apartments that you can live in for free.
cons: Terrible Work to life balance, was forced to work while sick because there was no one to cover my site. After leaving I've realized more and more that they only really care about their "Corporate" employees and the people at the site level aren't provided the same benefits.

title: Excellent but need more department career path
pros: People. Culture. Leadership is excellent. Pay is good.
cons: ‚ÄúGoldman Sachs‚Äù of the Self storage industry. Good ones and not so great ones get trained up and then get recruited out with ownership options with career growth.

title: Amazing Culture
pros: Fantastic teamwork, happy and engaged coworkers, strong District Manager support and great training program. Extra Space understands how to make the workplace feel supportive. I appreciate their diversity and inclusion training as well. Proud to be part of a team of such amazing and kind individuals.
cons: There is a lot of time spent alone, which if coming from faster paced retail may take some time to acclimate to.

title: Most Boring Job you will ever have!
pros: Time to read books and napüòÇ
cons: Boredom, no extra pay for working holidays of which you work most, a lot of role playing just in case you get a live customer! Phone sales are your primary job. It‚Äôs just awful. By far one of the worst jobs I ever had.

title: I wish I hadn't wasted the best years of my life here
pros: Sales Bonuses, free pizza, candy, coffee, pop, nice co-workers, good technology, the customer's are great! If you can turn your brain off at the door, keep your mouth shut and smile, do everything they tell you to do, you'll be fine.
cons: Very limited career advancement opportunities, sales bonus matrix is skewed in the companies favor, the stretch goal is extremely difficult to achieve because so many factors are out of your control. Bonuses are taxed at 40% to make matters worse.
