Very small annual increases, the work is monotonous, TL's micromanage everything, and cross the line into your private life, terrible communication, I hear more info from peers than from managers. TL's like to keep you in the dark about stuff, favoritism, you must be positive at all times, pointing out anything wrong, or will be misconstrued as "negative" and will get you fired.

title: Couldn't be happier to work here!
pros: Many opportunities to learn and grow. Fantastic group of people in all departments which makes a fun work place environment.
cons: I have yet to discover any personal cons of working here.

title: Great place to work.
pros: Running your own office. Helping customers in need. Great hours. Great management. Bonus are great. Pay is great. Upper management always has your back.
cons: Winter weather Ice and snow suck if you have an outdoor property. Auctions are sad, but it's something that has to happen.

title: Heavy Workload
pros: The best part of working for this company is being off on Sunday.
cons: I feel as if you always have a project to do that's not in your job description. If you don't use Pto you cannot have a Saturday off. Just a lot of work for little to no money.

title: Why I think ESS is an Amazing place to work!
pros: I feel like part of a team! The DMs and DTLs and RMs really make you feel included on new ideas. Most places you are a replaceable "number", but here you feel like you actually matter! Good benefits, Sunday Family time, and a caring supportive team!
cons: Ill have to let you know on that one!

title: Assistant manager
pros: Great schedule,benefits,education and room for advancement Surrounded by lots of great,enthusiastic,supportive people Every day is different and you are not cooped up in an office all day
cons: Pay is decent but you have lots of responsibilities especially when it comes to maintaining the property and dealing with all kinds of people Job can get very dirty also

title: I wish I could say better
pros: Not paying rent or utilities, monthly site incentive bonuses with 35% off the top, working inside and outside, dressing cute every single day.
cons: No cost of living raises, working Saturdays, being "on call," watching lazy, incompetent people continue to succeed.

title: Great culture, passion and teamwork
pros: Everyone works as team. From DM down everyone has common goals. Great work life balance. Most employees really care about their job, and have fun at work
cons: Really cannot think of many cons. Only thing is sometimes when new technology is rolled out, it doesn't go smoothly.

title: Building My Career
pros: In just my first year, I saw a lot of internal hiring, lateral job changes across departments to better-suited roles, and some investments made to develop employee skills. Career growth matters here. Extra Space Storage is full of fun people who live the company's core values. Plus, the office space at the national headquarters in Cottonwood Heights, UT is pretty cool.
cons: Compensation and benefits are "competitive" when compared to other companies. Not great.

title: Good Place to Work
pros: Great Friendly Team Stock Compensation Bonus Work Life Balance Executives are Approachable Work from Home Options
cons: Health Insurance not that great PTO not given for Christmas Eve Not that great of rewards for long time employees

title: Asst. Manager
pros: Flex work days can be set up with site manager. As I only want 2 days a week this works well for me. There are many locations so if a person would want to transfer or just work more hours it could bee arranged.
cons: I feel somewhat micromanaged. Having many years of experience dealing with the public and in the self storage business itself I do feel confined in scope of decision making.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Great company to work for. Nice PTO and 401k benefits. Great hours for a sales environment. Paid holidays. A set schedule, but management will work with you when a need for a change arises. A great culture with a friendly team that are all out to support each other. Great opportunity for advancement as well.
cons: Health care benefits are a little high.

title: Simple job, decent place to work
pros: Benefits, schedule, bonus, room for advancement, simple, given all the tools necessary to do a great job. Basically, you rent units following a certain sales process and in between, you're cleaning and conducting basic property maintenance needs as they arise.
cons: Understaffed, sometimes travel between sites is necessary, can be sweaty work and busy in the summer.

title: Good for stability
pros: Stable, essential job, yearly raises, room for growth, bonuses, benefits
cons: Favoritism, harsh mystery shops, uninspiring, easy to get fired for mistakes made, violent/aggressive tenants regularly, pay isn't as high as it could be, high turnover rate.

title: Great job, great people
pros: Best thing I've ever done is leave retail for Extra Space Storage. The hours are great, not just for District Managers but site level employees. This means the phone doesn't ring after 6pm or on Sundays. Awesome work life balance. Great people throughout the entire company from the CEO and executives to entry level employees.
cons: For some roles, relocation is required for promotions.

title: District Manager
pros: Work life balance is a reality here vs traditional retail. Executive teams are top notch and the CEO is just amazing! You are not just a number.....You are treated as a human and an integral part of the team
cons: A little operationally heavy but management is working on alleviating some of this for the field.

title: Its and okay place.
pros: The atmosphere can be really laid back, if you are hitting your goals you will not see upper management a lot. The monthly bonuses are a plus.
cons: The only real downside is that the pay is not competitive, the bonus structure is skewed in the favor of the SM's making it hard to be motivated as an AM

title: Great company to work for
pros: - Awesome company culture - Laid back atmosphere - PTO is quite generous - Opportunity to work with people in different departments - Great job for accountants who want a good work/life balance
cons: - Upward movement is difficult, although I feel this is offset by the fact that I've been presented with opportunities to tackle assignments that are outside the norm - Communication between departments needs improvement; the lack of communication makes work inefficient sometimes

title: Extra Space Review.
pros: I can say the best thing of working with Extra Space Storage is the great team that we are we work together and we can consider each other as a good big family.
cons: The only thing i can say is the pay i think the manager and the assistant should get pay equal because we due the same job. Just a different name.

title: Horrible experience
pros: If you want to work your butt off for hardly any money this is the job for you.
cons: They don't care about there employees. I was constantly working by myself at a busy site in a really bad neighborhood. You better make sure you don't forget to take the customer to the merchandise wall or you might as well start looking for a new job. They don't care about hard working employees that do everything to make sure they take care of the customer and also keep a great looking site.

title: District Team Lead
pros: Positive, great people to work with, overall management is good. Just depends on the district manager your assigned to.
cons: They wont fire workers that do not do their job unless they have a substantial amount. Of evidence against them. In the meantime you have to work with people that have no integrity or are lazy.

title: Work/Life Balance
pros: As a single mom of 3 - I can get my kids off to school EVERY morning since our locations open at 9:30 am and I'm home by dinner EVERY night at 6:30since we close at 6pm. I'm also home EVERY Sunday since most locations the office is closed. Family day is priceless! Thank You ESS
cons: I honestly can't think of any :)

title: Great Company to work with!!!
pros: Endlessly grateful for this opportunity provided. It is a great company to work for. They give you tons of development opportunities and learning is helpful. And the best thing about being here is meeting wonderful people who are willing to give all their knowledge. Thank you Extra Space Storage for allowing me to be part of your team
cons: Nothing bad to say. It's the best job that I could have.

title: A great culture with great people & benefits!
pros: -Excellent benefits -Work from home flexibility/hybrid schedule - awesome work/life balance -Positive culture -Great people to work with -Beautiful office with coffee, soda, and snacks available all day
cons: -PTO is standard, not as competitive with other companies as large -Paid paternal/parental leave minimal -Not a lot of organized opportunities to meet people across teams/departments (can be difficult for an introvert to get to know coworkers and make connections)

title: Great Company
pros: I have felt welcomed since the first interview. Everyone has been helpful and kind. The training process is complete and straightforward. Really great benefits package.
cons: I really do not have anything negative to say at this point.

title: Great place to work, difficult place for a long term career
pros: Great benefits and decent salaries. Many intelligent coworkers and great systems in place.
cons: Very difficult to advance within the company as they seem to prefer to hire from outside the company rather than promote from within.

title: Proceed with Caution
pros: Depending on the personality of your immediate supervisor; it can be a great place to work.
cons: The higher you move up in the company the more political it gets. If you don't brown nose, then you will be stuck in the same position..

title: Great Place to start a career
pros: good place to start getting experience to move up to other higher paying jobs. Management is great They value Family. Hours are great - can com in early and leave by 3:30pm Fun holiday parties and team activities
cons: Insurance is not great. Pay can be better. They have a lot of turnover due to employees getting better offers elsewhere.

title: A Great Place to Work with REAL Growth Opportunities
pros: - Work with experienced, dedicated, long-term employees - Increasing opportunities for career growth - Positive work culture and focus on teamwork - Dedicated Senior Management team driving growth and development - Individual efforts have a direct impact on company success - Provided autonomy to manage, but with outstanding support and guidance if needed
cons: - Work hard for fair pay, but compensation could be stronger - Company Growth = Frequent Changes

title: Growth Opportunity Diminishes
pros: Excellent in organization! Superior educational training is unparalleled to what I have experienced. The stores‚Äô office structure and trademark-branding color (Wasabi Green and Grey) settles as a nice modern look.
cons: My hard work and dedication never paid off‚Äîbut that‚Äôs okay‚Äîanother door has opened in recognition of my potential. God speed!

title: Great Place to Work.
pros: I have been with ESS for almost 2 years and there isn't 1 thing I don;t enjoy about my job. The company treats you very well and the people I work with are exceptional. I have never worked for a company that cared so much about me.
cons: I do not have any cons at this time.

title: No Care. No integrity. Stay away
pros: Onsite apartment if you are lucky.
cons: Pay is not competitive Traveling all over because the turn over is so high they can‚Äôt keep employees. They brag about their core values being about caring and appreciation, but will fire you while still on Workmans comp so you can‚Äôt get another job. Even though you dedicated 3 years of your life and wanted to retire from ESS. They couldn‚Äôt wait 4 weeks for me to come back to work. Meanwhile no one is applying and staff is stretched so thin people are barely surviving. They will set employees up for failure by shopping them. If you don‚Äôt do things exactly perfect then you get shamed for not being a robot. The only people making money is the CEO and president.. who like to brag about their new sports car at staff meetings. Then demean employees because we don‚Äôt want to rent to drug addicts. Raises are a joke! .20? In this economy? Are you joking? Also they fired me and kicked me and my family out of the onsite apartment a week before Christmas. Real caring place right? Class action lawsuit just got finalized because they refuse to staff offices correctly so people get their breaks.

title: Amazing Company
pros: Out of all the jobs I‚Äôve had Extra Space is my favorite. Most people get intimidated when they see sales and it‚Äôs really not bad at all. You get a lot of support and help, all you have to do is understand the info and apply. It‚Äôs a family here, and that what they treat you like.
cons: Only con I have is that there are shift bids, so you schedule can fluctuate

title: Best Company EVER!
pros: Employee and Customer focused. One doesn't have to suffer because of too much focus on the other. The Balance is near perfect! They support from the DM is AMAZING! Hours are fantastic!(My past is Retail Mgt.) Bonuses are achievable. I can't say enough good stuff about this company!
cons: Only negative and it's a small one....the insurance is a bit expensive. That's it, though.

title: Great Place to work
pros: Great work / life balance Tremendous learning opportunities for entry level accountants. Strong management team Opportunity to work on all aspects of property accounting and take on aspects of corporate responsibility as well
cons: Fairly typical time off policy, but no bereavement. Management has been doing a better job recently of getting property accountants more involved in the decision making, but could still use some improvement.

pros: Decent pay, great coworkers. Job security. As long as you do your job you can guarantee you'll be employed. Some of the upper management is ok.
cons: It was a great place for a while. But now it has changed. Promotions are no longer based on talent. If you aren't a bully, good luck moving up.

title: Great Place To Work!
pros: Extra Space Storage is a GREAT place to work. Great Benifits, Great Pay (Comparative), Senior Management is Always invoived with Field Employees with Communication and Town Hall Meetings for Face to Face interaction. Extra Space has Great growth potential as a company and as an employee and loves to promote from within.
cons: I cannot think of any cons as this is a Great company to work for.

title: Why the Storage industry?
pros: Great free apartment & all utilities. Pretty easy job at most locations. Fairly good bonuses and incentives.
cons: I got one of the no so easy location. Could be a bit better pay. At least for the site I manage.

title: Great place to work!
pros: Paid Time Off. Benefits. 401k. Yearly merit reviews. The ability to grow. The job is a good balance between inside and outside duties which helps with feeling complacent. I have been an employee for just over 5 years and truly love what I do.
cons: Sometimes you do have to work alone which isn't always a bad thing but can be challenging at times.

title: Best Place to work!!
pros: Good Career Opportunities and advancements, Work & Life balance is Excellent! Great Hours Full Time, Excellent Compensations & Benefits and a great team to work with. Excellent support from upper management. Great Work Culture. I should have came to work for this company years and years ago.
cons: no downsides of working with Extra Space that I have ever experienced

title: Great place to work!
pros: -Set schedule: M-F 9:30-6pm Saturday 9-5:30pm and Sundays off -Major holidays off with pay. I started the week of Thanksgiving and still got the holiday pay unlike alot of companies - Great/understanding team - PTO is great
cons: None really, everyone helps everyone in the district

title: Decent Company
pros: Company actively seeks employee feedback and takes it into account when making company-wide decisions. Above average pay for this industry.
cons: Anti-smoker environment, can be borderline hostile to smokers. Benefits are insanely expensive. Site manager at my particular facility grossly under-qualified to lead a team (although this is the exception, not the rule).

title: POOR BALANCE
pros: Decent enough pay. Easy work to catch on to.
cons: This is not a company where you can go to school and work. They are very difficult. Even if it's something that benefits the company. They want you to work around their needs. They often make promises that they can't follow through on. Make sure you get everything in writing.

title: Great Company
pros: Quick promotion potential, Laid back, great access to corporate associates, compensation provided for everything done
cons: Lots of cleaning, not all stores are the same, must have a car, sometimes have to cover other sites

title: Vice President
pros: I joined 19 years ago and have never considered going elsewhere. As a former big box multi store leader, the work life balance at Extra Space is like a wonderful gift every day. Here, I feel like I make a difference and my ideas are valued.
cons: We have amazing people who work here and we need more to keep up with our growth!

title: Love my career
pros: Great hours, good pay, great people, great leadership, easy advancement, treat their employees with respect and fairness.
cons: Can be long wait times to get items fixed which can make customers unhappy. In their defense most of the time it is either due to vendors or waiting for 3rd party owners to approve.

title: Ok if used to retail
pros: If you have always worked retail and enjoy the industry the job is good since you will work set hours each week. For retail work the wages are better then most jobs.
cons: If you have a family Saturdays are shot and flexibility with time is very limited. You will clean and clean and clean...

title: Asst. Manager
pros: I have never worked for a company that gives back to their employees, Bonus after bonus, clothing allowence, shoes, it never seems to end which is great, I have been here for over 20 years, I will surly end my career with ESS.
cons: Working out in the snow and cold weather, dealing with Irate customers.

title: Property manager
pros: Leadership empowers its managers to think like an owner and challenges us to be innovative with our ideas. ExtraSoace without a doubt treats their employees like we matter and with respect! Best company Ive ever worked for.
cons: If you're not self motivated and able to get work done on your own, you may find your day to day a challenge.

title: Great Company & Vision for Future
pros: Outstanding culture Sharp employees and modern technologies Clear digital strategy for future Great leadership who support the company and allow for creativity Nice perks! Food, drinks, bonuses, health-related reimbursements
cons: Not much, other than the drive for me to Cottonwood Heights

title: Not great for someone trying to get ahead
pros: Easy to communicate. Pay scale is good for the storage industry. Coworkers are happy to share knowledge and advice.
cons: No room to advance. No incentive to take on more responsibility. I was a manager making less than my assistant because he had been with the company longer, despite the responsibility and extra work accompanying the role of manager.

title: Good place to work.
pros: Good work/life balance. I like who I work with. Good focus of work tasks. Competitive Salary.
cons: It takes too long to accumulate PTO hours. You have to work here 5 years before you can earn at a faster rate. Suggest changing the tenure to 3 years to earn at a faster rate. Insurance is pricey for what you get. HSA is good.

title: Run don‚Äôt walk away from
pros: One thing closed on Sundays
cons: Most of what you do. You are expected to work by yourself pretty much all the time. The company has become a revolving door when it comes to staffing and this add to the working alone. Too goal oriented they have lost all sight of customers and only care about lining their own pockets. Understand that you will have to sell insurance, merchandise, and get (positive) google reviews, all while keeping the entire property clean, following up with delinquent customers, handling customer complaints and question, and renting units all by yourself due to lack of help. I worked for this company for 16 years the last couple of years I could count on 2 hands how many days of double staffing I had working at a site that brought in more then $60000 a month. The DM‚Äôs usually come from other company‚Äôs and have no idea how Storage works, the company wants to make it more retail but honestly is more realest like, we have strict laws that we have to follow and most times new dm‚Äôs just don‚Äôt see how they try to blur those lines. Repair and Maint. is another huge area of concern I worked at a site for over 6 years and it had flooding and wall leaking issue before I worked there and still had it when I left, these was most of the complaints that I had to deal with customers having mold it items ohh I‚Äôm sorry mildewed items as the insurance company wanted to to describe it, because mildew is not covered in the insurance that we sell. If you decide to work here o would not plan on long term at 1st you‚Äôll be loved then you will see the true colors.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: The company is growing fast and the opportunities feel endless. I have worked under several supervisors in various departments and have been very satisfied in the level of leadership. This company values people and advocates a good work/life balance.
cons: Corporate positions are typically located in SLC at corporate headquarters, which means relocation might need to be an option at some point.

title: Definitely recommended
pros: It's easy to get along with my coworkers. I never feel that I'm competing with them so much as I'm striving to reach our goals with them. We also have activities once in a while that help me get to know others and relax from the day-to-day tasks. I believe in our company vision and support our business model.
cons: We're a self-storage company and have to deal with foreclosures.

title: Assistant Store Manager
pros: Established policies and procedures, Good initial online training, Get to become familiar with colleagues when working at other sites, Get reimbursed for miles traveled, Stipend for uniform, Wellness credits, 401K matching
cons: Limited holidays and time off, No overtime, Hourly pay differs based on location, Expensive health coverage, Need to have a car, Pressure to meet monthly goals, Lack of communication regarding office renovations and vendors, Rebranding causes temporary disruptions

title: Not want they used to be
pros: Variety of work, some office, some out door. I get 13k steps a days. The job is easy.
cons: The culture is heading in a bad direction and it's clear they no longer care about their employees like they used to. The company is making too many changes too quickly and very quickly flushing their amazing customer service down the toilet. After 6 years, its time to go.

title: Good but extremely clique based
pros: Hours are steady, work isnt overly stressful, pay is acceptable for the work done, health benefits are good, PTO is good as well
cons: No real development to grow, no real help from corporate on internal issues, schedule isnt stable or set unless store manager, upper management only cares about upper management dont expect compassion or understanding from them

title: ESS Review
pros: Great company culture, values, professionals, work as a team, transparency. Benefits.
cons: The pay for the amount of work you do. Career opportunities.

title: Love my job
pros: Excellent company to get started in property management, great group of people to work with, always there when you need a hand and a very good work environment. Everyday is different nothing monotonous about the job, the best part is helping people with their storage needs and the sign of relief in their faces when it's all done.
cons: There is really no cons I can think of .

title: No Longer a great place to work
pros: Working at a self storage facility is truly a unique experience in the "retail" world and its great for some and hated by others. Many things have changed in the last several years that has negatively affected working for ESS. But here are still some of the positives that I can think of -Mainly get to work on your own and dictate your own day in how things are done and what order. Dont have a direct superior looking over your shoulder all day. -Free apartment for managers and some assistants for locations that still have them. -Mix of office and property work. Can stay in on rainy days and get out and enjoy nice days. Get a bit of exercise instead of sitting in a chair all day -Form good relationships with the long term customers that come in regularly -Decent benefits with healthcare, PTO and 401k - A growing business that wont go bankrupt anytime soon
cons: Now ESS has implimented several things over the years and it only accelerated during Covid and they use it as an excuse, like everyone will just accept the suffering. It basically boils down to a few things, but mainly this company trying to squeeze every penny they can out of this business. That means less hours, less pay, more work, less supplies. Here is what that has lead to -Though you get to work on your own, managers are increasingly micromanaged on simple things we used to be able to do without question. -They have been eliminating the free apartment whenever possible and replacing it with rentable storage units. -Almost everywhere is running on a skeleton crew with most sites going with a single person running them. They cut hours across the board and expect the same amount of work to be done. -Working alone by yourself is kinda nice when you get to dictate your own work day, but working alone weighs on you after a while. Working with others is nice sometimes, which is way less common now -They're doing crazy things like closing certain stores an extra day just to save on labor costs - They are going toward automated system and self service kiosks to further reduce labor costs - Employees cant order anything without is being scrutinized, again for cost cutting measures. This means everyone has to run on minimal supplies and makeshift stuff to compensate. - High turn over rate and horrible employee retention. This compounds the low hours and makes running districts even harder. They cant seem to hire anyone either. - Company misrepresents jobs as sales and retail, when its half that and half facility maintenance. Ive seen several new hires quit due to this - Extreme pressure to sell and meet company metrics. Micromanagement extends to this to where they track literally everything you do. - Company insists on using internally developed programs and sales systems, instead of paying other companies. This leads to shoddy computers systems that fail constantly, dont work as intended and dont have the same function of the program they replaced. - Hypocritical company culture with focus on customers and employees, though they only care about customers to get them trust us to sell them more and turn on them as soon as it would cost us money. They say they care about employees but do nothing to satisfy our concerns over hours and lack of support, just say they are "doing the best they can" - They ask employees to care about our customers and put them first, but any amount of success you will get comes at the cost of selling your soul and treating customers like numbers and opportunities to sell and hit metrics -No way to advance beyond manager without selling your soul and paying LOTS of dues and being liked by the right people. This is just on top of the normal corporate stuff like office politics, favoritism, disconnect from management and field employees

title: Great company
pros: good flexibility, management was amazing, great culture, decent pay. Lots of down time, regular hours. No mirco managing.
cons: There isn't many cons to working for this company in this specific position. As long as you complete the simple task they ask you will do fine. At times it seemed hard to get assistant managers to make the workload even lighter but ultimately didn't matter much to have them anyway.

title: It's okay but can be very stressful
pros: bonuses, Sundays off, 4 major holidays off, not boring
cons: high stress, break ins and homeless are very prevalent issues in storage industry, no training to deal with the many, MANY break ins you will experience, audits

title: Fast-paced but Friendly Culture
pros: While self-storage may seem like a pretty straightforward industry, Extra Space is very focused on innovation. There's a culture of experimentation and testing here - you have an idea? Great! Let's try it and see if it works. It's fun working in this kind of fast-paced, dynamic environment with a friendly, collaborative group of people.
cons: PTO is on the low end, and so is the 401k match.

title: Challenging
pros: Leadership is amazing. Pushing employees to grow, achieve goals, teach you what you need to know to get you where you want to be. (even if it is somewhere else)
cons: Strict, attendance policy, point system

title: I love my job at Extra Space!
pros: I love the energy and positivity. They make the workplace a fun place to work.
cons: With a sales job it can be mentally tough.

title: Love this Company !
pros: Extra Space is an amazing Company that is not only focused on providing top notch service to its customers, but also an incredible work environment and unwavering support for its employees. If you are looking for a rewarding career with unlimited growth potential and solid compensation, then look no further than Extra Space !
cons: I have no cons to offer

title: Dull and Political
pros: The job is not hard and anyone can do well.
cons: So much to say. I would not recommend anyone come work here. Well, that is not true. I would say accountants with no experience should come here first.

title: Such a Great Place to Work!
pros: This place is amazing, upper management really cares about the employees and honestly takes employee feedback seriously and tries to implement ideas we have to make the company better for customers and employees.
cons: During the busy season we could use temporary help to ensure our sites have adequate coverage and allow for days off without creating or requiring overtime.

title: Great place to work!
pros: Extra Space is a growing company, has allowed me to move up to different roles within the company. They do a great job promoting within.
cons: You work solo quite a bit. Not really a con but you have to be self motivated and keep on task.

title: Site Manager
pros: Free rent and utilities to live on site, The company cares about its employees, Some freedom to run a property as you would like
cons: Low hourly/yearly wages, A lot of hours are worked completely by yourself, Occasional disconnect between sites and district managers

title: Assist Manager
pros: Staff and DM is great although some of them need an attitude adjustment. Benefits are pretty good and pricing is not bad.
cons: Working every Saturday, hours suck. Not a fan of 930 to 6 pm. Whole day is gone by the time you get home. I don't see this as long term. Pay is not enough for what you actually do.

title: Was great, is getting worse each day
pros: Not long hours. No sundays
cons: The wrong people are being promoted. They go on a power trip.

title: Excellent place to have a career.
pros: You are challenged, developed, and rewarded. Opportunities are available to you for your career and personal growth. We live our company values every day.
cons: There are some boring tasks that have to be completed but what job doesn't have those!

title: Great company and people!
pros: Invests in people at all levels. Great work-life balance. Strong culture and core values.
cons: tantly looking to innovate through technology and industry standards.

title: Great place to work
pros: Work life balance Opportunity to move up to store manager Good work culture
cons: Extremely difficult to move to higher positions that pay more. Company prefers to hire external employees for higher paying titles Raises are small with and pay has a cap

title: Not a bad job
pros: Free time Monthly sales bonus Decent training
cons: I'm putting this in all caps: RATE INCREASES Extreme pressure from management for selling insurance

title: Amazing culture
pros: Extra Space is an amazing place to work with work life balance. Extra Space's culture is also amazing, they really care about their people and their growth. The training elements the company has is well thought out and achievable for their people. The growth of this company is expanding by the day! Great place to work!
cons: PTO program needs work but overall ok

title: Manager
pros: Life Balance compared to other retail envirement
cons: Humm. Maybe pay. But its a trade off

title: Overall good place to work
pros: My favorite thing about the company is it os very employee centered. At the store level we do bonus and recieve good benefits. Also we close at 6 and are closed on Sundays.
cons: The customers can be crazy and there is no over time available.

title: Great place to work
pros: Growing Company with advancement opportunities. Great work life balance. This company has a family feel. If you are looking for a career and company with a great work life culture, this is the place for you.
cons: Health Care options could be better but they have a great FIT program.

title: Great Culture and Open Minded Team Approach
pros: Refreshingly open culture with a passion for building strong team members and helping them achieve their professional goals.
cons: An environment of dynamic change as we continue to evolve into an ever-better company and team. No resting on your laurels here!

title: The best employer ever!
pros: Great work environment, not just your peers but the superiors too. The locations are great and the potential to advance is there for those that wish it.
cons: The ONLY con about this job is cleaning the units. There are no cons about working for ESS.

title: Great culture
pros: You are given all the tools you need to succeed .Hard work pays off and you will absolutely get noticed.
cons: Auctions and delinquencies can be a bit stressful but you have options to help people that fall behind

title: Striking Contrast to My Previous Employer
pros: A culture legitimately dedicated to the well-being of employees. Which is seriously different from my last job. Great teammates. I love not working downtown.
cons: Having a hard time coming up with heavy cons. I really like my job. There are always annoyances that crop up anywhere you work, but my experience here has been that they are few, far between and minor.

title: District Team Lead
pros: Great hours for a retail type place but not a 9-5. Also upper management is very supportive and approachable. The advancement opportunities are plentify, and they even have programs to get you ready for advancement. And they have apartments where you can live in for minimal costs.
cons: Staffing hours are low and when we are short staffed, its hard to get projects and other tasks completed.

title: AMAZING
pros: Kindness Respect Loyalty ESS goes above and beyond for its employees and I will forever be grateful to be a part of a company that appreciates its employees.
cons: PTO could be improved such as more hours per paycheck.

title: Watch your back and be "friends" with your boss to succeed
pros: OK raises and a good bit of autonomy. as long as you aren't caught "stealing time," you can basically show up and get a paycheck. If they write you up for something, correct it, but otherwise, you show up, clean some storage units and chill the rest of the day. And trust me, you don't actually have to "clean them" just sweep out some of the debris. They will tell you to clean the wall of the units. Don't do that, it's too much work and you can get away without doing it. They will give random bonuses, but if you look at how much money they are making, you will see that it is just an OK bonus. Health insurance is pretty cheap.
cons: very unprofessional, the district managers do whatever they want and if that means firing somebody because they are jealous of them, they will do it. They will also lie. They let their "friends" do whatever they want, but will write you up for doing the same thing. They claim to value diversity, but HR didn't even acknowledge my email about inclusion. They promote friends only. My friend was fired and her district manager told her she would write a recommendation for her, and then ghosted her. Won't return her emails or phone calls. Two managers took lunch but didn't "clock out" on the same day and ate at the same time, but only one of them was fired. They are cutthroat! They fired another friend for having a visitor to the office for "too long" after she worked there for EIGHT YEARS!

title: Excelent Place to work at.
pros: Management takes their time to teach you the ropes. Hours are great, I still get out with enough time to do anything else I want. The job it is easy. They promote from within. They reward those that work.
cons: Honestly there isn't any cons. The job is a mixture of Customer Service + Handyman + Cleaning.

title: Ambitious Associates
pros: The pay is the most competitive in the field. Associates are second to none; every one does their parts. Seems as if everyone is a go-getter. Ambitious employees who advance up the corporate ladder at lightning speed.
cons: Having to work on Saturdays but it is necessary in the retail end.

title: Extra Space Really Appreciates their Employees
pros: Extra Space is invested in the development and career growth of their employees. They work hard to provide recognition. Their culture and way of doing business is as good as i have ever seen it.
cons: I haven't seen anything that is a con.

title: An All Around Great Company
pros: This company is great! Great benefits, great co workers, great management, and great customers! Been here 4 years, still the best job ever!!!
cons: Cons for some is that we work outside in the heat sometimes (but we live in Charleston, of course it is hot), this isn't a con for me, I love the fresh air.

title: Great, Interesting, Rewarding, and Fulfilling Place To Work
pros: Great training, able to work as with a team and alone, good communication throughout the company, rewarding, growth, positive work environment
cons: coverage issues, aggressive metrics, follow-ups missed

title: Fantastic Company
pros: Flexible Schedule Great work life balance On site apartment (some positions) 50% computer work 50% physical activity
cons: Job can be a little physical taxing some times but nothing near other jobs I've had. Really not many cons I can think of

title: Wouldn't Recommend- Unless you're in IT
pros: Benefits Location Fantastic IT department Still Growing
cons: Work Life Balance support is non existent except for a select few. Some are allowed to miss a bunch of work (outside of FMLA), others are reprimanded/fired for far less. Lacking interest in personal growth and support from management. Disconnect with what HR promises vs what is actually provided via management. Disconnected internal departments.

title: Dead end accounting job
pros: Solid benefits. Most property accountants don't work 40 hours. Good place to at least work temporarily to decide if you want to continue with the accounting profession.
cons: Very few opportunities to get promoted. Whenever a senior PA quits, there are around 15-20 PAs that apply for the position, and unless you're besties with the managers, you probably won't get it. Pay is low to begin with.

title: My time at ESS
pros: low stress hours do not coincide with rush hour traffic company provides uniforms and footwear work mostly by yourself or with a store manager not a lot of driving involved
cons: pay could be more hours could be more traditional 9-5 not always very busy to make the day go by faster don't get trained in all aspects of the job. some things are learned as you go bi weekly pay

title: fine but unpredictable
pros: Sundays guaranteed off. Unless they feel like taking them away to make up for losses.
cons: If you're an assistant manager they send you wherever they want in the district. You have no say in it.

title: A Great Place To Work!
pros: I've been working as a remote sales agents for over 10 years and this has been, by far, my finest experience. After your initial training period of a month and a month getting your feet wet, you are allowed to select your hours. The Sales team takes inbound calls every day, so you can work M-F or any combination of days and shifts. That's cool! After training you are assigned to a team of about 20 other reps ad you have a Team Lead. Each week you have a team meeting and a private 1:1 with your TL to work on your success metrics. The pay is competitive and is excellent for the top 10% of the more than 200 sales reps. Base pay is $15, with attendance, call conversion percentage commissions and other bonuses available. For example. I am in the top 5% of reps, based on total storage unit rentals and my regular 'take home' paycheck average is $1,150 twice a month, with a commission and attendance commission/bonus amount is $1,400. That totals $3,700 deposited to my checking account monthly. That grosses out to over $53K, or $26/hr. Excellent for remote gigs. The management is outstanding! Understanding, with no micromanaging here. You have access to all levels of management, from your immediate superior (your Team Lead) to HR, the Sales Director, IT, even the CEO. You have access to a myriad of metrics related to your performance. This allows you to pinpoint areas that are costing you money and ways to strengthen those areas. The primary metric used for agents is average conversion rate for the entire company over a three-month period-nicknamed The Floor. Here you can see where you compare to the average. A wonderful way to judge your value, without it being broadcast to the entire team' A particularly effective area for improvement is the ability to listen to other agents' calls. I have listened to over 40 different high performing agents and have found many techniques and methods to improve not only my closing skills, but also ways to have more fun. My final 'Pro' for working at ESS is that it is FUN! As stress-free as any job I've ever had, including being a top executive and a small business owner.
cons: The pay, although quite acceptable for the top performers (and rightfully so), does tend to discourage the group hovering around the Floor, or below. Since the average is based on your prior and current three month performance, it is harder for these agents to move in to the upper echelon of compensation.

title: Very Impressed
pros: Team members are a pleasure to work with and I love the meetings and constant communication I have with everyone. Very different from my previous job but overall I've been very happy learning new things and am proud to work here.
cons: I cant think of any, maybe to work outside in the cold at times.

title: Good - Family environment
pros: no micro management. They leave it to you to determine what you want to do and how you want to do it. You can leverage your own abilities to do a better job.
cons: Tied too close to centershift. Sometimes the best decisions about the companies future are not taken for political reasons. Need to think bigger picture.

title: Great place to work
pros: Good work-life balance. Management recognizes personal effort. Fun place to work. Freedom to perform most of your responsibilities in your own way.
cons: Most employees like working for Extra Space, you have to work hard to get promoted! (If that can be considered a con).

title: Property Manager
pros: Good hours. No Sundays. Nice property
cons: Just saw Property Managers average salary, I am really angry. I am not even close to the the average.

title: District Manager
pros: A people first company. People are important to this company. The entire leadership team leads with Integrity and it is visible throughout the organization. High performance expectations, but also an expectation of work/life balance.
cons: Always innovating and changing due to the industry, so if you do not like change, may not be the place for you.

title: Store Manager
pros: Working retail with office hours. Always going the extra mile to develop and create new opportunities for employees
cons: To be quite honest, I don‚Äôt have any cons. Just grateful and thankful for the opportunities that have been given to me to advance myself.

title: A Great Place to Work
pros: Extra Space has a great leadership team. Working for the company is also great. You feel like an integral part of the team and have the opportunity to take responsibility for your work at your sitem
cons: For some the hours may be an issue. The stores are typically open 930-6 on the weekdays so there is not opportunities for different shifts.

title: Great community and people to work for with fair compensation
pros: You get to set your own task load during the day and the coworkers are all top notch and nice
cons: Micromanaging has become a little more prevalent than it used to be. As a publicly traded company, there seems to be a greater and greater drive to increase profit through gilding the lily.

title: Decent Job
pros: Definitely gives experience in a wide range of fields, the manager level title, although purely decorative, does make a resume look better.
cons: You consistently are by yourself, which is great when you don‚Äôt work at a very busy store, but when you are busy it can often get overwhelming. Also, I consistently was running into unfair treatment between employees which is ultimately why I left.

title: It‚Äôs was okay at the time
pros: Relaxed feel depending on the location, customers were nice. Sometimes it was flexible depending on the location.you‚Äôll get a increase in pay not to much though
cons: Management is horrible. Sometimes you have to float and it‚Äôs last min. Your quarterly pay is horrible. Store managers is horrible and your always having to cover someone else position.

title: Love my job
pros: I love that my District Manager and Store Manager are so pro-active. Anytime I have a question they are so willing to help me. An if I did something wrong they coach me and are not the typical demeaning managers.
cons: Just need more rentals to help our numbers!

title: Doesn't care about anything but metrics
pros: Nation Wide, and neon green. Closed on sundays *mormon
cons: Only wants to drive google reviews, and force insurance onto customers. Under staffed. No site has 2 employees. Poor assistant managers are expected to drive within a 50-mile radius to cover other stores. New external DM's that have no idea what storage is.

title: Great work life balance, and upper management
pros: - Management always asking for and receiving feedback - Run a site as if it was your own, within company policies of course - Super competitive compensation - Major holidays guaranteed off -
cons: tant communication from senior management - Fast answers / IT help

title: Constant Growth and Opportunities to Move and Advance
pros: Monthy Bonus based on district ranking. Ability to manage your own day and interact with people. Overall just an awesome company to work for.
cons: tant Growth and Opportunities to Move and Advance

title: Low Pay, lot of responsibility
pros: Great people to work with most of the time. You only work 40 hours a week, and it is rare to have overtime.
cons: Covering other people's stores they leave you no notes on. Too competitive against other stores in same district. Low pay for the amount they are making (a lot).

title: Awesome place to work
pros: Fantastic hours and every Sunday off! Monthly bonuses and great pay. The employees are listened to and some pretty great improvements came from employees in the field.
cons: The medical insurance cost is pretty high. I can't think of any other cons for Extra Space it is a great job.

title: Couldn't ask for a better workplace
pros: Amazing Work/Life balance, and the hours are just as amazing. I have been here for almost 2 years and it's truly awesome to work for a company that wants you here and shows you.
cons: It takes at least a year to build up a decent amount of PTO but most DM's will work with you if it's an emergency.

title: Employee review
pros: I have been employed with Extra Space for 6 1/2 years and I am very pleased and satisfied. Management is superior and really cares about the employees. Great hours and good people. Room for advancement!
cons: As all positions with customer service there can be some challenging situations but Management has your back and no unreal expectations.

title: Assistant manager
pros: Love the team work, great benefits, upper management always there to help you in time of need.
cons: Just going to new sites that you haven‚Äôt been to and learning the lay out but once you get used to it every store is similar

title: Really enjoy working here
pros: Love the work life balance that is here at Extra Space. Everyone here is friendly. 2 weeks for paternity. Great corporate parties. Modern corporate office. Company continues to have a lot of growth.
cons: I wish the health insurance was better here. Would like to have more retention of employees in this department by offering more competitive pay and benefits.

title: Great Company
pros: You get discounts when needing a storage unit yourself. You work besides dedicated Store Managers and Assistant Managers. You learn the retail Experience.
cons: You are mandatory off Sundays and Only get one day out of the week for your other day off can't be Saturdays or Mondays

title: Best company to work for
pros: Good pay, excellent support, real good work-life balance, excellent opportunities for growth within the company. And everyone is like family here. Excellent benefits
cons: Only being able to have one Saturday off a month not much weekend time to spend with family or friends

title: Depends on your TL
pros: Most of leadership is awesome, 401K match, sales commission can be good.
cons: If you have the wrong TL it can be a horrible place to work. Health benefits suck. I don't feel great working for this company because of how they treat long term customers especially during C19.

title: Just an OK Company
pros: Solid company vision Sunday's off (most locations) Recession proof business
cons: Low pay Always understaffed Poor management (outside of corporate office) Little to no opportunity for advancement

title: Training
pros: Everybody here is very helpful and always willing to help. They encourage you to ask questions and I did. They never got upset. Training is very thorough.
cons: The only thing I can think of, but it is nit picking, is not having two days off in a row. Other than that, there is nothing.

title: Core Values
pros: The company's core values are important to them, they hire employees that mirror those values. The customer experience is extremely important to them, but the employee experience is equally as important. The work/life balance is awesome!
cons: I currently dont have any downsizes to working at ESS

title: Great Company to work for
pros: full time work(even in the pandemic) generous wages plus incentives, good benefits, caring company and friendly co workers.
cons: This is not an office job. yes you rent storage units but you also clean them maintain your property and handle complaints all while still renting units.

title: Team work gets the job done
pros: Company Culture, good pay, all for one attitude, If you work hard there is always room for growth and promotions
cons: Fast pace work environment due to continued growth

title: Decent pay, set hours, and balanced work life.
pros: 9am-6pm shifts. A ton of autonomy. Great team/Co workers. Easy to advance.
cons: Lack in transparency of pay, especially between new hires and seasoned employees. Autonomy can also be a detriment if you don't hold yourself accountable.

title: Horrible company
pros: Work with little supervision, bonus checks if your lucky
cons: Unprofessional environment, DM plays favorites, you lie to your customers, benifits are bad, pay is no where near what it should for amount of manual labor cleaning and lifting, no help when needed ,they reward the lazy and the people who lie before they help hard workers. Don't waste your time here.

title: Extra Space Storage is a great place to work
pros: growth company, which means that there are lots of opportunities to move forward in your career. great work/life balance. stable industry. great compensation
cons: The office space is outdated, it would be nice to have more current office space. not enough women in management

title: Best company I have ever worked for.
pros: The company actually cares about the employees. Wonderful benefits, great hours, vacation time. I love how the actually care about not only you as an employee but also your family. To me its the best place to work!!!!
cons: Some of the employees are nothing but trouble makers but that's with every job. I just stay to myself.

title: Intern - Good Experience
pros: They pay well for an internship. They really include you and expect you to participate and learn. Its not just busy work. Everyone is hard working and focused. I learned a lot.
cons: The work life balance was challenging for me with school. It got to be too much for me and I ended up leaving.

title: Dynamic and Growth Environment
pros: You will never be bored. The marketed growth environment is very much a reality. The ability to professionally and personally grow is easily available to anyone interested in putting in the time and effort.
cons: This environment is not for everyone. If you want to punch the clock, and leave it all behind, you may want to keep your regular 9-5.

title: Very corporate
pros: Pay is decent, benefits are good for single people, clear paths to promotion
cons: Super micromanaged, everything has a set procedure, may pay women less

title: Assistant Manager
pros: Everyday is something new. I came from a call center environment that I had been in for many years. I have the ability to still do office work, interact with customers, and still go outside and do site maintenance.
cons: Accruing time off definitely takes awhile to build up so it's hard to be able to take any time off within the 1st year.

title: Fantastic Company to Work For
pros: Extra Space is a tremendous place to work. Corporate truly seems to care with field employees. Benefits are good and PTO is great.
cons: Pay isn't where is should be for work/level of service expected. Staffing in the field is minimal, due to lower pay scales.

title: Great place to work
pros: I have been working at Extra Space Storage for 10 years, I love the company culture and enjoy working with everyone. Great environment, supervisors and leads care about their worker.
cons: Company hire shops on us that they do not have a clue of what we do, they contradict themselves often no knowing that it will affect us as employee.

title: District Manager at Extra Space Storage
pros: Growth opportunities, great training program along with an award winning Learning and development webpage. Has an excellent internal webpage for employees.
cons: Senior management get caught up in what will the CEO or Senior Mgr will say or do, versus fostering a healthy working environment.

title: It feels great to love my job!
pros: Great pay and commission. Inbound calls only. Customers already need what we have, easy to sell. Fun interaction with co-workers. Leadership that wants to see each person do the best they can and make the most commission.
cons: Not a lot of room for advancement with-in the call center.

title: Store Manager
pros: It is a growing company that really cares about their employee and customer's. It has good benefits. They promote from within. They have training class to keep you growing and your co worker really care about you and always willing to help you out with a smile.
cons: You do have to work mostly every Saturday.

title: Great Place to Work
pros: Great Time Off & Holiday's Off Great Insurance Plan Great Workday system where you can request off ahead of time Great Sunday's off Great Co - Worker's Great Responsibilities Great Pay Great Compensations Great Hours
cons: Downsizes here would be customer confrontation but where do you not find that

title: Good Place To Work
pros: Never work past 6pm and every Sunday off. If you're a people person, then this is the job for you.
cons: Make you go between sites until you become a manager. Some sites are old and nasty.

pros: - Decent hours - Sense of independence
cons: - Janitorial duties - Rude customers

title: Glad I'm here
pros: Great comradery, good hours, wonderful working environment ,chance to advance, good pay, everyday I learn something new that makes me feel good about myself, and not to mention by the end of the day I have a feeling of completion and accomplishment.
cons: Can not think of any at this time.

title: Great Place to Work!!
pros: Family-like atmosphere. Competitive with in the District but everyone and I mean everyone wants each and every person to succeed.
cons: Having every Sunday off then a day off during the week sometimes makes it tougher to get back to back days off. I would rather work Sunday and have two back to back weekdays off.

title: Site Manager
pros: Great Work Hours - Great People - Cares about employees - Awesome Training program (Kim Fraser) - Stores Nationwide - Corporate Is very helpful if you have any issues or concerns -
cons: Benefits & Pay - When you take PTO you have to find your replacement while you are gone (Can be difficult at times) -

title: Great Company with Strong History
pros: Office space is as good as it gets. Strong team environment. Everyone these seems to really want to be there and make Extra Space the best it can be.
cons: Some times it seems slow to grow but that could have been a market timing.

title: Great Company to Work For
pros: Extra Space is a very technology minded company who likes to push the envelope. They provide employees with all the tools they need to be successful. The culture is great and management is very interested in helping employees progress in their own careers.
cons: None that I can think of. I've been very happy here.

title: Great company culture!
pros: This is a strong, growing company who manages to maintain a small-company atmosphere despite their tremendous growth. This company offers excellent benefits, work/life balance and career development opportunities. They care about their employees and about the community which really makes me proud to work here.
cons: I have worked here a short time but can honestly say, so far, none.

title: Good people!
pros: The people at ESS are what really make this place special. Every position I work with really understands what it takes to be a partner and we don't let titles get in the way
cons: As we grow, inconsistencies in practice are becoming more apparent. We need to shore this up before it becomes too large of a problem.

title: Depends on the team you're on
pros: Worklife balance is very good here, especially for IT staff.
cons: The overall culture of the company is good, however, it depends on the team you are on and who you have as a supervisor. There are inconsistencies in the leadership approach and who has your back and who doesn't. So, choose wisely.

title: It's A Decemt Job
pros: The flexibility in schedule is a key. Pretty decent amount of downtime. Flexibility in duties where I can work in office or outside on the property.
cons: As any company with shareholders, there is always a push to improve your monthly numbers. Some months are just down months, but they don't want to hear that. Not a terrible experience, though.

title: Great place to work
pros: Extra Space really takes the time to put people first in everything they do. One of the core values centers around employee experience and they really let you live this value here. Lots of collaboration and teamwork, too. Everyone has gone out of their way to offer assistance during my transition.
cons: None that I can see right now

title: Retaliation and no job security
pros: Some positions include an on-site apartment. CEO will listen to concerns at round table meetings. You need to be proactive about these concerns.
cons: Upper management will retaliate against anyone who questions their methods. They were violating federal law by failing to pay overtime. This was challenged and after Federal investigation, was resolved. Anyone involved was removed from the company directly or through attrition.

title: Descent place to work
pros: It's a clean environment, great managers, commission and okay pay. Not like other retail places. Company really takes care of employees. Room to advance and get an apartment. Paid holidays.
cons: Work every weekend. In the winter if it snows you have to shovel it and still work with customers.

pros: Great support from peers, ESS always trying new ways improve on procedure,a teaching company (i.e meetings, webinars, chatter), you wear many hats, much room for growth,
cons: low wage for the many hats you must wear, minimum staffed facilities,

title: Great place to work
pros: I'm a on-site manager and I love it!! The work life balance is amazing! The work is fun, challenging, and interesting,. Upper management is great and very knowledgeable and approachable. Family oriented even closed on Sundays so I can spend time with my family.
cons: You have to be self motivated

title: Store manager
pros: Apartment, coworkers, 401k, some district managers work with you others don't, work under no supervision, Sunday's off, major holidays off.
cons: High expectations for little pay. Used to feel appreciated but not anymore. Company makes so much money but does not pay his employees well for the work they do.

title: Great Place to start or grow a career
pros: Accounting team is very collaborative. I have the support around me to answer questions, teach me new skills and help me see and understand the bigger picture of the company. Management is very knowledgeable and willing to teach and develop young accountants.
cons: I would like to see more community involvement activities.

title: Great company that values it employees
pros: Steady hours, great benefits, the company cares about its associates. They run contests that keep you engaged. They also focus on health with a great health package.
cons: One year wait for 401k I would have liked to enroll after 90 days. Coverage can be an issue depending on your location.

title: Grateful for the Culture
pros: Clear path to success, people driven, consistent expectations, good pay, and healthy environment. ESS still promotes from within BUT also seeks superior external talent. This is a great strategy for staying fresh and rewarding hard work.
cons: You have to work bcs it is a job.

title: Manager and District Team Lead
pros: The culture in Extra Space provides a great,a safe and healthy work environment for all employees. growth opportunities and more. I love my Job and with that the balance in my life is quality.
cons: I have been with the company over 20 years and I do not have any cons to post.

title: Great team doing important work
pros: I really enjoy the teamwork and atmosphere at Extra Space. I feel well supported by the executive team and feel like we are working on things that really help the company succeed.
cons: There are not many cons. Benefits are an easy target as I think they are pretty average.

title: Team work
pros: Firs company I've worked for that shows team work across the board regardless of the issue/situation at hand.
cons: No paid vacation so you have to decide to be sick unpaid or take some down time off unpaid because we don't get both.

title: awful pay
pros: so far everyone that i have worked with has been great
cons: the pay is awful, especially for the amount of physical work that needs to be done and they hazards you deal with on a daily basis.

title: Okay for nthe industry.
pros: You feel integrated, you have customer contact.
cons: The salary and in my case the competence of the manager. Also customers are very rude and aggressiv because they are under stress (moving,etc) most of he time.

title: Extra Space is a great place to work
pros: Extra Space has a wonderful, supportive company culture. They train and develop their employees and 75% of their positions are promoted from within. They are very open and transparent with their employees and make everyone feel like they are a part of the team.
cons: No real negatives, I have had a great experience here.

title: Good Company - changes coming
pros: Great people, good benefits. Company values are great. CEO is amazing and cares about employees.
cons: Not too much room for growth within your specific department. Management has been making interesting and unpredicted changes as of late. No equality between departments

title: Assistant Manager
pros: Regular and consistent hours, friendly and encouraging environment. I love coming to work. It doesn't feel like a job. Overall it's a great company to work for.
cons: The health insurance is a little pricey compared to some other companies. Sometimes minor things are over intensified and analyzed.

title: Great employer
pros: live on site, wages, growth potential, co workers, sense of comradery, no nights, no Sundays, they dont micromanage
cons: None that I can think of. Maybe have an extra person to help cover days off, vacation time, days that are super busy. Just a part timer

title: IT Management
pros: Free soda. Close to my home.
cons: Almost everything else. "Just....ok?"

title: Store Manager
pros: Im going on my sixth year with #ExtraSpaceStorage, I can definitely say there is room for growth within the company. We have great benefits, salary, and senior management is wonderful to work with! We have a great working schedule as well.
cons: Honestly I can't say there is one.

title: Facility Service Manager
pros: -Decent Pay -Not micromanaged -Facilities Team is great to work with - Storage doesn't have a lot of emergency calls
cons: - The company lacks inclusive programs to support minority groups. - They lack attractive benefits

title: Assistant Manager
pros: The company gets the employees to think like a manager. You never have time to get bored and will always have something to do. We are to set to strive for the best and because of that, our numbers will show you.
cons: It's a dirty job, lots of cleaning and working outside.

title: A Great Place To Be
pros: I have really enjoyed my time so far at ESS. I have had the opportunity to work with a great team and have felt supported and developed as I have continued in my career path. The company is continuing to grow and it is an exciting time to be involved!
cons: Nothing comes to my mind.

title: Great company and a great work / life balance!
pros: Steady days/hours/schedule; pay is comparable to work entailed; great people and a positive culture and work environment.
cons: No light colored uniform shirts in the summer (But really, no cons!)

title: Great work life balance
pros: The culture is great. Everyone wants to do the right thing and improve. Communication is open and transparent.
cons: Overall not much to complain about. Benefits are average, would be nice to have more vacation or an accelerated path to earn more.

title: Great place to work!
pros: Great culture, amazing management, and a true team approach. ESS doesn't just tell you their values, they live them. I am proud to be a member of the team.
cons: The only con I can think of is that they need to keep expanding so they can present more opportunities for people to join the team.

title: A company that‚Äôs cares
pros: Working at your own pace. Monthly bonus. Visits from higher ups that want to talk to YOU. Recognition from DMs. Ability to live onsite if applicable. Bank hours. Essential business. Expanding company.
cons: A lot of time alone. Stress of meeting goals. Janitorial duties may apply.

title: Job stability and opportunity for growth
pros: Extra Space is a great company to work for! If you are looking for a place that provides work life balance, job stability, and opportunity for growth, look no further.
cons: We are out on our properties, so if you struggle with outside work, you may want to consider that.

title: Great Company
pros: I've worked at one other storage facility prior to Extra Space. The training they provide here is great, good benefits, and they really go the extra mile as far as ensuring everyone is on the same page and feels as if they're part of the team. The culture is strong.
cons: No cons as far as the company goes.

title: Stressful, low pay
pros: The ability to work alone
cons: Very low pay for the amount of physical work they expect, as well as the stress of having to sell and coerce the customers, while making them think we were looking out for them.

title: Great Company to Work For
pros: Great job with good benefits. I have worked here full time for almost 3 years. Lots to do to stay busy, but not much stress. This is a company that really cares about their employees.
cons: I can't think of any reason someone would not like it here unless they just don't want to work.

title: I'm a happy camper
pros: Always something to do, great pay, great benefits. This business is pretty much a family, in that you always have someone to turn to for help.
cons: I don't like working Saturday's during the summer but hey, I get off at 5:30, still time for fun.

title: Some Good, Some Bad
pros: Family-friendly that will work with your schedule for family time. Easy to schedule time off. Some good benefits
cons: Insurance is real expensive. No real bonuses for corporate employees. Lots of turnover.

title: Property Accountant
pros: Great place to start your accounting career. Flexible work hours with core hours from 9:00 A.M. until 3:30 P.M.
cons: There is very little focus on retaining employees. There is very little growth potential and even less incentive for top performers.

title: Don't expect to be promoted
pros: Easy job, good working environment.
cons: No matter how hard you work / apply yourself. You will not get promoted to a Network Technician, Manager or Team Lead. They hire from the outside for higher positions.

title: I love Extra Space
pros: Extra Space has been a great place for me to learn and to gain experience I would not find anywhere else. I recommend working here if your ready to learn, work hard and move up the corporate ladder. The opportunity is here!
cons: Pay could be higher considering the work we do.

title: Poor expectations
pros: For the first 10 years there it was a great place to work. Things changed drastically
cons: too much janitorial work. expect too much from the amount of employees at each site

title: District Manager
pros: A strong foundation of core values that the company believes in. A great work life balance. A culture that respects the customer, the employee and the brand. Competitive pay and benefits. A support structure that works to help each and every person at the company.
cons: I have found no cons to my position or the company

title: Best Place for Work
pros: Training and developments are great. Great Trainer with tons of experience in Customer service field. Good support from Management. Open areas for career growth. Good office timing for work.
cons: Due to customer service field, need to work on Saturday.

title: Retail Nightmare
pros: Pay, nothing else. If you aren't looking for another endless retail nightmare, run far and don't look back.
cons: FAVORITISM, unfairness, unpredictable schedule, traveling a lot, no structure in schedule, store managers treated better than assistant managers, hours, assistants are treated like slaves. Preach about values but then treat staff unfairly. When you go to upper management, you are ignored. You're just another disposable number in this retail environment. CONSTANT abuse from customers.

title: It's a Job
pros: Fulltime job with good hours
cons: Although not always busy, pay might not be enough for those needing to pay their bills

title: Great place to grow
pros: Extra Space is an excellent company to grow your career! Promotion from within is the primary goal for all openings. Apply if you want to work for a great company.
cons: No real cons to working here. It's like any job with pros and cons. A lot more pros here.

title: Storage industry is booming
pros: Sense of pride in your stores success. Ability to make own schedule each month. Current employees are given preference for advancement.
cons: Abundance of illegal activity on the properties. Although the industry is rapidly becoming popular around here, that reflects negatively on competitive pay and bonuses across the market.

title: Site Manager
pros: Great Place to work. I enjoyed my time there and would recommend Extra Space to anyone looking for a management position.
cons: Saturdays will be required and some outside work will be required

title: Great Company
pros: Room to grow, freedom where your not micro managed or tied to your desk. They care about their employees and show it. Great team atmosphere for colaboration.
cons: The pay isn't the most competitive and the benefits are sub-par.

title: LOVE MY JOB!!
pros: Absolutely love being a part of the Extra Space TEAM. We have so much leeway at site level. As long as you have outstanding customer service and time management skills you will excel here.
cons: Sometimes you can feel discouraged when others have more opportunity for advancement.

title: District Team Lead
pros: The Chain of Command care deeply about the employees. Overall Set Schedule, Many Employee Recognition, Company continues to grow.
cons: I have been with these company for 2 years and have nothing but good things to say.

title: Great Place to work
pros: Work hours 930-6 Monday-Friday and 9-530 on Saturday is awesome. You can go as far as you want to go depending on your drive to move up and better yourself. The company is always growing so always room for advancement
cons: No Cons for me to add

title: District Team Lead
pros: Job security.... People will always need storage.
cons: Working every Saturday, pay, work load is very heavy and you still have to run a site. Unrealistic expectations on meeting company goals.

title: Good company
pros: Pay is decent, depending on experience. Good hours and benefits
cons: Be sure your DM is actually on your side. Some put on a show and make nice to your face, but will stab you in the back o benefit their position or due to personal grudge.

title: Amazing company
pros: pay scale, opportunity to advance, not micromanaged, alone time, respect from company
cons: Not closed on labor day or memorial day, but that is just being nit picky because we have off 4th of July, Thanksgiving, Christmas and NYE

title: Great place to work
pros: There is plenty of room to advance since Extra Space is constantly growing in size. The pay and benefits are very fair and competitive. There is a great training program and continuing on going training through your career with ESS.
cons: To be very honest I can't think of any

title: Strong Company
pros: Very fortunate that never once during my employment during the pandemic I feared for my job. The company is going a great direction with consistent growth YOY.
cons: There are many times that the two offices in Utah (Call center and Corporate office) can feel like two separate entities often with one being overlooked or intentionally left out.

title: Best job I ever had, for a call center....
pros: great pay, easy enough schedule, great management and co-workers, small enough call center to feel like you're part of a team
cons: short lunch, weekend mornings are required shifts

title: Good Company
pros: Very easy to advance in company. Not a difficult job at all.
cons: Upper management doesn't really appreciate you on a personal level if your numbers are very good. Pay should be better. Insurance very expensive. Bonuses are horrible.

title: District Manager
pros: The working environment is great and as family focused as a corporation can be. You will have support from all levels regardless of the issues you have.
cons: You will be reported to death but will always know where you stand with company initiatives as long as the reporting is accurate.

title: The Review
pros: The company atmosphere is great. They believe in maintaining a quality of life based on the hours and this company provides. Everything and everyone is easy accessible including the CEO. This is a company heading in the right direction where profit margins arent their only objective.
cons: I wish the pay was a bit more

title: I love it!
pros: The company is wonderful. Strong growing leader in a multibillion dollar industry, very flexible time, reimbursement for travel and a great hourly rate that makes you feel valued.
cons: Messy units, disrespectful tenants and the maintenance. The only downsides come from clientele and not the company. Luckily you have a strong team to help you survive.

title: Depends on the Department
pros: Most departments are awesome. The company as a whole is awesome!
cons: The Treasury and Risk departments are led by incompetent leaders who prevent and restrict career advancement. They are also not trustworthy.

title: Upper Mobility
pros: EXR has a great atmosphere that makes it enjoyable to show up to the office everyday.
cons: There is an obvious line in the company, and if you are not on the correct side your chance at advancement doesn't exist.

title: The opportunity for career progression is absolutely here if you‚Äôre willing to work!
pros: Great work/home life, set hours, thorough training, excellent management, great office/property work loads.
cons: Typical customer service issues, but not that bad if you have experience in deescalating situations. Sometimes staffing is an issues for the bigger, heavier traffic sites.

title: 1 month experience
pros: Love my Colleague's , I like that the DM come to meet you personally, I like that the DM also have weekly meetings. I like the additional resource from Knowledge base to Walk Me Through in Breeze. I like to flexibility with scheduling. Great company thus far.
cons: Pay can be a little more better

title: Review
pros: excellent benefits, monthly bonuses, upbeat atmosphere,
cons: working every Saturday, not having a set schedule every week if different

title: Outstanding Company
pros: Company Culture: We walk the walk, not just talk the talk. Opportunity for Professional growth and advancement Competitive Pay and Benefits Work/Life Balance Supportive Upper Management
cons: Compared to other service industry careers like retail management and food service, this is by far the most rewarding.

title: Very laid back
pros: Laid back easy job. Flexible, supportive, and accommodating upper management.
cons: Extremely micro-managed. Everything is report and spreadsheet formula based.

title: Good company if you fit the mold
pros: Free apartment with utilities included. Free meals
cons: Negative feedback culture. Overwork for underpay

title: Not a Place to Grow
pros: Easy Work. Set Hours. Nice People.
