cons: Not a career. Employees stay in same positions/same salary for a long time.

title: Outstanding Company
pros: Top management listens to all employees. Great room for advancement. Outstanding growth and opportunity. Promote from within. Leaders in the industry.
cons: Self Storage can be perceived as a sleepy business and is not considered glamorous. Extra Space is a technology leader in the industry and helps to offset this.

title: Long interview process but totally worth it
pros: Room for growth,large company with small company feeling,great 401k match. Am absolutely amazing training plan with one stop shop access sites.
cons: None.Companies are forever changing and this company is doing a great job with this. I am lucky to be in the company at this time of my career.

title: Team players
pros: This is a great company to work for .Lots of room for upward movement if thats where you want to go . Team work is always encouraged and help or answers are always available . Training program gets you started and team support keeps you going along the way .
cons: No cons at this time

title: Good company and positive mindset
pros: Tight Ship Happy Staff Move to get promoted Buying into the mindset pays off Job security Incentive payouts Benefit plans
cons: Company moves people around a good bit Property Management / Sales / Selling insurance/ maintenance and auctions means more responsibilities than you are paid for.

title: Assistant Manager
pros: Great working environment and excellent support from team members.
cons: At times, depending on your district manager, you may begin to feel there is no room for career growth and increase in hourly wage is very slow.

title: District Team Lead (DTL)
pros: Phenomenal culture! This is company not only talks about appreciating employees, but also demonstrates it at every level.
cons: Every job/company has opportunities. The opportunities at Extra Space Storage are minor operational issues that are not worth mentioning on this platform.

title: Love my Job!
pros: Customer and employee centric, good structure to follow, good pay w/ competitive bonuses, great training and tools.
cons: You will work on Saturday

title: Extr-espect
pros: I love working at Extra Space because I'm widely respected by my co-workers. Extra Space is one big family that is open to my ideas which makes me confident in my role. A wonderful work environment that makes it easy to come in and do what's right for our company.
cons: The inability to work remote.

title: Customer Service is secondary
pros: Good pay and benefits and adequate training
cons: Laborious, work every Saturday , and you can be changed between stores based in need

title: Racism
pros: Three years Sales background experience,
cons: Unreliable employees! Very disappointed Time.

title: Great people
pros: A company that truly lives its values and communicates with respect and transparency from the top down.
cons: Advancement often takes relocation to another major market

title: Its a decent job
pros: Flexible schedule, don't take work home mentally, low stress. You have some cool workers from time to time. Not super corporate.
cons: Training, low pay with so many extra responsibilities, high turnover, combined sick and vacation days. Dm's are not the best and don't care for workers at branches.

title: Not the best company to work for
pros: 401k Match, PTO, paid holidays, and maternity leave
cons: They make you come into the office 3 days a week, you can't be fully remote. Their health insurance is really expensive. Don't do annual raises, and failed to protect identity when needed.

title: Awesome company
pros: I just started here a few months ago and I have had a good experience so far! Co-workers and supervisor are very helpful. I really like the store I am running and my tenants
cons: You are maintenance. Its not as bad as it sounds. Basically just cleaning. and you do work Saturdays

title: Really good company to work for!
pros: Excellent training, great opportunities for those that want to advance, wonderful people to work with, pay is good, variety in daily activities at work.
cons: No cons at this time!

title: Overall,,Great Place to Work!
pros: Extra Space has great benefits, great work environment, great bonuses! Their standards go above and beyond other self storage companies.
cons: Do not give employees Saturdays off unless they take it as PTO.

title: A great place to excel
pros: One of the best reasons to work for Extra Space Storage is the support and resources available.
cons: Keeping a facility extra clean is a tall task that will require multiple hours spent cleaning every day.

title: Extra Space Employee Based Review
pros: Company really respects work life balance. The pay is competitive to the market.
cons: Some of the benefits could be improved such as cost of insurance, and PTO (sick balance separate from vacation)

title: Invests in People
pros: Extra Space is a company that believes in investing in its people by developing them and extending the same respect and appreciation for them that they expect employees to extend to customers. The work hours also offer a great balance between your professional and personal life.
cons: I have no Cons to list.

title: Store Manager
pros: Great benefits, great work life balance. The job is fantastic really. Great mix of outside work and office/administrative work.
cons: Lot of pressure to hit certain sales metrics. That's anywhere though really. They push us very hard for insurance sales.

title: Property Accountant
pros: Great office space, love the culture, innovative for it's market segment, great CEO & great management team, cares about its employees. Have CEO lunches that all employees may attend.
cons: Can't work remotely, high turnover in accounting, long commute to work.

title: District Manager
pros: True Work Life Balance!
cons: Growth is discussed and talent is heavily reviewed however it seems that most of the opportunities are from specific divisions in the organization.

title: Solid Company to work for
pros: No boss oversight day to day Up to you how you want to handle situations Run the site as if it was your own
cons: Not for you if you are not motivated or need your hand held with things it is up to you to solve problems and get things done yourself

title: Great entry level for Management
pros: tools provided to success, inclusive work environments bonus pay
cons: pay at field levels low for the amount of knowledge you acquire. raises are very minimal leadership and mentee programs are non existent

title: Low wages
pros: Off on Sundays. Ability to grow. Nights off.
cons: Low low low pay for all of the work required. Sales job, 100%

title: Great place
pros: Great place to build a career. Ok benefits and great employees. Wage is lacking a bit but the job makes up for it. Lots of cleaning and paper work so be ready to work!
cons: Wage, Saturday and Sundays you must be free to work

title: Under payed
pros: Co-workers kept me entertained. Independent work atmosphere.
cons: Low pay grade. Small raises, typically under $1.00 a year. Responsible for running a multi million dollar company on a non livable wage.

title: Too much pressure.
pros: I loved working in this industry, at the store I was hired for, even a few other stores closer to home. I loved the customer interactions.
cons: Google Reviews, Sales goals and insurance goals, driving across town, 1 hour travel time one way, And when you didn't hit the big goals, the little ones didn't matter.

title: Great environment! Great leaders!
pros: Great experience overall working as an assistant manager and was promoted to District manager. The learning and Development team has the best trainings for developing the employees from within. From the top to bottom the leaders truly care of their employees.
cons: Really can't think of any. Company was an amazing experience.

title: I enjoyed working at Extra Space.
pros: ability to work independently. no night work.
cons: limited opportunity for advancement unless you are willing to be resident manager.

title: Operations Coordinator
pros: The culture and my coworkers are the best part of my job. I enjoy interacting with everyone. I learn something new all the time and am rewarded for hard work.
cons: There is a lot of pressure for continued growth. Growth is good for the company, but can result in a lot of stress.

title: Just another corporate company all about the $
pros: incentive payouts. decent insurance benefits.
cons: you as a person are not considered nor do you matter. You are just a means to make money for this company.

title: Property Accountant
pros: The culture here is great. Team/Department activities are fun and a good experience. Feels more like a team than just a bunch of individual people on their own. Good Flexibility as well.
cons: Not really any that I can think of at the moment.

title: Store Manager
pros: I have been in the storage industry for 25 years and this is by far the best company I have been employed with. They truly care about their employees and their tenants.
cons: I have nothing bad to say about them at all.

title: Assistant Manager
pros: There is a great work-life balance here. The employees are always welcoming and I enjoy working with everyone. They allow you to play on your strengths and help strengthen your weaknesses.
cons: I want to start taking college classes again, but the hours only allow me to take one class in the morning.

title: Pretty good place to work and go to college.
pros: Holidays off. Semi permanent schedule. Sunday off and one day during week. Almost your own boss. Decent pay for the work.
cons: Repetitive. Inconsistent workload. Some tough situations with customers at times. Silly after hours calls.

title: Venemous metrics
pros: The free apartment is great for college students.
cons: Extra Space Storage believes in death by employee metrics. Management frequently uses aggressive language to convince employees to make ethically questionable decisions. Examples include tricking customers into buying insurance plans, or lieing about unit availability and pricing.

title: Site Manager
pros: Extra Space provides a great work/life balance for it's employees. I love the hours and work environment.
cons: The one major con for working with Extra Space is the weather extremes you may have to deal with. Whether it be the snow and ice of the northern regions or the heat of Florida.

title: Assistant Manager wanting to be promoted
pros: Good pay, benefits, bonus plans
cons: I see no room for growth in the company until somebody quits or gets fired.

title: Love my job
pros: Executive team is industry best, flexible work hours and work/life balance, company invests a significant amount in technology, standing desks and other good wellness benefits, and challenging work.
cons: Top performers need to be better compensated.

title: AMAZING COMPANY!!!
pros: This company has been AMAZING to us! Throughout the pandemic, they have gone above and beyond to ensure our safety and job security. There were NO LAY OFFS, and they truly exhibited the company values.
cons: Pay could definitely be better, especially with the rising costs, but the pay is still decent nonetheless.

title: Ok. Will wear you down
pros: Freedom if your a self starter. Not working with too many other people.
cons: Not being staffed at your site to get the required tasks done for audits and daily operations.

title: Good
pros: Great training, decent pay, great people to work with. Awesome leadership and company.
cons: Cannot work onsite with a spouse, must prove yourself over and over to the District Managers,

title: Team Oriented Environment
pros: Encouraging staff and team, diversity throughout the work place and room for growth.
cons: Pay needs improvement and they need to bring back in person learning and development sessions for team building.

title: Solid Work, But Kind Of Boring
pros: Good job for someone who is just starting out or for someone who wants to get their foot in the door with property management
cons: Occasional break-ins to tenant storage units Split days off

title: Great place to work!
pros: The job itself is pretty straight forward. It‚Äôs very clear on what‚Äôs expected and there are tons of resources to goto if you have questions.
cons: You don‚Äôt get two days off in a row and the days are long, don‚Äôt get off until 6pm. Hard to manage with young children

title: employee centric
pros: Great incentive programs Great hours Leadership is phenomenal Opportunities to grow within company
cons: As any customer service job, dealing with irate tenants who are in lien status, if you dont like to get your hands dirty-is not the job for you

title: Assistant Manager
pros: Regular schedule that is very flexible. Wonderful benefits and competitive hourly wage. The people who work here are surprisingly awesome!
cons: Since the company is always expanding, they are acquiring new properties, so store coverage is hard to come by... Esp since not-just-anybody can get hired.

title: Low Pay, Few Incentives, Really just a Janitor job
pros: Not many and Few and far between
cons: No full weekends off forced to work 1 Weekend day period, Unattainable bonuses, constant maintenance work, No cleaning people so you are the janitor cleaning toilets/scrubbing walls/mopping floors, sweeping the entire parking lot.....

title: Store Manager
pros: This company is amazing to work for. Talk about team players. They take very good care of their employees. I sure miss this job. Great pay with benefits
cons: I have nothing bad to say about Extra Space Storage

title: ESS is a great place to work
pros: Really great company. Super welcoming and helpful throughout the training process, great support systems in place from management.
cons: None. You get a little dirty from time to time, but that's nothing in comparison to the pros.

title: Great place to work but pay is low
pros: The people are great, very good culture to be a part of, lots of opportunity for growth. I feel empowered at work.
cons: The hourly wage leaves something to be desired. They do off we other incentives but base pay is very low.

title: Great company and amazing people!
pros: I've been with Extra Space for 2 1/2 years now and couldn't imagine working for a different company! The employees are like family. Management does an amazing job to inform all employees of valuable company information to help us perform our duties!
cons: Can't think of a single one!

title: Site Manager
pros: good work life balance and DM is great to work with.
cons: Some managers get to live almost rent fee on the property and get paid almost the same as managers who don't and it's expensive to live in Los Angeles. Compensation should be made.

pros: Good hours and benifits flexibility in work schedule
cons: It‚Äôs cult minded everyone steps on each other to get ahead dms and upper management suck no help

title: Great experience
pros: ESS was a great company to work for and I enjoyed the relaxed yet challenging atmosphere. I unfortunately had to leave due to COVID-19 related personal issues however the company was understanding. I enjoyed every moment with the company.
cons: No cons to report for this company.

title: Great Company
pros: Extra Space is truly a company that values its employees and encourages then to be their authentic selves.
cons: Sporadic schedule changes and not always a well-planned schedule, although this mostly falls on a schedule maker and does not represent the company as a whole, just lack of willingness on a manager.

title: District Manager review of ESS
pros: Phenomenal work-life balance- no nights, no Sundays, no holidays. Incredible support staff. Company treats you like family, not like mall based retailers I have worked for in the past.
cons: There are no cons that I can see

title: Fast-paced, fun environment
pros: Great leadership and focus on continuous improvement. Recently they've added a lot of emphasis on employee satisfaction.
cons: There's definitely a culture of favoritism. Some people come in and are quickly accepted while others who are just as competent aren't as readily noticed or advanced.

title: Bittersweet
pros: Team and Family Environment, On site Apartments
cons: Not being fairly awarded opportunities to progress which ultimately created a loss of multiple employees

title: Great culture. Great place to work
pros: Company has a great culture from top to bottom. Good level of senior management transparency. Great work life balance. Willingness to change and adopt. Not afraid to explore new ideas. They do not over work employees.
cons: It may feel a little slow for some of you.

title: Great working environment
pros: Great training system in place Great Leadership from Managers who thrive on helping Assistant Managers become Store Managers Health Benefits They'll pay for gas when you Travel Sunday's off!
cons: Always understaffed Because it's understand allow over time

title: Great place to work
pros: Structure with sales process makes it easy to succeed
cons: Work weekends. Sales pressure creates an environment of cheating which is unfortunate, instead of pressure should use more positive coaching you will get desired results thw right way, also will create a team bond

title: Great Opportunity for manager skills
pros: The assistant and store managers have almost all the same responsibilities and is a great opportunity to gain skills in customer service.
cons: It can be slow at times with not much to do. Also there is little room to advance in higher positions for long term employees

title: Property Accountant
pros: It's a solid company with good benefits. Really values its employees and spend a lot of resources to make employees feel supported.
cons: They use a lot of different applications which they are working to merge in the coming year so once that happens it will not be a con.

title: They will teach you to run a business.
pros: Great culture, decent PTO, work-life balance
cons: Depending on where you work, the customers are shady. Also you will be occasionally shopped

title: District Manager
pros: This company lives their values. The teamwork and collaboration at Extra Space is unparalleled.
cons: Nothing at this time, the company is always asking for feedback and works hard to make improvements based on company recommendations.

title: The is the best Job I have ever had!!!!!

title: Friendly & Competent

cons: They've grown so fast that it's a bit hard to keep up with, policy-wise. Sometimes it feels like reaction-mode.

title: Best place I've ever worked

title: One of the best

You‚Äôre always working to meet your goals which hang over your head each month. Upper management plays favorites. Your job is one part salesman two parts janitor and one part babysitter.

title: Review for ESS / Extra Space Storage (via SMASH, Costa Rica)
pros: - Some people suited SMASH outsourcing company in Costa Rica . which was contracted for ESS. -They promove promotions and travel only for few people. -Toxic organizational culture -When I said something they removed the contract and start doing mobbing for not having responsability here in Costa Rica.
cons: Working with SMASH for Extra Space Storage was one of the worst professional experiences I have ever had. The environment was toxic and hostile. I was constantly subjected to bullying, mobbing, and inappropriate jokes about my personal life and even about my accent. It went as far as being spied on, and when I raised concerns, instead of addressing them, I was removed from my role. ESS showed no accountability and completely ignored my situation, hiding behind the fact that they are a U.S. company. Their only focus is cost-cutting, not the well-being or dignity of their employees.

title: Solid Company with Strong Culture, but Growth and Staffing Challenges in Key Areas Overall Rating
pros: Extra Space Storage has long maintained a strong, values-driven culture that promotes collaboration, innovation, and respect. Leadership is generally supportive, and many departments foster a healthy work environment. The company offers competitive benefits and compensation, though salaries tend to fall on the lower end of the industry spectrum. For those in well-resourced teams, the experience can be highly rewarding.
cons: Like many large organizations, departmental experiences vary. Construction and facilities teams face persistent staffing challenges, which can impact morale and performance. Opportunities for advancement are limited in certain sectors, and there appears to be no clear strategy to address this. While the company excels in many areas, some roles feel siloed or stagnant.

title: Thankful for Extra Space
pros: It is a pleasurer working with Extra Space they have great values here that not only help you become a better you at work but also in your every day life here are some of our values Integrity Team work passion be balanced also it is a great company to move up in so many opportunities.

title: Nice culture
pros: Everything is great from culture to work satisfaction!
cons: Cannot think of anything at the moment.

title: Great place to work!
pros: This is one of the best companies that fully recognizes their employees and wants the best for them. From having over a dozen of coworkers that you can reach at any moment to being encouraged to be a better version of you via the Health Advocate website that they promote. A great blend of using technology in the office and putting some elbow grease into the property itself, learning to relationships with both customers and vendors, having a set schedule of open-close (when full time, and in most cases) so there is no working late into the evening, all around a great place to work!
cons: At times (depending on the property you are working at) you will have to work by yourself. It can be incredibly difficult to get everything done in a timely manner when you first start. You have to have a backbone when working here, There is customers that will try and use your empathy against you to get their way, and in some cases will flat out scream in your face.

title: ESS Review
pros: Extra Space is an incredible employer. It has a small company feel but the benefits of a large corporation. Career opportunities are numerous and only controlled by your own motivation, you have incredible amounts of freedom to run the site as you see fit and as long as the site remains profitable and you are within company guide lines it is yours to run.
cons: Too many mystery shops conducted. There are 4-5 different kinds of mystery shops conducted each quarter. While not a huge negative it can sometimes become an annoyance.

title: Supportive and inclusive place to work with grets benefits
pros: The entire team is very supportive and willing to help with any problems or questions you have. They offer great benefits (401k, health insurance, bonuses, pto) and, maybe best of all, they respect your free time. They will work to promote you if they see that you're interested and if you are generally good at what you do.
cons: Customers can be rude and they'll direct their anger and/or bad attitude at you. However, unfortunately, that's a part of customer service. There is some light pressure to convert at least 80% of customers into buying insurance. KPI numbers are very important to them so there is also some light pressure to meet certain numbers. You only work with other person in the office, or by yourself at times, so it can get monotonous sometimes.

title: Overworked, underpaid.
pros: Most coworkers were cool. Given a lot of responsibility. They generally leave you alone to run the store how you see fit.... as long as it's working.
cons: Worked almost every Saturday. Constant mystery shops. Unreasonable expectations from management. Store performance is based on stupid measurements rather than important things like rentals, revenue, promotional use, merchandise sales, etc. Upper management always finds something to complain about. Your store can put up great numbers in every important financial category and they'll still complain.

title: Great to join the family!
pros: I joined Extra Space with almost 15 years of experience and after working for two other storage employers. I have found my peers in the District to be very welcoming and always ready to answer a question when needed. The District Team Lead was very thorough and patient throughout my training and is a great resource.
cons: The option to schedule me at a different location or to alter my requested days off to accommodate others without my consent.

title: Very fun
pros: It's a lot of fun driving around on the gold cart, depending on the location sometimes you'll be on the cart most of the day just cleaning the property. Hearing about peoples lives and why they're storing with us is interesting, and it's also fun putting units up for auction. You get every Sunday off because the store is closed which is very cool, and days you need to call in you only have to give a 2 hour notice which is nice. You don't constantly have people in your face with problems, most problems can be answered over the phone and people prefer to call. You get compensated for driving extra miles daily like going to the bank or another store. They offer benefits and 401k after just three months. They're a very inclusive company and set up teams groups for all minorities so that you never feel alone, you can choose to join into those groups or not at all.
cons: You have to be out on the property on very hot days- You have to clean units by hand the day that they move out, so if it's 100 degrees outside or if it's windy it gets pretty intense. You don't really know when your second day off will be week to week. Sometimes you work alone and you get a little swamped with all the things you need to do in a singular day. It's hard to explain to some people why their rate goes up and/or the amount of the increase, some people get hostile because it's their money. There are also tenants that go into auction almost every time they pay current and they're usually very hostile people too because they don't want to be called about their delinquency because it's a regular thing for them and they don't want calls every week.

title: A Great Place to Work
pros: Great training programs, ongoing training and development of skills. Opportunity for advancement. Forthcoming with information relating to changes in policies and procedures.
cons: Many recent changes in policies and procedures, (while the exchange of information is appreciated, and the reasoning clearly explained) many have found it overwhelming.

title: Extra Space is a great place to work! The culture is fabulous.
pros: You get a sense that upper management recognizes the importance of and the contributions made by its employees. Solid opportunities for growth.
cons: I can't think of any significant cons. Perhaps the rapid growth of the company is contributing to a reduction in that family feel that Extra Space once had.
